title: Sr Operations Research /Systems Analyst
location:
locations
Remote - U.S.
Salt Lake City, Utah
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Washington DC Metro Area
Patuxent, Maryland
description:
Title:

Sr Operations Research /Systems Analyst

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Come join the ITEA award winning TRMC BDKM team and be a part of the team responsible for revolutionizing how data analysis is performed across the entire Department of Defense

Key Responsibilities:

The successful candidate will be part of the KBR team supporting the Test Resource Management Center’s (TRMC) Big Data (BD) and Knowledge Management (KM) Team working on BD and KM systems supporting DoD Test Ranges and various acquisition programs.

Data Driven Analysis: Candidate will support our customers with insights gained from analyzing DoD Test & Evaluation data. Responsible for enabling the development of data-driven decision analysis products through the innovative application, and promotion, of novel methods from data science, machine learning, and operations research to provide robust and flexible testing and evaluation capabilities to support DoD modernization. Candidates should have a passion for discovering insights hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes through the delivery of high-quality products.
Data Mining: Must have strong experience using a variety of data mining and data analysis methods, accessing data stored in a variety of data storage paradigms, developing models using common statistical and machine learning modeling approaches, using and creating custom algorithms, implementing analysis workflows in Python or R, and writing reports and documentation.
Analytic Experience: Responsible for providing analytic consulting services, supporting analytic workflow and product development and testing, promoting the user adoption of methods and best practices from data science, conducting applied methods projects, and supporting the creation of analysis-ready data.  The candidate should be skilled at identifying opportunities for process or workflow optimization.
Customer-Facing Experience: Candidate will be the face of the CHEETAS Team and will be responsible for ensuring stakeholders have the analytical tools, data products and reports they need to make insightful recommendations based on your data driven analysis. 
Stakeholder Assistance: The ideal candidate is adept at collaborating with technical and non-technical stakeholders to identify analytic requirements and analysis questions that can be informed through the aggregation and analysis of large data sets collected during test events or exercises.
Communication: Proven ability to drive decisions through successful communication, in written or presented form, of their data-based insights. Must have the ability to effectively communicate at both a programmatic and technical level. 
Technical Support: The successful candidate will have extensive technical expertise in methods from operations research and experience working on Department of Defense problems. The candidate will have reach-back support from the software engineering, data science and system administration teams.  While onsite, candidate will be responsible for running and operating CHEETAS (and other tools); demonstrating these tools to stakeholders & VIPs; conveying analysis results; adapting internally-developed tools, notebooks and reports to meet emerging needs; gathering use cases, requirements, gaps and needs from stakeholders and for larger development items providing that information as feature requests or bug reports to the CHEETAS development team; and performing impromptu hands-on training sessions with end users and potentially troubleshooting problems from within closed networks without internet access (with support from distributed team members).  
Independent Work: Successful candidates must be self-motivated and capable of working independently with little supervision / direct tasking.  The candidate should have experience using a variety of methods and models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

Work Environment:

Location: Remote
Travel Requirements: This position will require travel of 25% with potential surge to 50% to support end users located at various DoD labs and ranges located across the US.  When not supporting a site, this position can work remotely or from a nearby KBR office (if available and desired). 
Working Hours: Standard, although you potentially may be the only team member physically on-site providing support, you will not be alone. 

Basic Qualifications:

Security Clearance: Active TS/SCI clearance
Education: An advanced degree in operations research, engineering, applied math, statistics, computer science or information technology with preferred 12+ years of experience within DoD. 
DOD Specific Experience: Candidates with 5-10 years of DoD experience will be considered on a case-by-case basis. 
Experience: Previous experience should include working with end users, gathering requirements and refining/operating data analysis tools or products to meet user needs.  Previous experience should include developing and interpreting the results of analytic products with DoD specific data types.

Qualifications Required:

Experience using scripting languages (Python and R) to process, analyze and visualize data.
Experience using notebooks (Jupyter Notebooks and RMarkdown) to create reproducible and explainable products.
Experience using interactive visualization tools (RShiny, pyShiny, Dash) to create interactive analytics.
Experience generating and presenting reports, visualizations and findings to customers.
Experience using analysis methods, including supervised and unsupervised methods, to work with time series and geospatial data.
Experience working with Windows, Linux, and containers.
Experience querying databases using SQL.
Ability to make insightful recommendations based on data driven analysis and customer interactions.
Ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing with customers and teammates.
Ability to speak and present findings in front of large groups.
Ability to document and repeat procedures.
Ability to train novice end users on the use of tools.
Should be self-motivated to design, develop, enhance, reengineer or integrate software applications to improve the quality of data outputs available for end users.

Preferred Qualifications: 

12+ years of DOD experience
Experience as a military ORSA.
Experience working in government / defense labs and within their computing restrictions.
Knowledge of military force structure and/or tactical messaging.
Experience working with major DoD experimentation events, such as Joint All-Domain Command and Control (JADC2) events.
Experience working with major DoD acquisition programs, such as Joint Strike Fighter (JSF).
Knowledge of the Test and Training Enabling Architecture (TENA), the Joint Mission Environment Testing Capability (JMETC) and distributed testing and training.
Knowledge of DoD cybersecurity policies.

US National Average:

$150,000 - $225,000

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s working location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, clearance level, contract affordability and in consideration of internal parity.

Basic Compensation:

$172,600 - $258,900

This range is for the California area only

$172,600 - $258,900

This range is for the District of Columbia area only

$165,100- $247,600

This range is for the Maryland area only

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Sr Operations Research / Systems Analyst
location:
locations

description:
Title:

Sr Operations Research / Systems Analyst

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Come join the ITEA award winning TRMC BDKM team and be a part of the team responsible for revolutionizing how data analysis is performed across the entire Department of Defense

Key Responsibilities:

The successful candidate will be part of the KBR team supporting the Test Resource Management Center’s (TRMC) Big Data (BD) and Knowledge Management (KM) Team working on BD and KM systems supporting DoD Test Ranges and various acquisition programs.

Data Driven Analysis: Candidate will support our customers with insights gained from analyzing DoD Test & Evaluation data. Responsible for enabling the development of data-driven decision analysis products through the innovative application, and promotion, of novel methods from data science, machine learning, and operations research to provide robust and flexible testing and evaluation capabilities to support DoD modernization. Candidates should have a passion for discovering insights hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes through the delivery of high-quality products.
Data Mining: Must have strong experience using a variety of data mining and data analysis methods, accessing data stored in a variety of data storage paradigms, developing models using common statistical and machine learning modeling approaches, using and creating custom algorithms, implementing analysis workflows in Python or R, and writing reports and documentation.
Analytic Experience: Responsible for providing analytic consulting services, supporting analytic workflow and product development and testing, promoting the user adoption of methods and best practices from data science, conducting applied methods projects, and supporting the creation of analysis-ready data.  The candidate should be skilled at identifying opportunities for process or workflow optimization.
Customer-Facing Experience: Candidate will be the face of the CHEETAS Team and will be responsible for ensuring stakeholders have the analytical tools, data products and reports they need to make insightful recommendations based on your data driven analysis. 
Stakeholder Assistance: The ideal candidate is adept at collaborating with technical and non-technical stakeholders to identify analytic requirements and analysis questions that can be informed through the aggregation and analysis of large data sets collected during test events or exercises.
Communication: Proven ability to drive decisions through successful communication, in written or presented form, of their data-based insights. Must have the ability to effectively communicate at both a programmatic and technical level. 
Technical Support: The successful candidate will have extensive technical expertise in methods from operations research and experience working on Department of Defense problems. The candidate will have reach-back support from the software engineering, data science and system administration teams.  While onsite, candidate will be responsible for running and operating CHEETAS (and other tools); demonstrating these tools to stakeholders & VIPs; conveying analysis results; adapting internally-developed tools, notebooks and reports to meet emerging needs; gathering use cases, requirements, gaps and needs from stakeholders and for larger development items providing that information as feature requests or bug reports to the CHEETAS development team; and performing impromptu hands-on training sessions with end users and potentially troubleshooting problems from within closed networks without internet access (with support from distributed team members).  
Independent Work: Successful candidates must be self-motivated and capable of working independently with little supervision / direct tasking.  The candidate should have experience using a variety of methods and models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

Work Environment:

Location: Remote

Travel Requirements: This position will require travel of 25% with potential surge to 50% to support end users located at various DoD ranges & labs located across the US.  When not supporting a site, this position can work remotely or from a nearby KBR office (if available and desired). 
Working Hours: Standard, although you potentially may be the only team member physically on-site providing support, you will not be alone. 

Basic Qualifications:

Security Clearance: Active TS/SCI clearance
Education: An advanced degree in operations research, engineering, applied math, statistics, computer science or information technology with preferred 12+ years of experience within DoD. 
DOD Specific Experience: Candidates with 5-10 years of DoD experience will be considered on a case-by-case basis. 
Experience: Previous experience should include working with end users, gathering requirements and refining/operating data analysis tools or products to meet user needs.  Previous experience should include developing and interpreting the results of analytic products with DoD specific data types.

Qualifications Required:

Experience using scripting languages (Python and R) to process, analyze and visualize data.
Experience using notebooks (Jupyter Notebooks and RMarkdown) to create reproducible and explainable products.
Experience using interactive visualization tools (RShiny, pyShiny, Dash) to create interactive analytics.
Experience generating and presenting reports, visualizations and findings to customers.
Experience using analysis methods, including supervised and unsupervised methods, to work with time series and geospatial data.
Experience working with Windows, Linux, and containers.
Experience querying databases using SQL.
Ability to make insightful recommendations based on data driven analysis and customer interactions.
Ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing with customers and teammates.
Ability to speak and present findings in front of large groups.
Ability to document and repeat procedures.
Ability to train novice end users on the use of tools.
Should be self-motivated to design, develop, enhance, reengineer or integrate software applications to improve the quality of data outputs available for end users.

Preferred Qualifications: 

12+ years of DOD experience
Experience as a military ORSA.
Experience working in government / defense labs and within their computing restrictions.
Knowledge of military force structure and/or tactical messaging.
Experience working with major DoD experimentation events, such as Joint All-Domain Command and Control (JADC2) events.
Experience working with major DoD acquisition programs, such as Joint Strike Fighter (JSF).
Knowledge of the Test and Training Enabling Architecture (TENA), the Joint Mission Environment Testing Capability (JMETC) and distributed testing and training.
Knowledge of DoD cybersecurity policies.

US National Average:

$150,000 - $225,000

title: Associate Accountant
description:
Title:

Associate Accountant

Responsible for the end-to-end billing lifecycle for projects, ensuring that all Lump Sum milestones and Reimbursable expenses are accurately invoiced in strict accordance with contract terms. This role serves as the bridge between project operations , project accounting and Billing team, requiring high attention to detail to minimize unbilled receivables.

Key Responsibilities

Contractual Compliance & Audit:
Thoroughly review and interpret Client Contracts to identify specific billing triggers, payment terms, and allowable reimbursable costs.
Check project data against contract terms to ensure compliance with agreed-upon rates (labor, equipment, etc.) and fee structures.
Lump Sum & Milestone Billing:
Prepare and issue fixed-price invoices upon the completion of specific deliverables or agreed-upon project phases.
Reimbursable Expense Management:
Validate and compile supporting documentation (receipts, subcontractor invoices, travel logs) for reimbursable expenses.
Ensure all out-of-pocket costs are marked up according to contract specifications before invoicing.
Financial Accuracy & Reporting:
Collaborate with Project Managers & Project Accountants to resolve billing discrepancies and disputes promptly.

description:
Title:

Material Specialist III

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN JACKSONVILLE, FLORIDA

Program Summary

The Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) is based in Jacksonville, Florida. We provide maintenance and logistic services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) in support of this program. For over 35 years we have planned, coordinated, and executed the maintenance and logistic services for ground combat vehicles and support equipment for USMC Expeditionary Forces.

Job Summary

Performs functions relating to technical research, requisitioning, stockage computation, stockage replenishment, custodial record keeping, issue, disposal, redistribution, tracking of equipment, supplies, and publications. 

operate personal computers, multimedia data entry, scanning and retrieval systems, generate routine reports, and perform technical research for customer inquiries within GCSS-MC, MDSS II and any other system of record. 

Maintains and prepares necessary inventory control reports, custody records, performs reconciliations and administers the expenditure of allocated funds in accordance with approved Statement of Work (SOW). 

Uses critical thinking skills to identify and take timely corrective action to solve date output and supply administration problems. 

includes the use of automated systems (both hardware and software) related to accomplishment of the above tasks. 

Provides training and guidance to lower-level employees. 

Perform other tasks as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

High school graduate or equivalent. 

4 years of related work experience. 

Complete basic enlisted military supply course, or equivalent. 

Solid understanding of Department of Defense logistic functions relative to large scale organization logistics functions and the activities involved in providing Supply Chain logistical support. 

Working knowledge of GCSS-MC or equivalent Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) technologies. 

Working knowledge of various computer capabilities, features and functions. 

Able to read, interpret, and correctly respond to communication provided by higher headquarters in the form of Disposition Instructions (WIR) and/or Supply Discrepancy Reports (SDR) as applicable.   

Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.  

U.S. Citizen.

 Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC) and Base Access.

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Project Manager
description:
Title:

Project Manager

At KBR, we partner with government and industry clients to provide purposeful and comprehensive solutions with an emphasis on efficiency and safety. With a full portfolio of services, proprietary technologies and expertise, our employees are ready to handle projects and missions from planning and design to sustainability and maintenance. Whether at the bottom of the ocean or in outer space, our clients trust us to deliver the impossible on a daily basis.

This Project Manager is a key role and will be responsible for delivering assigned packages of work using the NEC4 form of contract as directed by the Senior Project Manager.  The packages of work vary in complexity and may include civils, structural, M&E or marine engineering. 

This is an exciting time to join this Programme Delivery Team, the environment is both challenging and rewarding.  As the Project Manager you will be supported by an engineering and project controls team who have the same focus as you.  

We would like Project Managers who are:

Able to lead and motivate a diverse team to deliver benefits to client.

Equipped with strong communication skills to enable engagement with a wide range of Stakeholders.

Comfortable negotiating a way through conflict.

You will be accountable for the overall performance of assigned work packages, including:

Delivery of assigned packages of work as per the NEC4 contract conditions.

Cost and schedule performance of assigned work packages.

Risk management.

What We Need 

Demonstrable project management experience within multi-million-pound infrastructure construction, refurbishment and replacement programmes of work, within a complex regulated environment (preferably Nuclear). 

You will have a solid understanding of NEC4 Contracts and will have Full lifecycle experience from business case approval, design, execution and handover.

We would also like to see experience of change control and risk management.


You will be a Degree Qualified preferably with an NEC4 ECC Project Management Accreditation.

You will need a good working knowledge of the Microsoft Suite and CEMAR.

Location

The role is Hybrid where 3 days per week will be spent in the office in Glasgow City Centre.

 
Security Requirements

SC Clearance

Due to the secure nature of this project, restrictions in relation to UK residency and nationality will apply.

HR Generalist

KBR is looking to fill a position of HR Generalist to be based in Abu Dhabi – UAE

Ensure all HR operations, KBR procedures, and policies are efficient and in compliance with legislation and best practices. Support HSE initiatives and programs by working closely with HSE team leads and advisors. Responsible to ensure HR and HSE goals and objectives are met within established timelines.
Administer compensation and benefit plans
Assist in talent acquisition and recruitment processes, if needed.

title: Principal Consultant, Advisory & Consulting
description:
Title:

Principal Consultant, Advisory & Consulting

Job Responsibilities:

Reporting to the General Manager, the individual will work within the Global Advisory & Consulting team, in close collaboration with the organization’s vast engineering, technology, and scientific resource base.

Job responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):

Lead client engagements across the project lifecycle.

Manage client/external stakeholder relationships (including government authorities and regulatory agencies).

Build a team to support the overall growth of the Advisory & Consulting team.

Originate projects to grow the Advisory & Consulting business portfolio.

Articulate internal and external subject matter knowledge into strategic roadmaps and business cases for clients.

Apply strict confidentiality protocols and data warehousing rules to protect client, third-party, and proprietary company information.

Work collaboratively with the Global Advisory & Consulting Team to deliver overall P&L.

Coordinate resources and expertise with other offices and business units worldwide to deliver leading-edge solutions and excellent techno-commercial outcomes.

Coach and mentor junior team members to continuously improve the quality of delivery.

Provide inputs and support for strategic market communications.

Actively engage industry networks to stay abreast of the latest developments and innovations.

Represent the organization at public/industry functions and conferences to uphold and enhance the organization’s brand, especially in Asia.

Leverage current knowledge and continuously develop as a thought leader/subject matter expert in critical energy transition areas such as:

- Decarbonized hydrogen/ammonia, biofuels/e-fuels, carbon abatement, and management (including but not limited to CCS/CCUS).

- Heavy end-users of energy, including (but not limited to) oil & gas, petrochemicals, industrial, manufacturing, technology providers, data center operators, pharmaceuticals, agriculture, and power sectors.

- Regulations and policy across the region. Cross-sector understanding of decarbonization policies, particularly for heavy producers and/or end-users of energy, would be key capabilities and depth of knowledge sought.

-Expertise in CCS/CCUS deployment strategies, carbon abatement, and integration of low-carbon technologies across industrial sectors, with the ability to advise heavy energy users (oil & gas, petrochemicals, manufacturing, data centers, power industry) on decarbonization pathways and compliance with regional regulations and policies.

-Strong background in sustainability strategy planning and ESG gap analysis, ensuring alignment with global reporting standards such as GRI and ISSB, while supporting cross-sector regulatory compliance and energy transition initiatives.

- Experience in driving decarbonization strategies within the technology sector. Lead and manage regional teams to deliver Market Studies, Concept Development, Feasibility Assessments, and Pre-FEED projects, ensuring all outputs are completed on time, within budget, and aligned with technical specifications requirements.

 

Job Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in chemistry/chemical engineering.

At least 15 years of energy/related industry experience specific to corporate energy transition work, energy policy and regulations, and/or energy transition financing work.

At least 5 years of team management experience with advisory/consulting firms, with demonstrated capability to grow the business.

Proven capability in delivering high-end advisory/consulting projects and managing key stakeholders is essential.

Experience in working at executive/C-suite/C-1 levels, negotiating G2G/G2B business opportunities.

Experience developing and implementing energy transition strategy.

Strong understanding of energy transition technical concepts and commercial feasibility.

Familiarity with the broad ESG ecosystem, including local and international carbon markets, rules, and regulations.

Demonstrate business acumen (ability to grasp the commercial feasibility of proposals) and financial literacy (ability to understand basic financial concepts and evaluation methods).

Ability to work collaboratively with direct team members, as well as broader colleagues.

title: Market Sector Director – Buildings
location:
locations
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia
Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Perth, Western Australia, Australia
description:
Title:

Market Sector Director – Buildings

KBR is seeking an accomplished and visionary Market Sector Director – Buildings to lead our national Buildings segment. This senior leadership role sits at the forefront of our Infrastructure Solutions Australia business, driving strategic growth, sector leadership, and exceptional delivery outcomes across a diverse and high‑value portfolio.

As a key member of our leadership team, you will lead and implement the Buildings market strategy across all market sub-segments - Health, Education, Corrections, Aviation, Events, Commercial, Industrial, land‑development sectors etc – also spanning all engineering, specialty and advisory disciplines. You will also take ownership of client relationships, project portfolio performance (including profit and loss), and ultimately own the success of one of KBR’s most strategically important market segments.

About the Role

The Market Sector Director – Buildings is responsible for leading and governing a multi‑disciplinary, national portfolio encompassing multiple smaller projects through to larger major programs exceeding $1B in capital value. This role requires someone motivated to lead and grow a team and an existing successful business for the longer term; it is ideally suited to an executive level thinker capable of both shaping long‑term strategy and driving short‑term delivery excellence.

You will:

Develop and implement a multi‑year sector strategy to expand KBR’s market presence and drive profitable growth.
Lead business development, identify new opportunities, and secure new contracts—often personally acting as Project Director or Bid Leader for strategic pursuits.
Build and sustain relationships with senior‑level government and private‑sector stakeholders, representing KBR as a thought leader within the industry.
Oversee the successful delivery of the buildings project portfolio, ensuring commercial, risk, schedule, safety and client‑satisfaction outcomes are achieved.
Shape a high‑performance culture, attract and retain top talent, and champion KBR’s values across our Australian offices.
Drive financial performance, ensuring revenue, job income, overhead recovery, and business unit  income targets are consistently met or exceeded.

Key Skills & Experience

We are seeking a leader with:

Proven credibility in the buildings sector or broader property or built environment, ideally at the executive level.
Capability to lead complex, multi‑disciplinary teams across multiple states.
Strong financial and commercial acumen, including P\&L accountability.
Demonstrated success in strategy development, client engagement, and winning significant work.
A track record of delivering complex projects and navigating risk in high‑value portfolios.
Advanced leadership capabilities including influencing, inspiring others, facilitating change and coaching teams.

Why Join KBR?

At KBR, you will shape the future of infrastructure in Australia while being part of a global organisation delivering some of the most significant engineering, technology, and advisory projects worldwide. You’ll play a pivotal role in leading and growing a major business unit, supported by a high‑performing national team and international expertise.

You will enjoy working with a high-performing team, who live and breathe KBR’s outcome-focused culture, centered on our Values;. As a leader you can make a genuine impact.

What do KBR offer? 

Typical benefits include:

Industry leading salaries, reviewed annually
The opportunity to accrue an additional 8 hours of time off every 4 weeks
Salary packaging and Novated leases
Salary continuance (Income protection)
Paid Professional Membership Fees
Life/Health insurance discounts
Flexible work arrangements (start/finish times, WFH, Flex time)
End of trip facilities
Employee Stock Purchase Plans
Paid parental leave
Personal Career development plans
Growth and promotion opportunities

Location

While the role is ideally based in Sydney, we are open to appointing an exceptional candidate in Brisbane, Melbourne, Adelaide or Perth.

How to Apply

If you are a strategic thinker, a respected industry leader and passionate about shaping the future of Australia’s built environment, we would love to hear from you.

Apply now or reach out directly for a confidential discussion.

#LI-DNP #LI-DNI  #S-DNI

Advanced leadership capabilities including influencing, inspiring others, facilitating change and coaching teams.
Why Join KBR?
You will enjoy working with a high-performing team, who live and breathe KBR’s outcome-focused culture, centered on our Values
. As a leader you can make a genuine impact.

title: Sector Lead, Buildings
location:
locations
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
description:
Title:

Sector Lead, Buildings

KBR Australia | Flexible Capital‑City Location (Sydney Preferred)

KBR is expanding rapidly across Australia’s buildings sector—and we’re looking for an influential, energised Sector Lead – Buildings to shape the next phase of our growth.

If you're a respected industry professional with commercial sharpness, deep market insight and a passion for building, this is your opportunity to take your career to new heights.

Why this role matters

As a sector leader within KBR, you’ll guide and execute our strategy across diverse markets, including Health, Education, Corrections, Aviation, Events, Commercial, Industrial and Land Development. You’ll own client relationships, drive major pursuits, and be hugely influential in one of KBR’s most strategically significant portfolios.

This is a chance to make a large‑scale impact—locally and nationally—supported by a globally recognised engineering, technology and advisory organisation.

What you’ll be doing

Set and lead a multi‑year strategy to strengthen KBR’s presence across the buildings market.
Drive business development, identify growth opportunities, and personally lead strategic bids and project pursuits.
Cultivate and influence across government and private sectors, positioning KBR as a trusted advisor and thought leader.
Oversee delivery of a complex portfolio—ensuring project excellence in safety, schedule, commercial performance and client satisfaction.
Shape culture, contribute to a high‑performance, values‑driven environment.

What you bring

You’ll be a standout candidate if you have:

Recognised credibility across the buildings, sector.
Proven ability to lead multidisciplinary teams and deliver complex projects.
Strong commercial and financial acumen,
A track record in developing strategy, engaging clients and winning significant work.
Experience managing risk across high‑value programs or portfolios.

Why join KBR?

At KBR, you’ll shape Australia’s future infrastructure while collaborating with experts across our national and global networks.

We foster a culture built on trust, innovation, inclusion and Zero Harm—where leaders have the autonomy and support to make meaningful change.

Benefits you’ll enjoy

Industry‑leading salary packages, reviewed annually
Accrued flex leave every four weeks
Salary packaging & novated leasing
Income protection & insurance discounts
Paid professional memberships
Flexible working arrangements (WFH & flexible hours)
End‑of‑trip facilities
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Paid parental leave
Career development plans & clear promotion pathways

Our people are the heart of our success. We’re committed to building an environment where you feel supported, trusted and empowered to grow.

Ready to make an impact?

This is a rare opportunity to take on a national leadership role and influence the future of Australia’s buildings sector. If you’re looking for a dynamic, people‑centred organisation where you can lead with purpose and shape a growing business—this role is for you.

description:
Title:

Industry Lead – Buildings

KBR is seeking an Industry Lead – Buildings in Perth to support the growth of our national Buildings business segment.

As the Industry Lead for our Buildings sector in Western Australia, you will work alongside the Market Sector Manager for Buildings and be responsible for leading our client engagement, pursuit planning and tendering for projects in Western Australia. You will also lead the portfolio of projects in the region; where you may also take on the role of Project Director or Project leader for building projects that sit within the segment. You will be working to build our pipeline of project opportunities and deliver services that exceed client expectations. You will work closely with the WA operations team to build our Buildings presence as well as our delivery capability.

This includes across all buildings market sub-segments - Health, Education, Corrections, Aviation, Events, Commercial, Industrial and land development sectors etc – spanning all engineering, specialty and advisory disciplines.

Scope of the role:

Provide a strategic leadership role in the WA Building’s team.

Build on client relationships to maintain and grow our pipeline of opportunities in the region.

Develop capture plans for key opportunities.

Manage /update opportunity data

Provide leadership and oversight, ensuring expected client outcomes for Building projects in the region, where appropriate, this may include taking on the role of Project Manager or Project Director.

Collaborate across disciplines and geographies with other parts of the KBR business.

Expand the capability and capacity of the Perth Office

As part of an integrated team, support the Market Sector Manager for Buildings in WA to grow business across the state, including from time to time, working on tenders or projects that may be outside of Western Australia.

Requirements of the role:

10+ years' experience within industry on Building projects

A bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or Building services and/or other relevant qualifications  

Demonstrated experience of leading and winning project work

In-depth knowledge of the local market.

Experience in external and internal stakeholder management.

Excellent written and verbal communication and good presentation skills

Self-motivated and self-directed

Driven to innovate.

Ability to lead a team and deliver to agreed business plan targets.

Ability to build an inclusive team culture that is authentic and focused on the development and wellbeing of staff.

Track record of effective leadership, development, and motivation of staff

Understanding of health, safety and welfare matters, ensuring adherence by the team

Effective organisational skills, as demonstrated by achievement of deadlines, priority setting and maintenance of accurate administration records.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly successful team that is creating plentiful opportunities as we continue to grow. If you are looking for an agile, people centric culture where you can make your mark, develop your career and be instrumental in changing the infrastructure landscape then this could be for you.

title: Logistician, Intermediate Purchasing Coordinator
description:
Title:

Logistician, Intermediate Purchasing Coordinator

Program Summary:

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

Job Summary:

KBR is currently seeking an Intermediate Logistician, Purchasing Coordinator to join our team in the Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland location in support our customer, Project Manager Intelligence Systems & Analytics – Army (PM IS&A).

Roles and Responsibilities:

Coordinate purchases through various contract vehicles including Common Hardware System (CHS and CHESS)
Define purchase requirements with stakeholders
Coordinate for funding approvals for large scale purchases
Track multiple delivery orders over extended periods
Report and brief status to senior leadership
Conduct property accountability assisting with lateral transfers and traceability of equipment on site
Detail-oriented with technical, verbal, and written communication skills

Basic Qualifications:

Active Secret clearance.
Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Business Administration/Management or Technical.
A minimum of eight (8) years of related logistics experience
Direct experience in coordinating purchases through various contract vehicles including Common Hardware System (CHS and CHESS).
Direct experience in defining purchase requirements with stakeholders
Experience with coordination for funding approvals for large scale purchases
Experience in tracking multiple delivery orders over extended periods
Experience in reporting and briefing status to senior leadership (O6 and/or above)
Experience in Property Accountability to assist with lateral transfers and traceability of equipment on site
Allowable substitution: Twelve (12) years of logistics experience or a certified Professional Logistician (CPL) certificate with eight (8) years additional related experience may be substituted for education

Compensation:

$89,210.00 - $133,760.00. The salary range posted is for Maryland locations. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Benefits:

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development. 

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Logistics Analyst
description:
Title:

Logistics Analyst

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of Defense, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

KBR is a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace. The Senior Logistics Specialist position in support of KBR’s Government Services mission impacts a wide range of customer operational, project or service activities. Therefore, the position requires a person who has a strong knowledge of Logistics Best Practices and how their own area integrates with others. The person in this position must have the ability to build relationships with employees and stakeholders across all levels of an organization, must have the ability to solve complex problems, have a very high degree of initiative; and must be a dependable and highly organized team player who can communicate effectively and efficiently on all levels of an organization.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Provide Logistic and Programmatic support to Air and Missile Defense Programs.
Provide logistical analysis and technical input across multiple projects in support of the US Government Customer.
Analyzes, organizes, plans and administers various phases of day-to-day provisioning, spares, or maintenance/repair activities for one or more basic programs using established procedures.
Analyzes basic contractual documents, technical data, customer usage data, customer maintenance practices, customer operation characteristics, and related reports for assigned contracts to determine spares provisioning or maintenance/repair requirements.
Performs technical studies to refine project requirements.
Conducts research and identifies actions and logistical projects assigned to area of responsibility, coordinates assignment of all tasks, and monitors compliance and completion.
Initiates coordination between resource managers/supervisors/subordinates and ensures all necessary reviews and approvals are received.
Develops improvements to complex workflows, processes, and management practices and provides logistically sound recommendations to support programmatic decisions made by senior leadership.
Participates in Integrated Product Team Meetings, Working Groups, and Program Reviews to represent Customer’s logistics interest.
Collates information and provides written reports to Customer regarding salient meeting content.
Conducts frequent interface with senior leadership and the U.S. Government customer.
Supports completion of administrative needs, taskings, and evaluations.
Organizes and coordinates the planning and production of activities associated with assigned projects.
Serves as primary customer contact for assigned area of responsibility.

Basic Qualifications 

Requires a Bachelor's Degree
Requires 10+ years of relevant experience.
Must currently possess or have the ability to obtain a SECRET security clearance within six months of hiring.
Must be able to support the mission with up to 25 percent travel.

Preferred Qualifications

Ten or more years of experience working with or in support of the Patriot Air and Missile Defense Weapon System.
Preferred 10+ years of relevant DoD logistics-related experience.
A current SECRET security clearance at time of hiring.
Five or more years of experience with working DoD related Foreign Military Sales (FMS) projects.

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Administrative Coordinator
description:
Title:

Administrative Coordinator

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

KBR is seeking an Administrative Coordinator to support student management/accountability operations at SWESC/Naval Station Great Lakes.  This is a full-time, onsite role with shifts available from 4:30am-1:30pm OR 1pm-9pm.  This position provides administrative and program support in a professional office environment. The role focuses on coordination, recordkeeping, reporting, and customer service support to ensure smooth daily operations and accurate student accountability for continuous training improvement and effectiveness. The ideal candidate will collaborate with civilian, government-contract, and active-duty personnel to support communication, scheduling, and administrative processes for student management and training activities.  

Roles and Responsibilities:

Maintain accountability rosters and student status updates using Government/Command repositories and internal tracking tools; validate rosters and resolve discrepancies.
Perform data entry/verification in designated student accountability databases (e.g., PowerApp Learning Site database) and housing systems (e.g., EMH), as required.
Prepare and submit time-sensitive daily/weekly accountability deliverables in accordance with established reporting timelines.
Provide daily administrative support related to student preparation and accountability, including email communications, data validation, and updates to enrollment and appointment records. Maintain and verify student records in internal data systems by reviewing rosters, identifying discrepancies, and ensuring information accuracy.
Prepare, generate, and submit routine reports related to student status, room assignments, and accountability in accordance with established timelines. Support student check-in and check-out processes by issuing and tracking keys, maintaining logs, and ensuring required documentation is completed and filed appropriately.
Monitor shared inboxes and communication channels for student requests, scheduling updates, medical and dental notifications, academic changes, and other administrative items, routing information as needed. Provide administrative assistance with disciplinary and compliance documentation by assembling required forms, attachments, and records and routing them for review and approval.
Assist with weekly room inspection coordination by posting results, updating internal systems, and tracking follow-up actions as required.
Maintain and update administrative lists and tracking documents related to student appointments, class assignments, attendance, and status changes. This position provides administrative and clerical support only and does not include decision-making authority, supervisory responsibility, or independent judgment on policy, disciplinary, or operational matters.

Basic Qualifications:

Education & Years of Experience: High School Diploma/GED & 6+ years of experience.
Clearance: Active/Current Secret Clearance.
Skills/Software experience: Proficiency with Office 365 software and business tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.).  Use of computer programs such as EMH. 

Preferred Qualifications:

Possess exceptional organizational skills.
Possess exceptional customer service, time management, critical thinking, and active listening skills.
 Prior military experience is helpful but not required.
Experience with Enterprise Military Housing (EMH) software.
Comfortable working with databases and internal tracking systems.
CPR certification.
Strong organizational, communication, and customer service skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Adaptability and willingness to learn new systems and processes.

Schedule: Multiple full-time positions are available. Employees will be assigned to either Shift 1: 4:30 am – 1:30 pm, or Shift 2: 1:00 pm. – 9:00 pm.

Other Notes: Position is onsite. May require frequent travel between assigned buildings; candidate must provide their own transportation (no base transportation available). May require walking between buildings (potentially 1–2 miles) and working in inclement weather. May require stair use in multi-floor buildings without passenger elevators.

Basic Compensation: $53,000-$62,000. The salary range posted is based on the national average. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Logistics Specialist
description:
Title:

Logistics Specialist

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

The Logistics Specialist serves as a critical on-site resource supporting the Surface Warfare Schools Command (SWSC) N79 Damage Control Firefighting Directorate and other SWSC directorates in the San Diego. This role is responsible for procuring essential training resources by reviewing and processing Purchase Requests (PRs), tracking funding documentation, and ensuring requests align with established supply guidelines. You will optimize resource allocation through inventory, supply, and financial analyses and provide data-driven recommendations that help sustain training execution and Fleet readiness.

Roles and Responsibilities

Provide direct logistics, supply, and financial training requirements support for SWSC N79 and the San Diego region schoolhouse/courses of instruction.
Review funding request documents, track their progress between SWSC N79 and NAVFAC, and maintain clear status visibility for stakeholders.
Plan, schedule, and coordinate supply and material flow, including inventory storage and movement from supplier to customer to meet required timelines and specifications.
Prepare, submit, process, and track procurement requests and purchases, ensuring accuracy and completeness throughout the lifecycle.
Validate Purchase Requests (PRs) for compliance with Supply Center guidelines prior to submission and follow-through.
Coordinate with internal teams to ensure customer requirements are met and logistics support aligns with training demand.
Interface with outside vendors to obtain quotes and coordinate delivery of required inventory; coordinate with customs agencies as needed in the absence of a dedicated Import/Export Specialist.
Prepare logistics support documentation and source data (e.g., logistics support plans, user support summaries, post-production support plans, and implementation plans) to support operational needs.
Implement and maintain logistics plans, databases, and support files to support fielding of new systems or major modifications; apply logistics principles to specialized solutions and lead execution within the logistics discipline.
Attend N8 departmental meetings and training as required and perform other duties that support or improve N8 Department execution in support of the N78 Directorate.

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a U.S. citizen with an active Secret Clearance (or ability to obtain and maintain).   
High School Diploma/GED and a minimum 6 years of experience in DoD logistics or supply management.
Demonstrated experience preparing, reviewing, processing, and tracking procurement requests/purchases, including ensuring PRs align with established guidelines prior to submission.
Experience planning and coordinating supply/material flow, inventory handling, and delivery coordination to meet schedule and requirements.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree preferred (e.g., Business Management, Business Administration, or Accounting)
Experience navigating Navy supply/procurement research websites and tools (e.g., One Touch Support, FEDMALL, PIEE, GSA Advantage, IGC, etc.).
Understanding of the Government Commercial Purchase Card (GCPC) program and processes.
Familiarity with DoD governing instructions, publications, notices, messages, and memorandums.
Experience in a military or educational setting and familiarity with Surface Warfare Officers School operations or similar training institutions.

Basic Compensation: $76,000-$114,000. The salary range posted is based on the national average. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Senior Appian Developer - QA
description:
Title:

Senior Appian Developer - QA

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

Are you passionate about developing solutions to increase automation and innovation? KBR is a leading provider of science, technology, and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. We leverage technology to deliver innovative solutions that meet the complex demands of our diverse clientele.

Job Summary

Written as a Paragraph (4-5 sentences)

As an Appian Tester, you will be responsible for validating the functionality, performance, and security of Appian applications. This role focuses on creating and executing test plans, identifying defects, and ensuring that applications meet business requirements and quality standards. You will work closely with developers, Business Analysts, and stakeholders to support both production releases and new development projects, ensuring seamless user experience and robust application performance.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Written as Bullet Point List (5-10 bullets)

Test Planning: Develop comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test scripts for Appian applications based on business and technical requirements.
Functional Testing: Execute manual and automated tests to validate workflows, interfaces, and integrations within Appian.
Defect Management: Identify, document, and track defects using tools such as Azure DevOps or similar platforms; collaborate with developers to ensure timely resolution.
Regression Testing: Perform regression testing for new releases and updates to ensure existing functionality remains intact.
Performance Testing: Validate application performance under various conditions and recommend optimizations where necessary.
Collaboration: Work closely with Business Analysts and developers to clarify requirements and ensure accurate test coverage. Participate in meetings with stakeholders if necessary to get clarification on flow of operations.
Documentation: Maintain detailed test documentation, including test results, defect logs, and quality metrics.
Continuous Improvement: Recommend improvements to testing processes and contribute to best practices for Appian quality assurance.
Agile Practices: Participate in Agile ceremonies and integrate testing activities into iterative development cycles.
Security Testing: Ensure compliance with data security standards and validate secure application behavior.
This is a remote role, but may require travel up to 10% of the time.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a U.S. Citizen. If hired into this position, the employee must also reside in the United States.

title: Senior Appian Developer - Support
description:
Title:

Senior Appian Developer - Support

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

Are you passionate about developing solutions to increase automation and innovation? KBR is a leading provider of science, technology, and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. We leverage technology to deliver innovative solutions that meet the complex demands of our diverse clientele.

Job Summary

As a Mid-Level Appian Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining Appian applications that automate and optimize business processes. This role involves both production support, working closely with Business Analysts to troubleshoot and resolve issues, and new development, building scalable solutions to meet evolving business needs. You will collaborate with stakeholders and IT teams to ensure applications are stable, secure, and aligned with organizational objectives.

Roles and Responsibilities

Application Development: Design, develop, and maintain Appian applications to automate and optimize business processes.
Production Support: Troubleshoot and resolve application issues in collaboration with Business Analysts and stakeholders to ensure system stability and performance.
Requirement Analysis: Work closely with Business Analysts and stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions within Appian.
Workflow Design: Create and configure Appian process models, interfaces, and integrations to deliver efficient workflows and user experiences.
Collaboration: Partner with IT and development teams to ensure requirements are implemented accurately and align with organizational objectives.
Tool Utilization: Use Azure DevOps (or similar tools) for task tracking, version control, and communication across teams.
Documentation: Prepare technical documentation, including design specifications and deployment guides, to support application development and maintenance.
Quality Assurance: Participate in testing and validation of new features and fixes to ensure high-quality deliverables.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance existing applications and contribute to best practices for Appian development.
Agile Practices: Work within Agile methodologies to deliver iterative improvements and maintain flexibility in development cycles.
Security: Ensure compliance with data security standards and adopt best practices for secure application development.
This is a remote role, but may require travel up to 10% of the time.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a U.S. Citizen. If hired into this position, the employee must also reside in the United States.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field with 3–5 years of experience in Appian development, or a High School Diploma with 7+ years of experience in Appian development in lieu of degree.
Hands-on experience designing, developing, and maintaining applications using the Appian low-code platform, including process models, interfaces, and integrations.
Ability to meet with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into Appian solutions using Agile methodologies.
Proficiency in Appian application configuration, Appian Designer, and related tools; ability to generate reports and dashboards within Appian.
Familiarity with Azure DevOps (or similar tools) for managing tasks, version control, and communication.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to clearly communicate application changes, release schedules, and technical details to stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Appian development beyond core functionality, including advanced features such as plug-ins, connected systems, and Appian RPA.
Appian developer certification.
Familiarity with low-code platforms other than Appian.
Experience integrating applications with RESTful APIs and external systems.
Knowledge of Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server databases, including writing queries and understanding data modeling concepts.
Understanding of Agile development practices and experience working in iterative development environments.

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Title:

Administrative Assistant

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR (formerly LinQuest) is the prime contractor on the MSEIT contract. By applying to this position, you are in consideration for KBR employment. However, you also have the option to be hired by one of our subcontractor teammates.

KBR is seeking an Administrative Assistant to join our team in El Segundo.
 

The MILSATCOM Systems Engineering, Integration, and Test (MSEIT) effort provides leading edge Systems Engineering & Integration (SE&I) for the Air Force’s Space and Missiles System Center. We support the Air Force’s acquisition of state-of-the-art Military Satellite Communications systems, providing global secure, survivable, and protected communications for our nation’s warfighters. We seek technical individuals who will thrive in a highly collaborative work environment of small teams, using the most modern tools and methodologies to tackle the challenges of integrating complex space and ground communications systems.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key responsibilities:

Manage MSEIT related administrative support in El Segundo
Professionally interact with the (senior) leadership team, government customers, vendors, and personnel
Assist in scheduling conference rooms, set-up and clean-up internal and customer meetings and assembling meeting material packages
Create documents with Microsoft Office Suite including formatting, finding, or creating graphics, editing, proof reading and distribution
Assist with processing purchase requests
Verify VARS in Visitor Control
Manage MAR (Monthly Activity Report)
Badge Tracking
Unclassified Rosters/Classified Roster backup
Mail Distribution

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: Minimal

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Active DoD Secret Security Clearance required for this position
4+ years of experience with providing executive-level administrative support in a large, business and or military environment
Experience with managing calendars and meeting planning facilitation/holiday parties.
Able to communicate and discuss ideas with colleagues.
Be self-motivated, work independently, collaborate as part of a team to achieve office goals, and multi-task independently in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to proofread for grammar and punctuation with a high level of accuracy
Ability to interact effectively with internal and external senior-level executives and their assistants in a professional manner and be proactive in anticipating government and administrative needs

Desired:

Degree preferred
Excellent communications skills, friendly attitude, and ability to work well with people
Ability to accept direct supervision for work prioritization
Ability to handle multiple projects, work well with tight deadlines and be willing to do what it takes to get the job done
Experience with SharePoint and LiveLink
Experience with DoD, Intelligence, and Space Force or Air Force customers

Basic Compensation: $51,000 - $64,000 in California

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Ready to Make a Difference? If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team.

title: Senior Test and Evaluation Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Test and Evaluation Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

Senior Test and Evaluation Engineer

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in successfully getting mission capability on orbit and shaping the future of space reconnaissance.

Position Description/Job Responsibilities:

KBR is seeking a Senior Test and Evaluation Engineer to work with our team to supporting the United States Space Force Space Training and Readiness Command (STARCOM) Test and Evaluation Squadrons (TES) at Schriever SFB in Colorado Springs, CO. An active Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility is required.

Applicants should have experience in acquisition lifecycle and multiple phases of the test and evaluation process. Strong applicants will have experience with contractor or developmental testing, operational testing, and live-fire testing, particularly testing of space systems, and the role of modeling and simulation (M&S) and hardware-in-the-loop (HWIL) in a test campaign. Experience in evaluating both small subsystems' test results and major system program results is highly desired. In addition, applicants should have familiarity with major DoD acquisition programs as part of the Space Force acquisition process. Successful applicants should be adept at breaking complex systems into functional elements and determining test objectives applicable to each. Test Engineers/Operations Analysts must have the ability to self-teach to stay current with the best T&E and M&S tools and techniques for evaluating capabilities. Additionally, they must understand the advantages and limitations of differing techniques for solving a particular problem.

Responsibilities:

Assist in the planning, coordination, and execution of space systems tests & experiments
Design, develop, and execute advanced test/experimentation programs and processes to conduct assessment of space systems
Apply optimal scientific and statistical tools such as design of experiments to increase test efficiency and produce actionable test results
Create/review test engineering documentation to include test plans, Test Information Sheets, Safety Packages, Data Analysis. Management Plans, Technical and Safety Review Board Briefs, Test Readiness Briefs, Test Cards, and Test/Analysis Reports as required
Perform analysis on pre-test predictions, including those obtained through M&S and HWIL, to design test events and profiles, define data collection requirements, and develop go/no-go criteria to meet test objectives
Work with programs to perform reviews of systems, sub-systems, and components to ensure the data management and analysis plan (DMAP) provides proper data collection for real-time and post-mission data processing, evaluation, and analysis to meet test/experimentation objectives
Set up data analysis requests, process data, perform data quality control review and anomaly resolution, and analyze data as per the data analysis plan
Execute simulations to predict or evaluate system effectiveness or suitability under relevant operational conditions and scenarios
Monitor the gathering of M&S data and guide test result evaluation to determine if system configurations and architecture meet customer specifications and performance expectations
Create Test Reports/Presentations of complex data sets
Create/enhance data analysis tools

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree preferably in Operations Research, Engineering, Math, Probability, Statistics or Science
10+ years of demonstrated Systems &/or Test Engineering experience with space, ground, operations, and sustainment segments of DoD
A SME-level understanding of test, evaluation and experimentation and the distinctions between developmental, operational, and integrated test
Comfortable with methodologies including modeling and simulation, laboratory testing, open-air testing, and live-fire testing and supporting skills such as modeling and simulation, system decomposition, design of experiments and response surface methodologies, regression testing, and validation of models and simulations
Team mentality to provide integrated engineering/analysis support for design reviews, test planning working groups, test card prep, disciplined test execution, and collaborative authorship of post flight reports
Willingness to accept changing and evolving roles & responsibilities in support of customer requirements and needs
Aptitude and patience to process and analyze complex system test/experimentation data
Technical expertise in one or more of the following areas: Space-related data communications, EO/IR/RF Sensors, Spacecraft GNC, Space system Architectures, Space Battle Management and Control, Cyber
An active Top Secret security clearance with SCI eligibility is required

Desired Qualifications: 

Master’s Degree in Operations Research, Engineering, Math, Probability, Statistics or Science with 10+ years of demonstrated experience
Space Weapons officer (W13S/13S), with understanding of joint operations environment, and/or Offensive/Defensive space tactics &/OR graduate of specialized T&E training (e.g., USAFTPS Space Test Course)
DoD Acquisition Professional Development (ADPD) Test and Evaluation Level 3 certification
Experience within the DoD or as a Defense Contractor working in test and evaluation
Knowledge of orbital mechanics and astrodynamics
Space operations and/or orbital mechanics
Statistical techniques for approaching complex problems with large amounts of data
Application of operations research techniques and supporting skills such as database query languages, design of experiment and response surface methodologies, scripting language programming, and development of appropriate models and simulations

Work Location: Onsite at Schriever SFB, CO

Basic Compensation: 

The salary range for this position is approximately $155,000 -$165,000.  

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity. 

  

Additional Compensation: 

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.  

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.
