title: Program Manager (TS/SCI Required)
description:
Title:

Program Manager (TS/SCI Required)

KBR is seeking a Program Manager to join our team in Albuquerque, NM supporting the Space Systems Command Innovation and Prototyping Delta (SSC/SZI).

Key Responsibilities:

Serve as the face of the company to our government customer.
Manage the resources, personnel, and services necessary to provide program management support for all contract functions to include, but not limited to: quality, safety, security, and risk; accountable for credible cost, schedule, and performance reporting to the Government.
Establish and maintain a proactive, effective, and efficient program team that is responsive to changes in program/mission requirements.
Maintain a high level of quality of work, collaboration, open communication, and engagement with the Government program team.
Maintain an understanding of SSC/SZI’s mission and strong commitment to customer satisfaction.
Prepare for and conduct Program Management Reviews, as well as more frequent informal status meetings, at a frequency and scope as defined in the contract.
Notify the Government of any problems in meeting contract requirements as the problems are known.
Provide appropriate representation for meetings, as required, to include, but not limited to: management meetings and customer meetings at various locations.
Responsible for subcontract management necessary to integrate work performed on this contract.
Responsible and accountable for subcontractor performance on contract.
Report all contractor labor hours (including subcontractor labor hours) required for performance of services provided under this contract via the secure data collection site (i.e., Contract Manpower Reporting Application).
Participate in and contribute to Government processes and assign appropriate resources to effectively support the requirement.
Respond to Government requests for contractually driven requirements within timeframes requested by the Government for action.
Integrate and coordinate all activities needed to execute the requirement to include but not limited to: resource allocation, corrective action plans proposal submittals, timely identification of issues, and effective management of government approved and established vendors.
Provide required necessary on-site resources and infrastructure to manage, perform, and administer the contract.

Qualifications:

Required:

Security Clearance: Must have an active U.S. government TS/SCI security clearance, which is something only a U.S. citizen can obtain and SAP eligibility
PMI Project Management Professional (PMP) certification
Bachelor’s degree required; science, engineering, or management preferred
Current knowledge of space ground station development, management, maintenance and employment in garrison and operational environments
Current knowledge of DoD Contracting, Finance and Acquisition
Current Program Management experience executing $10M+ annually in the DoD, or related organization
Current experience managing 20+ employees
Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Superior collaboration and organizational skills
Proactive and highly motivated
Able to work in a secure, confined location
20% travel to support customer mission and goals may be required
Expertise in qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques for measuring the effectiveness, efficiency, and productivity of acquisition systems or services
Expertise in Government project governance and stakeholder communication

Desired:

Understanding of the Space Systems Command Innovation and Prototyping Delta (SZI) Prototype Ground Development and Sustainment Branch’s (SZIG) mission
5 - 10 years of program management experience supporting Department of Defense or related organization
Advanced STEM degree is preferred
Familiarity with SSC Ground Operations, facilities maintenance, cloud migration, and digital engineering practices

Location: On-site (Government site daily)
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

title: Sr. Director, Business Development
description:
Title:

Sr. Director, Business Development

KBR is looking for a Sr. Director, Business Development to provide leadership in planning, organization, management, and the continuous improvement of the business development and strategic development process. This includes the development and implementation of tactical plans which achieve the strategic objectives of both the short- and long-term business plans of the organization.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Conduct research and analysis of business opportunities through market research, financial feasibility studies, and planning consistent with the organization's long-range and strategic plans.

Identify market opportunities and work with the technical teams to grow profitable revenue for the company.

Serve as a liaison with KBR counterparts on cross-business unit opportunities. Strong communication skills are a must!

Develop and maintain strong customer relationships to identify customer objectives, priorities, and requirements and align company capabilities as an innovative industry leader.

Develop and maintain strong industry relations with large and small businesses with significant presence in assigned markets.

Conduct competitive analysis.

Develop, document, and implement effective win strategies supporting the business unit strategy for defined areas of responsibility.

Manage and execute the full BD life-cycle process across multiple simultaneous pursuits and proposals.

Demonstrate solid business acumen in all pursuit decisions.

Participate in the identification of potential acquisition targets.

Actively participates in key industry associations.

Undergraduate degree in a Business or Science Technology Engineering, and Math (STEM) (or related field)

Requires in-depth knowledge of the Department of War (DoW) acquisition process and new PEO structures, roles, and responsibilities.

Experience in briefing senior leadership, preparing and presenting information to prospective clients and technical leaders.

Master’s degree is desired

title: Senior Research Scientist
description:
Title:

Senior Research Scientist

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

Job Description:
 

The Intelligent Systems Research and Development Support (ISRDS) contract supports NASA Ames Research Center in developing and infusing advanced technology into NASA missions. Our scientists, engineers and technologists support research and development of critical enabling technologies for all of the NASA Mission Directorates. This KBR-led team has supported technology development for NASA space exploration missions such as LADEE, VIPER, Biosentinel, Starling and TESS, supports payload development for the International Space Station, and develops robotics and autonomous operations technologies for lunar and planetary exploration, and performs research in materials modeling (including quantum materials) and quantum computing.


KBR is looking for a Senior Research Scientist to support the Quantum Artificial Intelligence Lab (QuAIL) at NASA Ames.  This person must have a strong expertise in quantum algorithms development, quantum simulation, quantum error correction and a deep understanding of the physics behind quantum algorithms. We are looking for a candidate with at least 6 years of experience in exploring quantum computing including hardware experience and classical simulators of quantum systems.


This person will lead independent research through numerical and theoretical analysis, exploring quantum error-correction, quantum algorithms, for near-term applications on quantum devices, as well as early fault-tolerant and utility-scale architectures. This person must be skilled in both numerical and analytical evaluation of the performance of quantum and classical algorithms and architectures comparing different quantum and quantum-classical hybrid approaches with each other and with state-of-the-art classical alternatives.


This individual must have demonstrated experience leading a team of researchers in quantum computing, and in leading technical proposal efforts.

*** Must be U.S. citizen or green card holder ***

Responsibilities:

Will lead the ISRDS task in Quantum Computing
Will serve as primary interface with the Ames Quantum Artificial Intelligence laboratory (QuAIL)
Will lead research on quantum error-correction and quantum algorithms
Will lead research on fundamental quantum mechanisms and their use in quantum computation
Will supervise researchers in quantum computation
May support and lead other related tasks in quantum sciences, data sciences and AI-based technologies

REQUIRED Skills and Traits:

Ph.D. in Physics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
6+ years of experience in quantum computing
Demonstrated ability to lead small teams
Strong interest in management and leadership development
Excellent oral and written communication skills

*** Must be U.S. citizen or green card holder ***

Basic Compensation:

$169,800.00 - $254,700.00

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

title: NORTHCOM: Operations Coordinator-DM
description:
Title:

NORTHCOM: Operations Coordinator-DM

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

As part of the LOGCAP NORTHCOM scope, KBR provides rapid response support to scheduled and unscheduled U.S. Army training exercises. KBR’s LOGCAP team successfully completed another year of support to Warfighter operations by providing typical LOGCAP services at two locations.

Job Summary

As an Operations Coordinator for Document Management, you will maintain project documentation files, ensure accuracy and compliance with Document Management Close as You Go (CAYG) requirements. You will scan physical records, upload electronic files, conduct document audits, and assist with logistical functions. In addition, you may have the opportunity to travel to some or all sites NORTHCOM.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Maintain project documentation files, including technical data, engineering drawings, and purchase orders.
Scan physical records and upload electronic files to shared folders.
Conduct document management audits to ensure compliance with CAYG requirements.
Assist in lifting and packing boxes of physical records into Triwalls.
Coordinate with internal stakeholders to communicate Document Management objectives, priorities, and schedules.
Collaborate with Environmental, Safety, and other functional areas for logistical functions as directed.
Develop metrics for performance measurement and analyze work processes.
Ensure departments meet turn-in deadlines and are compliant in the document management process for record holders.
Under direct supervision, you'll be assigned daily tasks, which may involve coordinating material and equipment movement, The job will require moderate to heavy lifting, and adherence to safety rules and procedures, including wearing required personal safety equipment, is essential.

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Requires a High School Diploma or equivalent and at least 3 years of LCV Department POC for Document Management.
Requires at least 1 Year as part of the Close Out Document Management Team.
Must have a thorough understanding of Document File Plans (DFP).
Requires proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Experience in US Government contract closure processes.
Ability to successfully work with various levels of employees and management.
Self-directed with strong attention to detail and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

description:
Title:

Associate Solutions Architect - Business Development

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

Join KBR’s Mission Technology Solutions team and help shape the future of critical missions across government and commercial sectors. We are seeking experienced Associate Solution Architects who thrive on solving complex challenges and delivering innovative, customer-focused solutions. In this role, you will have the opportunity to influence technical strategy, drive growth in emerging markets, and collaborate with top talent to support programs that matter—spanning Defense, Intelligence, Civilian Space, and Homeland Security. If you are passionate about advancing mission success through cutting-edge technologies and strategic thinking, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities:

As a Associate Solution Architect at KBR, you will play a critical role in driving technical strategy and solution development to support business growth across diverse mission areas, including Defense, Intelligence, Civilian Space, and Homeland Security. This position requires a strategic thinker with deep technical expertise and the ability to craft innovative, customer-focused solutions tailored to unique mission requirements.

You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and subject matter experts to:

Lead technical solution development for complex problems across the Mission Technology Solutions portfolio.
Shape customer requirements through early engagement, market research, and identification of competitive discriminators.
Develop proposal content, including technical volumes, whitepapers, and Basis of Estimates (BOEs), and respond to RFIs and market surveys.
Apply advanced methodologies such as Digital Engineering, Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE), DevSecOps, Agile development, Cloud architectures, and Data Analytics using AI/ML, with a strong emphasis on System of Systems integration.
Strong interpersonal skills working across multi-disciplinary teams to capture and develop new and innovative solutions to a wide range of complex problems.

Security clearance requirements vary by position. While some opportunities may require an active Top-Secret clearance with eligibility for TS/SCI due to the nature of the work, others do not. Candidates without clearance are encouraged to apply, as we have roles that do not require this level of access. Clearance eligibility may be considered a differentiator for certain programs.

Work Environment:

Location: Chantilly, VA; Dayton, OH; Colorado Springs, CO, Los Angeles, CA; Valley Forge, PA, Huntsville, AL; Remote-US
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

Required Qualifications:

Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline (Engineering, Computer Science, or related field); advanced degree preferred.
Minimum 5-8 years of industry experience in solution architecting or directly supporting operational programs to delivery capability to customers.  Preferred experience in an operational leadership role such as a Team Lead or Integrated Product Team (IPT) lead.
Technical Expertise
Proven experience in one or more mission areas: Defense, Intelligence, Civilian Space, or Homeland Security.
Strong background in System of Systems integration, architectures, and infrastructure.
Familiarity with advanced methodologies such as:
Digital Engineering
Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE)
DevSecOps
Agile development (software or hardware)
Cloud architectures
Data Analytics, AI/ML methodologies
Cybersecurity 
Business Development & Proposal Skills
Demonstrated ability to create, lead, or deliver technical solution development for complex problems for proposal volumes or operational programs.
Experience writing technical solutions, whitepapers, and developing Basis of Estimates (BOEs) as part of a proposal.
Ability to respond to RFIs, market surveys, and support customer shaping efforts.
Leadership & Communication
Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to mentor teams, foster collaboration, and engage stakeholders.
Strong communication and presentation skills for interfacing with customers and internal leadership.
Ability to work across multi-disciplinary teams, foster collaboration, and engage stakeholders.
Demonstrate effective use multiple communication methods to work across geographically dispersed teams collaborating on shared artifacts.
Security Clearance
Security clearance eligibility is required.
Security clearance requirements vary by position. While some roles may require an active Top Secret clearance with eligibility for TS/SCI, others do not. Candidates without clearance are encouraged to apply; clearance eligibility may be considered a differentiator for certain programs.

title: Senior Technical Advisor
description:
Title:

Senior Technical Advisor

Job Posting Description

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

KBR is seeking a Senior Technical Advisor to provide senior technical leadership and acumen across our Technical Intelligence (TI) Operating Unit, supporting current mission execution with NASIC, NSIC, and MSIC, while also shaping technical proposals and contributing to business development opportunities.

This role serves as the senior advisor for the TI Operating Unit, responsible for providing high-quality technical advice and support to stakeholders, analysts and engineers ensuring KBR delivers high-impact, mission-relevant intelligence solutions across the Air Force, Space Force, Department of War (DoW), and Intelligence Community.  This role also provides technical guidance for select capture efforts and program execution activities.

Key Responsibilities

Mission & Technical Leadership (50%)

Serve as the senior technical authority for the TI Operating Unit supporting NASIC, NSIC, and MSIC programs.

Provide technical oversight and direction across intelligence analysis, engineering, and advanced technology efforts.

Guide analytic rigor, tradecraft standards, and technical innovation across multi-disciplinary teams.

Mentor and develop junior and mid-level analysts, engineers, and technical leads, strengthening bench depth and succession.

Advise program managers and government customers on technical approaches, emerging threats, and analytic methodologies.

Support program execution, technical reviews, and customer engagements as a trusted senior SME.

Provide senior technical input, solution shaping, and reviews for capture activities and proposals, ensuring technical accuracy, compliance, and compelling discriminators aligned to customer mission needs

Lead and coordinate Independent Research and Development (IRAD) initiatives for the Technical Intelligence Operating Unit, including identifying high-value concepts, shaping technical approaches, and championing proposals through KBR’s IRAD approval and governance process

Lead technical strategy and solution development for new business capture across DoW, IC, and adjacent mission partners.

Support capture teams with technical discriminators, win themes, solution architectures, and proposal content.

Engage directly with government customers to identify emerging needs, shape requirements, and position KBR for future work.

Expand TI capabilities and customer footprint beyond NASIC, NSIC, and MSIC, including new agencies, mission sets, and technologies.

Partner with BD, Capture, and Program leadership to drive sustainable growth aligned with KBR’s strategic objectives.

Required Qualifications

Master’s degree or PhD in a relevant technical or scientific discipline (engineering, physics, intelligence, data science, aerospace, etc.).

Minimum 15+ years supporting DoW and/or Intelligence Community missions in a technical or analytic leadership role.

Demonstrated experience supporting NASIC, NSIC, MSIC, or closely related IC/DoD intelligence organizations.

Proven ability to serve as a senior technical leader and mentor across diverse technical teams.

Experience supporting business development, capture, or proposal efforts, including customer engagement and solution shaping.

Active TS/SCI clearance (CI Poly preferred or ability to obtain).

Desired Qualifications

Prior experience as a Chief Scientist, Technical Director, Principal Engineer, or equivalent senior technical role.

Experience shaping or leading solutions for A&AS, SETA, or intelligence support contracts.

Familiarity with emerging intelligence technologies (AI/ML, advanced sensing, space systems, ISR, modeling & simulation, etc.).

Strong written and verbal communication skills, including proposal writing and executive-level briefings.

description:
Title:

Solution Architect

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

The National Security Solutions (NSS) Business Unit is seeking a dynamic and experienced Solution Architect with a strong background in creating innovative and customer focused solutions to join our Solution Architect team. This role is pivotal in driving the technical strategy and solution design for business opportunities, ensuring alignment with customer requirements and organizational goals.  The ideal candidate will have a proven track record working in Government, Defense, and Intelligence communities, providing support to capture efforts, proposal writing, and oral presentations.  

This is an exciting opportunity to bring your experience to deliver innovative solutions that help our customers transform, modernize, and accelerate delivery of new capabilities.  If you thrive at the intersection of technology and business development, this is the role for you.

Key Responsibilities:

Responsibilities include engaging in customer shaping efforts, requirements gathering, and proposal support activities, leveraging understanding of industry trends and KBR capabilities to design, develop, and deliver winning proposals.

Collaborate with Business Development, Capture, and Proposal teams to craft compelling, technically sound solutions that align with customer needs and win strategies.
Act as a subject matter expert in the translation of solution requirements into proposal artifacts.
Lead the development of technical volumes for proposals, including writing, reviewing, and editing content to ensure compliance with RFP requirements.
Translate customer objectives into innovative technical solutions that address mission challenges while adhering to budget and schedule constraints.
Conduct market research, identify discriminators, and articulate value propositions that differentiate our solutions from competitors.
Develop comprehensive artifacts such as system designs, technical roadmaps, and implementation plans to support proposal efforts.
Participate in reviews to refine proposal content and ensure alignment with win themes.
Research emerging technologies and incorporate them into solution designs to enhance competitiveness.
Lead and write technical proposals, whitepapers and develop other collaterals in support of technical solutions.
Provide responses to request for information (RFI) and government market surveys or sources sought notice.
Provide basis of estimates (BOEs) for technical solutions.

Required Qualifications:

Requires a bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline with 12-15 years prior experience or a master’s degree in a technical discipline with 10-13 years of prior relevant experience.
The candidate should possess strong team building and leadership capabilities that will engage key internal and external sources to develop clear, concise solutions to difficult problem sets across the DoD and IC. 
Experience leading technical solutioning in partnership with business development and capture management teams; Technical solutioning experience will be in the defense and intelligence community markets for technology-centric business units providing both services and products to US Government customers.
Proven ability to successfully derive customer solutions based on understanding of customer problems that meet technical objectives within cost and schedule. From this in-depth understanding, the ideal candidate will be able to interact with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), Key Stakeholders (internal to KBR and external), Technical Experts, and other key roles to develop a compelling Solution for strategic growth markets and opportunities aligned with the NSS growth strategy.
Understanding of Cybersecurity, System of Systems, Software, and Agile Engineering current and emerging processes in use across Defense and Intelligence Customer communities such as Digital Engineering, Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE), DevSecOps, and Cloud Architectures.  

Clearance Requirements: Active Top Secret Clearance is required, with eligibility for TS/SCI .

Work Environment:

Location: Northern Virginia; Dayton OH; Colorado Springs CO; El Segundo CA; King of Prussia PA
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 hours per week.

This range is for the Colorado area only.

$185,900.00 - $278,800.00.

This range is for the California area only.

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Logistics Clerk
description:
Title:

Logistics Clerk

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR’s Global Asset Management (GAM) group provides comprehensive manufacturing and supply chain solutions globally, serving both commercial and government clients. With a wide range of services including Government Property Management, Production Maintenance, and Equipment Tracking, GAM is dedicated to ensuring excellence in every aspect of the supply chain and asset management process. This commitment ensures the seamless operation of our clients' enterprises across diverse locations.

Job Summary

The Logistics Clerk is responsible for coordinating and expediting the movement of materials, parts, and assemblies. This role involves establishing and communicating deadlines for deliverables, as well as verifying the accuracy of incoming and outgoing shipments. The clerk maintains relevant records, stamps identification information and shipping instructions on containers, and arranges for the distribution of materials upon arrival. They inspect products for quality and quantity to ensure they meet specifications, working diligently to adhere to schedules and support customer satisfaction.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Work with relevant departments to manage and organize inventory, ensuring accurate tracking and timely replenishment of supplies.
Maintain records related to receipts, movements, and kitting of materials for consumption.
Arrange for the distribution of materials upon arrival, including processing receipts, recording inductions into SAP, notifying material inspectors, managing put-aways, and updating inventory records.
Conduct visual inspections to ensure material receipts meet approved physical standards and that accompanying paperwork is accurate and compliant with customer requirements and specifications.
Maintain records of equipment movements, ensuring accurate documentation for inventory control.
Safely operate forklifts (sit-down and reach) and other equipment to move materials and equipment within the premises.
Collaborate with team members to ensure the smooth transfer of goods, delivering them timely and accurately to designated areas.
Perform routine inspections and maintenance on equipment to ensure proper functioning.

Basic Qualifications 

High school diploma or equivalent.
Ability to lift heavy objects, both individually and as part of a team, and perform physically demanding tasks.
Must be able to obtain a forklift certification.
Basic knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Must be a U.S. Citizen.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in shipping and receiving, safety protocols, organization, and equipment operation.
Experience with SAP.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. title: Associate Payroll Specialist - Temporary 6 Months Role
description:
Title:

Associate Payroll Specialist - Temporary 6 Months Role

We are seeking an Associate Payroll Specialist for our Dubai Office. The role is for a 6-month tenure with a possibility of it to be permanent. Candidates based in UAE having relevant experience in payroll processing for US, UK , Canada payroll will be preferred.

Working within the Payroll Processing team, the applicant will process US weekly, biweekly payrolls, respond to employee queries on the phone and in writing. Develops methods and overlooks the preparation of documents and payout of all payroll payments. Process Timesheet inputs through Cost point and MS Dynamics systems and in addition process one-time earnings and deduction entries. Organizes the production of payroll checks and provides associated information. Assesses current structure and suggests efficient enhancements to the organization. Under direct supervision, performs routine assignments as an entry level professional. Develops core job competencies with existing procedures by solving standard problems. Responsible for any of Dubai Shared Services payroll operations as directed. Ability to cross train on other countries payroll processing and tax.

Requirements:

1)  Bachelors or equivalent , Preference on payroll processing experience for either US, UK, Canada Payrolls. 

2)  Experience in either of SAP/MS Dynamics (ERP) system and Workday payroll system will be an advantage. Federal, State & Local Payroll Laws: 

3) Understanding of tax regulations, wage and hour laws, garnishment and compliance requirements. 

4) Proficient in MS office functions, well versed in Data Analytics, Good communication skills in English both written and oral.

5) Fresh Commerce Graduates completed their Schooling/ College in UAE are considered for the role.

title: Assistant Program Manager – Test & Evaluation (T&E)
description:
Title:

Assistant Program Manager – Test & Evaluation (T&E) 

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

 The Assistant Program Manager – Test & Evaluation (T&E) supports the planning, coordination, execution, and reporting of developmental and operational test activities across the program lifecycle using NAVAIR procedures. In this role, you will help ensure test scope, resources, schedules, documentation, and execution align with acquisition strategy, technical requirements, and government guidance. You will collaborate closely with engineering, logistics, contractors, government stakeholders, test organizations, and end users to validate and verify system performance prior to fielding. This is an on-site position in Lexington Park, MD, with travel required, supporting mission-critical aviation programs.

Roles and Responsibilities

Assist in developing Test and Evaluation Master Plans (TEMPs), test plans, test procedures, and data collection requirements to support developmental and operational testing across the program lifecycle.
Coordinate with developmental test (DT) and operational test (OT) agencies to align overall test strategy, schedules, and execution priorities.
Ensure test documentation and reporting comply with applicable DoD and NAVAIR/program-specific test policy and guidance.
Develop and maintain integrated master schedules (IMS) for T&E activities; track milestones, risks, issues, and dependencies impacting test events.
Coordinate test readiness reviews (TRRs), test events, and field activities, including range scheduling, instrumentation needs, test resources, and test article configuration planning.
Support on-site test execution as required and serve as a liaison with test teams to resolve issues quickly and maintain schedule and quality.
Collect, analyze, and validate test data and results; support test report development, deficiency reporting, and corrective-action tracking with traceability to requirements.
Participate in program technical reviews (e.g., deficiency reviews, system verification reviews) and support technical studies/analyses to refine test verification methods and approaches.
Support acquisition documentation and milestone decision activities by providing T&E inputs, schedules, and execution status to stakeholders.

Basic Qualifications

Clearance & Citizenship: U.S. Citizen with an active Secret clearance and Top Secret eligibility.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Program Management, or related field or equivalent relevant experience in lieu of a degree.
Experience: 10+ years of experience supporting DoD/government acquisition programs. Demonstrated experience supporting developmental and/or operational testing (DT/OT), including test planning, coordination, execution support, and reporting. Prior experience supporting NAVAIR aviation programs in a T&E environment, including use of NAVAIR procedures/policy.

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree in a STEM or management field.
DAWIA/FACP/PM certifications (T&E, Engineering, Program Management).
Experience working with integrated product teams (IPTs) and government-led test programs.
Experience with major range and test facility bases (e.g., NAVAIR, ATEC, AFOTEC, MDA, DOT&E).
Proficiency with MS Project, Jira, DOORS, or equivalent tools.

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 hours/week

Basic Compensation: $116,100 - $180,000. The salary range posted is based on the national average. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

location:
locations

description:
Title:

Sr. Subcontracts Administrator

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! - At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

Program Summary

KBR's Readiness and Sustainment (R&S) division is the Team Behind the Mission®. We deliver mission critical services to the U.S. military and coalition partners around the world. Our key capabilities include base operations; contingency and expeditionary support; next generation asset management; digitally-focused logistics; prepositioned stock; and integrated supply chain management.

Job Summary

KBR is seeking a highly motivated Sr. Subcontracts Administrator to oversee and perform a full range of subcontract administration activities associated with subcontracting work. This includes qualifying suppliers, issuing requests for proposals, evaluating proposals, and maintaining subcontract files in accordance with established procedures. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing subcontracting work as assigned on multiple projects and ensuring the seamless integration of subcontract work within the broader program including cost, schedule, technical, and quality management.

Under broad direction, the Sr. Subcontracts Administrator will be accountable for managing the delivery of Subcontracts objectives of the assigned Projects/Programs.  

Roles and Responsibilities 

Drive all aspects of major subcontract execution including cost, schedule, technical, and quality performance, ensuring full integration of subcontract work within the program (e.g., proposals, negotiations, contract execution).

Serve as the primary point of contact between the subcontractor and project management team, remaining accountable to Subcontracts and Supply Chain leadership.

Oversee the entire procurement cycle, coordinating between KBR’s technical team and suppliers across various functional teams.

Address critical, time-sensitive, and complex issues including proposal evaluations, contract documentation, and modifications for contract changes.

Assist in developing subcontract specifications, work statements, and terms and conditions for specialized materials, equipment, and services.

Lead key supplier negotiations regarding cost, terms and conditions, and long-term agreements.

Control costs, manage cost avoidance, and perform price analysis as required.

Develop supplier sourcing strategies and metrics (scorecards) for all commodity products.

Measure, manage, and improve vendor delivery performance.

Research market trends to maintain a world-class procurement environment.

Conduct ad-hoc analysis as requested by upper management and corporate supply chain leadership.

Implement initiatives to improve efficiency and sustain KPIs.

Implement GR/IR strategies to promote timely payment to suppliers.

Provide procurement support to business development team for proposal efforts. 

Basic Qualifications 

Education: Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree a plus.

Experience: 10+ years of experience in procurement and subcontract management.

Minimum of 6 - 8 years of subcontracts management experience negotiating Master Service Agreements and complex Subcontract Agreements.

Proven experience in establishing scope of work and writing technical or non-technical documentation including strong understanding of Specifications, Statements of Work, Contracts/Subcontracts, and Supplier Deliverables.

Experience supporting all subcontract types (IDIQ, Cost Reimbursable, Fixed Price, etc.), negotiations, terms and conditions, incentive arrangements, and order placement.

US Government Contract experience is highly desirable; experience with LOGCAP and/or AFCAP.

Experience supporting business development, proposals and new pursuits is highly desirable.

Strong working knowledge of FAR (Federal Acquisition Regulation) and DFAR (Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement).

Significant experience working with and/or leading audits with DCMA, including CPSR Audits, is highly preferred.

Strong background with Cost Analysis and Price Analysis is a plus.

Significant experience negotiating Subcontract Agreements.  

Strong Familiarity with IDIQ (Indefinite Delivery-Indefinite Quantity) type contracts is preferred.

Proven experience managing complex Subcontract Agreements.

Excellent English communication skills, both written, verbal, and presentation to effectively communicate business cases to all levels of peers, suppliers, and management.

Ability to communicate effectively at all organizational levels including with international teams and suppliers.

Strong project management, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.

Attention to detail and the ability to solve complex problems with excellent organizational skills.

Background Check Required.

Preferred Qualifications

Government Contractor / Government Solutions experience highly desirable.

Experience providing proposals support is highly desirable.

Experience managing international customer/supplier relationships.

Proficiency in developing and tracking internal metrics.

Desire to work in a collaborative environment as a part of a diverse team.

Strong ability to implement GR/IR strategies to promote on-time payment to suppliers.

In-depth understanding of global procurement processes and supply chain management.

Ability to drive initiatives to improve efficiency and sustain KPIs.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Aerospace Quality Engineer
description:
Title:

Aerospace Quality Engineer

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

Program Summary

KBR Assurance Services (KAS) delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, intelligence community, NASA, and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.

Our people make the world a more productive, efficient, and fascinating place. And that’s only the beginning.

Job Summary

In this position, you will serve as the engineer for AS9102 First-Article Inspections (FAIs). You will assign, track, and manage assignments in the Greer, SC area. You will be required to work directly with the customer and KBR to meet quality standards and schedule expectations.

Roles and Responsibilities
Reviews and conducts First Article Inspections (FAIs).
Provide onsite and remote support at Customer/Supplier sites.
Assign, track, and manage First-Article Inspection assignments of the KBR team.
Coordinate with customers to determine schedule, requirements, and specific needs for projects and inspections.
Ability to use AS9102 FAI generating software.
Provide estimates, quotes, and feedback to customers during the proposal process.
Conducts tests, inspections, audits, and validations to ensure process compliance with contract, KBR and customer requirements and specifications for design, engineering, products, equipment, maintenance, and services.
Conducts source inspections, evaluations and/or surveillance of vendors, suppliers, and subcontractors.
Knowledge and ability to use inspection tools, measuring and test equipment.
Conducts sampling inspections in accordance with approved plans and procedures.
Supports and actively participates in root-cause-analysis.
Conducts follow-up audits to review the effectiveness of implemented corrective actions.
Collects and uses statistical data for the monitoring and evaluation of trends.
Maintain and update QMS documents and quality contents as needed.
Provides training and tutoring to other engineering personnel, suppliers, and contract personnel in First-Article Inspection, Six Sigma techniques, Manufacturing Process Control, variation reduction, etc.
Provide technical leadership to coordinate implementation of advanced quality processes including statistically based variation reduction, control planning, mistake proofing, and Manufacturing Process Control.
Prepare and present metrics associated with quality trends and related improvements within the customer base.
Prepare progress reports, program reviews as needed, to assure the highest quality and cost effectiveness.
Provides activity and status reports to management.
Performs all other duties as assigned.
Basic Qualifications

Ability to prepare AS9102 First Article Inspections, including ballooned drawings and Forms 1, 2, and 3, and support related FAI activities such as reviews, measurements, and expediting.

Capability to review build operations and PFMEAs, recommending improvements to reduce scrap, minimize quality notifications, and mitigate potential audit findings.

Experience conducting root cause and corrective action (RCCA) activities in collaboration with quality and manufacturing engineering.

U.S. Citizenship Status required due to client requirement.

Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, materials, supply chain, management, business or technical discipline or equivalent experience.

2 years of experience in manufacturing/assembly operations, quality, engineering (design or manufacturing), and materials/procurement; preferably in aerospace electronics; these areas may be replaced by related military experience.

Demonstrated self-starter & the ability to perform with minimal supervision.

Experience in leading teams focused on problem solving and improvements.

Good communication skills both written and oral with the ability to provide a clear vision of the strategy and processes for key stakeholders.

High level of analytical ability to identify and evaluate appropriate courses of action for definition and resolution of complex problems.

Ability to assess and analyze risk on a day-to-day basis.

Preferred Qualifications
Proven track record of working closely with suppliers preferred.
Certified Green Belt or equivalent; Lean Expert or Black Belt preferred.
Experience with Automotive or Aerospace products preferred.
Additional experience or training in RCCA, Process Mapping, FMEAs and Control Plans or APQP/PPAP preferred.
Experience using Six Sigma Plus tools preferred.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Special Operations Clinical Psychologist (10SFG, Fort Carson, CO)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Clinical Psychologist (10SFG, Fort Carson, CO)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION. 

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

The Special Operations Clinical Psychologist will provide technical expertise, guidance, and direct clinical service in the area of operational psychology to special operations forces (SOF). 

 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

• May develop, plan and initiate resiliency programs for preventing and treating behavior health issues to support all aspects of a service member readiness and resiliency. 

• Conduct psychological evaluations utilizing information from clinical interviews, psychological testing, and collateral sources, as appropriate. 

• Practice within the guidelines of their state licensing board, American Psychological Association Ethical Principles and Code of Conduct, and MTF privileges. 

• Establish psychiatric diagnoses according to the American Psychiatric Association Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Disorders including providing psychological treatment for individuals and groups, helping medical and surgical patients deal with illnesses or injuries, and assisting in rehabilitation of patients. 

 

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training:  

• Position requires U.S. Citizenship. 

• This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top, Secret Clearance or the ability to obtain a clearance. 

• Doctorate of Philosophy (PhD) or Doctorate of Psychology (PsyD) from an American Psychology Association accredited college or university with a doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology. 

• Successful completion of an Internship/Residency in psychology accredited by the American Psychological Association. 

• A minimum of two (2) years of experience within the past five (5) years in the independent practice of clinical work in a mental health setting. 

• Providers must be able to meet clinical competency requirements specified in the Service-specific credentialing instructions. 

• Licensure: Current, full, active, and unrestricted license to practice as a psychologist in any U.S. State, the District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico or U.S. Virgin Islands. 

• Obtain practice privileges from the servicing military medical treatment facility.  

 

Standard Company Requirements:  

• Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.  

• Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.  

• Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.  

• Responsible for completing all required training.  

• Perform other assignments and duties, as required.  

 

Desired Education/Experience/Skills/Training:  

• Experience working in a government setting such as DoD or Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) MTF. 

 

Basic Compensation: This range is for the Fort Carson, CO area only 

$129,108-$143,056

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, abilities and / or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commission, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Database Developer
description:
Title:

Database Developer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Job Summary:

The DoD International AIMS Program Office (DoD AIMS PO) is responsible for the testing and evaluation of Identification Friend or Foe (IFF) systems, ensuring interoperability for all DoD, NATO, and coalition partner weapons systems. The Air Force Life Cycle Management Center (AFLCMC) Avionics Engineering Division (AFLCMC/EZA) provides avionics systems engineering leadership and technical support to program offices to design, develop, manufacture, integrate, test, and deploy weapon systems. The KBR team provides support to DoD AIMS PO, facilitating the testing and evaluation of all IFF and Mark XIIB systems/subsystems. The KBR team is primarily located at the DoD AIMS PO at Robins Air Force Base (AFB), Georgia.  The incumbent of this position will function as an integral DoD AIMS PO Database Developer and Web Designer responsible for developing and maintaining a classified address assignment database. The incumbent will work within the development team supporting environments in cloud-based database applications (MongoDB preferred). As a Database Developer and Web Designer, you will evaluate customer requirements, address complex technical challenges in cloud-native development environments, manage the full application lifecycle from initial deployment through ongoing maintenance, and be able to define, generate, and review project requirements while providing detailed documentation. The ideal candidate will have strong experience with cloud-native database applications, including infrastructure security and management. You must be comfortable working in a dynamic, fluid environment with direct stakeholder engagement. Familiarity with DoD 5000.02 acquisition policies and processes is preferred, but not required.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain a cloud-native database in a classified DoD environment used for tracking and assignment measures.

Lead or support initial application deployment and infrastructure spin-up activities, including environment configuration and security hardening.

Assist the government customer in developing milestone schedules, integrating multiple development stages, performing schedule risk analysis, building projections of schedule outcomes, and developing reports or presentations.

Work within a cross-functional team to integrate development activities into achievable project milestones.

Communicate findings to management and stakeholders through briefings, written reports, and verbal presentations.

Collaborate directly with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide technical guidance.

Define, generate, and review project requirements with detailed technical documentation.

Implement and maintain database security protocols, backup procedures, and disaster recovery processes.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: 0-20% minimum travel

Working Hours: Standard 40 hours per week.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or related technical field. In lieu of degree, four (8) years of related professional experience is required

2+ years of backend development experience with JavaScript/Node.js

2+ years of experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL databases

Experience with SQL databases (Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, or PostgreSQL)

Possess or obtain IAT Level II certification (Security+, SSCP, CySA+, GSEC, CCNA-Security, CND, or GICSP) within 12 months of employment start date

Proficiency with Git version control

Experience with front-end technologies: React, HTML, CSS

Strong understanding of database architecture, design patterns, and optimization

Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to work directly with stakeholders.

Must possess a Secret security clearance or higher.

Desired Qualifications:

Experience with greenfield application deployment and initial infrastructure spin-up (standing up new applications from scratch)

Experience with Continuous Monitoring and Authorization to Operate (ATO) processes

Application security experience, including implementation of security controls, vulnerability remediation, and security best practices

Knowledge of cloud security frameworks and compliance requirements (FedRAMP, DoD IL4/IL5)

Experience with project management and collaboration tools (Trello, Jira, Confluence)

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevSecOps practices

Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)

Knowledge of API development and RESTful service design

Ready to Make a Difference?

 If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Position Summary:

KBR is seeking a Data Scientist to join our team in Dayton, OH. This position can be onsite or remote. KBR solves the toughest problems for our clients by extracting insight from data, delivering greater decision confidence, and improving processes.   Our analysts are involved in a wide range of activities that range from understanding and transforming data, applying state of the art analytic techniques, and driving business impact through insight visualization.  Our analysts are leveraged across of range of projects, such as artificial intelligence, advanced analytics, business process improvement, and application development. KBR analysts collaborate with Operations Research Analysts, Software Development Professionals, Data Architects, and Subject Matter Experts.

Key Responsibilities:

Execute analytical experiments methodically to help solve various problems and make a true impact across various domains and industries
Research and apply state-of-the-art artificial intelligence methods and innovative statistical models
Identify relevant data sources and sets to mine for client business needs, and collect large structured and unstructured datasets and variables
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Develop code for predictive/prescriptive models with applied machine learning and other modeling techniques
Clearly document and present methodology, assumptions, and findings to stakeholders
Working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams to improve business outcomes
Deliver in a fast-paced, team-oriented work environment
Adapt quickly to changing needs across several core areas, including data wrangling, data exploration, data analysis, and data visualization
Articulate trade-offs between analytic techniques, recommend a course of action to clients, and provide effective updates on project outcome uncertainty to leadership.
Hands on experience performing analysis to solve problems
Discovering insights hidden in large data sets
Using a variety of advanced analysis methods, data tools, and models
Using/creating algorithms and/or creating/running simulations
Testing the effectiveness of different courses of action 

Work Environment:

Location: Onsite or Remote
Travel Requirements: Minimal
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science or related field
5+ yrs experience in Data Science or Data analysis
Proficiency in programming languages like Python or R
Experience with AI frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Familiarity with Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and Large Language Models (LLM)
Developing data pipelines to support Analytics
Applying advanced analytics and machine learning techniques
Documenting and communicating results of analysis
Familiarity with SQL and BI Tools (Tableau, Qlik etc.)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Hands on experience with driving analytic insights and workflow automation.
Must have the ability and motivation to self-teach in order to stay current with leading best practices in analytics.
Candidates must be able to tackle difficult problems, specifically working with artificial intelligence.
Expected to have data wrangling skills.
Ability to obtain a DoD Secret clearance

Desired:

Master's degree in Data Science or related field
Solid understanding of applied machine learning methods and algorithms
Exploratory Data Analysis and Workflow Improvement
Applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Data-oriented personality with proficiency in using data query languages such as SQL and ability to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
Ability to use data visualization to communicate value of insights
Designing and developing AI agents, implementing agentic workflows
Agentic AI frameworks such as LangGraph and standards such as Model Context Protocol (MCP)
Text mining and Natural Language Processing techniques such as Named Entity Recognition and Text Classification
Graph Analysis tools such as Neo4J and Cypher
Databricks, Azure AI Foundry, Amazon Bedrock, Amazon SageMaker
Process Automation, Image Analysis, Predictive and Prescriptive analysis

Basic Compensation:

$80,000-$130,000

This range is for the Dayton, OH area only.

*The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s working location, knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience, clearance level, contract affordability and in consideration of internal parity.

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

title: Commercial SATCOM, SME
description:
Title:

Commercial SATCOM, SME

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

                                                                                

The Commercial SATCOM SME position provides expertise with developing, planning, operating, controlling, and/or managing multiple various military or commercial SATCOM systems and software.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provides expertise and focus for integrating Amazonas Nexus, mPower constellation, and other commercial satellite networks and leased transponders within the broader DoD SATCOM enterprise.

Develops, plans, operates, and controls military or commercial systems and software.

Experience with; DoD and Service Teleports and Gateways, allocation processes for ground, Space, and control networks, and planning tools for commercial assists.

Recommends changes to improve site operations and system performance; and

Interfaces with developers, manufacturers, vendors, and/or Government personnel to resolve technical and engineering problems and perform other duties as specified.

Identifies, plans, and accomplishes training instruction needed to ensure engineering support personnel stay current and obtain certifications needed. 

Collaborate with government and military stakeholders to define mission needs and operational problem sets.

Apply systems engineering and operations analysis methods to evaluate space mission capabilities and architectures.

Participate in agile planning processes and collaborate with other analysts, developers, and subject matter experts.

Prepares recommendations and solutions for specific areas in question.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

BA/BS degree and 8+ years of experience, or equivalent work experience in lieu of degree.

Citizenship and Clearance:

US Citizen.

Active Top Secret security clearance with ability to obtain TS/SCI is required.

Technical Knowledge:

Demonstrated relevant experience with the SATCOM apportionment planning and allocation processes taking into consideration all ground, space, and control networks, and operational control of sub-networks for apportioned SATCOM resources.

Knowledge of SATCOM joint integrated management tools.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Knowledge of operation and maintenance of space, SATCOM, airborne, and terrestrial networks.

Experience in systems engineering related field with a specialization in satellite communications, information technology, or electrical engineering.

Excellent written and verbal communications skills; able to communicate and brief complex concepts at all levels.

Able to troubleshoot and resolve problems independently and in high pressure situations.

SCHEDULED WEEKLY HOURS:

Normal hours of operation (0730–1630 hours).

40 hours, 5 days a week.

TRAVEL:

May require travel to CONUS and OCONUS locations, expect approximately 10%.

This position is contingent upon contract award.

Basic Compensation:

$129,800 - $162,200

This range is for the CO area only

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s work location, knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience, clearance level, contract affordability and in consideration of internal parity.

 

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance

title: Operations Integration Department Manager (Supporting NASA at Johnson Space Center)
description:
Title:

Operations Integration Department Manager (Supporting NASA at Johnson Space Center)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

 

Around here, we define the future.

 

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking to identify a candidate for a Department Manager (DM) position within the Integrated Mission Operations Contract III (IMOC III) at the NASA Johnson Space Center’s Flight Operations Directorate (FOD) located in Houston, Texas.  IMOC III is the operations contract for Human Space Flight Operations and includes the support of mission preparation (Plan); crew, flight controller, instructor, and analyst training (Train); and real-time mission execution (Fly) activities related to the International Space Station (ISS), Orion, Space Launch System (SLS), Gateway, Human Lander System (HLS), EVA and Human Mobility Program (EHP), Commercial LEO Destination (CLD), and Private Astronaut Mission (PAM) operations.

The DM position primarily supports the Operations Integration Division (CO). The DM position reports directly to the Program Manager and is responsible for ensuring support of CO technical services tasked on the IMOC III including development and operations for the ISS, Artemis, Commercial Programs.  This position includes company and competition-sensitive duties related to the IMOC III  and other commercial space endeavors that requires establishing company and program strategies.

The Operations Integration DM is a second-level management position responsible with day-to-day oversight of five first level leaders and their direct reports within the department, including coordinating resource prioritization and allocation, and ensuring that the team completes its responsibilities within budget and schedule.  In addition, the candidate is responsible for handling administrative tasks associated with the department’s leadership and administrative personnel such as performance rating, merit planning, career development, technical and leadership training, disciplinary actions, etc., and other duties as assigned.

Responsibilities:

Lead, manage, and supervise five Technical Area Leads (NASA)
Develop and maintain successful professional relationships with customers, stakeholders, peers, and direct reports
Manage budget, staffing, and personnel performance to ensure all task order requirements are successfully met
Report contract budget and employee performance status to the NASA division and office management on a regular basis
Implement process improvements that benefit the program and customer
Develop and implement strategies for customer and company success

Qualifications/Skills:

Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to effectively communicate with peers and direct reports in a very dynamic, fast-paced organization
Demonstrated ability to plan, prioritize, and coordinate tasks and resolve issues within a contractor–customer environment.
Demonstrated understanding of the FOD’s overall mission and associated Plan/Train/Fly concepts
Proven experience as a capable contributor to FOD technical tasks and the ability to support assignments associated with IMOC III task orders
Ability to tactfully handle personnel issues
Experience recruiting and interviewing
Demonstrated ability to manage manpower, priorities and customer requirements
Effective at handling multiple tasks, flexible, and responds quickly to changes
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to interact across organizations and all levels of personnel
Experience with the IMOC III Management Information System is desired
Position typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 15 years progressive relevant management experience.

title: Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker (75th RR, Ft. Moore, GA)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker (75th RR, Ft. Moore, GA)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

 

KBR maintains a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts.  We are looking for a Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker to join the team who is responsible for integrating the physical, mental and psychological wellness of our service members and their families.    

 

This Special Operations Licensed Clinical Social Worker will function within an operational unit, as a Behavioral Health Care Provider and is responsible for the application of social work procedures and techniques, including interviewing, behavioral assessment, and evidenced-based therapies, in the evaluation, diagnosis, and treatment of psychological and neuropsychological disorders using the following skills: individual, family and group psychotherapy, couple's therapy, alcohol and drug treatment evaluations.  

  

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

Engage all quality improvement and staff meetings, conferences  

Conduct applied research and clinical investigations in clinical/behavioral health/organizational social work.  

Consult with medical personnel, legal authorities, military commanders and school districts as required.  

Maintain accurate medical records of all patients seen and produces reports of evaluation and/or treatment.  

Participate in military specific training.  This position may include clinical supervision of unlicensed providers or trainees.  

May be required to perform some, or all, of the following activities: Participates in and successfully completes required DoD or service required training; Contact referred patients to assess treatment adherence; Use validated symptom inventories to assess current symptom severity; Assess barriers to treatment adherence and help patient problem-solve solutions to barriers; Provide patients with education regarding their mental health condition and treatment regimen; maintain patient information in a patient registry; maintain accurate and current notes in the electronic medical records of all patients contacted for review by the managing physician; Routinely staffs difficult cases with the referring provider, behavioral health consultant and/or psychiatry consultant; and Performs case management functions.  

  

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training:  

Position requires U.S. Citizenship.  

This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top Secret Clearance, or the ability to obtain a clearance. 

Master of Social Work (M.S.W.) or equivalent (MSSW, MSSA) degree from a graduate school of social work fully accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE).  

Maintain a current, unrestricted clinical license to independently practice social work in any one of the 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, or the U.S. Virgin Islands.  

Maintain credentialing requirements in good standing at a local MTF.  

A minimum of two (2) years peer-reviewable clinical social work experience in a mental health setting. 

Demonstrate a working knowledge of professional standards and ethics regarding the delivery of clinical social work services.  

Experience in brief behavioral interventions.  

May be required to receive and maintain clinical practice privileges. 

Fluent oral and written communication skills in English.  

Experience working in a Government setting such a DOD or Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) MTF.  

Must maintain current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) by the American Heart Association; must provide front and back proof of all training/certs/documentation. 

 

Standard Company Requirements:  

Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.  

Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.  

Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.  

Responsible for completing all required training.  

Perform other assignments and duties, as required.  

  

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: LCV EUCOM Kosovo: Operations Coordinator DM
description:
Title:

LCV EUCOM Kosovo: Operations Coordinator DM

Program Summary

KBR leads the government services world contingency market by providing responsive, full-service logistics support to forces deployed around the world under the Logistics Civil Augmentation Program contract (LOGCAP). KBR’s enduring mission support of the LOGCAP program dates back to 1992 when we served as the contract’s original prime contractor. Today, we have a workforce of over 6,000 people representing 40 nationalities who perform work on the contract in 14 countries.

Job Summary

This role is responsible for managing and maintaining physical records throughout their lifecycle, including storage, rotation, destruction, and compliance with retention requirements. Key duties include tracking and documenting all record movements, preparing records for destruction using FIFO principles, coordinating shipments and transfers, and supporting audits and RFIs. The position also involves inventory management of records and equipment, assisting with scanning and box preparation, and collaborating with safety and logistics teams as needed.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Maintain project documentation files, including technical data, engineering drawings, and purchase orders.

Scan physical records and upload electronic files to shared folders.

Conduct document management audits to ensure compliance with CAYG requirements.

Assist in lifting and packing boxes of physical records into Triwalls.

Coordinate with internal stakeholders to communicate Document Management objectives, priorities, and schedules.

Collaborate with Environmental, Safety, and other functional areas for logistical functions as directed.

Develop metrics for performance measurement and analyze work processes.

Ensure departments meet turn-in deadlines and are compliant in the document management process for record holders.

Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

 Requires a High School Diploma or equivalent

Experience on the document management process.                

Requires at least 1 Year as a part of the Close Out Document Management

Must have a thorough understanding of Document File Plans (DFP).

Requires proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

A level of English proficiency in accordance with the position

Fluency in Albanian and possessing an unrestricted right to work and reside in Kosovo.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Experience in US Government contract closure processes.

Ability to successfully work with various levels of employees and management.

Self-directed with strong attention to detail and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
