Job Summary

This role is responsible for managing and maintaining physical records throughout their lifecycle, including storage, rotation, destruction, and compliance with retention requirements. Key duties include tracking and documenting all record movements, preparing records for destruction using FIFO principles, coordinating shipments and transfers, and supporting audits and RFIs. The position also involves inventory management of records and equipment, assisting with scanning and box preparation, and collaborating with safety and logistics teams as needed.

Roles and Responsibilities

Maintains documentation and tracking of all physical records that are destroyed, shipped or sent out for Request for Information (RFI’s) and audits.

Pull records that are ready for destruction and destroy them via shredding.

Receive shipments of EUCOM records that are sent for retention and destruction.

Responsible for the storage and Rotation of records using the First In First Out (FIFO) for destruction.

Pack triwalls of records to move from Storage containers to Destruction point.

Maintain inventory of all boxes received, scanners and shredders.

Coordinate TMR’s for box movement.

Assist with scanning and preparation of the boxes.

Collaborate with Environmental, Safety and other functional areas for logistical functions as directed.

Perform other duties as assigned. 

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Requires a high school diploma or equivalent.

Must have at least 2 years of SSA, PSM, MCT and warehouse experience or combination of each.

Must have current/or able to get base access throughout EUCOM.

Requires proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint).

Capable of standing for extended durations and lifting up to 50 pounds

Intermediate in English proficiency: Must be able to speak, read, and write in English at an Intermediate level.

Fluency in Albanian and possessing an unrestricted right to work and reside in Kosovo.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Experience in US Government contract closure processes.

Ability to successfully work with various levels of employees and management.

title: NSA BOSS Bahrain: Maintenance Technician, EVT
description:
Title:

NSA BOSS Bahrain: Maintenance Technician, EVT

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

Since 2017, KBR has provided multi-site BOS services to NSA Bahrain, which includes dining facility 
services that have produced more than 1.3 million meals and operations and maintenance of more than 
220 facilities, some of which require 24/7 uninterrupted services due to being mission critical.

Job Summary

We are seeking a skilled and certified Mechanic Technician, EVT, to support our maintenance operations. This role is responsible for performing diagnostics, repairs, and preventive maintenance on a wide range of vehicles and equipment, including forklifts, loaders, trucks, emergency vehicles, and other heavy machinery. The mechanic will report directly to the Project Leader and play a critical role in ensuring all equipment is operating safely, efficiently, and in compliance with operational standards.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Must have strong Mechanical background and abilities. Responsibilities may include inventory of special bench stock items dedicated to repair and maintenance of fire Emergency Vehicles and Critical Equipment (EVTCC) supporting fire and emergency services in the Middle East, Central Asia (ME/CA).
Technicians must hold a Level 2 Emergency Vehicle Technician (EVT) certification/qualification, as defined by the EVT Certification Commission, Inc. (EVTCC), in the area of [e.g., Fire Pump and Plumbing] is required.
Responsible for delivery of critical parts to designated sites and submits requisitions to replace special bench stock.
Submits and tracks parts and supply requisitions for fire assigned vehicles and critical equipment.
As directed by F&ES, is responsible for inventory of special bench stock items dedicated to repair and maintenance of EVCE and stands inventory audits as appropriate.
Will be a designated member of the Mobile Maintenance Contact Team (MMCT) in support of site local maintenance for fire assigned vehicles and emergency critical equipment.
Reports to sites (as directed) to assist local maintenance with hands on EVCE troubleshooting and repair.
Performs direct, hands-on Preventive Maintenance (PM) and Corrective Maintenance (CM) and repairs as appropriate.
Provides local maintenance guidance and training on EVCE.

Basic/Required Qualifications 

High school diploma or GED required; technical or vocational training preferred.
Experience in vehicle and heavy equipment maintenance.
Valid Level 2 Emergency Vehicle Technician (EVT) certification/qualification, as defined by the EVT Certification Commission, Inc. (EVTCC), in the area of [e.g., Fire Pump and Plumbing] is required.

Preferred Qualifications

Must be fluent in English.
Must possess a passport book (not passport card) with at least 12 months of remaining validity AND with at least 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining.
Ability to work effectively in a high-pressure environment with multiple interruptions/distractions

Physical Requirements        

Ability to lift to 50 lbs.
Work in various environments including outdoors, in workshops, and around heavy machinery.
Stand, bend, and kneel for extended periods.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which include medical insurance.
We support career advancement through professional training and development and flexible work schedule.

title: LCV EUCOM Kosovo: Cook
description:
Title:

LCV EUCOM Kosovo: Cook

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR leads the government services world contingency market by providing responsive, full-service logistics support to forces deployed around the world under the Logistics Civil Augmentation Program contract (LOGCAP). KBR’s enduring mission support of the LOGCAP program dates back to 1992 when we served as the contract’s original prime contractor. Today, we have a workforce of over 6,000 people representing 40 nationalities who perform work on the contract in 14 countries.

Job Summary

As a Cook at our Dining Facility, you will be responsible for preparing menu items in accordance with recipes and providing hands-on operational oversight, training, and supervision during your assigned shift.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Prepare menu items according to recipes and maintain direct operational oversight, providing training and supervision during assigned shifts.
Ensure compliance with KBR Policies and Procedures and the DFAC SOW, following technical manuals such as AR 30-22, DA PAM 30-22, TB MED 530 and TM 10–412-Armed Forces Recipe Service.
Immediately correct all food related deficiencies.
Adhere to KBR Policies and Procedures and comply with the Dining Facility Statement of Work (SOW).
Adhere to KBR Standard Work Instructions as per the Quality Program (QCP) and the Twenty-One (21) Day Continuity of Operations (CONOPS) Menu.
Ensure safety, follow technical manuals and standard work instructions, and obtain required approvals where applicable.
Obtain appropriate and required approvals for all actions.
Conduct taste tests of menu items before meal service and ensure food production aligns with TM 10-412 and prescribed recipes.
Prepare food with appropriate decoration/garnish for scheduled meals and special events within the facility.
Maintain constant attention to safe work practices, promptly addressing any unsafe acts witnessed.
Check all food production equipment for safe and proper operation, reporting and following up on equipment requiring maintenance or replacement.
Ensure proper operation of kitchen equipment and verify that all personnel have been trained before operating such equipment.
Enforce the use of appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) when handling potentially hazardous foods or chemicals.
Review Preventive Medicine and KBR QA/QC inspections with the Food Service Sous Chef and correct all documented deficiencies.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must have a High School Diploma or equivalent and a minimum of 3 years of directly related food services experience.
Requires the ability to read, write, understand, and speak clearly in English.
Must be able to comprehend verbal and written instructions and effectively communicate instructions to others.
Require ServSafe Food Handler at hire or completion within a defined period post-hire. 
Fluency in Albanian and possessing an unrestricted right to work and reside in Kosovo.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Culinary certification or degree.
Previous experience in a military dining facility or similar setting.
Familiarity with KBR Policies and Procedures.
Strong understanding of safe work practices and compliance standards in food service operations.
Familiarity with military food service technical manuals (TM 10–412) preferred; training/certification provided post-hire.

title: Principal Technical Professional
description:
Title:

Principal Technical Professional

Division:

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset

life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

Summary Section

As part of the electrical engineering team you will be involved in the design of electrical systems for the oil and gas and/or power including renewable energies industries. This may be a conceptual study or front-end engineering design (FEED) or a design execution involving, the procurement of all equipment and detailed drawings for the construction and commissioning of an entire facility.

Responsibilities:
Shall be able to read, understand and implement client specifications / local / international standards
Shall have good knowledge of electrical equipment like MV/LV Switchgears, transformers, UPS etc.
Shall be able to prepare technical specifications and datasheets for electrical items with minimum supervision.
Shall have good understanding of various electrical layouts and shall be able to guide and check work performed by designers
Shall be able to understand overall power distribution scheme and SLDs
Shall be able to prepare load list, load calculations, cable sizing, earthing and lighting calculations including preparation of cable schedules and interconnection diagrams
Shall be able to understand and prepare basic control schematics
Shall be able to manage a team of 5 -10 Engineers / designers
Shall be able to perform vendor drawing review of Electrical items and mechanical packages
Shall be aware of and implement relevant HSE aspects while performing assigned tasks
Working experience in ETAP / SPEL will be an added advantage
Shall have good written and oral communication skills
Shall be able to work in multi-cultural environment

Qualifications including Required Education, Experience, & Skills:
Shall have a Bachelor’s Degree (Full Time) in Electrical & Electronics Engineering
12 - 16 years of experience in Oil & Gas / industrial projects

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!
skills: Shall be able to work in multi-cultural environment
Qualifications including Required Education, Experience, & Skills:
Shall have a Bachelor’s Degree (Full Time) in Electrical & Electronics Engineering
12 - 16 years of experience in Oil & Gas / industrial projects
Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

title: I&C Designer
description:
Title:

I&C Designer

Responsibilities:

Work closely with clients providing solutions and deliverables, building a business of work based on continued success delivering projects
Develop and deliver discipline-specific instrumentation and controls (I&C) designs, drafting, and 3D modeling services in alignment with company standards, client expectations, and applicable codes and regulations
Apply recognized offshore and onshore design principles, standards, and practices in all aspects of I&C engineering
Interpret and incorporate data from P&IDs, one-line diagrams, loop diagrams, and other technical documentation
Conduct site visits and field verification to validate and update marked-up drawings
Collaborate effectively with clients, engineers, construction teams, contractors, and multidisciplinary teams throughout the design lifecycle
Produce deliverables such as design drawings, 3D models, bills of materials, schedules, and material take-offs
Support TIC estimates with MTO’s quantities and pricing
Utilize electronic document management systems (EDMS) to organize and manage design documentation
Ensure design output is timely, accurate, and within defined scope and budget
Assist in the development and review of final project documentation, incorporating client feedback and internal quality standards
Continuously seek and implement process improvements, technological advancements, and innovative approaches to enhance design efficiency and integrity

Qualifications:

Degree in a technical discipline (Instrumentation, Electrical Design, or related field)
Advanced proficiency in AutoCAD and Smart Plant Instrumentation (In tools)
Strong understanding of I&C design standards, including the ability to interpret and update P&IDs, loop drawings, and one-line diagrams
Proficient in 3D modeling and drafting software tools, with the ability to generate accurate and detailed deliverables
Skilled in organizing and managing complex design data from multiple sources
Experience conducting field verification and site walks to validate design intent and drawing accuracy

location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:

Engineer, Pipeline (Integrity)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals. Job Title: - Engineer, Pipeline (Integrity)

Job Purpose

                 

KBR is looking for talented individuals to join our PMC team to work on an exciting project as a Engineer, Pipeline (Integrity) for a PMC project to be based in Abu Dhabi in Client Proposed office

 Candidate will plan & implement all pipeline integrity activities including, but not limited to Integrity Pigging Surveys. Candidate will technically advise on the integrity status of pipelines as and when needed / asked. Candidate with contractors & site to follow up Intelligent Pigging Surveys outcomes, ensure all required data is acquired and properly saved for future use / reference and issue Integrity Status Summary Report. Candidate will frequently ensure that “ADNOC Offshore Pipeline Integrity Strategy” is current.
Accountabilities:
Advise and support on the development and implantation of PIMS related supporting systems, Pipeline Integrity Strategy, procedures and guidelines.

Validate the inspection findings, review, assess and evaluate the IP findings.

Provide technical advice and support to management and Business Units on pipeline integrity issues.

Good knowledge of English,
Min. of 10 years’ experience as Pipeline Integrity Engineer

title: Senior Civil Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Civil Engineer

Our Purpose

We’re here to deliver better infrastructure for a better tomorrow.

By designing smart, sustainable transport solutions, we connect people and places across Australia’s major cities, regional communities, and remote areas. Our mission is to move people more safely and efficiently through innovative rail, road, bridge, and maritime projects—always with sustainability at the forefront.

We design with care for people and the planet, creating vibrant, connected places that respect heritage, support community growth, and shape the cities of the future.

The Opportunity

As a Senior Civil Engineer, you’ll play a key role in delivering some of Victoria’s most complex and high‑profile transport infrastructure projects.

You will contribute as a Civil Lead on multidisciplinary projects—supporting technical direction, driving design development, and solving complex engineering challenges to deliver robust, practical solutions across road, rail, and major transport programs.

You’ll provide technical guidance, support junior engineers, and help manage project delivery to meet quality, safety, budget, and timeline expectations. You’ll work closely with clients and stakeholders, helping to shape design decisions and ensuring engineering outcomes align with project objectives.

This is an exciting opportunity to take on a senior technical role within projects that will define the future of Australia’s transport networks.

Who You Are

You’re an experienced Senior Civil Engineer with strong technical capability and a proven history contributing to complex civil design on major infrastructure projects. You’re comfortable working in fast‑paced environments, coordinating across disciplines, and bringing well‑reasoned engineering solutions to the table.

You understand how to collaborate effectively, support clients and teammates, and deliver integrated, high‑quality civil engineering outcomes.

You Bring:

A degree in Civil Engineering (or equivalent)
Solid experience delivering transport or civil infrastructure projects with consultants, contractors, or government agencies
Demonstrated experience contributing as a Civil Engineer on major road, rail, or transport programs
Advanced technical competency in civil engineering design tools and methodologies
Strong knowledge of relevant Australian and state transport standards, codes, and guidelines
Chartered status (CPEng) or progress toward chartership

What We Do

KBR’s Infrastructure Services team is building a smarter and more sustainable future for Australia. We deliver end‑to‑end solutions across transport, water, defence, and the built environment, partnering with clients nationwide throughout every stage of the project lifecycle.

With more than 1,200 specialists across the country, we combine global expertise with deep local knowledge. We’re digitally connected, agile, and committed to delivering social and environmental outcomes that benefit communities long into the future.

At KBR, We Value You

Our values define how we operate and how we support our people:
We Value Our People, We Deliver, We Are People of Integrity, We Empower, and We Are a Team of Teams.

As you focus on leading high‑impact engineering solutions, we ensure you have the support, flexibility, and autonomy you need to thrive. Enjoy hybrid working options, family‑friendly arrangements, and a culture built on trust, empowerment, and collaboration.

At KBR, you’ll work alongside some of the industry’s most respected experts with the support of a global organisation—and the connected, supportive feel of a local team. Here, you’re not just part of the business; you’re integral to shaping its future.

KBR values an inclusive and diverse work environment, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences. 

#LI-DNP #LI-DNI  #S-DNI
skills: of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.
#LI-DNP #LI-DNI  #S-DNI

Title:

Telecom Engineer

Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for the delivery of the TSI/Telecoms Package.

Support the Telecoms Lead Engineer in all other Telecoms activities.

Develop Telecoms Systems Specifications, TSI Scope of Work, and Bill of Materials.

Prepare Telecoms systems block diagram sketches.

Review telecoms systems studies such as PAGA coverage study, radio coverage study, VSAT link calculation, fiber optic link budget, etc.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Title:

Test Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Job Summary: KBR is seeking a highly motivated Test Engineer to support the DoD International AIMS Program Office at Robins AFB, GA. This position involves working with a high operational tempo team focused on Identification Friend or Foe (IFF) certification efforts to ensure interoperability between DoD, NATO, and partner nation weapon systems. The Test Engineer will perform various engineering tasks related to IFF certification, including data collection, technical analysis, and communication with external program offices. The role requires travel to government and commercial sites for testing and data collection.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Perform engineering tasks related to IFF certification to establish and maintain interoperability of air, land, and sea weapon systems.

Travel to government and commercial sites to witness bench, platform, and operational testing of weapon systems, collecting data points to evaluate performance against DoD technical standards and test requirements.

Conduct technical data analysis of IFF systems and prepare comprehensive system-level evaluations, including the review and interpretation of supplementary test data (e.g., antenna patterns, EMI/EMC reports, Software Version Description documents, interrogation management schemes).

Communicate with external program offices to collect required test data, coordinate test plans, evaluate test results, and determine if product design and/or integration meets DoD standards and performance expectations.

Monitor the progress of assigned projects from initiation through certification, ensuring continuous communication with all stakeholders.

Identify all failures, deviations, or discrepancies against technical standards and test requirements in a discrepancy report.

Utilize technical writing abilities to prepare final certification packages, enabling government customers to make decisions on system suitability for certification.

Monitor and manage the progress of multiple projects and continually update internal databases.

Move, lift, and carry objects weighing up to 50 lbs.

Travel out of the local area up to 25% of the calendar year if needed.

Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: Moderate 20-50%

Working Hours: Standard

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field and 4 years of experience in lieu of formal education 8 years of experience with IFF systems and certification process with be required

Strong technical writing and data analysis skills.

Active secret clearance

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working with DoD, NATO, or partner nation weapon systems.

Familiarity with DoD technical standards and test requirements.

Excellent communication and project management skills.

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

description:
Title:

*SkillBridge Only* ICS: AFHE Maintenance Technician

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

MUST BE ACTIVE DUTY MILITARY AND ELIGIBLE FOR THE SKILLBRIDGE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM. 

Program Summary

KBR Government Solutions pioneers comprehensive professional and technical services, enhancing operational preparedness and fostering innovation across diverse domains. We specialize in empowering mission success across terrestrial, aerial, maritime, celestial, and virtual frontiers, serving esteemed clients such as the Department of Defense, intelligence community, NASA, and other government agencies. Our proficiency spans engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity, ensuring robust support for critical endeavors.

Our dedicated team propels global productivity, efficiency, and intrigue, offering an unparalleled opportunity to drive transformative change within the realm of DoD Fuel Management Systems. Join us on this journey toward greater impact and endless possibilities.

Job Summary

Are you passionate about delivering exceptional work with unwavering integrity? Step into the role of AFHE Maintenance Technician and become an indispensable part of our team.In this pivotal position, you will be at the forefront of maintaining, modifying, and installing Automated Fueling System Equipment (AFHE) across various sites and projects worldwide. Your dedication will directly contribute to the seamless operations crucial for Global Readiness & Sustainment of the United States Military.

We're not just meeting standards; we're exceeding them. As an AFHE Maintenance Technician, you'll join forces with like-minded professionals dedicated to excellence. Your meticulous attention to detail, coupled with your commitment to exceeding expectations, will drive our success forward.

This is an on-site position. This position is not eligible for remote work. No relocation assistance nor uplift available.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Efficient Time and Resource Management: Strategically direct and manage the allocation of time and provided resources to meet demanding schedules, ensuring adherence to both KBR and stakeholder standards for quality and value.
Documentation Management: Diligently maintain and track maintenance documents and deliverables, ensuring timely submission to management for review and approval.
Customer Site Coordination: Organize, schedule, and execute high-quality work at customer sites, maintaining a standard of excellence in service delivery.
Stakeholder Engagement: Foster and sustain positive relationships with stakeholders, effectively engaging and collaborating with site personnel to achieve project objectives.
Install Industrial Control Systems: PLC panels (Programmable Logic Controllers), VFDs (Variable Frequency Drives), Control wiring (24VDC, 120VAC, analog, digital signals & modems, sensors, limit switches, encoders, HMI screens (Human-Machine Interfaces)
Troubleshoot Automation Equipment: PLC logic issues, faulty relays, sensors, or I/O modules, motor control problems, network or communication faults (Ethernet/IP, Modbus, Profinet).
Program or Modify Control Systems: Create or edit PLC ladder logic, function block, structured text, configure VFD parameters, update HMI graphics and process controls.
Additional Responsibilities: Undertake any other duties as assigned, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability in supporting organizational needs.
Must be able to lift ±40 lbs
Must be able to climb stairs to access heights of 20’ or greater
Must be able to perform physical duties such as kneeling, bending, and working in varied conditions to complete installations effectively.
Travel: This position has a 60% travel requirement.


Basic Qualifications 

Must be a US Citizen.
Must be able to pass a NACLC security background check.
Strong electrical knowledge (often more advanced than standard electricians)
Proficiency in troubleshooting  3 phase and single phase AC circuits, low voltage DC control circuits and various communication protocols including Modbus RTU and TCP/IP.
Ability to troubleshoot and maintain industrial network infrastructure including Ethernet and fiber optic networks
Experience with PLC programming (Allen-Bradley, Siemens, Mitsubishi, Omron).
Ability to read, interpret, and verify control schematics, wiring diagrams, design drawings, P&IDs, ladder logic
Proficient with the use of hand tools and diagnostic equipment i.e. multimeters, process calibrators, and instrumentation calibration (pressure, flow, temp, level).
Strong understanding of analog and digital technology.
Understanding of NEC code and NFPA 70e & mechanical aptitudes (pneumatics, hydraulics)
Computer and Microsoft Windows proficiency.


Preferred Qualifications

Preference for current possession of a government CAC.
Active or previous security clearance preferred.
Experience with Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems is a plus

description:
Title:

PSAB ESS: Facilities AMP Manager (Secret Clearance)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

Under the AFCAP V Program, KBR supports the U.S. Air Force by providing Engineering Support Services to the 378 ECES. These services ensure mission-critical Installation Engineering, Asset Management and Visibility, and Real Property support to the 378 AEW. In addition to Engineering Support Services at Prince Sultan Air Base, KBR also provides food services and other quality-of-life support to sustain base operations.

Job Summary

The Facilities AMP Manager leads asset management planning and performance oversight for PSAB facilities, including SRM, demolition, facility space accountability/space planning, housing assets, and specialized requirements such as HEMP-related considerations. Supporting the Operations Flight R&O cell, this role ensures facility portfolio investment decisions are informed by accurate SMS BUILDER inventory/assessment data and risk-based requirements planning.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Serve as primary AMP Manager for Facilities, aligning efforts to Asset Visibility, Requirements, Planning, and Performance
Provide portfolio-level leadership for facility lifecycle management: O&M, repair, sustainment, restoration, modernization, and demolition
Oversee integration of Sub-AMP inputs for mechanical systems and interior utility systems (plumbing, lighting, fire alarms/suppression, interior electrical)
Establish and enforce data standards and QA practices to ensure SMS/NexGen IT reflect accurate facility and RPIE inventories
Validate SMS repair/replace outputs and develop prioritized requirements aligned to mission needs and investment strategies
Participate in IPL and Squadron Execution Plan development; lead/participate in AMP working groups and provide required products/minutes
Drive performance management through KPI evaluation (BCI/SCI targets and BUILDER confidence goals) and trend analysis
Coordinate with Operations Flight shops and Engineering Flight on execution pathway decisions (organic vs project)
Support root cause analysis and corrective action recommendations based on asset performance and failure trends

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a U.S. Citizen with a current U. S. Driver's License.

Must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 13 months of remaining validity AND 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining

Must have and maintain a valid U. S. SECRET Security Clearance

Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English fluently

Candidate must also meet CENTCOM MOD-15 theater requirements.

Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering from an ABET-accredited university
5+ years experience with HVAC, plumbing, fire protection, and/or building automation systems
Building codes and standards experience required
AFIT required: WENG 200, WENG 400, WMGT 231, WMGT 417
Ability to obtain/maintain a SECRET clearance (Key Personnel / USN requirement per PWS)
Willingness to work within a KPI-driven asset management framework using BUILDER and related sustainment tools

Preferred Qualifications

Experience managing facility portfolios using BUILDER outputs (work plans/scenarios) and aligning to FYDP planning
Experience with Uniformat II / NISTIR 6389 nomenclature and FCA methodologies
Experience with space accountability/space planning or facility program optimization.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Pricing, Principal Specialist
description:
Title:

Pricing, Principal Specialist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

NSS Pricing is seeking a Principal Pricing Specialist to join our team of dedicated professionals. The selected individual will support NSS’ Business Divisions to prepare compliant and competitive Price Proposals while collaborating with Finance, Contracts, Compensation and other allied functional support teams. 

Key Responsibilities:

Responsibilities may include but are not limited to the following:

Leads and/or manages major and complex cost proposals generally valued at $100M+
Applies a broad knowledge of general financial analysis and Government proposal Pricing techniques to a variety complex business proposal solutions, primarily in support of professional services
Lead Pricing strategy and some PTW analysis in collaboration with the proposal capture team to improve probability of win. Influence team to adopt bid specific pricing strategies.
Draft and finalize Cost/Price proposal narratives to substantiate cost and pricing approach and data in compliance with all RFP Section L criteria
Develops complex pricing strategies and performs risk and cash flow analyses as applicable
Develops and presents price assumptions, financial summaries, and risk assessment to senior leadership prior to proposal submission
Collaborate and support functional support staff from Contracts, Subcontracts, HR, Finance, etc. to deliver compliant and compelling price proposals
Provides strategic focus to all proposal efforts to ensure alignment with Section M RFP criteria and support Business Unit growth/profit objectives
May have limited supervision of team members at a Department level to include verification of time cards, oversight of daily tasks/schedules and quality assurance review of proposals

Performs all other duties as assigned such as:

Prepares special reports and analysis as required in support of audits and department administration
Provides assistance to other pricing analysts during periods of surge demand
Provides guidance for less experienced team members on compliance-related issues

Work Environment:

Location: Remote and/or Hybrid acceptable.
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%.
Working Hours: Standard workday with occasional non-standard work hours required.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelors degree and 10+ years of direct federal government pricing experience
Comprehensive knowledge of direct government pricing practices, cost and price analysis, and FAR and CAS regulations
Experience managing subcontractor data calls and price proposals in support of prime contractor pricing strategy
Cost/Price proposal narrative writing and subsequent experience responding to Pricing evaluation notices, final proposal revisions, etc.
Comprehensive organizational, written, and oral communication skills
Strong analytical skills and business acumen to make sound financial analysis decisions/recommendations
Proficient in Microsoft Office with advanced MS Excel skills
Ability to work in a team environment

Preferred Qualifications:

Management and/or mentorship of junior to mid level pricing analysts
Federal Government Price to Win analysis experience
Top Secret / SCI clearance (TS/SCI)

title: Principal Proposal Specialist
description:
Title:

Principal Proposal Specialist

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! - At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

Program Summary

KBR combines mission expertise with advanced digital technologies to solve the world’s toughest challenges on a global scale. KBR is a trusted national security partner for a wide array of customers across space, land, air and sea. KBR delivers innovative solutions across digital engineering and integration, rapid prototyping, mission operations, data analytics, artificial intelligence and secure logistics. At KBR, We deliver.™

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Proposal Writer to join our dynamic Business Development team and contribute to our mission of growth and excellence. As a Principal Proposal Specialist at KBR, you will play a pivotal role in crafting compelling narratives that showcase our company's capabilities, expertise, and successes. Our small, robust team is a dynamic and tightly-knit group of professionals dedicated to achieving excellence in our work. We take pride in our ability to make a significant impact within our organization, and we're looking for individuals who are eager to contribute and grow with us.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Strategic Content Creation: Write, edit, and produce persuasive content for proposals, corporate databases, sales documents, and other business development-related projects. Relies upon experience, interpersonal skills, and broad knowledge of the field to ensure task completion in compliance with policies, procedures, and business strategy.

Information Sourcing: Identify and gather relevant information sources to enrich proposal content, including conducting interviews and research as needed. Use specialized knowledge and skills to solve complex problems.

Knowledge Management: Support initiatives to organize and upload content within corporate databases and archives.

Collaborative Teamwork: Work closely with stakeholders including Subject Matter Experts to capture concepts, maintain messaging consistency, and ensure alignment with our corporate strategy.

Quality Assurance: Proofread and edit your own work and the work of others, ensuring it aligns with in-house and client styles.

Project Coordination: Coordinate multiple simultaneous proposals, create outlines and storyboards to guide content development, and manage proposal plans.

Illustration Collaboration: Collaborate with graphic designers to develop visuals that enhance narrative content.

Basic Qualifications 

Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Business, Communications, or a related field.

7+ years of proven experience in proposal development, business development, or a related field.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Detail-oriented, with excellent organizational and time management skills to thrive in a deadline-driven environment.

Strong interpersonal skills, ability to build rapport, and work effectively in a team.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and proposal management tools.

Preferred Qualifications

Exceptional persuasive writing skills with the ability to tell a clear and compelling story.

Familiarity with SharePoint and Adobe Creative Suite is a plus.

Relevant work experience is preferred.

Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and occasional overtime requirements (including over weekends and holidays, potentially on short notice).

Previous KBR or industry experience desired.

description:
Title:

Marketing Specialist (Denver, CO)

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

KBR is seeking a Marketing Specialist to support our SPARC Program for KBR’s Science and Space division.  We provide solutions for NASA, federal-civilian agencies, the U.S. Department of Defense and commercial customers. Our services include astronaut training, health and human performance as well as a wide range of spacecraft and satellite development, operations and support services.   In this role, you will be part of a groundbreaking opportunity to support research and treatment studies for brain health for our military and Veteran community. Working with a top tier research and study team, the Marketing and Outreach program supports study goals by building community support and awareness for the program’s initiatives, especially within the military and Veteran community.   As the Marketing Specialist, your role will be to provide strategic and tactical guidance to create and implement a comprehensive marketing and outreach campaign within the overall program objectives and strategies.

The Marketing Specialist will be responsible for implementing community outreach and collaborating with the project team to develop local approaches and strategies to achieve the program’s objectives related to brain health education, awareness, and increasing awareness of this research study.  You will develop weekly, monthly and quarterly scheduling assignments and activities for your team as well as evaluating effectiveness and generating real-time insights into team performance.  Expect to be in the field with direct partner engagement at least 75% of your time and field work daily. You will be responsible for tracking the team’s performance goals to achieve outcomes associated with our brain donation initiatives. This includes exceptional ability to build community relationships, especially within the end of life and military and veteran local and regional partners. The Marketing Specialist will work with their supervisor, assigned teams, and senior leadership to provide outreach coordination across the team’s efforts and well as interface with teams outside of the region as appropriate.  This work involves a great deal of driving in the region conducting site visits at partner locations. 

Additional Responsibilities Include:  

Research, assess, develop, design, and coordinate and conduct outreach initiatives with other team members to achieve program objectives in the assigned region. 

Support all outreach initiatives by coordinating program scheduling, materials management, and event planning necessary to implement all outreach efforts.

Coordinate across regions with peers to build a cohesive and standard approach.

Plan and coordinate outreach events as well as participating in community events.

Implement promotional strategies with a strategic mindset.

Support the marketing initiative’s administrative tasks.

Support overall program objectives through directed activities to achieve its mission. 

Comfortable in a highly collaborative setting.

Comfortable presenting to and managing executive level relationships.

Outreach at event and conference tables and subsequent contact management follow-up.

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Education: Must have a bachelor’s degree in the field of Marketing, Communications, or a field related to our customer intimacy needs, and 3-5 years of engagement and outreach experience in a relevant field.  An additional 4 years of directly related experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.

Prior experience implementing and coordinating outreach initiatives in medical sales, end-of-life sales/marketing, law enforcement, civic leaders, military/veteran partners or similar roles.

Demonstrated experience in implementing and managing complex Customer Relationship Management systems, tools and processes.

Demonstrated experience utilizing marketing and outreach tools, i.e. print, presentation, audio, video.

Reliable transportation and current driver’s license due to daily use of personal vehicle.

PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Prior experience working in end-of-life and/or military environments.

Ability to speak, read, and write in Spanish.

Thorough knowledge of relevant regional partners.

Basic Compensation: This range is for the Colorado Springs, CO area only

$66,000-$99,000

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, abilities and / or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commission, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR BENEFITS

KBR offers a wide range of benefits for their employees; we offer medical, prescription, dental, vision, AD&D, disability benefits, retirement 401k, travel benefits, PTO, holidays, flexible work schedules, parental leave, military leave, education assistance, and the list goes on and on! We also support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Regional Operations Coordinator (Central TX)
description:
Title:

Regional Operations Coordinator (Central TX)

Belong. Connect. Grow. With KBR

The Regional Operation Coordinator serves as both an operational and community engagement leader within SPARC. Reporting to the Senior Program Manager or delegated authority, this individual supervises regional team, ensures successful execution of brain donation logistics, and drives community education and outreach strategies to increase awareness, participation, and registry enrollment.

This position requires a balance of operational management, staff leadership, and marketing/outreach, with a focus on advancing the program’s mission and maintaining compliance with all regulatory and contractual obligations. Local travel ~60% | Rotating On-Call Coverage

Key Responsibilities

Leadership & Supervision

Supervise assigned team and oversee day-to-day site operations, including scheduling, case management, problem-solving, and performance management.
Prepare and submit weekly site activity reports; provide updates to senior leadership on goals, progress, and challenges.
Ensure team completion of all required training; plan, document, and track training needs and outcomes.
Maintain SOPs, manuals, and regulatory compliance for staff operations.

Donor Operations & Case Management

Lead and coordinate the informed consent process with families.
Partner with coroners, medical examiners, justices of the peace, hospitals, law enforcement and transport providers to facilitate timely donations.
Oversee the proper handling, processing, inventory, recovery and shipment of brain specimens in accordance with all IRB protocols.
Ensure on-call coverage and manage staff scheduling for donation cases.

Outreach, Marketing & Education

Develop and implement outreach and education strategies to promote brain donation awareness and registry participation, ensuring compliance with IRB requirements.
Support assigned team in designing, executing, and evaluating community engagement efforts.
Plan, coordinate, and participate in outreach events, community education sessions, educational events, and presentations.

5+ years of experience in management, research studies and recruitment, donor/tissue operations, or allied health leadership.
Demonstrated leadership ability with experience supervising staff.
Strong skills in outreach, event planning, detail-orienting reporting, and stakeholder engagement.
Ability to manage complex schedules, multiple priorities, and on-call responsibilities.

Preferred

Master’s degree in public health, biological sciences, marketing/communications, or related field.
Experience in tissue or organ donation, social/biological research, forensic sciences, law enforcement, or military health management.
Prior experience in tissue recovery, brain health, and/or autopsy
Prior experience working with military personnel, veterans, and their families.

title: Systems Engineering, Integration and Test (SEIT) Team Lead
description:
Title:

Systems Engineering, Integration and Test (SEIT) Team Lead

Program Summary

KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives. Our Colorado Springs, CO Cygnet Heights office is an integration, development and sustainment facility that provides solutions for our customers with safety and quality at the forefront of our operations.

Why Join KBR?

· Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges

· Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment

· Competitive pay and great company culture

· Grow with a values-driven organization

Job Summary

KBR is seeking a Systems Engineering, Integration and Test (SEIT) Team Lead to join our Electronic Warfare Systems organization in Colorado Springs, CO. In this leadership role, you will oversee a multidisciplinary team responsible for systems engineering, system integration, and end-to-end test activities supporting ground-based mobile satellite communication systems, advanced RF technologies, and software-enabled mission capabilities.

The SEIT Team Lead will guide the definition, development, integration, and verification of complex systems while ensuring engineering rigor, technical quality, and mission-focused execution. This role includes team leadership, planning and coordinating system integration events, directing verification and validation activities, and collaborating with government and industry partners. The selected candidate will work under the Technical Operations Manager while leading SEIT engineers, junior systems engineers, and interns within the Technical Operations functional area.

Roles and Responsibilities

· Lead requirements analysis, decomposition, allocation, and traceability across system and subsystem levels.

· Develop and maintain system architectures, interface definitions, and technical documentation.

· Guide users and stakeholders in formulating technical requirements and evaluating alternative approaches.

· Provide technical direction for the integration of requirements, design artifacts, and emerging technologies.

Integration & Test Leadership

· Plan, coordinate, and execute system integration, verification, and validation activities across multiple teams.

· Confirm system and component capabilities by designing and supervising test methods, test plans, procedures, and events.

· Ensure all interfaces, dependencies, and technical baselines are fully tested and verified.

· Troubleshoot technical issues during integration and test, coordinating solutions with software, hardware, and RF engineering teams.

Team Leadership & Coordination

· Lead, mentor, and grow a team of SEIT and systems engineering personnel.

· Coordinate with cross-functional teams to champion SEIT-informed processes and workflows for product development and engineering standardization across programs.

· Support Program Management with tracking requirements, technical baselines, risks, issues, and configuration management.

· Communicate effectively with customers, government stakeholders, and program personnel regarding SEIT technical considerations.

Basic Qualifications

· Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related technical field.

· Ten (10) or more years of experience in systems engineering, system development, integration, and/or system testing.

· Experience planning and leading system integration and test efforts across multi-disciplinary teams.

· Active Top Secret clearance with eligibility for TS/SCI.

· Moderate understanding of RF engineering fundamentals, antenna design, or related discipline(s).

· Experience supporting ground-based SATCOM terminal operations and related signal generation/processing devices.

· Demonstrated ability to derive, analyze, and manage system requirements in complex programs.

· Experience supporting system integration at the enterprise or system-of-systems level.

· Experience implementing structured processes for integration, interface coordination, and verification.

· Experience with Agile development principles and collaborative engineering environments.

Preferred Qualifications

· Master’s degree in Engineering or a related technical discipline.

· Experience supporting DoD or federal government programs.

· Experience leading teams in systems engineering or SEIT-focused organizations.

· Hands-on experience with satellite communications, RF systems, or complex mission system architectures.

· Familiarity with MBSE tools (e.g., Cameo, Rhapsody) and digital engineering approaches.

· Experience with test automation frameworks, modeling and simulation, or system performance analysis.

Salary Range: $137,130 - $205,695

The salary range posted is for Colorado Springs, CO. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
Title:

Mechanical Engineer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for an entry-level Mechanical Engineer that will contribute to the Mechanical Department by learning technical skills required for a mechanical engineer while assisting in providing valuable deliverables for our customers’ projects. 

What to expect: In the Mechanical Department, you will gain practical experience to understand what a day in the life of a mechanical engineer looks like and perform tangible meaningful work to reinforce your skills as a mechanical engineer while making an impact on real world customers.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Responsible for compliance with Safety, Health and Environmental plan; must be committed to a high standard of safety and be willing and able to comply with all safety laws and all of the Company’s safety policies and rules and must be willing to report safety violations and potential safety violations to appropriate supervisory or management personnel
Working with senior engineers to assist with
Preparations of specifications, datasheets, technical requisitions and technical bid evaluations.
Performing Design Calculations using PVElite and HTRI
The application of pressure vessels (ASME), tanks (API), heat exchangers (ASME), and rotating equipment (API) including compressors, turbines, and pumps and auxiliary systems.
Propose ideas, collaborate with the team, improve, and document/update the work process.
Attend customer site meetings and field walk downs
Crosstrain in other Engineering disciplines such as Environmental, Process Safety, and/or Furnaces
Communicates and resolves technical issues as related to project assigned tasks
Successfully communicates with leadership, engineers, designers, document control, and all other departments
Ensures all project documentation for his/her own work is completed

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering
0-5 years’ experience in Mechanical Engineering
Ability to receive technical guidance from senior engineers
Willingness to travel domestically or internationally a plus
Software Experience with Office 365 (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, TEAMs, SharePoint), Documentum, Autocad, and Adobe
Professional Engineer a plus
Exposure to programming (any language) a plus
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to interact with team members, clients, and stakeholders.
Problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to addressing project challenges.
Attention to detail and the ability to ensure project documentation is accurate and up to date.

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

title: Network Administrator SME
description:
Title:

Network Administrator SME

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a Network Administrator SME to join our team in Colorado Springs, CO. Active TS/SCI clearance required.

The Network Administrator SME provides support at the Wideband C-SSE in Colorado Springs, CO providing site guidance and leading troubleshooting actions for NIPRNET, SIPRNET, WSOMS, RMCE LAN, and WAN issues. Network support requirements reside in Colorado Springs and at geographically dispersed contract locations.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Leads the effort to evaluate local network equipment and capabilities, monitor performance of LANs and identify anomalies or discrepancies that appear in network availability, capacity, or Quality of Service (QoS) metrics. 

Provides guidance to site personnel and leads troubleshooting NIPRNET, SIPRNET, WSOMS< RMCE LAN and/or WAN issues.

Resolves interoperability problems to obtain operations across all platforms including E-Mail, file transfer, multimedia, teleconferencing and the like, and configure systems to user environments.

Evaluates and reports system security incidents, virus attacks, classified message incidents, and identify threats, vulnerabilities, and associated countermeasures using the policies, procedures and report formats per compliance requirements.

Track and dispose of unclassified IS storage media previously contaminated with classified data as classified media.

Provide assistance in all aspects of network management, from network design through implementation, to the maintenance of upgrading existing networks.

Ensures configuration for firewalls, switches, routers, and domain controllers are configured correctly and documented through CM.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

BA/BS degree and 5+ years of experience, or equivalent work experience in lieu of degree.

Requires DoD 8140 (DoD 8570) Cybersecurity certification. 

Certified in Networking (Cisco, Juniper, Network+) and Security+ DAF Cyberspace Workforce Management Program.

Meet personnel security and training requirements for duties as required by DAFMAN 17- 1303, DAF Cyberspace Workforce Management Program. 

Citizenship and Clearance:

US Citizen.

Active Top Secret security clearance with ability to obtain TS/SCI is required.

Technical Knowledge:

Analyzing local and wide area network systems, including planning, designing, evaluating, selecting operating systems and protocol suites and configuring communication media with concentrators, bridges and other devices. 

Able to troubleshoot and resolve problems independently and in high pressure situations.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Expertise with network administration. 

Experience with NIPRNET, SIPRNET, WSOMS, RMCE/WAN is highly desired

Solid understanding of satellite communications (SATCOM)/telecommunications.

SCHEDULED WEEKLY HOURS:

Normal hours of operation (0730–1630 hours).

40 hours, 5 days a week.

Provides on-call support 24/7.

TRAVEL:

May require travel to CONUS and OCONUS locations, expect approximately 5%.

This position is contingent upon contract award.

Basic Compensation:

$105,100- $131,300

This range is for the CO area only

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s work location, knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience, clearance level, contract affordability and in consideration of internal parity.

 

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

description:
Title:

Senior Software Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Program Summary

KBR is seeking a highly experienced Senior Software Engineer to support a major Air Force Research Laboratory Program. The ideal candidate brings deep technical expertise in air to air refueling or other current aircraft systems in the research and development phase. Knowledge of aerial networks, software development processes and an ability to communicate are highly desired. This role requires a strategic, solutions-focused professional with exceptional leadership, acquisition, and system integration capabilities.  

Key Responsibilities:

Apply 8+ years of recent software engineering experience supporting fifth-generation fighter aircraft or modern aircraft systems in modernization/sustainment.

Provide extensive knowledge of modernization strategies, software engineering methodologies, and lifecycle procurement for Air Force systems, subsystems, and equipment.

Utilize Agile/iterative software development principles to support modernization planning and execution.

Deliver expert-level support in integration, communication, coordination, and planning across diverse functional disciplines.

Assist in planning, organizing, and managing critical aspects of development, production, deployment, and sustainment for aircraft systems and equipment.

Offer technical review of proposed software solutions and recommend improvements to ensure requirements, schedules, and quality standards are met.

Oversee the work of junior engineering staff and/or manage the full scope of staff assigned to specific tasks or projects.

Provide authoritative guidance to program leadership management, organizational improvement, and technical strategies.

Deliver detailed studies, reports, and recommendations on developmental and improvement efforts.

Provide niche expertise in areas such as strategic and business planning, systems alignment, productivity improvement, organizational assessments, performance metrics, and program audits.

Apply prior knowledge in weapons systems security engineering and cryptographic systems, enabling rapid assimilation and impact.

Support software engineering development for modernization programs including risk management, performance measurement, cycle-time reduction, and process improvement.

Support software, hardware, aircraft modification, and training integration activities throughout modernization.

Provide guidance on transitioning systems into post-modernization sustainment phases.

Support the creation, review, and updating of program documentation related to software engineering requirements.

Support OEM software assurance efforts involving program protection, cybersecurity, and airworthiness certification.

Apply comprehensive knowledge of aircraft software engineering policies and procedures to both procurement and sustainment activities.

Work Environment:

Required:

Minimum 8 years of recent software engineering experience with fifth-generation fighter aircraft or aircraft systems in modernization/sustainment.

Strong background in aircraft software engineering, modernization programs, and Air Force acquisition processes.

Active Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility

Desired:

Experience with Agile software development.

Prior experience with weapon system security engineering and cryptographic systems highly preferred.

Proven ability to lead technical staff and manage complex modernization efforts.

Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.

Title:

Logistician, Fielding Coordinator (Specialist)

Program Summary:

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.
 

Job Summary:

KBR is currently recruiting a Fielding Coordinator (Specialist) to join our team in Fort Hood, TX to support our customer, Project Manager Intelligence Systems & Analytics (PM IS&A).

Coordinate Total Package Fielding (TPF) events IAW AR 700-142.
Communicate with military units directly in support of all fielding activities to support DA G8 Priority Fielding Guidance.

title: Space Acquisition Program Element Monitor (PEM) Support Analyst
description:
Title:

Space Acquisition Program Element Monitor (PEM) Support Analyst

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

KBR is seeking highly qualified and motivated Space Acquisition Program Element Monitor (PEM) Support Analyst in support of the Assistant Secretary of the Air Force for Space Acquisition and Integration (SAF/SQ) in Arlington, VA. SAF/SQ has overall responsibility for Department of the Air Force (DAF) space systems acquisition and architectures oversight as well as integration of allied, civil, and commercial space capabilities into United States Space Force (USSF) architectures. These responsibilities are carried out in close collaboration with the Chief of Space Operations (CSO) and the USSF staff. SAF/SQ also serves as the Space Service Acquisition Executive (SAE) and oversees and directs the activities of the Space Rapid Capabilities Office (SpRCO), Space Systems Command (SSC), and the Space Development Agency (SDA). SAF/SQ’s guiding objectives are to (1) drive speed into space acquisitions, (2) make our space architecture more resilient, (3) integrate our space architecture with other war fighting domains, (4) drive program management discipline across our acquisitions, and (5) ensure that space and ground acquisitions are time phased to optimize operational availability. Achieving these objectives requires a workforce with broadly diverse and deep skills in system engineering, program management, architecture analysis, program planning and budgeting, and executive level communications and support.

Some of the responsibilities include:

Experience fostering stable and productive working relationships that communicate expectations and promote cooperation. 

Experience communicating effectively and concisely using a variety of styles and techniques appropriate to the audience. 

Ability to work collaboratively with personnel at all levels of the customer organization to deliver results; strong networking, interpersonal, and customer service skills are key.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site, Arlington, VA

Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Must have an active TS security clearance with SCI eligibility.

Bachelor’s Degree and at least 5- 7 years of experience working in a space-related field.

Familiarity with the full range of Space Operations and Associated Capabilities. 

Familiarity with Defense Space and National Security Space in the areas of strategy, requirements, capabilities, architectures, programs, acquisition, and operations.

Familiarity with civil, commercial, and international space capabilities.

Experience working on a headquarters staff.

Excellent organizational skills; ability to plan, track, and maintain due dates for multiple tasks and products central to the organization’s business processes.

Exemplary writing and editing skills. 

Strong attention to detail. 

Ability to adapt to rapidly changing work environments while maintaining flexibility and versatility.

Experience working successfully with senior executives at multiple organizational levels. 

Demonstrated proficiency with using Microsoft Office and other standard computer applications. 

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 

40hrs

Basic Compensation:

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Electrical Technician I
description:
Title:

Electrical Technician I

Program Summary

KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives. Our Las Cruces, NM office is an engineering and manufacturing facility that provides solutions for our customers with safety and quality at the forefront of our operations.

Why Join KBR?

· Mentorship from senior welders, machinists and electrical technicians

· Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges

· Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment

· Competitive pay and great company culture

Job Summary

The Electrical Technician Level I is an entry-level role designed for individuals pursuing electrical certifications or degrees while receiving hands-on training. This position supports electrical assembly, testing, troubleshooting, and documentation tasks under the direction of a supervisor. The ideal candidate demonstrates strong initiative, the ability to shift tasks quickly, and a commitment to completing assignments efficiently and on schedule.

Roles and Responsibilities

· Perform basic electrical tasks, including component installation, wiring, soldering, and harness preparation.

· Conduct basic electrical testing on components and subassemblies under supervision.

· Use hand tools, soldering equipment, and test instruments safely and correctly.

· Read and follow schematics, wiring diagrams, Bills of Materials (BOMs), and work instructions.

· Identify missing or unclear information and escalate as needed.

· Accurately document work performed in logs, travelers, or build records.

· Complete assigned tasks on or ahead of schedule through efficient planning and time management.

· Adjust quickly to shifting priorities, changing work assignments, and evolving project needs.

· Follow direction from supervisor and communicate progress or issues promptly.

· Actively participate in on-the-job training to develop technical skills and industry knowledge.

· Work toward obtaining required electrical certifications, licenses, or degree programs as part of career progression.

· Apply learned skills to progressively more complex tasks.

· Follow all safety rules, PPE requirements, and equipment procedures.

· Maintain a clean, organized, and hazard‑free work area.

Basic Qualifications

· Possess a valid Driver’s License

· Must be eligible to obtain security clearance

· Possess a High School Diploma or equivalent

· Basic understanding of electrical principles and components.

· Ability to read and interpret schematics, diagrams, and BOMs.

· Foundational soldering skills (surface mount or through-hole preferred).

· Ability to use multimeters or other basic test equipment.

· Strong attention to detail and accuracy.

· Ability to take direction and work effectively as part of a team.

· Reliable, motivated, and eager to learn.

· Ability to sit, stand, bend, and use hands for extended periods.

· Ability to lift 40 pounds as needed.

· Comfortable working around energized equipment under proper supervision.

Preferred Qualifications

· Associate’s degree in engineering or related field

KBR Benefits

title: Project Controls - New Grad Hire
description:
Title:

Project Controls - New Grad Hire

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets. These services range from small, standalone contracts to world-class mega projects.

KBR's office in Newark, DE holds a leading role in our Integrated Solutions business, providing engineering and project deliverables to our clients. Services include front-end and detailed engineering, procurement, construction services, and program management primarily in the hydrocarbons and energy transition industries.

As KBR adapts to the unique challenges presented by the COVID-19 pandemic and industry changes, we are keen to hear from recent graduates who can help achieve our long-term ambitions. 

Project Controls

We are looking for Project Controls new graduates interested in a full-time career as a professional in Project Controls (Cost/Scheduling).

Under direct supervision, you will perform assignments requiring knowledge and application of basic project controls principles. You will use judgment in making selections and adaptation of cost/scheduling alternatives and perform specific and well-defined assignments.

We encourage you to apply and become a member of the KBR Team of Teams!

The key duties and responsibilities for this role include:

Actively participates in recording actual and committed cost and workhours, development of project variances, trending and analysis of commitments and expenditures and development of the project forecast and cash flow.

Actively participates in the administration of the change control process.

Actively participates in development and completion of job progress milestones through scheduling.

Actively participates in coordination with procurement and material mangers as well as engineering work group leads pertaining to essential items of supply.

Actively participates in identification of priorities for projects to guarantee completion.

Complete assigned tasks with consideration of the budgeted work hours and schedule commitments.

Job Requirements

Recently graduated from an accredited college or university with a preferred baccalaureate or master's degree in Engineering, Finance or Business

Advanced skills with Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, preferred

Skill should include pivot tables, formulas, chart creation and managing large data files

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to function within a project team

Must be able to self-lead and communicate to all levels of project team, including management and clients
