title: Supervisor, Accounting
description:
Title:

Supervisor, Accounting

Job Title 

Supervisor, Accounting

Summary Section  

The Statutory Audit Coordinator will be responsible for managing the end-to-end statutory audit process, ensuring timely and accurate financial statement preparation, and coordinating effectively with external auditors and internal stakeholders. This role is critical to maintaining compliance with regulatory requirements and meeting audit deadlines.

Responsibilities:  
Prepare and review financial statements in accordance with applicable accounting standards and statutory requirements.

Coordinate with external auditors to provide necessary documentation and clarifications.
Liaise with internal teams (tax, treasury, operations) to gather required information for audit purposes.
Ensure all audit schedules, reconciliations, and supporting documents are accurate and complete.
Monitor audit progress and proactively address issues to ensure completion on or before the due date.
Maintain compliance with local laws, regulations, and company policies.
Assist in implementing recommendations from audit findings to improve processes.
Prepare the tax audit schedule and coordinate with external auditors to complete the review on or before the due date.
Complete annual tax filing accurately and within statutory timelines.
Prepare transfer pricing documentation, review with auditors, and ensure timely TP filing.
Prepare advance tax workings, coordinate with tax consultants for review, and ensure timely deposit of advance tax.

Qualifications including Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field and CA.
7–10 years of experience in statutory audit or financial reporting.
Strong knowledge of Indian Accounting Standards (Ind AS) and Companies Act requirements.
Proficiency in MS Excel and ERP systems MSD, SAP
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Experience working with Big 4 or large audit firms.
Ability to manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Timely Completion of Audit – 100% statutory audits completed on or before regulatory due dates. Accuracy of Financial Statements – Zero material misstatements or audit qualifications. Audit Adjustments – Minimal adjustments required by auditors (target: <2% of total entries). Stakeholder Coordination Efficiency – All required information provided to auditors within agreed timelines. Compliance Score – Full adherence to Companies Act and Ind AS requirements. Process Improvement Implementation – Timely execution of audit recommendations within 30 days of closure.

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability 

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!
skills: and meeting audit deadlines.

description:
Title:

MCPP - Engineer Equipment Mechanic

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

THIS POSITION IS LOCATED IN JACKSONVILLE, FLORIDA

Program Summary

The Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP) is based in Jacksonville, Florida. We provide maintenance and logistic services to the U.S. Marine Corps (USMC) in support of this program.  For over 35 years we have planned, coordinated, and executed the maintenance and logistic services for ground combat vehicles and support equipment for USMC Expeditionary Forces.

Job Summary

This position performs high level preventative maintenance and repairs to diesel engines and gasoline and diesel driven material handling and construction equipment such as 50 Ton mobile hydraulic cranes, container handlers, 4k -10k forklifts, tractors, power shovels, road machinery, air compressors, concrete mixers and other engine driven or towed construction equipment. Trouble shoot and repair to MVAC system.  Must be able to lift 50 pounds.  Performs operator, intermediate and limited major rebuild levels of maintenance which includes spot painting. Provides technical assistance, guidance, or training to lower level mechanics and assists higher level mechanics.  Performs other tasks as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

High school graduate or equivalent. 

Four years of directly related work experience.

Complete the Basic Engineer Program Mechanics Course, or equivalent.

Complete MVAC course and hold a valid certificate.   

Ability to use technical manuals, specifications, and measuring instrumentation.   

Must have a valid State Drivers License and able to obtain and maintain a Tactical Operator License as necessary. 

Must be able to lift 50 pounds. 

Ability to comply with all established methods, safety standards, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position. 

U.S. Citizen. 

Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC) and Base Access.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Project Engineer – VAP & Performance
location:
locations
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
description:
Title:

Senior Project Engineer – VAP & Performance

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

The KBR team of teams delivers future-forward science, technology and engineering solutions and mission-critical services that help governments and companies around the world accomplish their most important objectives, while also helping achieve their sustainability goals. KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design and engineering capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

Job Title: Senior Project Engineer – VAP & Performance

We are actively seeking to fill a PMC role for a Senior Project Engineer – VAP & Performance for an Offshore Client to be based Client Office ( HQ) in Abu Dhabi.

Profile matching below criteria only will be contacted.

Key Responsibilities
A. Invoicing & Financial Tracking
Track and follow up on end-to-end invoice status with PMC consultant and internal stakeholders , ensuring compliance with invoicing procedures.
Maintain and reconcile invoice registers, highlighting delays, mismatches, or overdue payments.
Coordinate with Projects Control Team, Contracts, and Project Managers to clear invoice bottlenecks.
Report any delay / red flags to Manager VAP & Estimation in a weekly basis
B. Staffing Plan & Resource Management
Develop and maintain the staffing plan, ensuring alignment with approved manpower plans.
Monitor resource deployment, availability, mobilization, and demobilization across AOF projects following the approved resource management procedures
Identify resource shortages/excess and recommend corrective actions.

title: Principal Fire Protection Engineer
description:
Title:

Principal Fire Protection Engineer

Overall Summary

Technical Advisor Fire Protection, Fire & Gas detection, Process Safety studies with experience in the design of Fire Protection system, Fire & Gas detection system, Process Safety Studies, utilities and offsite facilities at the conceptual, FEED, or detailed design stage of medium to large size projects. Knowledge of process safety & Fire engineering practices, economics principles, calculation methods, international standards, codes, specifications, and procedures.  Minimum 15 years’ experience in Oil & Gas, Hydrocarbons, and/or Infrastructure industries.  Excellent communication skills required.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Minimum 15 years of experience in Engineering companies for design of upstream Oil and Gas Plant facilities and Petrochemical Facilities.
Develop fire water basis of design report, fire water and foam water demand calculations.
Prepare P&IDs for Fire water network, Foam water system, Fire water pumps & tanks and Fire water coverage layouts, Fire hazardous area layouts, Electrical area classification layouts, Fire risk area drawings,
Prepare Fire protection equipment data sheets & specifications, Safety equipment data sheets & Specifications and Fire hazardous equipment schedule.
Perform Steady State Hydraulic calculations & Transient analysis for Fire water network, Foam water system and Water spray system.
Preparation of Fire & Gas Philosophy, Fire & Gas detection layouts, Block diagram, Cause and Effect diagrams and 3-D Mapping studies.
Preparation of Emergency escape routes, Safety sign layouts, Safety shower layouts and Safety equipment layouts (SCBA, SABA, windsocks, extinguishers).
Prepare Third party scope of Works such as EIA, PHA etc., technical bid evaluations, review vendor non-material requisitions.
Participating and reviewing reports for safety studies like PrHA, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL, LOPA, BRA, QRA, Consequences modeling and prepare actions close outs.
Prepare MTO’s and Construction scope of work documents.
Attend the 3D model reviews.
Develop process safety discipline budgets and review proposals with estimate manhours.

Key Interactions:

Project Management
Discipline Managers
Team Leader
Client

Qualifications & Years of Experience:

Minimum Bachelor of Science in Chemical, Mechanical, Fire Engineering, or related field, and a minimum of 15 years of relevant engineering experience.

Key Skills & Technical Competencies:

Sound knowledge of basic engineering principles, P&ID/PFD development, hydraulic calculations, equipment sizing, safety devices
Experience in Hydraulics Software (e.g. Pipenet, Elite)
Strong written and verbal communication abilities to work both within a team and independently.
Handle Work Group Leader activities.
Familiarity with the International Fire Code, NFPA Standards, Saudi Aramco engineering standards and procedures and Saudi Building Code.
Ability to handle responsibility and complete projects within schedule.
Must be proficient in English, oral and written.
Excellent technical presentation skills required.
Preferred relevant Registration / certifications Such as Professional Engineer (P.E), CFPS, HAZOP, Functional safety and SCE.

Title:

Designer - Roads

Ready to shape the future of WA’s transport network?

Join KBR as a Roads Designer and bring your expertise in OpenRoads Design to life on some of Western Australia’s most significant road and highway projects. You’ll be at the forefront of innovative design, working with a passionate team to deliver solutions that meet Main Roads WA (MRWA) and Austroads standards—and set new benchmarks for quality and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

Create detailed road and highway designs using OpenRoads.

Produce high-quality design documentation, drawings, and BIM deliverables for transport projects.

Apply MRWA and Austroads standards to ensure technical excellence and compliance.

Collaborate with engineers and multidisciplinary teams to deliver innovative, cost-effective solutions.

Participate in design reviews, quality checks, and stakeholder coordination to keep projects on track.

Skills & Experience:

Minimum 7+ years industry experience in civil design for roads/highways.

Proficiency in OpenRoads and AutoCAD (12D experience is a bonus).

Strong understanding of MRWA standards and Austroads guidelines.

Ability to manage complex projects and meet deadlines with confidence.

Excellent communication and teamwork skills to thrive in a collaborative environment.

Why Join KBR?

At KBR, our people are the heart of our success. We create an environment where you can flourish, feel valued, and focus on doing what you do best.

Our Purpose:

Together, we deliver infrastructure for a better tomorrow. Our reputation for excellence is built on our people and our culture of caring, collaboration, learning, and trust. We partner seamlessly with our clients to deliver innovative, sustainable solutions that make a lasting impact on communities across Australia.

Our Values:

We Value Our People – We respect, trust, and empower our people to reach their full potential.

We Deliver – We are committed to excellence and accountability in everything we do.

We Are People of Integrity – We act ethically and responsibly, always.

We Empower – We encourage innovation and give our people the autonomy to succeed.

We Work Together – Collaboration is at the heart of our success as OneKBR.

Culture:

We’re a people company—great people doing great things. With the agility of a small firm and the capability of a global leader, we give our people autonomy, resources, and opportunities to grow in all directions.

Benefits:

Just some of our benefits include the following:

Work on iconic WA transport projects

Flexible work arrangements and genuine work-life balance

Ability to purchase additional leave

Career development and leadership pathways

A collaborative, supportive team culture where your ideas matter

Shape tomorrow by applying today!

Apply now and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities.

title: APS-4: Stock Clerk
description:
Title:

APS-4: Stock Clerk

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

Program Summary

KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, intelligence community, NASA, and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.

This position supports the Army Prepositioned Stocks – 4 Program located in Camp Carroll, Korea. The Stock Clerk will comply with all applicable safety and environmental regulations, local safety policies, and KBR’s Zero Harm program.

Job Summary

The Stock Clerk receives, stores, and issues equipment, materials, supplies, merchandise, or tools, and compiles stock records of items in stockroom, warehouse or storage yard. The Stock Clerk sorts, or weighs incoming articles to verify receipt of items on requisition or invoice, examines stock to verify conformance to specifications, stores articles in bins, on floor or on shelves, according to identifying information, such as style, size or type of material, fills orders or issues supplies from stock, prepares periodic, special or perpetual inventory of stock, and requisitions articles to fill incoming orders. The Stock Clerk also compiles reports on use of stock handling equipment, adjustments of inventory counts and stock records, spoilage of or damage to stock, location changes, and refusal of shipments, may mark identifying codes, figures, or letters on articles, may distribute stock among production workers, keeping records of material issued, may make adjustments or repairs to articles carried in stock, and may cut stock to site to fill order.  Packs cargo containers, pallets and intermediate packs. Performs other duties as assigned.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Ability to work from technical manuals, work instructions and work orders.

Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.   

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must be a U.S. Citizen with a valid U.S. Passport.

Possess a valid State Motor Vehicle Operator License.

Favorable adjudication of an NACI background check.

Ability to provide documentation to qualify as US EXPAT Invited Contractor Status and SOFA Visa IAW USFK 700-19 Regulation.

High School/GED plus 2-3 years of related work experience.

In lieu of formal course work, a combination of college credits, on-the-job training, other formalized training, or experience may be considered.

Ability to work from technical manuals, work instructions and work orders.

Ability to comply with all established methods, quality standards, and time schedules applicable to this position.

Must be able to work in a non-temperature controlled environment, heat and humidity.

Ability to lift 50 pounds to waist level and 35 pounds to shoulder height.

Required to pass initial and periodic medical screening.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Completion of the basic warehousing course, equivalent from a military service-related Advanced Individual Training or certification from a vocational school with a focus in Material Accounting/Inventory Methods preferred.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development. Click here to learn more: KBR Benefits

title: Cybersecurity Specialist
description:
Title:

Cybersecurity Specialist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Job Summary: 

KBR is seeking an experienced Cybersecurity Specialist to support the acquisition of aeronautical systems and subsystems. The successful candidate will utilize their expertise in developing and analyzing systems and cybersecurity engineering artifacts used to support the integration of advanced avionics systems and subsystems at the Air Force Life Cycle Management Center (AFLCMC) C-130 Program Office at Robins Air Force Base. The candidate should be experienced and successful at solving complex cyber security issues, enjoy working in a dynamic, responsive, and collaborative environment, and dedicated to the success of our customers against advanced, persistent threats. 

Role and Responsibilities:

Support and advise the C-130 Information System Security Manager (ISSM) working as part of a dynamic team to develop cybersecurity strategies, program protection planning, and support development of artifacts required to obtain Interim Authorizations to Test (IATTs) and Authorizations to Operate (ATOs) according to the Risk Management Framework (RMF)
Review program documentation (e.g. concept, requirements, design, manuals, reports, deficiency/change reports and program schedules) to ensure that established security requirements are adequately addressed and sustained
Solve complex cyber security issues while working in a collaborative environment dedicated to the success of our customers against advanced, persistent threats
Conduct analysis on components that comprise integrated weapons systems such as data environments, software, data, and hardware to identify the cybersecurity requirements and risks
Analyze and identify component and subsystem vulnerabilities and risks to determine potential solutions and safeguards including system survivability and interoperability
Analyze systems to ensure cybersecurity controls, risk mitigations, and testing are in compliance as they relate to RMF

Work Environment:

Location: On-Site at Robins AFB
Travel Requirements: Minimal 
Working Hours: Standard

Required Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree and minimum of 5-7 years of Information Systems Security experience.  In lieu of the degree an additional eight (8) years related professional experience is required.
DoD 8570.01-M IAM Level I certification is required
Experience in:
  Risk Management Framework (RMF)
  Life cycle support on developmental programs
  Collaborating with Program Offices on Weapon Systems Programs
  Weapon system/airborne platform software, avionics or networking desired
DoD Clearance Requirement: Secret

Desired Qualifications: 

Familiarity with DoD 5000.02 acquisition policies and processes, a plus, but not required.
C-130 or other similar fixed wing or military aircraft experience

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together. 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title:

PSAB ESS: Structures Technician (Secret Clearance)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

Under the AFCAP V Program, KBR supports the U.S. Air Force by providing Engineering Support Services to the 378 ECES. These services ensure mission-critical Installation Engineering, Asset Management and Visibility, and Real Property support to the 378 AEW. In addition to Engineering Support Services at Prince Sultan Air Base, KBR also provides food services and other quality-of-life support to sustain base operations.

Job Summary

The Structures Technician supports Sub-Activity Management and Asset Visibility Services by providing system-level expertise and field support for facility condition assessments, inventory accuracy, and sustainment requirements development. This role contributes directly to the BIAT function and supports SMS BUILDER data quality, assessment completeness/currency targets, and maintenance strategy development.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Support Sub-AMP-level asset visibility and requirements development for structural-related portfolios
Conduct and document condition assessments using SMS BUILDER standards and the 9-point rating method
Assist with inventory creation, updates, and discrepancy correction (including facilities lacking RPUIDs)
Execute data quality tasks (e.g., support QA-15A/QA-15B discrepancy resolution workflows)
Support quarterly Sub-AMP working groups, including risk-based maintenance strategy discussion and minute input
Coordinate with Operations Flight shops and SMEs to align PM/CM planning and prioritize work tasks
Support reconciliation of RP/RPIE inventory discrepancies between SMS and base records
Provide system-level inputs to AMP Managers for IPL, execution planning, and investment recommendations

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a U.S. Citizen with a current U. S. Driver's License.

Must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 13 months of remaining validity AND 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining

Must have and maintain a valid U. S. SECRET Security Clearance

Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English fluently

Candidate must also meet CENTCOM MOD-15 theater requirements.

Air Force minimum 5-level (or equivalent) and 5+ year’s experience in structures trade
AFIT required: WENG 200, WENG 440, WMGT 231, WMGT 417
Experience executing inspections/assessments and documenting findings accurately
Ability to obtain/maintain access required for role-based SMS activities (assessor/read-only as assigned)

Preferred Qualifications

Prior BUILDER assessor experience and familiarity with Uniformat II / NISTIR 6389 terminology
Experience supporting BIAT-style assessment teams and meeting assessment production targets
Experience in OCONUS/expeditionary base environments

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Wideband Global SATCOM (WGS) SME
description:
Title:

Wideband Global SATCOM (WGS) SME

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a Wideband Global SATCOM (WGS) SME to join our team at Schriever SFB.  Active TS/SCI clearance required.

The WGS SME provides expert technical assistance, analysis, and informal training related to the WGS satellites and the Global SATCOM Configuration Control Element (GSCCE).

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsible WGS and GSCCE expert.

Informs/Advises system operators on enterprise-scale SATCOM. 

Exhibits exceptional degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness in SATCOM operations and maintenance.

Provides technical information and analysis concerning WGS and GSSCE operations.

Participates in technical meetings, working groups, analysis, and reporting tasks as required.

Coordinates and consolidates integration and test efforts.

Leads troubleshooting efforts and resolves problems.

Supports major GSCCE system updates and configuration rollouts.

Analyzes and resolves difficult and complicated program support deficiencies.

Conducts independent technical assessment of systems design.

Performs as the primary contract technical liaison with contractor technical experts, representatives of other contractors, and U.S. Government personnel.

Leads or participates in spacecraft operations support, analysis, and reporting.

Develops technical documentation and procedures for installation, maintenance, operation, troubleshooting and repair of equipment in accordance with technical specifications, program requirements, and quality standards.

Supports informal training related to the WGS satellite and the GSCCE.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

BA/BS degree and 8+ years of experience, or equivalent work experience in lieu of degree.

Citizenship and Clearance:

US Citizen

Active Top Secret security clearance with ability to obtain TS/SCI is required.

Technical Knowledge:

Five years of system design experience, including hardware/software integration.

Ten years of directly related experience in SATCOM is required.

Applies advanced knowledge of WGS to achieve customer requirements associated with operations and sustainment of the WSOMS network and the GSCCE.

Able to troubleshoot and resolve problems independently and in high pressure situations.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Advanced understanding and ability to troubleshoot WGS satellite and the GSCCE.

Demonstrates exceptional degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness in SATCOM operations and maintenance.

SCHEDULED WEEKLY HOURS:

Normal hours of operation (0730–1630 hours).

40 hours, 5 days a week.

TRAVEL:

May require travel to CONUS and OCONUS locations, expect approximately 10%.

This position is contingent upon contract award.

Basic Compensation:

$129,800 - $162,200

This range is for the CO area only.

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s work location, knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience, clearance level, contract affordability and in consideration of internal parity.

 

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Senior Enterprise-level Systems Engineering and Technical Analyst (SETA)
description:
Title:

Senior Enterprise-level Systems Engineering and Technical Analyst (SETA)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: Briefly describe the cutting-edge projects or technologies the candidate will be working on.
Collaborative Environment: Highlight the team dynamics and any unique aspects of the workplace culture.
Impactful Work: Explain how the candidate’s work will make a difference in the company and the broader field.

Key Responsibilities:

KBR is seeking an Enterprise-level Systems Engineering and Technical Analyst (SETA) for an Intelligence Community Space customer.

The successful candidate will work across Architecture and Requirements, Analysis, and Digital Engineering teams to perform end-to-end Enterprise Systems Engineering of Space systems across multiple domains. While your duties may fluctuate, you will primarily be responsible for:
Managing Customer’s Request for Change (RFC) and Requirements Configuration Management (CM) processes, understanding and implementing Customer’s enterprise capability architecture and requirements baseline management processes
Identifying and managing risks, issues, and opportunities (RIO) within projects, developing effective mitigation strategies and collaborating with partner stakeholders on joint RIO management
Planning, organizing, and executing enterprise tests, developing comprehensive test strategies, plans, scenarios, and transition plans, ensuring thorough documentation, requirements tracing, and review of all testing activities
Developing, managing, and maintaining integrated project schedules using MS Project, collaborating with team members and stakeholders to keep schedules up-to-date and aligned with project goals
Applying expertise in SIGINT and GEOINT capabilities, requirements, systems, architectures, and mission objectives while utilizing systems engineering skills in requirements gathering, architectural design, digital engineering, modeling, analysis, and testing

Work Environment:

Location: On Site Chantilly VA
Travel Requirements: Minimal Travel
Working Hours: Standard shift

Qualifications Required:

TS/SCI W poly
Bachelor’s Degree (STEM preferred)
5+ years’ experience working for government Space system acquisitions in DoD or Intelligence Community
Ability to collaborate across stakeholder organizations

title: Model and Simulation Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Model and Simulation Systems Engineer

KBR seeks a highly motivated Systems Engineer to support an Intelligence Community Space customer.  The successful candidate will possess an understanding of government space architecture and systems, insight into resiliency mission fundamentals, and the ability to perform modeling and simulation of complex space systems in a Digital Engineering Environment.  Modeling and Simulation activities will support the development and validation of requirements, Concepts of Operations (CONOPs), architecture products, and the development and integration of simulation and analysis tools for space system resilience-related activities in the overall Enterprise.


Responsibilities:

Modeling and simulation of space systems, space, and ground segments

Provide technical expertise in systems and engineering to support resilience enterprise mission operations activities, programs, systems, and processes

Support modeling and simulation, including threat assessments/impacts, trades, and analyses

Communicate technical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences

Participate in system design reviews and technical interchange meetings

Interface with customers, directorate/office representatives, and across system engineering groups to drive resolution plans and strategies for complex technical challenges

Work Environment:

Location: On Site
Travel Requirements: Minimal
Working Hours: Standard

Bachelor’s Degree in the STEM field

5+ years' experience in the space systems domain

Prior experience with satellite systems

Experience in modeling and simulation

Experience analyzing and summarizing data with Microsoft Excel

Ability to generate and maintain technical documentation and reports

Desired Qualifications:

Object-Oriented Design and Analysis experience

Experience with orbital analysis tools such as Ansys Systems Toolkit (STK)

Prior experience with resilience mission fundamentals

Prior experience with sensor modeling

Experience with UML/SysML/UAF models

Experience working in an Agile development environment

Familiarity with IC and/or DoD

Security Requirements: TS/SCI with Poly

title: Drafting Technician
description:
Title:

Drafting Technician

KBR is seeking a competent Person Who Will Work closely with Engineers, Designers, and mechanical personnel to prepare various manufacturing layout drawings, electrical drawings, schematics, illustrations, three-dimensional models, and other types of drawings required for technical documentation.

Uses broad knowledge of mechanical and electrical devices, engineering mathematics, manufacturing methods, and related drafting practices to develop equipment, accessory fabrication, and assembly drawings within established dimensional and weight limits. Performs engineering design work in interpreting available designs others have prepared or completing missing design details.

Completes technical drawings using 2D & 3D CAD based upon familiarity with the construction and functions of equipment and utilizing knowledge of electronic circuits, controls, and components.

Completes the most complex and challenging designs and layouts for complete systems and components of a project.

Checks drawings for compliance with engineering requirements and drafting standards related to dimensional tolerances and design layout of form, fit, and function. Provides guidance on resolving technical issues associated with drawing content and presentation—coordinates drafting resources on program projects.

Provides production CAD support and organizes the CAD environment.

Develops, implements, and enforces department CAD standards based on department requirements and current industry practices. Develops and manages drafting processes, including product lifecycle definition and management, document/revision control, technical drawing libraries, and CAD tools.

Qualifications:

Five (5) years of mechanical drawing, computer-aided design, and illustrative design or commercial art experience.

Two (2) years’ experience with AutoCAD v14 or later.

Two (2) years of experience preparing and revising drawings, schematics, logic diagrams, and block diagrams.

Training in Graphics Arts, Industrial Design, or Engineering Design.

Must have or be able to obtain a Secret Clearance

Two (2) years’ experience with Autodesk Inventor 2019 version or later.

Familiar with Autodesk Vault (CAD data management) software.

Basic Compensation:

$50,000 to $70,000

This range is for the Maryland area only.

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional compensation may be in the form of a sign-on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

description:

Electronics Assembler

KBR is looking for an Electronics Assembler to support our government customer in Columbia, Maryland.

Responsibilities include:

Prepare electrical and electronic equipment for assembly and integration into systems. 

Works from drawings, wire and cable lists to perform inter-system equipment connections. 

Performs simple or routine chassis wiring utilizing wire lists and schematics. 

Install cable assemblies using standard written and generally accepted techniques including the provision for cable service loops and for proper cable routing.

title: Field Operations Manager/Alternate Program Manager
description:
Title:

Field Operations Manager/Alternate Program Manager

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a Field Operations Manager/Alternate Program Manager to join our team in Colorado Springs, CO. Active TS/SCI clearance required. The Field Operations Manager is the primary on-site liaison for the Government at the C-SSE. This person is Recognized as a Spatio Peritus (Space Expert) (Speritus) task order expert and is responsible for the Commercial and Military Satellite Communications Operations Support (COSMOS) contract Speritus task order field staff, located at the geographically dispersed contract locations. This person provides overall direction and management of on-site personnel performing Operations and Maintenance.

THIS POSITION IS CONTINGENT UPON CONTRACT AWARD

Responsibilities:

Acts as the primary liaison for Government on day-to-day operations at C-SSE.
Establishes and maintains relationships with key stakeholders, communicating progress, risks, and issues effectively.
Responsible for programmatic guidelines set by the program manager and customer.
Establishes unit objectives, work plans, schedules, and ensures resources are available for completion of projects and assignments.
Solves unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business; requires conceptual and innovative thinking to develop solutions.
Anticipates customer issues; recommends product, process, or service improvements. Solves unique and complex problems.
Identifies internal or external business challenges and/or regulatory/ compliance issues; recommends business unit improvements
Responsible for all communication and actions required by field personnel in performance of the Speritus TO.
Manages field operations resources; defines staffing levels and budgets.
Mentors and advises field operations team members on projects with notable risk and complexity.
Ensures quality of services and products delivered/provided by the field operations teams.
Ensures field team compliance with all applicable contractual, legal, regulatory, and corporate guidance.
Collaborates with the program manager to define program objectives, develop project plans, and allocate resources to meet business goals providing strategic direction, guidance, and support to ensure successful Task order execution. 
Contributes to Program Management Reviews (PMRs), produces status reports, and accomplishes contractor manpower reporting. Supports teleconferences and quarterly Technical Interchange Meetings with the customer.
Contributes to proposals, business plans, proposal work statements and specifications, operating budget and financial terms/conditions of contract.
Supports contract transition.

Required Skills and Experience:

An active Top Secret security clearance with ability to obtain TS/SCI is required.
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or science.
10+ years of related experience.
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent experience is required.
Requires in-depth and/or breadth of expertise in satellite communications (SATCOM)/ telecommunications and broad knowledge of other disciplines within the program.
Experience with Wideband Satellite Operations Centers (WSOCs) and RSSCs.
Exhibits exceptional degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness for problem solving and customer service.
Ability to manage complex program requirements and team interactions with a diverse and distributed employee population in a restrictive contractual environment.
Experience leading work teams in a continuous improvement environment with quality management tools, behaviors and practices.
Effectively manages resources, schedules, budgets and makes technical business decisions.
Understands and can apply risk management principles to day-to-day operations.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly at all organizational levels, both written and oral.
Strong negotiation skills with the ability to influence decisions and build strong relationships.
Demonstrated management experience with increasing levels of leadership responsibility.
Must have a valid passport and be willing to travel internationally, approximately 25-30%. 

Work Environment:

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Must have a valid passport and be willing to travel internationally, approximately 25-30%.
Working Hours: Normal hours of operation (0730–1630 hours)

Compensation:

For Colorado only, the salary range for this position is approximately $150,000 - $170,000. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Other Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Chief Front Office Technical Lead
description:
Title:

Chief Front Office Technical Lead

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

The Chief Front Office Technical Lead provides senior‑level technical, organizational, and operational leadership to our Customers Front Office, ensuring coherent execution of enterprise priorities and mission support activities. This role oversees a broad portfolio of technical and administrative functions including personnel actions, awards processing, enterprise briefings, and cross‑directorate coordination. The position integrates information from across the division to support the Chief of Staff, Budget Director, Deputy Director, Technical Director, and Chief Data Officer. The Technical Lead ensures timely and accurate execution of taskings, data calls, governance products, and operational support functions that enable efficient Front Office decision-making. Candidates must possess deep experience supporting executive‑level environments within the national security space or Intelligence Community enterprise.

This position is contingent upon contract award

Roles and Responsibilities:

Lead Front Office technical and operational integration, consolidating information and preparing materials for senior leadership decision forums.

Manage awards program activities, including announcing cycles, tracking nominations, coordinating reviews, processing packages, obtaining awards, and maintaining official records.

Provide technical and organizational support for personnel management functions, including tracking performance evaluations, mid‑cycle feedback sessions, manpower actions, and related HR processes.

Prepare, coordinate, and deliver briefings for the Career Service Panel and other executive governance bodies.

Support the Chief of Staff, Budget Director, Deputy Director, Technical Director, and Chief Data Officer with technical products, program tracking, and Front Office coordination.

Respond to ad hoc taskings, data calls, and time‑sensitive requests from senior leadership, mission partners, and external stakeholders.

Maintain accurate and up‑to‑date tracking mechanisms for personnel actions, staffing matrices, manpower documentation, and enterprise program artifacts.

Provide graphics development and visual product support for leadership briefings, official reports, and enterprise communications.

Coordinate cross‑division technical inputs and ensure alignment of Front Office products with division priorities and mission objectives.

Basic Qualifications:

15–20+ years of experience supporting technical, operational, or enterprise management functions within national security space, the Intelligence Community, or DoD environments.

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business, Public Administration, Computer Science, or a related technical/analytical discipline.

Demonstrated experience managing enterprise personnel processes, awards programs, or technical staff support functions for a government or IC organization.

Proven experience supporting executive‑level leadership with technical, organizational, or programmatic products.

Active TS/SCI security clearance with Polygraph.

Preferred Qualifications:

Master’s degree in Engineering, Systems Management, Public Administration, or a related field.

Experience supporting Front Office operations, career service panels, or executive governance processes.

Background with IC or DoD manpower systems, HR support services, or enterprise‑level administrative workflows.

title: Senior Software Architect
description:
Title:

Senior Software Architect

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

Are you ready to embark on a journey where your expertise meets meaningful impact? As a Senior Software Architect, you'll dive into modular software design and architecture for Mission needs across multiple customers in the Department of War. Join our team in Huntsville and be at the forefront of Open Systems Architectures, contributing directly to our success story. You'll collaborate closely with a diverse team, fostering innovation and excellence every step of the way. If you're ready to make a difference and thrive in a dynamic environment, apply now and let's shape the future together

Roles and Responsibilities:

Candidate will be responsible for the planning, development and execution of Software Aspects of an Integrated Modular Avionics (IMA) System to achieve successful integration with an existing Aviation Platform.
Candidate will engage with DoW clients to include Army Aviation, NAVAIR and Air Force as well as sub-tier suppliers to ensure that the software solution is architected in accordance with the Modular Open System Approach (MOSA) principles
Candidate will contribute to an overall Modular Mission Software Strategy to speed Technology Upgrades and Capability insertion to various platforms.

Basic Qualifications:

Us Citizenship and Security Clearance
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering or Computer Science,
10+ years direct and relevant experience with RTCA/DO-178 processes including experience with Real Time Operating Systems for Safety Critical Design Assurance Level Software.
Direct and relevant experience with RTCA/DO-297 tailored for Defense Aviation
In-depth experience with MOSA and FACE definition and architecture approaches
Familiarity with Airworthiness processes (Army, NAVAIR, DAF)
Familiarity with Reference Architectures to include EAF, AMS-GRA, A-GRA, FAF, OMS, Big Iron

Preferred Qualifications:

Master’s degree preferred
Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) familiarity
CAST-32A familiarity

title: Data Science SME
description:
Title:

Data Science SME

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

The Data Scientist SME serves as the senior technical expert guiding advanced data fusion, analytics, and automation capabilities for our customer. This role supports the research, development, and transition of next‑generation analytic tools into operational environments, ensuring scalability, reliability, and mission relevance. The position leads technical activities that mature AI/ML models, advanced analytics pipelines, and automated workflows from concept through deployment. The SME collaborates with mission partners, development teams, and acquisition organizations to evaluate technologies and integrate new capabilities into the enterprise ground architecture. Candidates must possess extensive experience in AI/ML, data engineering, prototype development, and managing complex technology maturation efforts within national security environments.

This position is contingent upon contract award

Roles and Responsibilities:

Provide senior technical leadership in the design, development, evaluation, and operational transition of advanced data fusion, analytics, and automated workflow solutions.

Lead the maturation of AI/ML capabilities through prototyping, proof‑of‑concept demonstrations, scaling activities, experimentation, testing, and operational deployment.

Oversee technical efforts supporting analytic model development, data pipeline creation, data quality assessment, and algorithm performance evaluation.

Manage technology transition initiatives, including identifying integration paths, assessing system impacts, and coordinating with operational stakeholders.

Guide research and development activities focused on advanced analytics, automation, machine learning, and multi‑source data exploitation.

Support acquisition planning by defining technical requirements, evaluating vendor capabilities, and contributing to concept development for new data‑driven systems.

Maintain awareness of emerging analytic technologies and assess their applicability to mission challenges across the Ground Enterprise Division.

Prepare technical artifacts such as data models, analytic specifications, evaluation reports, and transition readiness assessments.

Coordinate with cross‑directorate engineering, mission operations, and software development teams to ensure analytic tools align with enterprise architecture goals.

Basic Qualifications:

15–20+ years of experience in data science, AI/ML development, advanced analytics, or related technical roles supporting national security space or Intelligence Community missions.

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related technical field.

Demonstrated experience leading AI/ML or advanced analytics development and transition efforts, including prototyping, testing, and operational deployment.

Proven experience supporting technology maturation, system integration, or acquisition activities for complex analytic or software systems.

Active TS/SCI security clearance with Polygraph.

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s or doctoral degree in Data Science, Computer Engineering, Machine Learning, or a related STEM discipline.

Experience with IC or DoD data architectures, large‑scale analytic platforms, or cloud‑based AI/ML development environments.

Background managing or supporting R&D programs focused on automation, predictive analytics, or mission data exploitation.

description:
Title:

Chief Architecture Technical Lead

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

The Chief Architecture Technical Lead serves as the senior architect responsible for defining, developing, and overseeing enterprise architecture products for our customer. The role leads the creation and evaluation of architectural views, frameworks, and technical baselines that guide system‑of‑systems modernization and long‑term enterprise design. The Technical Lead collaborates with System Program Offices (SPOs) and cross‑division architecture leads to ensure consistent architectural direction and alignment with mission objectives. The position supports enterprise-level architecture integration, trade studies, and gap analyses to inform investment decisions and capability evolution. Candidates must bring extensive experience in developing large‑scale technical architectures, coordinating with multi‑organization stakeholders, and guiding architecture teams supporting national security systems.

This position in contingent upon contract award

Roles and Responsibilities:

Serve as the Chief Architect responsible for developing, refining, and maintaining enterprise architecture products and views.

Oversee and conduct architectural analyses, including trade studies, gap assessments, risk evaluations, and system-of-systems architectural reviews.

Collaborate and coordinate with SPOs on architectural items, ensuring alignment with program requirements, enterprise plans, and technical baselines.

Work closely with architecture leads across other divisions to synchronize architectural direction and resolve cross‑organizational architectural issues.

Guide the development and documentation of technical architecture artifacts, ensuring compliance with enterprise standards and modeling frameworks.

Integrate architectural inputs from program offices, engineering teams, and mission partners to support cohesive enterprise architecture development.

Support enterprise planning activities by assessing architectural impacts and identifying modernization opportunities.

Ensure architectural concerns, recommendations, and updates are communicated effectively within the architecture team and leadership.

Provide oversight for architecture process improvements and alignment with evolving engineering methodologies and enterprise models.

Basic Qualifications:

15–20+ years of experience in systems engineering, enterprise architecture, or architecture development for large, complex programs or systems-of-systems.

Master of Science degree in Engineering or Computer Science field.

Demonstrated experience overseeing architecture development, trade studies, and technical baseline assessments in national security, Intelligence Community, or DoD environments.

Experience in Safe Agile practices tools, Release and system engineering.

Experience working with cross‑functional teams and coordinating architecture efforts across multiple technical or organizational divisions.

Experience with software acquisition.

Active TS/SCI security clearance with Polygraph.

Preferred Qualifications: 

Experience in architecture development management for large, complex programs or systems of systems.

Experience developing or assessing DoDAF/UAF architecture products, MBSE models, or digital engineering artifacts.

Experience with architecture development supporting cloud-based systems, modern software architectures, or enterprise modernization efforts.

title: Senior Advisor - Integrated Fires
description:
Title:

Senior Advisor - Integrated Fires

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

The candidate will serve as a Senior Advisor supporting Army Integrated, Defensive, and Offensive Fires weapon system portfolios, and OSD equities. This role spans the full acquisition lifecycle, integrating engineering, program control, testing, fielding, training, deployment and logistics. The candidate will play a critical role in coordinating multi-disciplinary efforts essential to major defense acquisition programs, as well as other-than-major systems and subsystems. The candidate will help to ensure that acquisition decisions are driven by operational needs, reducing delays, and creating tighter alignment between requirements and delivered capabilities. Key stakeholders will include the Joint and Army Staffs, OSD, HQDA DAMO-Fires, Space and Missile Defense Command (SMDC), Missile Defense Agency (MDA), Fires Center of Excellence (FCoE), Army Transformation and Training Command, Portfolio Acquisition Executive (PAE) Fires, and Army Air and Missile Defense Commands (AAMDCs).

Key Responsibilities:

Strategic Acquisition Execution:
Lead development and implementation of acquisition strategies that align with customer overarching capability delivery goals. Candidate will serve as a KBR Senior Adviser for strategic acquisition pursuits for Army Fires, Integrated Air and Missile Defense, MDA, SMDC, Army Transformation & Training, and appropriate subordinate commands and elements.  Candidate will develop strategic visions and plans and set objectives for new and existing government customers.  Candidate will work with Senior Leaders to develop and implement strategic and tactical action plans in support of combat developments, materiel development, HQDA integration, and modernization initiatives. 

Program Integration & Oversight:
Support cross-functional integration of program elements—operational, technical, and logistical—to enable effective acquisition and sustainment of Fires systems. Work with stakeholders to ensure that Army Fires programs are no longer “system-centric” but capability-centric, with the warfighter’s operational requirements driving decisions.

Stakeholder Engagement & Governance:

Collaborate with stakeholders to align acquisition with operational concepts to enable faster and more accurate translation of warfighter needs into delivered systems. Key stakeholders will include Joint and Army Staffs, OSD, HQDA DAMO-Fires, SMDC, MDA, FCoE, Army Transformation and Training Command, PAE Fires, and AAMDCs to better posture the Army to deliver capabilities our Soldiers need without delay. These engagements will help to ensure the warfighter’s voice is central for acquisition, fielding and ensuring responsive adaptation of programs to real-world needs.

Strategic Growth & Business Development:
Serve as a KBR Senior Advisor for Integrated Fires pursuits with Army PAE Fires, MDA, SMDC, OSD and AAMDC business pursuits. Shape strategic direction, engage with new and existing government customers, and support solution development aligned to Army modernization priorities. Candidate will also serve as a liaison with other peers on KBR cross-business unit opportunities.

Leadership Development & Mentorship:
Contribute to the KBR Leadership Program through development and deployment of training, mentoring, and enrichment activities designed to develop future leaders and improve retention and engagement.

Basic Qualifications:

Clearance: Active Top Secret security clearance
Education: Master’s degree preferred, bachelor’s degree required
Experience: 25+ years of experience supporting Warfighter mission and requirements (e.g. Air and Missile Defense / Fires, Army, MDA, SMDC, and/or OSD systems)

Preferred Qualifications:

Proven success integrating programs and providing acquisition support for PAE Fires, SMDC and MDA related organizations
Deep familiarity and established relationships with Army Staff, Fires Center of Excellence, AAMDCs and key acquisition offices
Hands-on experience with Foreign Military Sales (FMS) execution
Strong leadership in planning, executing, and managing large-scale DoD programs
Excellent briefing and communication skills, with experience delivering content to senior Army, SMDC and MDA leadership
Demonstrated ability to operate in high-tempo environments with competing priorities and diverse stakeholders

Location:
Huntsville, AL (Government Site or Contractor Site) with periodic travel to Washington, D.C.; El Paso, TX and other CONUS locations as required.

description:
Title:

APS-3: GCSS-Army Technical Instructor/Course Developer

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR maintains and manages Army prepositioned stocks at the Army Field Support Battalion - Charleston (AFSBn-CHS) land site to include all logistics and maintenance operations. The KBR APS-3 Program is managed and executed at Goose Creek in support of the Army’s power projection doctrine and resources.  The contract provides maintenance of APS-3 stocks (Class II, IIIP, IV, VII, IX) to ensure that unit sets are configured and maintained at optimal readiness.  KBR also provides maintenance services and logistical support for other Army programs, IAW individual scope of work contract requirements.

Job Summary

The GCSS-Army Technical Instructor/Course Developer role requires a deep understanding of Warehouse and Unit Supply Operations (Skill Level: 92A Automated Logistics Specialist 20-30 levels or equivalent). This role manages and escalates GCSS-Army incident reports to the Service Desk, ensuring timely resolution. Additionally, this position involves assisting with the development and delivery of training in both classroom and practical settings for TUCs 930 and 960 areas. The ideal candidate must be proficient in various GCSS-Army transactions, including Excess and Reparable Management, Plant 2000/2001 MRP, and BI Launch Pad reporting. Knowledge of GCSS-Army Training and Certification (GTRAC) and user roles/system access, and practical skills in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) are preferred. This position reports directly to the Logistic Information System Instructor/Training Manager. 

GCSS-Army is a Systems, Applications, Products in Data Processing (SAP).

This is the U.S. Army primary system to manage maintenance, supply, and property management.

This role is NOT a remote position.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Managing and escalating GCSS-Army incident reports to the Service Desk.

Training contractor personnel that perform daily GCSS-Army functions for the APS-3 team and special projects in TUC 930 and 960.

Providing troubleshooting assistance for daily critical warehouse processes.

Developing job aids that support work instructions for SSA/warehouse operations.

Formulate teaching outlines and determine instructional methods and utilizing knowledge of specified training needs and effectiveness.

Perform all other position related duties as assigned or requested to include providing reports related to training and GCSS-Army user report.

Basic Qualifications 

High School diploma required

Must Possess a valid State Motor Vehicle Operator License. 

Must be a U.S. Citizen.

Must be able to obtain and maintain local base access. 

Must be able to obtain and maintain a favorable Common Access Card (CAC) issuance.

Physical Requirements:

Must be able to stand - between 5 to 6 hours per day.

Must be able to walk - between 3 to 4 hours per day.

Must be able to Lift - up to 35 lbs. – 50 lbs. periodically.

Must be able to squat, kneel, bend, reach and climb periodically.

Must be able to work outside and inside in non-climate-controlled environments.

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in related field preferred, but not required. 

Preferred experience as a DoD contractor, GSA employee, or uniformed military with the ability to review and apply technical specifications and requirements.

Strong written and oral communication.

Strong working knowledge of Supply Support Activity (SSA) core processes, Excess and Reparable Management, and Plant 2000/2001 Material Requirements Planning (MRP).

Familiarity with supply reports in Business Intelligence (BI) Launch Pad.

Proficiency in GCSS-Army process troubleshooting and understanding the functional flow of customer requirements and material procurement.

Knowledge of the GCSS-Army Training and Certification (GTRAC) system and associated personnel roles.

Skill in using Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.

title: Sr. Radar Payload Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Sr. Radar Payload Systems Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Position Summary:

KBR National Security Solutions is seeking a motivated and talented Senior Radar Payload Systems Engineer to join our team in Chantilly, Virginia. The selected candidate for this position will contribute to the design, development, implementation, integration, testing and delivery of radar hardware, software, and systems solutions for Government contracts.

Responsibilities

Radar Hardware Development: Define and document the RF front-end electronics and architecture of an advanced space-based SAR radar system, including the antenna arrays, receivers, and digital electronics.
Engineering Tasks: Perform engineering tasks to develop systems capable of meeting operational requirements within imposed constraints.
Acquisition Modeling Support: Perform rigorous link-budget modeling and analysis and conduct trade studies for hardware components to ensure mission success.
Algorithm Development. Support algorithm and analytical development using a variety of scientific programming languages (e.g., Python, MATLAB, etc.) to process synthetic aperture radar data (SAR) and Moving Target Indicator (MTI).
Test Data Assessments: Analyze and assess integration and test data at the component, subsystem, payload, and space vehicle segments to identify and resolve issues with hardware design and manufacturing.
V&V Processes: Assess the verification and validation of system vendor testing at all levels to ensure the radar system meets its requirements.
Vendor Performance Monitoring: Monitor the system provider’s performance in designing, documenting, and verifying all interfaces within the system.
Functional Analyses: Perform functional analyses to ensure systems meet performance criteria.
Operations and Procedures: Formulate, recommend, and direct operations and procedures to resolve engineering and/or technical problems.
Conduct Studies: Conduct special studies and investigations related to projects.
Technical Assistance: Provide technical assistance and instruction related to design problems.
Project Requirements Analysis: Analyze project requirements and provide information and instruction for designing, operating, maintaining, and modifying systems.
Solutions Integration: Ensure that solutions can be integrated into viable, complete systems.
General: Perform all other duties as assigned.

Work Environment

Location: On-Site
Travel Requirements: Moderate (20% to 50%) travel to contractor facilities, test sites, or launch locations.
Working Hours: Flexible. Standard Government work hour support and surge support during integration and launch phases.

Required Qualifications:

Clearance: Active TS/SCI clearance (with current polygraph).
Education: Bachelor’s degree in engineering, applied physics, or a related STEM technical discipline. Specific contract requirements regarding education and experience will prevail.
Relevant Radar Hardware Experience: Demonstrated 8+ years of experience supporting radar space system hardware development, integration, and test.
Remote Sensing Knowledge: Knowledge of remote sensing technologies including active and passive sensor systems which operate in the RF regime, and the concepts, signal and image processing algorithms and software architectures that enable these systems.
Prototyping Experience: Engineering software (prototyping) experience in MATLAB and/or Python.
Established Client Relationship Skills: Demonstrated ability to establish and maintain trusted client relationships.
Government Contracting Understanding: Knowledge of U.S. Government contracting and federal acquisition regulations, spacecraft lifecycle milestones and review processes, and success in operating within this environment.
System Test: Hands-on experience with radar payload systems, interfaces, and Assembly, Integration and Test (AI&T) activities.
Business Management Tools Proficiency: Ability to work with standard business management tools and financial systems, MS Office, and project management software.
Work-style Flexibility: Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently.
Communication Skills: Strong oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to communicate technical issues clearly to senior Government leadership.

Desired Qualifications:

Education: Master’s or Ph.D. degree in a related STEM technical discipline. Radar focus in this degree is highly preferred.
Relevant Radar Hardware Experience: Demonstrated 10+ years of experience supporting radar space system hardware development, integration, and test is preferred.
Breadth of Experience: Experience working across multiple satellite programs or production lines is preferred.

Ready to Make a Difference?

title: Sr. Security Specialist - SSO
description:
Title:

Sr. Security Specialist - SSO

Program Summary:

KBR’s Product and Technology Solutions Division specializes in rapid prototyping and advanced technology solutions for directed energy, electronic warfare, and security applications. With expertise in electronic warfare systems, critical infrastructure protection, and product R&D, KBR delivers cutting-edge innovations to meet mission-critical needs. Backed by a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR collaborates closely with customers to develop secure, effective, and forward-thinking solutions.

Job Summary:

KBR is seeking to hire a Sr. Security Specialist to support a US Government customer located at the Naval Research Laboratory (NRL) located in Washington, DC. Typical security related responsibilities may include enforcing and monitoring security procedures; ensures compliance with all aspects of the government and company security policies and procedures related to: physical access to buildings, room, couriers, clearances, packages, documentation and debriefings. May develop and implement security procedures in coordination with management personnel. May conduct security briefings and maintain security education programs. Investigates losses and security violations; may recommend corrective action. Maintains liaison with outside agencies and keeps upper management informed of all security activities. Ensures destruction of classified and company proprietary information in accordance with policies and procedures. Assists in revision of procedures manuals.

 

Roles and Responsibilities:

- Experience primarily in physical security for SCI

Generating Construction Security Plans (CSP), including reviewing design files for new and existing SCIF construction
Fixed Facility Checklist (FFC)
SCIF TEMPEST Checklist
Compartmented Area (CA) Checklist - Including general knowledge of SAP and SAP security policy
Co-Use Agreements (CUA) and Memorandums of Understanding (MOU)
SCIF Co-Use Requests
Completing annual SCIF inspections
Intrusion Detection Systems (alarm systems) and access lists - Including alarm testing procedures and alarm response drills with security forces

- Experience using DISS

Sending and receiving Visit Requests (or via email, fax with memo, etc.)
Confirmation of clearances (including Scattered Castles)
Foreign travel notifications

- Use of other IT systems and database applications

M3 messaging system
Scanning documents (unclassified and classified networks)
DoD Safe – for sending/receiving unclassified encrypted emails/files
DOTS Web Transfer Portal and Intelink Secure Access File Exchange – for moving files up to higher classified networks

- Filing/maintaining SCIF records

- Reviewing and approving equipment requests

- Submitting Medical device requests for approval by SSO Navy

- Reading and following / interpreting policy and guidance: IC Tech Spec – for ICD/ICS 705, DoDM 5105.21, Vols. 1-3, DoDM 5200.01, Vol. 1, and DoDM 5205.07, Vols 1-4

- Create step by step guidance / standard operating procedures

- Create training slides and give training briefs to SCIF custodians

- Create and manage a task schedule

- Communicate to SSO Navy on behalf of NRL SSO

- Coordinating and scheduling meetings (including VTC and Microsoft Teams) and sending out e-mail invites / notifications

- Create designation letters

 

Basic Qualifications:

Requires a college or university degree. Minimum 4-6 years of relevant experience (mid-level). In lieu of degree, an additional 8 years of relevant experience is acceptable.
Experience with ICD/ICS 705
Experience primarily in physical security for SCI
Experience using DISS.
US Citizen. Top-Secret / SCI clearance (or SCI eligibility) Required.

 

Preferred Qualifications:

- Customer service mentality. Good communication skills (oral and writing), including clearly informing SCIF custodians and customers of Department of Defense (DoD), Department of Navy (DoN), and NRL security requirements.

- Very good organizational skills

- JWICS e-mail and familiarity with DIA Security, SSO Navy, M3, Scattered Castles, and other JWICS websites

- Pro-active tactical and strategic thinker and problem solver

- Willing to learn other SCI related security functions:

Personnel security – SCI pre-screening, nomination packages, reporting security infractions/violations, etc.
Information security – proper labeling of media, packaging classified materials for mailing, security classification guides (SCG), etc.
Cyber security – reviewing file transfers to other networks

 

Compensation: $100,395.00 - $150,650.00. The salary range posted is for Washington, DC locations. The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, contract affordability, and in consideration of internal parity.

Benefits:

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.
