title: Power Apps Developer - Entry Level
description:
Title:

Power Apps Developer - Entry Level

The Role


The Defence & Nuclear Technology Solutions (UK) division, part of KBR’s Mission Technology Solutions Business Unit, is seeking a Power Apps Developer to join our Information Systems team.

This role would suit someone starting their career—whether you’re a recent graduate or have some hands-on experience—and are passionate about creating innovative tools and solutions using the Microsoft Power Platform. You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders to design and deliver intuitive, scalable applications and workflows that streamline business processes and improve data management.

Location

Leatherhead – 3 days in the office (with occasional travel both nationally and internationally)

Security Requirements

Due to project security requirements, candidates must be eligible for UK security clearance. This typically requires sole British National with 5-year footprint living and working in the UK.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain Power Apps applications to meet business needs

Build both Model-Driven and Canvas Apps to deliver tailored solutions for different scenarios

Create and manage tables in Microsoft Dataverse to support data storage and integration for Power Apps solutions 

Develop automated workflows using Power Automate to streamline processes and integrate systems across the organisation

Build and configure dataflows in Power Platform to extract, transform, and load data from multiple sources into Dataverse

Integrate Power Apps solutions with existing data sources and systems

Ensure solutions adhere to DNTS standards for security, usability, and performance

Provide technical support and documentation for developed applications

Stay updated on Power Platform capabilities and recommend improvements

What we Need

We’re seeking someone with a strong foundation in Microsoft Power Platform and a passion for building effective solutions. Ideally, you’ll bring:

Essential

Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience)

Solid understanding of Microsoft Power Apps and Power Automate

Basic knowledge of data modelling and relational databases

A problem-solving mindset with great attention to detail

Ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with stakeholders

Desirable

PL-900: Microsoft Power Platform Fundamentals certification

Familiarity with SharePoint, Dynamics 365, or Azure services

Exposure to the software development lifecycle and agile methodologies

Knowledge of programming languages such as JavaScript, C#, R, or Python

Why join us?

Opportunity to grow within a dynamic project controls team

Exposure to diverse projects across sectors

Supportive environment for professional development and training

description:
Title:

DJBOSS: Fire Suppression Technician NICET III

Program Summary

KBR sustains the operational well-being of U.S. armed forces at Djibouti, Africa, Camp Lemonnier Naval

Base. Our services encompass program management, contingency and expeditionary, asset management

and recreation support, postal operations, safety services, logistics, and more. KBR ensures the base

operate smoothly, allowing deployed personnel to focus on mission execution.

Job Summary

This position requires the ability and experience in servicing, repairing, and replacing a variety of Fire Alarm products and inspecting a variety of Fire Alarm systems. Experience and the ability to install and connect fire alarm systems to MONACO Fire Alarm receiving equipment and maintain this equipment with the knowledge of NFPA standards required and NICET III certification.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Servicing, inspecting and testing alarm and related systems to manufactured specifications.
Performing on site emergency troubleshooting, programming and repairs of Fire Alarm System.
Identifying code and non-conformance issues
Analyse blueprints, schematics and drawings of Fire Alarm Systems and other related electrical systems.
Diagnose problems or failures in assigned systems for the purpose of identifying equipment and/or systems repair.
 Inspects Fire Alarm, Security Systems and their components for the purpose of evaluating condition, identifying and performing necessary repairs and performing preventative maintenance.
Installs Fire Alarm Systems components as assigned (e.g., panels, audible/visual alarms, pull stations, detectors, etc.)
Have experience in the following Fire Alarm panels and system components (Simplex 4100E, FIRELITE – Panels, Monaco – BTX, Gamewell E3, Honeywell, Det-tronics, Secutron and Auto Pulse)
 Must carry all Fire Alarm keys, radio, and telephone always while on base and be on a rotational call service.
Troubleshooting/repair of Fire Alarm Systems

Basic Qualifications 

Minimum two to three years of experience in the Fire Protection Life Safety Industry including: Fire Alarm Installation & Programming
National Institute for Certification in Engineering Technologies (NICET) Level III certification in Fire Alarm Systems or State/Local certification or licensing acceptable to the AHJ. Certifications Level III (Fire Alarm Systems)
 Knowledge of functions associated with the testing of Fire Alarms Systems Programming, access control, and security systems.
Must posses a secret clearance or be in position to obtain one
 Complete knowledge of low voltage wiring, especially troubleshooting
 High level if knowledge & application of the National Fire Alarm Code.
 Must be thoroughly capable of reading, interpreting, and applying system design plans, as well as building construction drawings and documents.
Must not be afraid of heights with the ability to be over (50) ft. in the air.
Must Have Computer and good Communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Must be fluent in English.
Must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 12 months of remaining validity AND with at least 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining.
Must possess driver’s license with at least 6 months of remaining validity.
Must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 12 months of remaining validity and with at least 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining
Ability to work effectively in a high-pressure environment with multiple interruptions/distractions.
Excellent customer relations, leadership, and interpersonal skills

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Title:

PSAB ESS: Water & Fuel Systems Maintenance Technician (Secret Clearance)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

Under the AFCAP V Program, KBR supports the U.S. Air Force by providing Engineering Support Services to the 378 ECES. These services ensure mission-critical Installation Engineering, Asset Management and Visibility, and Real Property support to the 378 AEW. In addition to Engineering Support Services at Prince Sultan Air Base, KBR also provides food services and other quality-of-life support to sustain base operations.

Job Summary

The WFSM Technician supports Utilities and Facilities Sub-AMP activities by providing technical expertise and field assessment capability for plumbing systems, fire suppression systems, water treatment systems, fuel storage/distribution systems, and associated controls. The role supports BIAT and SMS BUILDER asset visibility requirements through high-quality inventory and condition assessment execution.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Perform HVAC system condition assessments and inventory validation in SMS BUILDER
Support maintenance-based assessments during PM where applicable and document updates per work closeout rules
Identify inventory/assessment discrepancies and correct within required timelines
Provide system-level recommendations to Sub-AMP/AMP leadership for requirement prioritization and investment planning
Participate in Sub-AMP working groups and support the development/balancing of PM plans and CM strategies
Support data quality standards and assist with quarterly reviews of shop data entry quality/timeliness
Coordinate with Operations Flight shops on work task grouping and deconfliction for WRRB submissions

Basic Qualifications 

Equivalent of Air Force minimum 5-level (or equivalent) and 5+ years experience in plumbing, fire suppression, water treatment, fuels storage/distribution, and associated controls
AFIT required: WENG 200, WMGT 231, WMGT 417
Ability to document condition and inventory data to required standards and timelines

Preferred Qualifications

Experience supporting environmental/public health compliance workflows related to utilities (sampling/reporting coordination exposure)
BUILDER assessor experience and familiarity with Uniformat II / NISTIR 6389 nomenclature
Experience supporting outage coordination and system lifecycle sustainment planning

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Senior Consultant, Advisory & Consulting – Digital & Security
description:
Title:

Senior Consultant, Advisory & Consulting – Digital & Security

Reporting to the General Manager, the individual will work within the Global Advisory & Consulting team, in close collaboration with the organization’s vast engineering, technology, and scientific resource base.


The successful candidate will be leading various digital and security projects and have primary responsibility for the delivery of studies from concept through to pilot. Additionally, the candidate shall support the group’s overall sales effort through proposal/tender preparation, contract negotiation, and other client interfacing activities.

 

Job Responsibilities:

Lead cybersecurity and AI/ML consulting engagements for defense, intelligence, and critical infrastructure clients

Assess vulnerabilities in AI-enabled defense platforms, autonomous systems, and mission-critical networks

Advise on secure system architecture and threat modeling for national security applications

Support developments in AI governance, cyber resilience strategies, and compliance with industry recognised standards

Integrate AI security frameworks (e.g., NIST AI RMF, ISO/IEC 23894) into system design and operational workflows

Evaluate risks in neural networks, deep learning, and reinforcement learning models used in sensitive environments

Provide technical guidance on secure deployment of AI platforms in hybrid cloud, edge, and embedded environments

Ability to conduct technical due diligence for M&A, infrastructure and energy transition type projects an advantage

Assess cyber-physical risks in offshore, nearshore, and terrestrial energy systems

Deliver bespoke consulting solutions by coordinating with cross-functional teams across cybersecurity, engineering, and data science

Support secure integration of sustainable fuels, gas infrastructure, and digital control systems

Lead and mentor technical teams in high-stakes, interdisciplinary environments

Communicate complex technical concepts to defense and security stakeholders, policymakers, and non-technical audiences

Collaborate with government, military, and industry partners to align cybersecurity and AI strategies with national priorities

Drive project execution and ensure delivery of secure, scalable, and mission-aligned solutions

 

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Cybersecurity, or a related field. Post graduate degrees a plus.

Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, OSCP, or CRT; advanced credentials like CCT, CCSAS, or CCSAM are highly desirable.

Familiarity with AI security frameworks and standards (e.g., NIST AI RMF, ISO/IEC 23894, OWASP ML Top 10) an advantage

5–8 years of hands-on experience in cybersecurity operations, AI/ML security

Operational Technology (OT) engineering, operations, and cybersecurity

Deep understanding of AI/ML technologies, including neural networks, deep learning, and reinforcement learning.

Strong knowledge of software development, system architecture, and network architecture.

Familiarity with security testing methodologies, penetration testing, and adversary simulation.

Passionate about cybersecurity and AI, with a curious, hands-on mindset and eagerness to explore vulnerabilities across diverse technologies.

Proven track record in leading and mentoring technical teams and working in cross-functional, interdisciplinary environments.

Excellent analytical, conceptualization, and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and interpersonal abilities, capable of translating complex technical concepts for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Well-versed in security principles, policies, industry standards, and best practices.

title: Senior Manager, Advisory & Consulting (Pre-FEED)
description:
Title:

Senior Manager, Advisory & Consulting (Pre-FEED)

KBR Advisory & Consulting is seeking a Senior Manager, Advisory & Consulting to join its team. The successful candidate will be primarily responsible for delivering studies from concept through to Pre-FEED, as well as supporting Transaction Advisory services, including technical and operational due diligence. He or she will contribute to the group’s overall sales efforts through proposal and tender preparation, contract negotiation, and other client-facing activities. Reporting to the General Manager, the Senior Manager will collaborate closely with the broader team, led by the Director of KBR Consulting International.

Job Responsibilities:

Originate projects to grow the Advisory & Consulting business portfolio, covering initiatives from concept to Pre-FEED, as well as Transaction Advisory services

Ensure regional financial targets are achieved

Build a team to support the overall growth of the Advisory & Consulting function

Manage client and external stakeholder relationships

Develop and maintain strong customer relationships to ensure satisfaction at the project level and resolve any issues that arise

Lead client engagements throughout the project lifecycle

Oversee the successful execution and completion of projects within the APAC region

Review project obligations and manage changes, including variation orders

Lead the regional project management team and proactively manage risks to prevent delays or reputational damage

Supervise project managers to ensure high-quality, timely, and budget-compliant project delivery

Train, develop, and mentor the next generation of Project Managers

 

Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or another relevant engineering discipline

Minimum of 15 years of experience in the energy or related industries, with a focus on corporate energy transition, energy policy and regulations, and/or energy transition financing

Proven experience managing projects from Concept to Pre-FEED, as well as delivering Transaction Advisory services (Technical and Operational Due Diligence)

At least 3 years of team management experience within advisory or consulting firms, with a demonstrated ability to grow the business

Strong track record in delivering high-end advisory and consulting projects, with the ability to manage key stakeholders effectively

Experience engaging with executive-level stakeholders (C-suite/C-1), including negotiating government-to-government (G2G) and government-to-business (G2B) opportunities

Able to work within a ‘sell-do’ model

Strong self-starter and motivated to succeed

Practical experience in front-end consulting, including scoping, selling, and delivery

Demonstrated business acumen (ability to grasp commercial feasibility of proposals) and financial literacy (understanding of basic financial concepts and evaluation methods)

Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively with both direct team members and broader colleagues

title: Mechanical Engineering Intern - Summer 2026
description:
Title:

Mechanical Engineering Intern - Summer 2026

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for a Mechanical Engineering Intern that will contribute to the Mechanical Department by learning technical skills required for a mechanical engineer while assisting in providing valuable deliverables for our customer’s projects. 

What to expect: In the Mechanical Department, as an intern, you will gain practical experience to understand what a day in the life of a mechanical engineer looks like and perform tangible meaningful work to reinforce your skills as a mechanical engineer while making an impact on real world customers.

Early Career & Internships New | KBR

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Responsible for compliance with Safety, Health and Environmental plan; must be committed to a high standard of safety and be willing and able to comply with all safety laws and all of the Company’s safety policies and rules and must be willing to report safety violations and potential safety violations to appropriate supervisory or management personnel
Working with senior engineers to assist with
Preparations of specifications, datasheets, technical requisitions and technical bid evaluations.
Performing Design Calculations
The application of pressure vessels, tanks, heat exchangers, and rotating equipment including compressors, turbines, and pumps.
Propose ideas, collaborate with the team, improve, and document/update the work process.
Attend customer site meetings and field walk downs
Possibility to cross-train in other Engineering disciplines such as Environmental, Process Safety, and/or Furnaces
Communicates and resolves technical issues as related to project assigned tasks
Successfully communicates with leadership, engineers, designers, document control, and all other departments
Ensures all project documentation for his/her own work is completed

Job Requirements

Currently enrolled in an accredited college or university, seeking a baccalaureate, master's, or doctoral degree; or recently graduated from an accredited college or university with a baccalaureate, master's, or doctoral degree (Mechanical Engineering).

title: Contract Program Manager
description:
Title:

Contract Program Manager

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award

KBR is seeking an Expert-Level Contract Program Manager (CPM) to support a procurement providing Systems Engineering and Integration (SE&I) support to an IC/DoW government customer within the Washington DC Metropolitan area.

The CPM will be the interface with the government customer regarding contract activities and programmatic, and overall contract or program performance. To achieve this, the CPM shall maintain regular communication with the Contracting Officer’s Representative (COR) and Government Program Manager (PM), keeping them informed of relevant contractor related information especially significant risks and issues and the associated resolution plans and status. The CPM will be responsible for day-to-day contract activities to include formulating and enforcing work deliverables, assigning schedules, reviewing work discrepancies, supervising contractor personnel and communicating policies objectives and goals of the organization to the contractor team. The CPM will also help establish both technical and business goals in consultation with top management and make detailed plans for the accomplishment of the established goals.

Primary Responsibilities:

Ensuring the timely execution of all financial, staffing and administrative contract actions.

Lead the team assisting the customer in the development, implementation, and adoption of the Digital Engineering (DE) environment, Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) practices, and Digital Twin capabilities
Serve as the primary point of contact with the government customer and key figures and offices (including the Chief Engineer and Program Executive Offices (PEOs)) within the organization.
Provide contract management support to the Program(s) PMO to ensure the timely execution of all financial, staffing and administrative contract actions.
Provide program management support to include cost, schedule, risk and performance management of all staff and work activities.
Ensure contractor personnel are qualified to perform the assigned task and that potential personnel problems are pre-empted.
Ensure contract tasks are completed within the specified timelines.
Establish and implement processes and procedures enabling the rapid response to surge requirements for increased contract personnel.
Ensure programmatic alignment and adherence to the customer’s visions and priorities.
Ensure the accuracy, quality, configuration management and timely delivery of all required deliverables to include the Monthly Financial Report, Monthly Staffing Report, Monthly Activity Report, Quarterly Program Management Review materials, and as required Trip Reports, Briefings, Evaluations, Technical Assignments, White Papers or other Government requested deliverables necessary for the successful execution and/or completion of work activities.
Plan and execute Quarterly Program Reviews to provide the Government customer(s) an comprehensive understanding of the health/status of all activities.
Coordination program management activities between various offices within the customer organization.
 Perform day-to-day contractual and programmatic management of the TO.
Monitor performance metrics, SLAs, and KPIs and report progress to government customer leadership

Required Qualifications:

Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or related STEM degree program, or equivalent Expert level experience as a Program Manager.
Expert-level experience (10 years or more) as a Program Manager in terms of managing program level cost, schedule, performance, and risk management for a development, engineering, or other Information Technology DoW or IC program.
Project Management Professional (PMP), DAWIA Level III certification in Program Management, or similar professional certification in program management or demonstrated experience applying Project Management tools and techniques.
Extensive experience working with NGA, and other IC\DOW mission partners.
Ability to engage with senior government stakeholders and lead cross-functional teams.
Expert experience as a Program Manager in terms of cost, schedule, performance, and risk management.
Demonstrated experience in engineering, Enterprise engineering, design and analysis of IT or related systems experience in all phases of design, development, analysis and documentation, and development of standards and guidelines for tasks being performed.
Expert-level working experience in government or industry in DoD/IC Acquisition Process or PPBES.
Active TS/SCI required
Experience with Digital Engineering (DE) and Model Based System Engineering (MBSE)

Desired Skills and Experience: 

Knowledge of the geospatial intelligence mission and its contributions to the Intelligence Community.
Knowledge of the National System for Geospatial Intelligence.
Working knowledge of Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE), processes, tools and languages.
Experience with the development and/or review of cost estimates and the associated technical work scope necessary to achieve stated objectives.
Experience in tailoring and using both Agile and Waterfall development methodologies
Experience with the identification of technical issues and proactive communication of possible impacts.
Experience in performing validation and verification of various engineering results and deliverables to ensure the highest quality results against customer requirements.
Experience advising and assisting the government leadership team in achieving their mission objectives by leveraging the combine resources within the government team and their industrial base
Basic understanding of cloud technologies, DevSecOps, CI/CD pipelines, and AI/ML integration.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short-term incentives, long-term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Research Psychologist
description:
Title:

Research Psychologist

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers and dreamers and we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

Around here, we define the future.

On the Human Health and Performance Contract we are at the forefront of safeguarding astronaut health, ensuring human performance, and advancing technologies for human space exploration. We are seeking a Research Psychologist at the NASA Johnson Space Center (JSC) in Houston, TX.

What You’ll Do: 

In this role, you will be a key scientist for helping NASA achieve its goals for human spaceflight exploration. You will perform this work in the Behavioral Health & Performance (BHP) Laboratory at NASA’s Johnson Space Center. The Research Psychologist will facilitate ongoing studies; write proposals for directed studies and grant solicitations; and complete data analyses and prepare reports, journal articles, and presentations regarding the study results. You will assist in the management and execution of multiple BHP Lab tasks to ensure the team produces high quality, implementable, and timely deliverables that help to reduce the risks associated with the behavioral health and performance of astronauts. You will work on a highly collaborative team, interfacing routinely with our NASA customer, laboratories in the Biomedical Research and Environmental Sciences Division, external PI teams, and provide timely deliverables to stakeholders for BHP Lab products such as Human Research Program, Space Medicine Division, Extravehicular Activity and Human Surface Mobility Program (EHP), and Mars Campaign Office.

You will:

Work with the NASA BHP Lab Lead to implement research activities related to behavioral health and performance risks
Develop grant proposals in response to research calls from NASA or external funding organizations
Develop directed research proposals and support directed research in space flight analogs, available flight opportunities, and with medical and mission operations personnel
Conduct and coordinate data collection, cleaning, and organization
Analyze and interpret research and operational data, consulting with NASA statisticians for complex issues
Draft interim and final reports, literature reviews and summaries, and project summaries
Provide subject matter expertise for research design, methodologies, technologies, and assessments related to behavioral health and performance
Disseminate research findings through presentation to NASA program management, presentations at various national and international meetings and working groups, scientific conferences and publishing in peer-reviewed journals
Participate in presenting project updates, interim and final results, as well as program objectives and direction to scientists, engineers and managers
Collaborate with a variety of contributors and stakeholders including BHP Operations personnel, flight surgeons, mission managers and a multidisciplinary team of personnel to effectively plan and execute the research plans
Monitor multiple research project schedules, deliverables, and discuss status of projects with lab project manager
Provide inputs to weekly and monthly status reports for NASA technical monitor review
Assist NASA technical monitors with updates to NASA standards, and periodic review and update of human spaceflight risks especially relates to behavioral health and performance
Advise and assist in the development of protocols and processes that promote efficient and effective management of the BHP Laboratory projects and personnel.
Maintain data quality practices and standards established within the laboratory
Liaise with internal and external collaborators to effectively plan, track, and complete collaborative research
Assist the BHP Laboratory Lead with other duties as assigned to ensure the efficient operation of the lab, or due to NASA’s program requirements changes

What You Bring:

You bring experience leading research design and execution to help answer applied human spaceflight questions.  You use your experience and judgment to develop innovative solutions to problems that will inform NASA’s future spaceflight mission planning and preparation. As a key part of our safety culture, you will comply with KBR’s Safety, Health and Environmental Plan, Quality Plan, and all safety policies and procedures, and complete all assigned training.

Your Qualifications:

REQUIRED:

Ph.D. and at least 3 years of experience in one of the following areas of psychology: Neuropsychology, Clinical, I/O Psychology, Space Psychology, Physiological, Health Psychology, Behavioral Medicine
Experience conducting behavioral health and performance research, conducting literature reviews, and collecting and analyzing behavioral health and performance data

DESIRED:

Prior experience in managing, coordinating, and directing research projects.
Prior experience with NASA, Aerospace, Military, or operational environments

Your Skills:

REQUIRED:

Proficient with software tools used by the lab including MS Office, R, and RMarkdown
Proven ability to apply research methodology for evaluating proposals and research design
Demonstrated technical and scientific writing ability, completing all levels of writing, such as research reports and summaries, briefings, technical reports, and project plans, etc.
Possess broad understanding of behavioral health and performance outcomes required for individuals required to function effectively in an isolated, confined environment during long-duration exploration missions (e.g., performance, cognition, mood)
Highly ethical and respectful of human research data confidentiality, protections, and intellectual property
Demonstrated excellence in effective communication and presentation skills with varied audiences, including various levels of management, internationals, scientists, medical professionals and engineers
Demonstrated organizational skills for coordinating complex activities and schedules, and managing tasks per a defined timeline
Successful project management experience
Ability to be flexible and adapt quickly to changing requirements
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary setting where there is frequently divergent or competing goals for the project implementation and outcome
Demonstrated ability to interpret requirements for real-time implementation
Demonstrated interpersonal effectiveness and professionalism in working with others in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.

DESIRED:

Demonstrated ability to evaluate proven or developing technologies for measuring and assessing behavioral health outcomes as well as evaluating and applying countermeasures in a spaceflight environment.

What to Expect

This position is expected to be 100% on site and a minimum of 60% in person. Occasional travel may be required.

Why KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to an ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. title: National Security Solutions (NSS) Electrical Engineering and Computer Engineering Internship
description:
Title:

National Security Solutions (NSS) Electrical Engineering and Computer Engineering Internship

Who We Are

KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.  KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives.

The Mission Ahead

This role is with KBR’s Government Solutions U.S. division.  At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow.

Why Join KBR?

Mentorship from experienced subject matter experts
Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges
Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment
Networking opportunities with other technologists and executives
Competitive pay and great company culture

What You’ll Do

KBR is looking for highly motivated rising Juniors, Seniors and Graduate students seeking science, engineering and software development opportunities that provide challenging and meaningful work experience to be a part of our 2026 Intern class. 

KBR is recruiting full-time Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) Interns for the summer term. MBSE is the formalized application of modeling to support system requirements, design, analysis, verification and validation. At KBR, Model-Based Systems Engineers support government customers in engineering design, acquisitions, and education and training. MBSE interns at KBR will implement MBSE using the Systems Modeling Language (SysML), the most widespread language for systems modeling.

As a National Security Solutions Intern, you will:

Explore Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) approaches for defense applications
Develop curriculum to train engineers in systems theory and MBSE
Gain a wide breadth of experience in SysML modeling to support MBSE education

Selected interns for this paid opportunity will be provided with the opportunity to mentor with experienced professionals, gain experience and establish a name for themselves in this high demand career field. 

Anticipated Skill Set:

Experience with Python, MatLab, C++, Java or similar coding languages. 
Learn and apply state-of-the-art scientific coding practices 
Perform validation and regression testing of new and existing MATLAB scientific code 
Experienced with Microsoft Excel 
Major fields of study: Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or any other scientific/engineering/technical degree with appropriate experience. 

Scheduled Weekly Hours:  

Average 40 hours per week.

Requirements:

Security Clearance: Ability to obtain a U.S. Government Secret Security Clearance.

Basic Compensation:

$19.00 - $31.00 per hour (This range is for the Colorado area only).

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

title: APS-3: Specialist, Logistics Administration
location:
locations
Charleston, South Carolina
Goose Creek, South Carolina
description:
Title:

APS-3: Specialist, Logistics Administration

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

Program Summary

KBR maintains and manages Army prepositioned stocks at the Army Field Support Battalion - Charleston (AFSBn-CHS) to include all logistics and maintenance operations. The KBR APS-3 Program is managed and executed at Goose Creek in support of the Army’s power projection doctrine and resources.  The contract provides maintenance of APS-3 stocks (Class II, IIIP, IV, VII, IX) to ensure that the land-based unit sets stored are configured and maintained at optimal readiness. KBR provides limited maintenance and supply support to ensure that equipment sets are maintained in a ready condition for emergency issues to operating units at the direction of the US Army. KBR also provides maintenance services and logistical support for other Army programs IAW individual scope of work contract requirements.

Job Summary

KBR executes a contract for the US Army to provide Maintenance and Logistics services for the Army’s War Stock set #3 (APS-3) at the Army Field Support Battalion - Charleston, located on Joint Base Charleston Naval Weapons Station.  The Maintenance Department consists of 180-210 employees in nine maintenance shops across 12 facilities and provides Field Level Maintenance on the full spectrum of combat and tactical equipment assigned to the program.

The Maintenance Technical Analyst serves as the contractors MTR (Maintenance Technical Representative) who receive assignments or technical direction from the Maintenance Manager and abides with guidance provided by the U.S. Army / local government sources.  This person performs in-depth research and analysis of workload requirements to assist with forecasting and planning of warranty, safety message, and modification work order parts and other compliance needs.  This person will periodically observe and critique maintenance activities and associated documentation for verification of compliance with the application of provided procedures to ensure proper, accurate, and consistent data reporting.  This person vigorously enforces the standards for validation of disposition turn-in documents, and using applicable forms, prepares deviation and waiver submissions to be presented to the customer as required.  This person will coordinate and schedule maintenance actions with external contractors to facilitate warranty repairs as required.

The Maintenance Technical Analyst is the curator for all technical information and administrative publications relating to maintenance support requirements not readily available through the Technical Librarian.  This person standardizes cataloging of reports, manuals, and related technical material concerned with work methods, procedures, installation, operation, and maintenance of equipment.  This person will actively monitor relevant publication sites and is responsible for providing timely notification of changes in technical direction.

Additionally, this individual will participate in drafting materials regarding recommended improvements of work methods and procedures.  

Roles and Responsibilities 

Technical Research – Access and utilization of multiple Apps, websites, documents and SOP’s.

EMS NG – Electronic Interactive TMs.

IADS - Electronic Interactive TMs.

ETM/IETM App – Within LOGSA (LIW). Single use or download up to date TMs/IETMs.

UTAP – Unit Training Assistant Program (equipment training website)

APD – Army Publishing Directorate (ARs, DA PAMs, DOD FORMS, etc.)

LOGSA (LIW) – Multiple Applications

Safety Message Coordinator – Guidance provided with MWO/SMG SOP. Creation, Update & Provision of APS-3 Form MT-30 as well as utilization of MMIS app within LOGSA and TULSA website required for this duty.

Disposition Coordinator – Validate and submit equipment code-out documentation to Operations dept.  Access for TM/IETM, APD, LOGSA, AWRDS and FEDLOG required.

MWO Coordinator – Guidance provided within MWO/SMG SOP. Provision of DA FORM 2408-5 and utilization of the MMIS app within LOGSA is also required for this duty.

Deviation/Waiver Coordinator – Work Instruction for filling out form is undocumented. Access and utilization of the ETM/IETM app within LOGSA and utilization of the APD website are required for this duty.

Controlled Exchange Coordinator – GCSS-Army access rights required.

DA FORM 2408-4 Coordinator - Access and utilization of the TULSA Weapons Card link required.

AOAP Coordinator - AOAP rights required.  Access and utilization of AOAP App within LOGSA required.  Requires AOAP Monitor test/cert to submit samples to Lab.

Warranty Coordinator - Required to create and maintain a database of warrantors as new equipment is received into the program.  Also responsible to facilitate planning with external contacts for performance of contractor required warranty repair actions.

Additions and Add-on’s - Download electronic copy of PS MAG, HIP TIMES, HMMWV Newsletter, etc. as they are made available. Post to the Shared Drive and notify all personnel. Save and post all solutions to issues not found by “normal” means, to include email replies from Item Managers office, local GOV and/or LAR. SOP revisions and updates.

All other duties assigned

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must be a U.S. Citizen with a valid U.S. Passport

Must be able to obtain and maintain a Common Access Card (CAC)

Must be able to obtain and maintain local base access

Must be able to meet government-specified requirements for deployment

Working knowledge of GCSS-Army and strong communication and computer skills

Highly proficient with Microsoft office suite, particularly MS-Excel, MS-Word, and MS-Power BI Data extraction, manipulation

High School diploma: college completion/military service viewed favorably

Bachelor’s degree in related field or 5 years of applicable specialized military or military contracting experience can be used in lieu of formal post high school education on a one-to-one basis

2 years’ related experience in fields involving U.S. Army production, maintenance, logistics, supply, or record keeping using automated systems

Physical Requirements:

Must be able to stand - between 2 to 3 hours per day

Must be able to walk - between 4 to 5 hours per day

Must be able to lift and carry up to 20-35 lbs. frequently and with team 50 lbs. periodically

In addition to day-to-day standard office activities, must be able to sit and/or stand for extended periods of time, stoop, stretch, bend and climb periodically

Must be able to work outside and inside in non-climate-controlled environments

Work may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as hearing and eye protection, hard hat and steel-toed boots as well as Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) which may include but not limited to clothing (undergarments, shirts and pants and/or coveralls), reflective vests/belts, sound suppression devices, etc.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

title: Control Systems Engineering (CSE) Intern - Summer 2026
description:
Title:

Control Systems Engineering (CSE) Intern - Summer 2026

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for a Control Systems Engineering (CSE) – Intern that will contribute to the Control System Engineering (CSE) department by learning technical skills required for a CSE engineer while assisting in providing valuable deliverables for our customer’s projects. 

What to expect: In the CSE department, as an intern, you will gain practical experience to understand what a day in the life of a CSE engineer looks like and perform tangible meaningful work to reinforce your skills as a CSE engineer while making an impact on real world customers.

Early Career & Internships New | KBR

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Responsible for compliance with Safety, Health and Environmental plan; must be committed to a high standard of safety and be willing and able to comply with all safety laws and all of the Company’s safety policies and rules and must be willing to report safety violations and potential safety violations to appropriate supervisory or management personnel
Responsible for compliance with the Quality Assurance Plan, policies and procedures
Attend customer site meetings and field walk downs
Validate and mark up P&ID’s to validate CSE engineering work
Write and support control narrative development
Assist in Functional Acceptance Testing
Support commissioning efforts either in Houston or on location at customer site
Develop I/O lists
Develop network layouts
 Develop organizational savvy and relationship building skills to influence both internal and external resources, producing tangible results
Work with internal and external engineering resources to develop the required deliverables for the Engineering Stage Gate Process
Communicates and resolves technical issues as related to project assigned tasks
Successfully communicates with leadership, engineers, designers, document control, and all other departments
Ensures all project documentation for his/her own work is completed

Examples of work rotations:

Work routinely at a customer site assisting with site walk downs, verification of scope of work by walking down P&ID’s in the field and marking up any discrepancies, and support lead engineer to complete other project deliverables.
You will learn project engineering methodology, stage gate process, and what deliverables are specific to control systems engineering.
Assist senior designer in the development of network design for control systems. This will require use of AutoCAD and potentially Visio.
You will learn physical requirements and how to design a control system network
Support commissioning and start up at a customer site by walking the site and validate engineering deliverables are complete by performing field verifications and updating documentation to reflect the As-Build state or highlight inconsistencies and work to resolve them.
In this rotation, you will gave real world hands on site commissioning experience.
Support development of engineering deliverables ss part of the FEED (front end engineering and design) process including developing I/O lists, control narratives, and FAT test plans.  This rotation could include attending and assisting with an FAT.
You will learn how to create deliverables for each stage of the FEED process.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

EDUCATION: working towards 4-year Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Chemical Engineering, Electrical, Mechanical preferred)
Completion of all discipline specific curriculum through Sophomore/2nd year
Strong knowledge of and use of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and AutoCAD
Nice to Have: exposure to programming (any language)
Nice to Have: exposure to Emerson DeltaV, Honeywell Experion
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to interact with team members, clients, and stakeholders.
Problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to addressing project challenges.
Attention to detail and the ability to ensure project documentation is accurate and up to date.

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

title: Technical Safety Engineer
description:
Title:

Technical Safety Engineer

KBR’s Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) group is looking for a Technical Senior Safety Engineer to support the Abadi LNG project, one of the largest projects in Asia.  This project will provide front-end design (FEED) for onshore liquefied natural gas facilities & will have a peak production capacity targets of 9.5 million tons per annum of LNG and 150 million standard cubic feet per day of pipeline gas.  The Abadi LNG project has been designated a project of national strategic importance by the Indonesian government.

The Technical Senior Safety Engineer will develop Design Safety Philosophies, Specifications for fire protection systems (active & passive), data sheets for firefighting systems independently or with minimum supervision. 

 Responsibilities:  

Develop UFDs, P&IDs for the fire protection systems and perform Fire water/foam demand calculations (incl. Gas suppression system), and Firewater system Hydraulic check analysis
Prepare Hazardous Area Classification Source release schedule and Drawings, Fire Zone drawings, Fire & Gas Detection Layouts, Safety & Fire Fighting equipment layouts, , Escape route drawings, Firefighting Nozzle coverage shadow drawings. Etc
Participate in Process Hazard reviews and analysis including HAZOP/HAZID/SIL/Bowtie/ALARP studies (when needed) and support in Actions close-out
Under minimum supervision or independently, carry out the design of Active and Passive Fire Protection packages (including preparing requisitions, datasheets, TBE, etc) and PFP schedule documents
Support in reviewing/consolidating comments and coordinating third party studies, including FERA, dispersion analysis, EERA, ESSA, QRA studies, etc. (not limited to)
Support preparation of TBE and vendor document reviews for Mechanical/Electrical/Instrument packages on safety / HFE aspects
Provide inputs, including Human Factors Engineering, for projects as required
Interface/coordinate with other Engineering disciplines to resolve technical matters related to safety aspects & with Designers and provide inputs for safety layout preparations for projects as required

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering or related field
2-4 years HSE Engineering experience (Process Safety/Risk Analysis/Loss Prevention Engineering), with average experience ranging from 2-4 years in the Hydrocarbon industry
LNG facilities experience in design projects is required
Strong knowledge of International Codes and Standards, Regulatory codes and standards (DNV/ ABSNFPA) and the ability to influence designs to achieve optimal HSE outcomes
Familiar with plot plan reviews, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL classification/ verification and other safety reviews (e.g.SIMOPS, ALARP)
Good working knowledge of PIPENET, Flaresim & other consequence modelling software such as DNV PHAST etc
Need to be a good team engineer and have proactive inter-discipline communication skills

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

title: Civil Engineer
description:
Title:

Civil Engineer

We’re looking for motivated and capable Civil Engineers to join our high-performing Civil team in Adelaide. You’ll contribute to the delivery of complex and meaningful infrastructure projects across Defence, Transport, and Buildings, working alongside experienced technical specialists and project leaders.

This role is ideal for engineers who have developed a solid technical foundation, are confident delivering packages of work independently, and are ready to take the next step in responsibility and project ownership.

The Opportunity:

As a Civil Engineer, you’ll support and contribute to the planning, design, and delivery of multidisciplinary civil infrastructure projects. You’ll collaborate closely with senior engineers, designers, and project managers, gaining exposure across all stages of project development while continuing to build your technical and leadership capability.

What You’ll Be Doing:

Deliver civil engineering designs, analyses, and technical documentation.

Perform engineering calculations, modelling, and reporting with guidance from senior team members.

Coordinate with internal disciplines and external stakeholders to support integrated project delivery.

Assist with design reviews, planning activities, and project decisions.

Support proposal development, bids, and technical submissions where needed.

Contribute to design assurance, safety, and quality processes.

Participate in site visits, meetings, and inspections as part of project delivery.

Continue growing your technical expertise with support from mentors and professional development programs.

What You’ll Bring:

Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering.

Proven experience delivering civil engineering design and documentation across infrastructure projects.

Strong understanding of Australian Standards and relevant industry practices.

Solid technical skills in analysis, modelling, and design.

Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within multidisciplinary teams.

Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage confidently with stakeholders.

A proactive approach to quality, safety, and continuous improvement.

Working toward, or interested in pursuing, Chartered status (CPEng), supported by KBR.

Australian Permanent Residency or Citizenship (Preferred for Defence related projects).

Why Join Us?

At KBR, you’ll be part of a forward-thinking team delivering some of Australia’s most complex infrastructure projects. We’re investing in the future of South Australia — and you’ll be at the heart of it. You’ll be part of shaping our local capability, contributing to our growth, and helping build a lasting impact in the region. We offer flexible work arrangements and clear pathways for professional growth, supporting both technical development and leadership capability. You’ll have access to tailored learning opportunities, mentoring, and a range of initiatives designed to help you progress in the direction that matters most to you.

KBR Values:

Our KBR Values - We Value Our People, We Deliver, We Are People of Integrity, We Empower, We Are a Team of Teams - embody our people centric organisation.

Our culture, and our genuine focus on our people is a major factor in our success and we want you to be part of our journey. 

Help shape tomorrow by applying today!

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to leave your impact on our society with one of Australia’s leading infrastructure businesses. Apply now and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities.

#LI-DNP #LI-DNI  #S-DNI

title: Certification Engineer
location:
locations
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
description:
Title:

Certification Engineer

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

Think.KBR.com

KBR in Australia 

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Learn more about KBR in Australia  

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR 

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

The Opportunity: 

KBR are seeking an experienced Certification Engineer to support the delivery of the Certification Assurance Program within the Amphibious Combat and Support Capability Life Cycle Manager (ACS CLCM) program of work.

In this role, you will work under limited direction to coordinate certification requirements across engineering and sustainment activities, ensuring compliance with Defence, Navy, statutory and classification standards. You will provide trusted technical guidance to ensure all engineering activities align with the approved Certification Basis for supported maritime platforms.

This is a key role within a multidisciplinary, integrated team supporting Defence maritime capability.

Responsibilities: 

Coordinate, manage and report on certification assurance across sustainment engineering and maintenance activities.
Ensure certification requirements comply with Defence and Navy policies, statutory regulations and classification society rules.
Support the management of Certification Sets for equipment and materials.
Provide trusted advice to the ACSSPO Principal Engineer on Certification Basis issues and engineering decisions.
Assess deviations, waivers and associated risk assessments; recommend authorised changes to the Certification Basis.
Work collaboratively with the Systems Safety Lead on certification‑related safety and statutory matters.
Review engineering deliverables across the systems engineering lifecycle for compliance with Certification Basis requirements.
Assist with planning and participating in witness points during Class Society periodic surveys (Annual, Continuous Machinery, Continuous Hull).
Track and manage Conditions of Class and Surveyor Observations and develop remediation plans.
Liaise with Defence, Navy, industry stakeholders and classification societies on certification matters.
Contribute to the development and continuous improvement of ACSSPO and CLCM certification processes and plans.
Provide support and guidance on DOORS utilisation and certification requirements.
Maintain compliance with all mandatory training, engineering policy and safe working practices.

As the ideal candidate you will bring: 

Essential:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience coupled with relevant qualifications).
Average of 6 to 10 years’ experience in a Defence or related technical industry (CASG/Defence/Industry experience).
Requires a minimum 4 years’ expertise in Mechanical or Naval Architect engineering discipline and a broad awareness of systems engineering.
Hold, or be eligible for, membership of a recognised professional body and registration as Chartered Engineer.

Desirable:

Experience in Certification Management and/or Certification Basis for Maritime Assets.
Experience in managing requirements in DOORS.

All candidates will be required to hold and maintain an active Baseline Defence Security Clearance. Only candidates holding a Baseline Clearance or above should apply. 

What we will offer you: 

· A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work

· Flexible working

· Competitive salary (including annual reviews)

· Paid parental leave

· Income protection

· Corporate rewards

· Salary packaging/Novated leasing

· Employee stock purchase plans

· Flu shots, skin checks and discounted private health insurance

· Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

If you’re ready to shape tomorrow, let’s get started. Apply Now! 

KBR acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country throughout Australia and their continuing connections to land, sea, community and culture. We pay our respects to Elders past and present. 

As a Major Service Provider of the Australian Defence Force, an AGSVA security clearance will be required and compliance to International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). As such, our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences. 

#LI-AH1

Possess knowledge of the respective industries / engineering disciplines. Candidates with experience in Offshore FPSO Topsides/LNG terminals/Energy transition will be given preference.
Knowledge of digital delivery of projects is preferred.

title: Senior HV Secondary Design Engineer
location:
locations
Melbourne, Victoria, Australia
AUS, Sydney, 320 Pitt Street, New South Wales
description:
Title:

Senior HV Secondary Design Engineer

Help deliver the next generation of Australia’s transport infrastructure in Melbourne

KBR is seeking an experienced Senior Secondary and Protection Design Engineer to join our growing national Power team. With major project wins in Melbourne’s Rail Transport sector on Suburban Rail Loop (SRL) Linewide and Stations contracts, as well as ongoing work with on North West Program Alliance this role offers the chance to influence some of the most high‑profile infrastructure programs in Australia and help shape the face of Melbourne for generations to come

You’ll work both independently and as part of a multidisciplinary engineering team to deliver complex secondary and protection designs for substations and HV networks. This role will see you collaborating with talented colleagues across the country while contributing to projects that will reshape transport and energy infrastructure across Melbourne and beyond.

What you’ll be doing

Lead HV substation secondary design, including protection, control, SCADA, and AC/DC systems. (1kV–132kV+).
Undertake analytical power system studies, including:
Protection coordination
Load flow
Short‑circuit analysis
Arc flash hazard assessments
Develop protection system drawings, SLDs, functional schematics, wiring diagrams and control logic.
Calculate CT/VT sizing and burden requirements based on system parameters.
Prepare protection relay settings and produce detailed settings reports.
Select protection relays and develop technical specifications aligned with project requirements.
Work closely with Primary, SCADA, E&B and project delivery teams to produce integrated substation designs.
Coordinate with clients, utilities, contractors and suppliers throughout design and delivery.
Provide mentoring, technical guidance and training to junior engineers.
Support proposals and bid development across multiple market sectors.
Lead the design and checking, quality assurance and standards compliance.
Support the sustainable growth of the team.
Identify new opportunities to work with new clients.

Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor of Electrical Engineering accredited by the Washington Accord (or recognized equivalent by Engineers Australia )
Chartered Engineer / CPEng / RPEQ / RPEV (or ability to attain it is required)
Proven consulting/design experience delivering for Transport clients.
Proven experience leading teams on complex projects.
Strong technical depth in:
Protection and control design
AC/DC auxiliary systems
SCADA systems
Secondary systems studies
MTM Accreditation (Designer/Checker) — or ability to obtain within 6 months is required.
Experience with DNSPs/TNSPs — highly desirable.
Familiarity with protection relays (e.g., SEL, GE, ABB, Schneider).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
Strong organisational and project‑management capability with the ability to manage multiple priorities.
Experience in client-facing roles, with the ability to provide robust advice and clear communication

Why join KBR?

At KBR, we partner with our clients and delivery partners to deliver exceptional outcomes — driven by collaboration, technical excellence and our One Team approach.

With nearly 2,000 employees across Australia, we offer:

Access to iconic projects in Transport, Energy and Defence.
Genuine opportunities for professional development, certification and career progression.
A collaborative, people‑first culture where you are valued and supported.
Flexible work arrangements and work/life balance.
National career pathways and exposure to multidisciplinary teams.

Join a team where people matter, your expertise is respected, and your work directly shapes critical Australian infrastructure.

KBR Values:

Our KBR Values - We Value Our People, We Deliver, We Are People of Integrity, We Empower, We Are a Team of Teams - embody our people centric organisation.

Our culture, and our genuine focus on our people is a major factor in our success and we want you to be part of our journey. 

Help shape tomorrow by applying today!

Don’t miss out on this opportunity to leave your impact on our society with one of Australia’s leading infrastructure businesses. Apply now and follow us on LinkedIn to stay up to date with all the latest news and job opportunities.

title: Database Administrator
description:
Title:

Database Administrator

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Job Summary:  

KBR is inviting applications for the position of Database Administrator to bolster the efforts of USSTRATCOM J73. This role involves the full range of database administration tasks. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing, using, and maintaining critical databases that support USSTRATCOM.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop, use, and maintain relational databases
Develop, use, and maintain data entry and extraction graphic user interfaces and interfaces between relational databases and analytic and visualization software.
Maintain and utilize various database, analytical, and visualization tools to support assessment execution.
Support modeling and simulation data management.
Design, develop, and maintain front-end graphical user interfaces according to established requirements

Work Environment:

Location: Offutt Air Force Base On-site, Must be local to the Omaha, NE area
Travel Requirements: None
Working Hours: Standard

Required Qualifications:

Must have Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field or have an equivalent combination of related training and experience.
Must have a minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in database administration, including the installation, configuration, and management of relational databases.
Must be able to complete the following tasks: data modeling, database design, database schema creation and management, general database management, ensuring data integrity, ensuring data availability, capacity planning, and web-specific technology expertise.
Must have Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility at hire.

Desired Qualifications:

Database design and development (tables, indexes, triggers, stored procedures)
Application architecture experience and Windows//IIS server administration.
JavaScript, C#, VBA, SQL, and other languages, as required, to include web development experience in front end, back end, and within VBA applications using Office suite (Excel, Word, Access).
Familiar with visualization software: Tableau and Power BI
Strong organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work independently while keeping management and stakeholders informed
Adaptable and eager to learn new technologies, tools, and database management techniques

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

Job Summary: 

KBR is seeking an experienced Security Controls Assessor Representative (SCAR) to provide product support located at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Ohio.  This successful candidate will provide AFLCMC/EZAS analyses and deliverables that include documentation, reports, technical data, and other products necessary to support the alignment, standardization, and cybersecurity processes across Air Force Life Cycle Management Center (AFLCMC) aeronautical weapon systems. Analyses will include the performance of in-depth technical review and assessment of the documentation and related products. Candidate will provide critical inputs into Program Office Risk Management Framework (RMF)-based cybersecurity documents including (but not limited to) Architecture Analysis Reports, Security Plans, Security Assessment Plans/Reports, Risk Assessment Reports, POA&Ms, Continuous Monitoring Plans, and Annual Authorization Updates.

Roles and Responsibilities: 

Provide technical recommendations based on results of evaluation of the technical implementation of the security design to ascertain that security software, hardware, and firmware features affecting confidentiality, integrity, availability, accountability, and non repudiation have been implemented. Analysis of weapons systems’ Supply Chain Risk Management plans and implementation. Develop A&A package artifacts for assigned systems as well as, assisting the program managers in developing decision briefings for the Security Control Assessor (SCA) and the Authorizing Official (AO).Conduct hardware and software assurance assessments.  Participate in Continuous Monitoring activities to include document or process reviews and onsite inspection/ audit / validation activities.  Participate in requirements prioritization, reviews and inspections of processes and documents.  Participate in peer reviews of work products derived from requirements specifications to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly.  Perform other duties as assigned by management. 

Work Environment: The primary place of performance for this role is Wright-Patterson AFB, OH, due to the requirement to work in a secure facility. As such, remote work opportunities will be minimal.

Basic Qualifications: 

10+ years of experience in information assurance and/or cybersecurity with BS Degree in   Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field. 8 years of experience may be substituted for a bachelor’s degree

DoD 8140 IAM Level II is required (CAP, CASP+ CE, CISM, CISSP (or Associate), GSLC) CCISO, HCISPP)Familiarity with DoDIs 8500.01 & 8510.01, NIST SP 800-53, and RMF

Active Top Secret Clearance with ability to gain SCI, SAP

Desired Qualifications:

Prior performance in role as ISSM

Information Assurance background with policy, STIGS, ACAS. Network security and Network management/operations experience is desired

Weapon system/airborne platform software, avionics or networking experience is desired.

Knowledge of Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) is desired

description:
Title:

Bounty Hunter Instructor

KBR is seeking an Instructor to provide Bounty Hunter mission qualification training to Guardians at Peterson Space Force Base in Colorado Springs, CO.

A strong candidate will have experience operating the Bounty Hunter, Counter-Communications System weapon systems (or equivalent) and instructing.

Provide classroom instruction consistent with Instructional System Development (ISD).

Position Overview

The Senior Project Engineer (PMC) is responsible for supporting the Project Manager in the planning, execution, monitoring, and close‑out of large‑scale oil & gas, petrochemical, or industrial projects. The role ensures that engineering, procurement, construction, and commissioning activities are delivered in accordance with contract requirements, corporate standards, approved schedules, budgets, and HSE requirements.

Act as PMC focal point coordinating EPC engineering, procurement, construction, and commissioning activities.

description:
Title:

Associate Security Specialist

Program Summary:

KBR’s Mission Engineering Division delivers complex technical solutions and expert support to the U.S. Department of War, specializing in modeling and simulation, cyber transformation, air vehicle mission integration, and lifecycle support. As a trusted partner with a proven history in mission technology, KBR collaborates closely with clients to develop innovative and effective solutions. With a strong ethical framework, KBR prioritizes data security, privacy, and responsible information management to ensure mission success.

Job Summary:

KBR is seeking an Associate Security Specialist to join our team. This position supports a Sensitive Compartment Information Facility in Orlando, FL.  The successful candidate will team with other professionals to provide support services through the Security Office. This position is not eligible for remote work; on-site support is required.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Must have experience with the Department of Defense (DoD) 5205.07 Volumes 1-4 and ICD 705 directives. Manage an Automated Document Control Database (ADCS) and ensuring accountability and tracking is always maintained. Maintain program facility accreditation files to include physical accreditations and personnel files. Responsible for maintaining visitor control in the facility to include providing visitor badges; escorting uncleared visitors; and verifying visitor clearance information using customer approved databases. Must be able to conduct security briefings to include indoctrinations, debriefings, and administer Security Education Training Awareness (SETA) that supports SAPs.  Experience creating PARs in the JADE system. Must have experience with investigating losses and security violations and recommend corrective actions. 

Specific tasking:

Responsible for conducting inventories of controlled and accountable material. The candidate will maintain document control/database records to include creation, receipt, dispatch, tracking, destruction of documents and media, to include through electronic and physical transmissions in accordance with policy and facility guidelines.
Manage media for correct markings and application of cover sheets as necessary.

title: Senior Acquisition Intelligence Analyst
description:
Title:

Senior Acquisition Intelligence Analyst

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

As the Senior Acquisition Intelligence Integration Analyst, you will serve as a key subject matter expert supporting the International Acquisition Directorate (IAD). Your primary function is to integrate validated intelligence, market data, and acquisition trends to produce actionable insights that shape Army Foreign Military Sales (FMS), armaments cooperation, and international acquisition strategies. You will leverage expertise in military intelligence, open-source intelligence, and capability analysis to inform senior leader decisions, align industrial participation, and guide program execution. This role requires deep collaboration with HQDA G-2, NGIC, DIA, and other Intelligence Community (IC) elements to ensure strategic alignment and operational efficiency.

Roles and Responsibilities: 

Intelligence Analysis: Analyze intelligence from HQDA G-2, NGIC, DIA, and other IC elements to assess threats, competitor capabilities, and global defense trends relevant to Army acquisition programs.
Market Research: Conduct market research on defense industry trends, competitor offerings, and emerging technologies to produce actionable assessments for FMS and armaments cooperation programs.
Capability and Risk Assessment: Evaluate partner nations’ military capabilities, industrial capacity, and sustainment readiness to inform acquisition strategies. Identify supply chain risks, foreign dependencies, and industrial vulnerabilities affecting cooperative or export programs.
Decision Support: Develop and deliver reports, assessments, and briefings on competitor activities, partner capability gaps, and market dynamics to translate intelligence into clear, decision-ready insights for Army leaders and program managers.
Strategic Engagement: Support capability alignment strategies by synthesizing partner demand signals with threat-informed analyses. Identify opportunities for co-production, MRO, and technology insertion with international partners.
Liaison and Collaboration: Collaborate with NGIC, DIA, and other IC elements to ensure intelligence integrity and alignment with Army priorities. Maintain industry relationships to stay informed on emerging technologies and market dynamics.

**This is a full-time, on-site position supporting daily operational rhythms**

Basic Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field with a minimum of five (5) years of relevant experience
Active Secret Security Clearance
Experience with capability analysis, market intelligence, and threat assessments
Experience with standard intelligence analysis tools

Preferred Qualifications: 

 Master’s degree in a relevant field
Strong written and verbal communication skills for producing high-quality reports and confidently engaging senior leadership.
Proven ability to work effectively in fast-paced environments and collaborate with diverse stakeholders from the Intelligence and Acquisition communities.
Direct experience working at NGIC or DIA
Familiarity with DoD acquisition processes and policies
Familiarity with advanced intelligence tools and a general understanding of GEOINT and SIGINT capabilities
