title: Special Operations Clinical Psychologist (Dam Neck, VA)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Clinical Psychologist (Dam Neck, VA)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION.

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

The Special Operations Clinical Psychologist will provide technical expertise, guidance, and direct clinical service to special operations forces (SOF).

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

• May develop, plan and initiate resiliency programs for preventing and treating behavior health issues to support all aspects of a service member readiness and resiliency.

• Conduct psychological evaluations utilizing information from clinical interviews, psychological testing, and collateral sources, as appropriate.

• Practice within the guidelines of their state licensing board, American Psychological Association Ethical Principles and Code of Conduct, and MTF privileges.

• Establish psychiatric diagnoses according to the American Psychiatric Association Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Disorders including providing psychological treatment for individuals and groups, helping medical and surgical patients deal with illnesses or injuries, and assisting in rehabilitation of patients.

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training: 

• Position requires U.S. Citizenship.

• This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top Secret Clearance or the ability to obtain a clearance.

• Doctorate of Philosophy (PhD) or Doctorate of Psychology (PsyD) from an American Psychology Association accredited college or university with a doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology.

• Successful completion of an Internship/Residency in psychology accredited by the American Psychological Association.

• • A minimum of two (2) years peer-reviewable practice of clinical work in a mental health setting. 

• Providers must be able to meet clinical competency requirements specified in the Service-specific credentialing instructions.

• Licensure: Current, full, active, and unrestricted license to practice as a psychologist in any U.S. State, the District of Columbia, Guam, Puerto Rico or U.S. Virgin Islands.

• Obtain practice privileges from the servicing military medical treatment facility. 

Standard Company Requirements: 

• Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.

• Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.

• Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.

• Responsible for completing all required training.

• Perform other assignments and duties, as required.

Desired Education/Experience/Skills/Training: 

• Experience working in a government setting such as DoD or Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) MTF.

title: Associate Project Engineer
description:
Title:

Associate Project Engineer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for an Associate Project Engineer who is a recent engineering graduate with excellent communication skills that is eager to develop their project management competence.  You will learn on the job, working with our experienced team, including designers, technical experts, construction personnel, and operations.  Under general supervision, this position is responsible for all phases of planning and execution on capital projects. You will plan, organize, coordinate, and control capital engineering projects in accordance with the established policies, procedures, systems, and requirements approved by the company. You will have responsibility for day-to-day contact and communication with the client and focuses on providing customer satisfaction. Job role has financial accountability.

This position is located at a client site in Circleville, OH.

No per diem is offered for this position.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

Defines, generates, and reviews project documentation.

Performs technical studies to refine project requirements and scope.

Responsible for technical and operational leadership of project within the guidelines set by the program manager and client.

Monitors projects to ensure scope, schedule, and budget are well defined and maintained.

Leads a cross functional project team composed of operations, maintenance, design, construction, scheduling, and procurement.

Provides the coordination between resources and business leaders to ensure all necessary reviews and approvals are received.

Requirements/Qualifications:

Recent graduate with a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering.

1-3 years' experience.

Project management experience a plus.

Strong problem-solving skills

High level of drive and initiative to complete assigned tasks and seek out improvement opportunities.

Solid interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.

Ability to lead multiple projects/task and drive these to completion.

Experience in Microsoft Office Suite is required.

Physical Requirements:

Work is located at a chemical plant and requires exposure to ambient temperature extremes.

Work may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as fire-retardant clothing, hearing and eye protection, hard hat, and steel-toed boots.

Day-to-day physical requirements involve standard office activities including sitting/standing for extended periods of time, attending meetings, use of keyboard and mouse repetitively, lifting and carrying less than 20 lbs. frequently, etc.

Work requires moderate physical exertion including walking to operating areas and walking up stairs.

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

title: Electrical & Instrumentation Engineer
description:
Title:

Electrical & Instrumentation Engineer

As an Electrical & Instrumentation Engineer, you will perform advanced engineering techniques, makes decisions on engineering problems and methods, and interfaces with the client to define project scope. Required to perform electrical engineering and design assignments associated with production, maintenance, process, capital projects, R&D, and power distribution involving the application of established electrical technology and principles, including performing all electrical calculations, and often requiring coordination with other engineering design, and cross-functional competencies to provide economical and expedient task implementation. The assignment will include participation in all electrical functions associated with projects including assistance with front end loading, production design, electrical construction management, commissioning, startup, and troubleshooting activities. Provides technical guidance to designers and less experienced engineers and is consulted extensively by the associates and others with a high degree of reliance placed on scientific interpretations and advice. Job role is responsible for a measurable asset including but not limited to forecasting & budget. 

***Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident***

This is a long-term position located in Parlin, NJ. 

Responsibilities

Functions as a project lead for a small project or an area lead for larger projects.

Scope definition from receipt of basic data to Issue for Design process deliverables

Interface with the clients’ cross functional teams to define all operating requirements.

Responsible for study, design, specification, and services related to electrical systems including power generation, power systems performance and control, cabling and wiring, lighting, motor control centers, communication systems, cathodic protection, grounding, lightning protection, heat tracing, etc. 

Responsibility for assessing the quality, robustness, and capability of newly designed and installed Capital Projects.

Industrial electrical power distribution ranging from high voltage (greater than 35kV), medium voltage (1kV through 35kV) through low voltage (120V through 1kV)

Electrical power distribution equipment such as generators, substations, switchgear, transformers, motor control centers, distribution panels

Electrical utilization equipment such as motors (AC and DC), controllers, electrical process equipment

Electrical drawing knowledge (reading and generation via MicroStation V8):

Single Line Diagrams

Three Line Diagrams

Schematic Diagrams

Wiring Diagrams

Physical Drawings

Involved in discussions around the control of the process.  Frequently pulls in additional technical resources for making decisions about the project viability and resolve any safety concerns or hazards.

Provides engineering, Checkout and Qualification for the Capital Project process control systems, such as distributive control systems and components, instrumentation technology, and programmable logic controllers.

Overall responsibility for design, specification, selection, and services relating to instrumentation and control systems including basic process control systems, safety systems, control panels, analyzer systems, field instrumentation, valves, etc.

May self-perform or lead other engineers to complete project scope and provide technical guidance to less experienced engineers. On some occasions, will also plan, schedule, and conduct work requiring independent judgment and adaptation of engineering techniques.

Participation in Process Hazard Analysis for project-related work.

Define the process design basis for other disciplines, specifically Electrical Systems, conduit sizing, and Instrumentation and interface with these groups throughout detailed design. Leading multidisciplinary small project teams across several different businesses and site infrastructure.

Develop project estimates, scopes, and schedule.  May lead estimate reviews.

Work with Construction Manager during FEL as well as to oversee project execution in the field.

Forecasting and project cost tracking, monthly.

Manage scope change technically and commercially.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or Control Systems

Must have a good understanding and knowledge of industry codes and standards (NFPA 70E/NEC, OSHA, IEEE, ANSI, NEMA, API, and ASI.

8+ years of qualified related experience

Experience in the chemical, refining, or biofuels industry required.

Experience with P&ID Development, equipment sizing, electrical calculations, and instrumentation.  Demonstrated leadership of process design on capital projects, including responsibility for budget, schedule, and change management.

Professional Engineering (P.E.) license preferred but not required.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

· Work is located at a chemical plant and requires exposure to ambient temperature extremes

· Work may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as fire-retardant clothing, hearing and eye protection, hard hat and steel-toed boots

· Day-to-day physical requirements involve standard office activities including sitting/standing for extended periods of time, attending meetings, use of keyboard and mouse repetitively, lifting and carrying less than 20 lbs frequently, etc

· Work requires moderate physical exertion including walking to operating areas and walking up stairs

· Assignments may require conducting plant walkdowns and wearing chemical plant or refinery PPE to include an H2S monitor, escape respirator, and FP coveralls.

BENEFITS

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits, which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Electrical and Instrumentation Designer
description:
Title:

Electrical and Instrumentation Designer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for an Electrical and Instrumentation Designer to work independently by applying advanced engineering techniques, makes decisions on engineering problems and methods, and represent the organization in conferences to resolve important questions or to negotiate with key engineers and officials of other organizations. You will provide technical guidance to designers and less experienced engineers and is consulted extensively by associates and others with a high degree of reliance placed on scientific interpretations and advice. Job role is responsible for a measurable asset such as an assigned staff and budget.

** This position is assigned to a client site in Dayton, Ohio. Work will be performed full time at site. No relocation or per diem will be offered. **

RESPONSIBILITES

Responsible for design for electrical systems and components for heavy industrial facilities in the Power, Chemical or Refinery industries

Responsible for preparing design and detail drawings for installation of electrical systems and equipment including motors, controls, panels and wiring, starting and protective devices, substation and distribution circuits, and cable tray and conduit routing

Assist in conducting Electrical reviews of all project packages prior to RFC to ensure that quality procedures were followed

Review project design estimates and work scopes for new project

REQUIREMENTS

Minimum 5 to 10 years of applicable industry electrical design experience within the chemical and industrial industry

Experience in working with and mentoring designers/team members

Experience in communicating job packages/projects with construction and plant personal.

Experience in specifying vendor instrument equipment and reading vendor manuals.

Have a working knowledge of the NEC Codes.

Experience in voltage drop calculations, wiring sizing and conduit fill calculations.

Experience in creating and modifying P&I diagrams, loop sheets, single lines, logics and electrical schematics.

Experience in 24kV to 480-volt power distribution systems, lighting, schematic wiring diagrams, cable / raceway sizing, lightning protection and grounding required

Experience in developing scopes of work, task analysis, material list and project schedules

Proficiency with 2D MicroStation or AutoCAD is required.

Experience in Microsoft (Outlook, Word, Excel, etc...) is required.

Work is located at a chemical plant and requires exposure to ambient temperature extremes

Work may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as fire-retardant clothing, hearing and eye protection, hard hat and steel-toed boots

Work requires moderate physical exertion including walking to operating areas and walking up stairs

May require walking the project property

description:
Title:

Electronic Warfare Electrical Engineer

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

Program Summary

KBR is seeking an experienced Electronic Warfare (EW) Electrical Engineer that will provide integration and testing support for the Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) C-130J Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Office at Wright-Patterson AFB or Robins AFB.

Job Summary
The EW Electrical Engineer will provide support for the development, integration and testing of a new EW system and will perform system engineering functions such as developing and managing systems level requirements, developing operational systems concepts, and performing systems level integration and test for the EW System.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Provide engineering support in integration and testing of EW systems

Derive requirements for EW systems to meet mission needs

Validate and verify vendor products upon delivery of systems

Complete in-depth technical assessments, analysis, and evaluations for EW system

Analyze and assess system performance

Generate official reports that contains the structure of the test events, the rationale on the structure of the test events, detailed analysis, conclusions, and suggested approaches for future development

Perform Requirement analysis / management for Electronic Warfare system

Strong technical writing and communications skills

Ability to work well collaboratively and thrive independently


Work Environment: 

Location: Wright-Patterson AFB/Robins AFB 

Travel Requirements: 10-15%
Working Hours: Standard 40 hrs/wk

Basic Qualifications 

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or other related field

10 years of engineering

Test background/experience

General electrical education/knowledge in avionics

EW and/or software experience and willing to learn

Hands-on laboratory/field experience

Familiar with DOD acquisition process

Must have a DoD SECRET security clearance

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s Degree in Engineering or related area

Knowledge of EW M&S systems and techniques

Design knowledge of EW hardware and software

Experience with standard software pertaining to EW and/or aircraft platforms (i.e. C++ and MATLAB)

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

title: Subcontracts Administrator
description:
Title:

Subcontracts Administrator

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR's Readiness and Sustainment (R&S) division is the Team Behind the Mission®. We deliver mission critical services to the U.S. military and coalition partners around the world. Our key capabilities include base operations; contingency and expeditionary support; next generation asset management; digitally focused logistics; prepositioned stock; and integrated supply chain management.

Specifically, this role will be supporting the Marine Corps’ Maritime Prepositioning Force (MPF) and Marine Corps Prepositioning Program (MCPP), who have been operationally invaluable in supporting our Nation’s interests across the world. Located at the Marine Corps Support Facility Blount Island in Jacksonville, Florida, the program ensures that combat-ready equipment and supplies are pre-positioned to support rapid deployment and sustainment of Marine forces worldwide.

Job Summary

The Subcontracts Administrator plays a crucial role in managing all procurement and administrative activities related to subcontracting. The administrator will oversee the full range of procurement and subcontract management, from pre-award activities through close-out. Under general supervision, this role will require problem-solving skills, industry knowledge, and the ability to navigate both field and best practices in subcontract administration.

 **This role will be onsite the Blount Island military installation in Jacksonville, FL 

Roles and Responsibilities 

Effectively manage the subcontracts lifecycle as associated with procurement activity.

Issue requests for proposals, evaluate proposals, and qualify suppliers.

Maintain accurate subcontract files in compliance with established procedures.

Utilize problem-solving skills and industry knowledge to steer best practices for the group.

Display expertise within the subcontracting focus and seek continuous improvement within both processes and individual skills.

Basic Qualifications 

Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.

At least 2+ years of experience in subcontract administration or related procurement activities.

Strong understanding of procurement processes, proposal evaluation, and subcontract management.

Excellent negotiation and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Previous experience working with government contracts and their compliance requirements.

Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.

Familiarity with subcontractor claims resolution.

Experience using procurement software or contract management systems.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Civil Structural Engineer
description:
Title:

Civil Structural Engineer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for a Civil Structural Engineer to independently apply advanced engineering techniques, make decisions on engineering problems and methods, and represent the organization in client meetings to resolve important challenges. You will be expected to work both independently and in coordination with other discipline designers to provide technical guidance and produce CSA project deliverables.   

This position is located at a client site in Richmond, VA with work expected to be completed at site unless required to travel.  Relocation may be offered for candidates outside the region. 

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Responsible for drafting CSA drawings

Responsible for technical content on issued for construction civil structural drawings

Responsible for preparing structural calculations

Responsible for preparing construction specifications & scope of work

Responsible for developing repair plans & recommendations based on field work

Responsible for answering technical queries regarding CSA design

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

BS degree in Civil or Structural Engineering

10+ years of related experience

It’s preferred that the candidate be a Professional Engineer licensed for Virginia, or have the ability to complete this certification within 6 months

Experience in structural and civil engineering at industrial sites is preferred

Ability to model and analyze using either STAAD or RISA 3D

Experience using 2D drafting software such as MicroStation or AutoCAD

Experience writing scope of works

This role may require up to 10% travel as part of the job responsibilities

Physical Qualifications

Work is located at a working plant and requires exposure to ambient temperature extremes

Work will require walking the plant property

Work may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as fire-retardant clothing, hearing and eye protection, hard hat and steel-toed boots

Day-to-day physical requirements involve standard office activities including sitting/standing for extended periods of time, attending meetings, use of keyboard and mouse repetitively, lifting and carrying less than 20 lbs. frequently, etc.

Work requires moderate physical exertion including walking to operating areas and walking up stairs. 

Employee may occasionally need to climb a scaffold with fall protection to undertake an inspection.

title: Diego Garcia: Senior Network Engineer
location:
locations
Diego Garcia, British Indian Ocean Territory
description:
Title:

Diego Garcia: Senior Network Engineer

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR provides full-spectrum base operations support to Naval Support Facility Diego Garcia, a remote location in the British Indian Ocean Territory. Our robust supply chain ensures on-time delivery of mission-critical supplies, and our team conducts essential port and airfield operations in this geographically complex environment. The KBR team is over 1,000 people strong, providing not only life support services such as water treatment, electricity, and telecom/antenna maintenance, but also quality of life services like Morale, Welfare, and Recreation (MWR) and an award-winning dining facility. 

Job Summary

KBR is seeking a highly skilled Senior Network Engineer to join our team in support of mission-critical network infrastructure operations. This role involves hands-on network design, implementation, maintenance, and incident response in a high-tempo operational environment. The ideal candidate will have in-depth technical knowledge and the ability to lead network integration and security initiatives. Minimum 5 years of experience with large-scale Cisco-based WAN/LAN environments.

Roles and Responsibilities

Provide incident response support by analyzing, blocking, and remediating network/system threats.
Correlate firewall logs, system audit logs, and antivirus postures to identify and address security threats.
Implement recommendations and solutions for routers, firewalls, dial-up, and internet connectivity issues.
Perform vulnerability management and ensure compliance with security alerts.
Configure and maintain network infrastructure including web servers, routers, and switches.
Audit and assess current network and infrastructure processes, recommending improvements aligned with best practices.
Install, configure, and maintain UNIX/Linux systems.
Evaluate, recommend, and support LAN infrastructure and topology.
Design network architecture and coordinate full network integration efforts.
Oversee and support hardware installation and application software deployment.
Configure routing protocols and provide user-level software and hardware familiarization training.
Conduct site surveys and provide technical assistance for fiber optic installation and LAN connectivity.
Troubleshoot major network nodes and ensure system reliability and performance.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications

Must be a US Citizen
Hold an Active Secret Clearance
Strong knowledge of network capacity planning, security principles, and best practices.
Proven ability to lead technical teams and projects, implementing infrastructure and security standards.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Ability to perform effectively in high-pressure environments.
Excellent communication skills (oral and written) for collaboration with clients, stakeholders, and senior management.
Valid driver’s license (Manual and Automatic Transmission).
Must pass overseas medical screening and be in good health.

Preferred Qualifications

Education: 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Certifications:

Must meet DoD 8570.1M IAT Level II requirements.
One or more of the following certifications: Security+, GSEC, SCNP, or SSCP.

Experience

Proven experience working with Cisco routers, Switches, fiber modems, and subnetting is needed.
Proven experience configuring and troubleshooting security configuration issues with MS Exchange, WWW, DNS, and NT Domain Controllers are required.  

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: HSE Area Manager/Coordinator
description:
Title:

HSE Area Manager/Coordinator

KBR’s Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) group is looking for a HSE Area Manager/Coordinator to support HSE initiatives on a multi-billion-dollar project.

KBR is seeking an experienced leader who is capable of providing stakeholder management and influence with Global Project Execution within the Integrated Solutions (IS) Business Unit and KBR Sustainable Technology Solution (STS) Division.  

The HSE Area Manager/Coordinator will be accountable for HSE on a large-scale industrial project and will be crucial in ensuring the successful completion of the project by being proactive in risk identification and mitigation and by providing timely response and remediation of incidents across the global organization.

***To be considered you must submit an English resume***

This position is located in Lobito Angola

Responsibilities 

Define the project HSE objectives, programs, and performance measurement standards
Timely response and remediation of incidents, proactive risk identification and mitigation across the Global organization
Ensure that adequate resources are assigned to all phases of the project to enable HSSE objectives to be reached
Ensure that the HSSE policies, plans and procedures are documented and implemented
Display all characteristics of KBR Leadership in the office and field, being a Leader of Safety within the organization
Comprehensively manage incidents, including root cause analysis and execution of necessary improvement efforts; deliver the expedient and clear communication of incidents to IS and Corporate leadership
Keep visibility of incidents and HSERS metrics
Collect and review leading and lagging safety data to predict and prevent future incidents
Provide leadership in hiring safety managers and their successful onboarding and understanding of KBR HSSE systems and standards; support and provide direction to all Project safety managers and support site personnel to enable the Zero Harm culture
Develop and maintain training programs for contractors and competencies of Regional Safety Managers
Collaborate effectively and align with all regions’ site personnel to drive effective site safety program and culture
Lead for a specified area of the Project and be the point of contact for reporting of safety data, analytics, incidents, and program advancement to the Senior HSSE Manager/Deputy HSSE Manager and have dotted line reporting to Project Management.

Experience & Skills

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or HSE related field
5 + years of progressive experience
Strong ability to communicate effectively with audiences that include but are not limited to management, coworkers, clients, vendors, contractors, and other stakeholders
Proven ability supporting Health, Safety, Security, and Environmental systems
Must be able to learn and apply knowledge of applicable local, state/province, and federal/national statutes and guidelines
Attention to detail and capacity to work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner
Proven ability to analyze problems, determine resolutions, and a path forward
Must have ability to communicate fluently in both spoken and written English

Additional Qualifications

PMC experience working with China based EPC Contractors and executing work in Angola preferable
Industrial construction background: ability to understand, interpret and apply regulatory requirements applicable to the project scope of work
Demonstrated high level of interpretive thinking and mature judgment
Proven ability to run the HSE function on large-scale projects
Proficiency in spoken and written Chinese is preferred; however, it is not a requirement for the role.
Advanced computer and software skills to include the use of word processing and email as well as the advanced use of spreadsheets, electronic presentations, and databases
Effectively demonstrate high critical thinking/reasoning ability
Highly proficient presentation skills including public speaking
Strong organizational and leadership skills
A valid driver’s license, is required

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

title: UABOS Turkey LN: Water Treatment Plant Mechanic Operator
location:
locations
Incirlik Air Base, Adana, Turkey
description:
Title:

UABOS Turkey LN: Water Treatment Plant Mechanic Operator

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR supports the operational needs of U.S. armed forces at Morón Air Base in Spain and several bases in Turkey. Our services ensure smooth operations, allowing Air Force and government personnel to focus on their missions. We provide program management, civil engineering, morale, welfare, and recreation support, among other essential services. Awarded by the Air Force Installation Contracting Center, our contract spans a five-year base period with three one-year options, reflecting our commitment to excellence and operational support.

Job Summary

Incirlik Air Base Water Treatment Plant operator has the responsibility to operate, maintain, inspect, repair and overhauling Water treatment system, Ground water wells, Filtration process, Reverse Osmosis system, Disinfection and Fluoridation processes, base swimming pool and associated equipment and system components. The candidate should be familiar with hazardous chemical work environments to include corrosive acids and toxic gases. The operator is also responsible for ensuring all facilities equipment operate in the most efficient manner possible to ensure that the facility meets safety, efficiency, quality, and environmental targets that exceed KBR and UABOS standards.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Ensure compliance with all operational guidelines, standards, and regulations to guarantee that treated water entering the distribution system is safe and meets quality requirements.
Monitor, operate, repair, and maintain plant processes and associated equipment system components to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
Conduct routine inspections and operational rounds for treatment systems, water wells, main pump stations, water storage tanks, and swimming pools to verify functionality and compliance.
Operate and monitor the Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system to control and assess plant operations.
Collect, inspect, test, and evaluate water samples to ensure compliance with regulatory limits and operational standards.
Maintain and adjust chemical feed pumps to achieve proper chemical dosage rates, ensuring effective treatment.
Monitor chemical dosage tank levels and perform timely refills to sustain uninterrupted operations.
Perform preventive maintenance on plant equipment, including calibrations, basic mechanical and electrical repairs, lubrication, and replacement of worn components.
Maintain accurate and complete records, including daily operating logs, Air Force (AF) forms, inspection checklists, chemical usage logs, and parts inventory reports.
Support facility upkeep by performing general building and grounds maintenance, grass cutting, cargo hauling, trash removal, and contractor escort duties.
Operate hand and power tools safely and effectively in the execution of assigned duties.
Attend required training sessions to maintain compliance and proficiency in plant operations and safety procedures.
Perform additional related duties as assigned to meet operational needs.
Daily use of mechanical, electrical, and automation systems, with the ability to troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair instrumentation malfunctions.
Daily use of common hand tools and related equipment in a safe and correct manner.
Daily use of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) to complete reports, tasks, and communicate with customers and co-workers.
Responsible for the complete operation and maintenance of the water treatment plant.
Read, write, compile, and analyze technical data and reports daily.
Work collaboratively and respectfully with colleagues in close-quarters operational environments.
Maintain operational readiness through regular equipment inspections, maintenance, and troubleshooting.
Work may involve noise exposure, chemical fumes, and hazardous chemicals in liquid, vapor, or solid forms.
Daily use of appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to include but not limited to chemical coveralls, full-faced mask, and SCBA when performing assigned tasks.
Demonstrate sound judgment in safe work practices and proper equipment usage.
Frequent entering of confined spaces (manholes, reservoirs, filters, water storage tanks) and climbing elevated structures up to 40–50 meters.
Work on rotating shifts (days, nights, evenings), including weekends and holidays.
Available for emergency on-call duty and overtime on a 24-hour basis.
Maintain punctuality and a reliable level of attendance.
Work with minimal supervision while meeting performance expectations.

Basic Qualifications 

Turkish Citizen
Possess a valid Class B driver’s license.
English Level I
High school diploma

Preferred Qualifications

2- or 4-year degree in Electrical, Control and Automation, Industrial Automation, Mechanical Trade, or a related technical field.
English level II
Experience working in industrial systems maintenance, including water pumps, electric and diesel-driven motors, mechanical systems, motorized and pneumatic valves, chemical dosing systems, control panels, and automation systems.
Experience in the maintenance, repair, and operation of mechanical and electrical pumping systems and related machinery within a municipal water or wastewater treatment plant environment.
PLC/SCADA programming and instrumentation experience, or equivalent control systems certification.

All positions require the applicant to obtain and pass a medical physical that is certified by a doctor, to include a vision test including color recognition and a respirator fit test.

All positions require a current and favorable Turkish Security background check.

All male candidates must have completed their military service.

KBR Benefits

Local Nationals (LN) personnel will receive benefits in accordance with the collective labor agreement (CLA) within the appropriate country location where they reside. KBR supports career advancement through professional training and development.

description:
Title:

End User Compute Engineer

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

Think.KBR.com

KBR in Australia 

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Learn more about KBR in Australia  

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR 

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

Mission and Scope

This opportunity is located in Canberra. 

The End User Compute (EUC) Engineer is responsible for the support, maintenance, and continuous improvement of endpoint and server environments across client ICT systems. This role ensures that users have secure, reliable, and performant access to computing resources by managing endpoint configurations, server infrastructure, application packaging and patch compliance.

Operating under the direction of the Service Delivery Manager (SDM), the EUC Engineer works closely with both infrastructure and service delivery teams to support platforms such as MECM, WSUS and MDT. This position involves hands-on support, advanced troubleshooting, system optimisation and adherence to best practices in user device management and standard operating environment (SOE) design.

Responsibilities

The key responsibilities of the role will include, but are not limited to:

Service Operations

Provide day-to-day sustainment of EUC platform services.

Monitor and maintain endpoint performance, patch compliance, and availability.

Administer EUC services across several government networks with varying sizes and classifications.

Respond to and resolve incidents and service requests.

Work within SHIs and in alignment with SOW-defined service boundaries.

Incident & Change Management

Act as a primary escalation point for complex EUC-related incidents and problems.

Conduct root cause analysis for recurring issues and implement corrective actions.

Plan, test and implement changes in accordance with established change management processes.

Participate in change advisory board (CAB) meetings where required, ensuring EUC-related changes are risk-assessed and documented.

Ensure changes are rolled out with minimal user disruption and in line with service level expectations.

 

SOE & Endpoint Management

Maintain and enhance Standard Operating Environment (SOE) images for desktops and servers using tools such as MDT and SCCM.

Manage and deploy operating system updates, security patches and configuration baselines.

Ensure consistent application of group policies and compliance with configuration standards.

Application Packaging & Deployment

Package, test, and deploy applications to endpoints and servers using SCCM and/or Tanium.

Manage application updates, version control, and compatibility with the SOE.

Liaise with application owners and business stakeholders to ensure successful packaging and deployment of new applications.

User File Storage & Profile Management

Support enterprise user file storage solutions and ensure availability and recoverability of user data.

Implement and maintain profile management and redirection solutions.

Support migration and consolidation of user data during SOE refreshes or system transitions.

Incident Response & Crisis Management

Act as an escalation point for technical ICT incident, working closely with internal teams and external partners to restore services quickly and effectively.

Participate in post-incident reviews to analyse root causes and implement preventive measures.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Essential:

3+ years’ experience in an EUC, Desktop Engineering or Systems Administration role.

Demonstrated experience supporting:

Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops (or equivalent VDI platforms).

Endpoint management via SCCM, Tanium or similar platforms.

SOE development and management with MDT or other imaging tools.

Proven experience with application packaging, deployment and lifecycle management.

Strong understanding of patch management, user file storage solutions and folder redirection.

Working knowledge of Active Directory, Group Policy, Windows 10/11 desktop operating systems.

NV1 Security clearance (with the ability to upgrade to NV2).

ITIL V3/4 Foundation Certification.

Desirable:

Certifications in Microsoft technologies (MD-102, MS-101), Citrix (CCA-V or higher) or Tanium.

Working knowledge of Linux OS (RHEL 7/8/9).

Experience with PowerShell scripting for automation of EUC tasks.

Background supporting secure or classified environments with compliance requirements.

Experience in environments with high-volume or enterprise endpoint deployments.

Soft Skills:

Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, particularly in diagnosing user environment issues.

Excellent communication and documentation abilities.

Customer-centric mindset with a focus on delivering a seamless end user experience.

Ability to manage competing priorities and support multiple environments simultaneously.

Strong teamwork, adaptability and willingness to continuously learn new tools and technologies.

Benefits of KBR

A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work (Aus, India, UK & US)

Flexible working conditions

Competitive salary (including annual reviews)

Paid Parental leave

Paid Reservist leave

Income protection

Corporate rewards

Salary packaging/Novated leasing

Discounted employee stock purchase plans

Flu shots, skin checks and private health insurance discounts

Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

If you’re ready to shape tomorrow, let’s get started. Apply Now!

location:

description:
Title:

Senior Financial Analyst/Project Planning & Controls (PP&C)

Mission Technology Solutions - Defense, intelligence and space innovation technology at the speed of tomorrow.

KBR combines mission expertise with advanced digital technologies to solve the world’s toughest challenges on a global scale. KBR is a trusted national security partner for a wide array of customers across space, land, air and sea. KBR delivers innovative solutions across digital engineering and integration, rapid prototyping, mission operations, data analytics, artificial intelligence and secure logistics. At KBR, We deliver.™

KBR is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst/Project Planning & Controls (PP&C) to join the project team, supporting Program Management and cross-functional partners. This role oversees full P&L and cash flow responsibility for assigned project(s), managing financial activities for various contract types and sizes with minimal direct supervision. The Senior Analyst requires in-depth expertise in budgeting, forecasting, estimates to complete (ETC/EAC), variance and trend analysis, and reporting cycles. The Senior Analyst identifies financial opportunities and risks, supports backlog management, fosters a strong control and compliance environment, and applies advanced knowledge of accounting principles, contract management, and government contracting processes, including FAR and CAS.

Key Responsibilities

Develop, maintain, and control work breakdown structures (WBS) and lead project set-up activities to ensure compliant cost charging, billing, and revenue recognition.
Oversee project budgets, baselines, funding, schedules, and milestones, including calculating estimates to complete (ETC/EAC) and processing scope changes.
Review incurred costs and forecast future expenditures using labor productivity, material price forecasts, subcontract agreements, wage rates, and risk analysis.
Monitor and maximize project cash flow by reviewing customer invoices, reconciling unbilled balances, and identifying opportunities for improvement.
Oversee subcontractor expenditures, track costs and fees against budget, analyze trends, and prepare monthly accruals.
Collaborate with Program Management and customers to achieve financial and contractual objectives, preparing reports and presentations for internal and external stakeholders.
Lead corporate budget and forecast activities for assigned projects by documenting assumptions and evaluating financial opportunities and risks.
Reconcile weekly, monthly, and cumulative cost and performance data; provide variance analysis, trending, and completion reporting.
Develop price and cost estimates using complex pricing concepts and applicable government accounting standards (FAR, CAS).
Establish and maintain financial controls, procedures, systems, and forecasting techniques to evaluate project status and ensure compliance with government and customer requirements.
Lead cross-functional teams, implement process improvement initiatives, and provide mentorship and guidance while managing multiple priorities and long-term objectives.

Basic Qualifications

Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
4+ years of progressive financial analysis and program management experience, including hands-on budgeting, forecasting, and project controls.

Financial Expertise:

Demonstrated expertise in complex program management concepts (budgets, estimates to complete, project schedules, variance and trend analysis).
Knowledge of financial accounting principles as they relate to U.S. GAAP.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced Excel skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Deltek Costpoint, COBRA, COGNOS, Hyperion, or Power BI.
Knowledge of standard U.S. government agency reporting requirements (e.g., NASA, DOD, FEDSIM).
Knowledge of Earned Value Management System (EVMS) reporting.

Additional Compensation: KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Benefits: KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include a 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture.  These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company.  That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Lead RF Engineer
description:
Title:

Lead RF Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR seeks a Lead RF Engineer with expertise in signal processing, embedded systems, and cybersecurity to advance our mission-critical programs. The ideal candidate will combine hands-on experience in real-time software development (C/C++, Python), digital signal processing (DSP), and RF engineering with technical leadership skills to mentor teams delivering solutions for environments at the tactical edge.

Ideal candidates are eager to build on their expertise in SIGINT applications, real-time SWaP-constrained systems, and AI development to address high-stakes national security challenges. They should demonstrate proven leadership in delivering mission-critical defense solutions and possess hands-on experience in prototype development, from design through implementation, testing, and user transition. 

Why Join Us? 

Innovative Projects: At KBR, you'll be working on prototype projects that support the U.S. Air Force Research Laboratory’s most mission-critical objectives. The Air Force Research Laboratory is the primary scientific research and development center for the Department of the Air Force. AFRL plays an integral role in leading the discovery, development, and integration of affordable warfighting technologies for our air, space, and cyberspace force.  
Collaborative Environment: KBR fosters a dynamic and collaborative atmosphere where cross-functional teams of product managers, engineers, developers, and defense experts work in unison. We practice Agile and DevOps principles, ensuring rapid iteration, continuous feedback, and integration across all projects. Our team is passionate, forward-thinking, and united by a mission-first mindset that encourages knowledge sharing, innovation, and problem-solving at every level. 
Impactful Work: Your work here won’t just be limited to software development—it will directly support the Air Force in expanding current national capabilities. As the Air Force's leader for National-to-Tactical capability development, AFRL collaborates with leading experts across the Intelligence Community, Department of Defense, National Laboratories, industry, inter-agency, academia, and partner nations. 

Key Responsibilities:

Lead full-cycle development of real-time, resource-constrained systems (e.g., SDR-based adaptive filtering, GPS spoofing mitigation) using AI/ML and DSP techniques
Architect and prototype cybersecurity capabilities to counteract SIGINT threats, jamming interference, and target tracking challenges
Collaborate with stakeholders to design functioning prototypes aligned with operational constraints
Mentor junior engineers in software development methodologies, technical problem-solving, and embedded software lifecycle management
Communicate complex concepts clearly to senior leadership and non-specialist audiences

Work Environment:

Location: Colorado Springs, CO – 100% Onsite
Travel Requirements: Minimal
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Security Clearance: Must possess an active U.S. government Top Secret (SCI) security clearance, which only a U.S. citizen can obtain
Education: PhD or MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields
Experience: 5+ years of experience working on DOD/intelligence programs (SIGINT, SATCOM, RF systems)
Proficiency in DSP algorithm design, embedded software development (C/C++, Python), and real-time system integration
Familiarity with RF prototyping tools (e.g., SDR, MATLAB), test environments, and low-level hardware interfaces
Demonstrated leadership in technical teams, including mentorship of junior staff and program management

 Desired:

title: Joint Modeling, Simulation, and Analysis (MS&A) Expert
description:
Title:

Joint Modeling, Simulation, and Analysis (MS&A) Expert

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

The qualified applicant will support the Space Warfighting Analysis Center’s (SWAC) Force Design Integration Office (FDIO) in Chantilly, VA with anticipated travel within the National Capital Region (NCR) in support of the SWAC’s priorities. The applicant will work closely with the SWAC program offices, Department of the Air Force Headquarters, and the Joint Staff to model joint operational scenarios, missions, and interdependencies at multiple classification levels. The qualified candidate may support SWAC Force Design through Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) efforts to include: capturing joint operational scenarios, missions, and interdependencies in SysML and/or Unified Architecture Framework (UAF) using CAMEO; translating operational analytic models and outputs into dynamic SysML and/or UAF models using CAMEO; understanding and integrating models both from within SWAC program offices and from analytic partners across the services; supporting maintenance and standardization of models in a SWAC Digital Engineering Library. The qualified candidate may support SWAC Force Design through MS&A efforts to include: developing models in Operations Analysis (OA) tools such as Systems Toolkit (STK), Advanced Framework for Simulation, Integration, and Modeling (AFSIM), and others; supporting execution of analytic tradespace studies at the mission and campaign levels within the integration layer; supporting development of analysis scripts using standard data processing tools such as MATLAB, Python, and R. The qualified candidate will be the MBSE and/or MS&A expert during engagements with DAF, Joint Staff, and other DoD organizations. The candidate will translate complex technical information into products that communicate effectively to non-subject matter experts and will prepare correspondence and other documentation (formal letters, position papers, reports).
 

Work Environment:

Location: On-site, Chantilly, Customer Site

Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20% to NCR region

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

SAP eligibility is required

Must have an active U.S. Government TS/SCI security clearance and be able to pass a Counterintelligence (CI) polygraph

Ability to effectively work both independently and with a cross-country, multi-disciplinary team

STEM Bachelor's Degree is required

5+ years MS&A experience developing OA simulations and executing analyses

5+ years MBSE in SysML/UAF experience

Ability to understand complex technical issues and produce recommendations for a wide audience

Experience with space operations or space acquisition

Desired:

Existing or previous SAP access

Current CI Polygraph

STEM Master’s Degree

10+ years MS&A experience

10+ years MBSE and SysML/UAF experience 

7+ years Joint Operational Planning / Joint integration experience

Experience with DoD, IC, and Commercial Satellite systems in SCI/SAP environment

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 

40hrs

title: Director of Engineering for Mission Software
description:
Title:

Director of Engineering for Mission Software

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Work Environment:

Location: Remote
Travel Requirements: Minimal, less than 20%
Working Hours: Standard

KBR is seeking a Director of Engineering to serve as the technical leader for the Mission Software capability area within the Office of the CTO. This leader will define technical direction, reference architectures, and delivery standards for mission software investments across the IR&D portfolio and provide technical guidance for select capture efforts and program execution activities.

This role serves as the primary steward of the Mission Software Initiative, including roadmap execution, IR&D alignment, customer engagement, and technical integration across programs.

Key Responsibilities:

CTO Initiative Ownership:

• Lead the Mission Software Initiative, defining and managing execution of multiple projects and related roadmap elements.

• Track initiative KPIs, technical milestones, risks, resourcing needs, and alignment to Mission Tech Technology Strategy and 2030 objectives.

• Coordinate with other initiative leads (AI, Digital Integration, Mission Engineering, Digital Environment) to ensure cohesive enterprise advancement.

IR&D Strategy & Technical Review:

• Review IR&D proposals related to mission software for feasibility, desirability, and strategic impact.

• Shape IR&D investments around open architectures, cloud scale mission software, and future ready mission capabilities

Customer Engagement & Capture Support:

• Provide technical leadership for captures and pursuits involving mission systems, OMS/FACE, mission applications, autonomy frameworks, and digital enabled C2.

• Engage with customers to shape technical requirements, architecture options, and integration pathways.

Cross Portfolio Mentorship & Knowledge Development:

• Mentor engineers across BUs in mission architecture, DevSecOps, software assurance, digital engineering, and platform agnostic integration approaches.

• Sponsor and contribute to Communities of Practice, capability catalogs, reusable software patterns, and enterprise knowledge management.

• Define and propagate best practices in DevSecOps across programs —including CI/CD automation, software assurance, test harnesses, secure coding policies, and cloud orchestration approaches.

Required Qualifications: 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related technical field.
12+ years of experience developing or integrating mission systems software for defense, space, intelligence, or national security programs.
Demonstrated expertise in:
Open Mission Systems (OMS), FACE, MOSA
Cloud native mission applications (AWS GovCloud, Azure Government)
DevSecOps toolchains (GitLab/Azure DevOps, IaC, containerization, Kubernetes)
Software assurance, cyber compliance, RMF integration
Real time/near real time mission systems
Proven leadership in designing and scaling secure, reliable, and interoperable software architectures across complex programs.
Ability to influence senior stakeholders and communicate technical concepts clearly to customers, executives, and non technical audiences.
Clearance: Active TS/SCI clearance; U.S. citizenship required

Desired Qualifications:

Advanced degree (MS/PhD) in Software Engineering, Systems Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline.
Experience in one or more mission domains: ISR, autonomy, space operations, EW, C2, cyber, or tactical aviation.
Familiarity with MBSE, digital engineering environments, or mission modeling/simulation.
Experience with exportability strategies, releasability planning, and coalition ready mission software.
Relevant certifications: AWS/Azure Architect, Security+, CISSP, SAFe, or equivalent.

title: Research Scientist
description:
Title:

Research Scientist

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

Job Description:
 

The Intelligent Systems Research and Development Support (ISRDS) contract supports NASA Ames Research Center in developing and infusing advanced technology into NASA missions. Our scientists, engineers and technologists support research and development of critical enabling technologies for all of the NASA Mission Directorates. This KBR-led team has supported technology development for NASA space exploration missions such as LADEE, VIPER, Biosentinel, Starling and TESS, supports payload development for the International Space Station, and develops robotics and autonomous operations technologies for lunar and planetary exploration, and performs research in materials modeling (including quantum materials) and quantum computing.


KBR is looking for a Research Scientist to support the Quantum Artificial Intelligence Lab (QuAIL) at NASA Ames.  This person must have a strong expertise in development and analysis of quantum and quantum-inspired algorithms, quantum simulation, quantum error-correction and quantum error mitigation and a deep understanding of the physics behind quantum algorithms. We are looking for a candidate with at least 3 years of experience in exploring quantum computing including hardware and software experience.


This person will lead independent research through numerical and theoretical analysis, exploring quantum error-correction, quantum algorithms, and quantum “inspired” classical algorithms for near-term applications on quantum devices, including but not limited to quantum machine learning, quantum simulation and optimization. This person must be skilled in both numerical and analytical evaluation of the performance of quantum and classical algorithms, comparing different quantum and quantum-classical hybrid approaches with each other and with state-of-the-art classical alternatives.


This individual must have demonstrated experience leading a team of researchers in quantum computing, and in leading technical proposal efforts.

Responsibilities:

Will support development and analysis of quantum and quantum inspired algorithms
Will support resource estimation and benchmarking of architectures and algorithms
Will support research and software engineering on quantum error-correction and quantum algorithms
Will lead research on fundamental quantum mechanisms and their use in quantum computation
May support and lead other related tasks in quantum sciences, data sciences and AI-based technologies

REQUIRED Skills and Traits:

Ph.D. in Physics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
3+ years of experience in quantum computing
Experience in developing, benchmarking
Demonstrated ability to lead small teams
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to develop and execute technical proposals

Basic Compensation:

$142,100.00 – $213,200.00

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: Metrology Technician II
description:
Title:

Metrology Technician II

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary  

The KBR Metrology team supports manufacturing, engineering & test, repair & overhaul, and aftermarket service centers globally in support of Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Medical, Safety, Semiconductor and other industries.  Our support includes services such as complete management of embedded metrology systems, calibration and repair, test & inspection, metrology engineering, preventive maintenance, NADCAP special process support, and AMS2750 Heat Treat pyrometry services and more.  Our teams are located across the globe working in KBR and customer embedded laboratories as well as performing onsite visits with our field service operations and mobile laboratory platforms.  Our teams work to ensure our customer systems are maintained to high standards through calibration, preventative maintenance, automation and programming, calibration recall system management, and audit support.  We ensure great customer experience by tracking and providing performance and delivery metrics through digital dashboards, as well as routine customer service surveys and direct customer meetings.

Job Summary  

Metrology Technician II is responsible for performing routine calibrations, tests and/or inspections in-lab or on-site using accredited standards, taking care of the day-to-day escalations and priority requests, maintaining traceability and calibration of laboratory standards.   Calibrations, tests and inspections may be performed with and/or without automation.  The position requires knowledge and fluency in basic and advanced calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures and processes, and hands-on experience with setting up advanced test equipment calibration systems.  This position also requires the ability to review, validate, create, and/or modify calibration, test, and/or inspection procedures. This role will report to the principal technician and/or lab manager.

Roles and Responsibilities   

Responsible for the calibration and certifying of electronic and physical/dimensional measuring and test equipment to technical specifications, maintaining traceability to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).

Performs calibration/repairs on equipment.

Calibrates standards used in calibrations.

Installs new equipment; performs modifications on equipment to make it compatible with existing equipment or to enhance its functions.

Makes reports on electronic or instrumentation system conditions, repairs and preventive maintenance performed; prepares and maintains repair and maintenance records as required by federal and department regulations and directives.

Develops automated procedures using basic/complex programming skills.

Uses all hand tools and sets up and uses standard machine tools. Uses common laboratory measuring, calibrating, and test equipment.

Performs troubleshooting in conjunction with design modification functions involved in production or engineering liaison.

Provides guidance regarding equipment operation to customers and equipment operators.

Proficient at understanding and writing reports and work instructions and assists customers to define technical requirements to meet their objective.

Performs work safely, in-compliant to HS&E requirements, and takes actions to ensure a safe working environment.

Maintains records of test data and assists in writing test procedures and test evaluation reports.

Applies advanced skills in area of specialization.

Basic Qualifications 

 

High school diploma with 2+ years experience in the field, OR Associates degree in engineering technology or other relevant field and 2 years experience. Formal military PMEL, TMDE or calibration school training with proof of attendance.

Previous customer service experience is a plus

U.S. Citizenship Status required due to client requirement.

Preferred Qualifications 

IndySoft, Fluke Met/Team, Fluke Met/Track and Met/Cal experience a plus+.

Proficient using Microsoft technology, including Excel

PMEL, TMDE or calibration school a plus+

Specific contract requirements regarding education and experience will prevail.

title: Modeling And Simulation Engineer - Mid
description:
Title:

Modeling And Simulation Engineer - Mid

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

KBR is seeking a Modeling And Simulation Engineer with in-depth knowledge of satellite relevancy to the Intelligence Community unique missions to be part of our team supporting our customer in Chantilly, VA that delivers mission-critical capabilities directly supporting intelligence-gathering missions from overhead systems.  We lead architectural assessments and report recommendations to senior US Government personnel guiding acquisition and execution of next-generation systems needs for the next 10-20 years.  These systems deliver collected data distributed to US Government Intelligence Community and Military users. The Modeling And Simulation Engineer serves as a technical advisor to support the Government with performing analysis on complex space systems needs.  This is a position of trust advising the US Government and supporting critical missions in multiple intelligence missions. 

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

Conduct mission analysis assessments and studies for the Program Office.

Coordinate assessments to architecture, perform architecture trades, and conduct architecture performance assessments for the Program Office.

Manage development, test, and validation of systems assessment methodologies and tools such as STK, MATLAB, and potentially organically developed software.

Perform analysis of space systems, performance metrics, timelines, and models.

Identify and document issues impacting both spacecraft and ground systems through objective analysis and processes.

Provide pre- and post-algorithm implementation and process analysis and modeling.

Provide support to verification and validation of algorithms including tuning, testing, and integration planning.

Support orbital analysis, including threats assessments/impacts, trades, and analyses.

Communicate technical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Interface with customers, directorate/office representatives, and across system engineering groups to drive resolution plans and strategies for complex technical challenges.

Generate and maintain technical documentation and reports.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: <10%, minimal, within the United States

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Active TS/SCI with Polygraph required.

Bachelor's degree (Master's degree preferred).

5+ years of relevant modeling and simulation experience.

Detailed understanding of government satellite systems and designs.

Insight into operations mission fundamentals, and ability to perform analysis on complex space systems.

Knowledge of satellite relevancy to Department of War and the Intelligence Community unique missions.

Previous ground site experience with flight operations.

Experience in Matlab, Python or similar.

Ability to support a flexible work schedule.

Desired:

Master’s degree in engineering discipline.   

6+ years of relevant modeling and simulation experience.

title: LCV APS-2 Germany: Maintenance Technician (COMSEC/C5ISR)
description:
Title:

LCV APS-2 Germany: Maintenance Technician (COMSEC/C5ISR)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR leads the global government‑services contingency market by providing responsive, full‑service logistics support to forces deployed worldwide under the Army & Strategic Programs. Under APS‑2, KBR supports the Army Prepositioned Stocks program by delivering maintenance, readiness, and logistics solutions that enable the rapid deployment of combat‑ready equipment and materiel across Europe in support of U.S. Army missions. Our APS‑2 workforce is composed of skilled professionals from diverse backgrounds who work together to ensure all equipment is properly stored, maintained, and mission‑ready for issue whenever required.

Job Summary

As a Maintenance Technician COMSEC/C5ISR, you will provide technical expertise in the maintenance, installation, and troubleshooting of Communications Security (COMSEC) equipment and Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Combat Systems, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C5ISR) systems. This role ensures secure communications and operational readiness of mission-critical systems in compliance with Department of Defense (DoD) standards and security protocols.

This position is designated as a TESA (Technical Expert Status Accreditation) role. Candidates must meet all TESA eligibility requirements as defined by the U.S. Army and applicable SOFA regulations. Final approval is subject to government review and issuance of TESA status. Employment is contingent upon successfully obtaining and maintaining TESA accreditation for the duration of the assignment.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Perform field and sustainment-level maintenance on COMSEC and C5ISR systems, including cryptographic devices, Controlled Cryptographic Items (CCI), radios, and associated electronic subsystems.
Install, configure, and verify communication systems in tactical vehicles and fixed facilities.
Conduct troubleshooting and diagnostics using specialized Test, Measurement, and Diagnostic Equipment (TMDE) such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, and signal generators.
Implement Modification Work Orders (MWO) and ensure compliance with technical manuals, Army Regulations (AR), and security directives.
Maintain accountability and secure storage of COMSEC material in accordance with DoD and NSA policies.
Perform key management operations using EKMS/KMI systems and devices like SKL AN/PYQ-10 and KIK-30.
Document maintenance actions, prepare reports, and update system records in GCSS-Army or equivalent platforms.
Adhere to safety protocols and promote a culture of zero accidents during high-voltage and sensitive equipment handling.
Provide technical training and guidance to junior technicians and supported units

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

U.S. Citizen with ability to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance.
Must have a bachelor’s degree plus 3 years of recent specialized experience, OR; An associate’s degree plus 7 years of recent specialized experience, OR; A major certification plus 7 years of recent specialized experience, OR; 11 years of recent specialized experience.
Minimum 3–5 years of experience in COMSEC or C5ISR systems maintenance and installation.
Proficiency in reading and applying Army Technical Manuals (TM), Technical Bulletins (TB), and wiring diagrams.
Familiarity with cryptographic key management systems (EKMS/KMI) and COMSEC handling procedures
Must be able to work in non-climate-controlled environments, outdoors in all weather conditions.
Must be able to grasp or handle objects, use finger dexterity, bend elbow/knee and reach above/below shoulders.
Must be able to lift and carry up to 40 pounds unassisted.
Must be able to team lift up to 50 pounds in a two-person carry.
Must be able to speak, read and write English fluently.
Must be free of medical restriction/ limitations that prevent the wearing and utilization of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Must be able to pass pre-employment and background checks related to the position.
Must be able to climb in and out of military vehicles and related equipment.
Must be able to work in cramped areas for at least two continuous hours.
Must be able to work in all types of weather conditions to include intense heat, heavy wind, blowing sand, heavy rain, and snow and sleet.
Employees shall utilize all proper lifting procedures and practices associated with all lifting and material handling tasks that are assigned and associated with this job description
Requires a valid passport with at least 12 months of validity and 6 blank pages.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Certified COMSEC Technician (CCT) or equivalent certification.
Certified C5ISR Technician (CC5ISR-Tech) or related credentials.
GCSS-Army certification and experience with DoD maintenance systems.
Advanced knowledge of IP networking, LAN/WAN troubleshooting, and secure communications protocols.
Experience with Type 1 cryptographic devices and associated loaders.
Experience and ability to work effectively with non-native English speakers strongly preferred.
Prior overseas professional experience.
