title: LCV APS-2 Germany: Master Mechanic (Tracked Vehicle)
description:
Title:

LCV APS-2 Germany: Master Mechanic (Tracked Vehicle)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR leads the global government‑services contingency market by providing responsive, full‑service logistics support to forces deployed worldwide under the Army & Strategic Programs. Under APS‑2, KBR supports the Army Prepositioned Stocks program by delivering maintenance, readiness, and logistics solutions that enable the rapid deployment of combat‑ready equipment and materiel across Europe in support of U.S. Army missions. Our APS‑2 workforce is composed of skilled professionals from diverse backgrounds who work together to ensure all equipment is properly stored, maintained, and mission‑ready for issue whenever required.

Job Summary

The Master Mechanic (Tracked Vehicles) is responsible for the efficient management of all personnel and resources to accomplish all mission requirements pertaining to the tracked vehicles in direct support of the tracked vehicle maintenance mission. The role is also responsible for ensuring excellent customer service, effective implementation of the quality control program, and mission compliance with all contract requirements.

This position is designated as a TESA (Technical Expert Status Accreditation) role. Candidates must meet all TESA eligibility requirements as defined by the U.S. Army and applicable SOFA regulations. Final approval is subject to government review and issuance of TESA status. Employment is contingent upon successfully obtaining and maintaining TESA accreditation for the duration of the assignment.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Maintains close coordination with the Government to ensure responsive support.
Maintains awareness of all operations, projected workload, inspection results, training, Government requests, guidance, and all issues relative to safety, environmental, and personnel.
Directly reports to the General Forman/Foreman and has the approval authority to accomplish all mission requirements as specified in all applicable regulations and contractual requirements. This authority includes but is not limited to performance of all functions required by the contract and related regulatory requirements: i.e., approves timecards, administers discipline in accordance with company policy and “stop work authority” if a safety or potential safety situation occurs.
Directly leads mechanics responsible for preventive maintenance and fault repair of tracked vehicles, to include complex, interrelated mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic, electronic, and electrical systems, equipment, and components while in operation or standby condition. Utilizes specially designed testing methods and equipment such as computerized test sets, precision gauges, electronic sensors, injector test stands, engine scopes, etc., to ensure tolerance and safety factors are met.
Advises mechanics of proper operation and maintenance of equipment, trains new Technical Inspectors, and further develops their skills. 
Monitors operation and production at job site and ensures that proper maintenance and safety procedures are followed.
Performs under stressful conditions and meets short suspense dates.
May be required to work extended hours, nights, weekends, and holidays.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must have an Active U.S. Government issued Secret Security Clearance and maintain it for the duration of your employment on this contract. Due to this, you must be a U.S. Citizen to be eligible for this position.
Must have a bachelor’s degree plus 3 years of recent specialized experience, OR; An associate’s degree plus 7 years of recent specialized experience, OR; A major certification plus 7 years of recent specialized experience, OR; 11 years of recent specialized experience.
Must be educated on and have experience in tracked vehicle military combat systems, including hull and turret operations.
Requires well rounded training and experience on tracked vehicles. Experience is normally acquired through a formal apprenticeship or equivalent. 
Must be able to speak, read, and write English fluently.
Experience in the use of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint.
Requires experience with GCSS-Army.
Requires knowledge in equipment repair or equivalent experience, thorough knowledge of field services, equipment operation, and maintenance.
Must have a valid Driver’s License.
Requires a valid passport with at least 12 months of validity and 6 blank pages.

Additional Requirements

Prior Military, LOGCAP, or other contract experience in working with military equipment and environment.
Knowledge of US military regulations and OEM requirements, including OSHA, ANSI regulations standards.
Work under stressful circumstances and meets short suspense dates
Must be free of medical restriction/limitations that prevent the performance of required duties and/or prevent the wearing and utilization of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Must be physically capable of performing the work in conditions of extreme temperatures, low humidity, rain, and blowing sand and dust
Employee shall utilize all proper lifting procedures and practices associated with all lifting and material handling tasks that are assigned and associated with this job description
Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds unassisted
Must be able to team lift-up to 100 pounds in a two-person carry
Use crowbars, brooms, mops, sledgehammers and related items
Must be able to stand, stoop, crawl and climb as necessary to perform job functions using proper techniques and PPE for extended periods to include confined spaces

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include medical, dental, life insurance, AD&D, R&R, an Employee Support Program and more. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Candidates must meet visa and or work permit requirements for the country of assignment to be considered and eligible for employment.
skills: Roles and

title: LCV APS-2 Germany: Maintenance Technician (COMSEC/C5ISR)
description:
Title:

LCV APS-2 Germany: Maintenance Technician (COMSEC/C5ISR)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR leads the global government‑services contingency market by providing responsive, full‑service logistics support to forces deployed worldwide under the Army & Strategic Programs. Under APS‑2, KBR supports the Army Prepositioned Stocks program by delivering maintenance, readiness, and logistics solutions that enable the rapid deployment of combat‑ready equipment and materiel across Europe in support of U.S. Army missions. Our APS‑2 workforce is composed of skilled professionals from diverse backgrounds who work together to ensure all equipment is properly stored, maintained, and mission‑ready for issue whenever required.

Job Summary

As a Maintenance Technician COMSEC/C5ISR, you will provide technical expertise in the maintenance, installation, and troubleshooting of Communications Security (COMSEC) equipment and Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Combat Systems, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C5ISR) systems. This role ensures secure communications and operational readiness of mission-critical systems in compliance with Department of Defense (DoD) standards and security protocols.

This position is designated as a TESA (Technical Expert Status Accreditation) role. Candidates must meet all TESA eligibility requirements as defined by the U.S. Army and applicable SOFA regulations. Final approval is subject to government review and issuance of TESA status. Employment is contingent upon successfully obtaining and maintaining TESA accreditation for the duration of the assignment.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Perform field and sustainment-level maintenance on COMSEC and C5ISR systems, including cryptographic devices, Controlled Cryptographic Items (CCI), radios, and associated electronic subsystems.
Install, configure, and verify communication systems in tactical vehicles and fixed facilities.
Conduct troubleshooting and diagnostics using specialized Test, Measurement, and Diagnostic Equipment (TMDE) such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, and signal generators.
Implement Modification Work Orders (MWO) and ensure compliance with technical manuals, Army Regulations (AR), and security directives.
Maintain accountability and secure storage of COMSEC material in accordance with DoD and NSA policies.
Perform key management operations using EKMS/KMI systems and devices like SKL AN/PYQ-10 and KIK-30.
Document maintenance actions, prepare reports, and update system records in GCSS-Army or equivalent platforms.
Adhere to safety protocols and promote a culture of zero accidents during high-voltage and sensitive equipment handling.
Provide technical training and guidance to junior technicians and supported units

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must have an Active U.S. Government issued Secret Security Clearance and maintain it for the duration of your employment on this contract. Due to this, you must be a U.S. Citizen to be eligible for this position.
Must have a bachelor’s degree plus 3 years of recent specialized experience, OR; An associate’s degree plus 7 years of recent specialized experience, OR; A major certification plus 7 years of recent specialized experience, OR; 11 years of recent specialized experience.
Minimum 3–5 years of experience in COMSEC or C5ISR systems maintenance and installation.
Proficiency in reading and applying Army Technical Manuals (TM), Technical Bulletins (TB), and wiring diagrams.
Familiarity with cryptographic key management systems (EKMS/KMI) and COMSEC handling procedures
Must be able to work in non-climate-controlled environments, outdoors in all weather conditions.
Must be able to grasp or handle objects, use finger dexterity, bend elbow/knee and reach above/below shoulders.
Must be able to lift and carry up to 40 pounds unassisted.
Must be able to team lift up to 50 pounds in a two-person carry.
Must be able to speak, read and write English fluently.
Must be free of medical restriction/ limitations that prevent the wearing and utilization of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Must be able to pass pre-employment and background checks related to the position.
Must be able to climb in and out of military vehicles and related equipment.
Must be able to work in cramped areas for at least two continuous hours.
Must be able to work in all types of weather conditions to include intense heat, heavy wind, blowing sand, heavy rain, and snow and sleet.
Employees shall utilize all proper lifting procedures and practices associated with all lifting and material handling tasks that are assigned and associated with this job description
Requires a valid passport with at least 12 months of validity and 6 blank pages.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Certified COMSEC Technician (CCT) or equivalent certification.
Certified C5ISR Technician (CC5ISR-Tech) or related credentials.
GCSS-Army certification and experience with DoD maintenance systems.
Advanced knowledge of IP networking, LAN/WAN troubleshooting, and secure communications protocols.
Experience with Type 1 cryptographic devices and associated loaders.
Experience and ability to work effectively with non-native English speakers strongly preferred.
Prior overseas professional experience.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include medical, dental, life insurance, AD&D, R&R, an Employee Support Program and more. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Candidates must meet visa and or work permit requirements for the country of assignment to be considered and eligible for employment.

title: LCV APS-2 Germany: Sr. Mechanic (Tracked Vehicle)
description:
Title:

LCV APS-2 Germany: Sr. Mechanic (Tracked Vehicle)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR leads the global government‑services contingency market by providing responsive, full‑service logistics support to forces deployed worldwide under the Army & Strategic Programs. Under APS‑2, KBR supports the Army Prepositioned Stocks program by delivering maintenance, readiness, and logistics solutions that enable the rapid deployment of combat‑ready equipment and materiel across Europe in support of U.S. Army missions. Our APS‑2 workforce is composed of skilled professionals from diverse backgrounds who work together to ensure all equipment is properly stored, maintained, and mission‑ready for issue whenever required.

Job Summary

As a Senior Mechanic (Tracked Vehicles), you will assist the perform various maintenance activities and work directly with the Master Mechanic. Perform technical inspections, determine repair parts required and perform mechanical maintenance action and repairs on various tactical and commercial vehicles and equipment. Trains, mentors, and enhances the performance of coworkers and other personnel.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Performs technical inspections, determines repair parts required and performs mechanical maintenance action and repairs on various tactical and commercial vehicles and equipment IAW appropriate procedures and publications utilizing TM and IETM.
Performs scheduled and unscheduled mechanical maintenance actions on various materials and handling equipment such as but not limited various types and sizes of forklifts (4k to 10k) 40-ton crane, RTCH 240/250, tactical and commercial heavy and light equipment transport trucks and trailers.
Performs diagnostic tests, using measuring devices, instruments, test equipment, special tools and lifting devices, to identify mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic, and cooling system failures IAW appropriate procedures and publications.
Operates, tests various types of equipment and attached systems IAW appropriate procedures and publications.
Repairs mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic, and cooling systems and components, on equipment IAW appropriate procedures and publications.
Removes, repairs, and replaces engine, drive train and body components of vehicles and equipment IAW appropriate procedures and publications.
Prepares, maintains, and completes logs, records, and all NTC Inspection packets, etc. equipment IAW appropriate procedures and publications.
Performs clean-up duties and polices the shop areas as assigned.
Must be able to read and comprehend equipment status reports and work order through the GCSS-Army system and Lead work assignments off such prints to designated team.
Ability to pull applicable maintenance reports utilizing the GCCS-Army system.
May conduct roll calls as necessary and in absence of supervision open and close shop and maintain work production as a Lead in compliance with company SOP, DOP and standard. Supports/ participates in the KBR Zero harm Culture, absolutes and guidelines, Company Continuous Improvement Process (CIP) and QA program.
Mentors and assists with the on-the-job training and cross-training.
Complies with all company rules, policies, and procedures.
Complies with all safety, environmental, and quality standards and applicable COPs and DOPs.
Provides for the accountability and proper care of all Team.
Favorably interacts with internal/external customers.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must have an Active U.S. Government issued Secret Security Clearance and maintain it for the duration of your employment on this contract. Due to this, you must be a U.S. Citizen to be eligible for this position.
Must understand and be able to use technical manuals and schematic diagrams
Field of expertise: Mechanical inspection, maintenance and repair of tactical/commercial vehicles and equipment
Must be able to speak, read, and write English fluently
Writes performance evaluation comments and reports when places in a control/assignment directive role
Five (5+) years of verifiable tracked vehicle repair and maintenance experience, and one (1) year verifiable leadership experience in inspection, repair, and maintenance on tactical wheeled vehicles, of a crew of 10 ten or more mechanics.
Must have five + (5+) years of verifiable experience in inspection, repair, and maintenance on combat/tactical wheeled vehicles and their sub-systems/MKT unit/various trailers/various generators and other equipment, Civilian semi-truck tractors and trailers and heavy-duty construction type equipment.
Extensive knowledge (ASE Certified and Certificates-Preferred) on power and drive train, brakes, electrical and fuel systems with five (5+) years verifiable maintenance experience (lubrication tasks not included)

Additional Requirements

Work under stressful circumstances and meets short suspense dates
Must be free of medical restriction/limitations that prevent the performance of required duties and/or prevent the wearing and utilization of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
Must be physically capable of performing the work in conditions of extreme temperatures, low humidity, rain, and blowing sand and dust
Employee shall utilize all proper lifting procedures and practices associated with all lifting and material handling tasks that are assigned and associated with this job description
Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds unassisted
Must be able to team lift-up to 100 pounds in a two-person carry
Use crowbars, brooms, mops, sledgehammers and related items
Must be able to stand, stoop, crawl and climb as necessary to perform job functions using proper techniques and PPE for extended periods to include confined spaces

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include medical, dental, life insurance, AD&D, R&R, an Employee Support Program and more. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Candidates must meet visa and or work permit requirements for the country of assignment to be considered and eligible for employment.

title: Engineering Technician
description:
Title:

Engineering Technician

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

KBR is seeking an Engineering Technician to support our RECO/DTRA contract for KBR’s Science and Space division.  Provide test support for environmental testing on CBRNE experiments at Kirtland AFB, WSMR, Dugway, and other US testing grounds.

Scope and Responsibilities: Under general supervision, performs non-routine assignments of substantial variety and complexity, using operational precedents. Such assignments, which are typically parts of broader assignments, are screened to eliminate unusual design problems. May also plan assignments. Receives technical advice from supervisor or engineer; work is reviewed for technical adequacy (or conformity with instructions). May be assisted by engineers and technicians and have frequent contact with professionals and others within the establishment.

Additional Responsibilities Include:  

Under supervision, conducts tests or experiments requiring selection and adaptation or modification of a wide variety of critical test equipment and test procedures; sets up and operates equipment; records data, measures and records problems of significant complexity that sometimes require resolution at a higher level; and analyzes data and prepares test reports.
Applies methods outlined by others to limited segments of research and development projects; constructs experimental or prototype models to meet engineering requirements; conducts tests or experiments and redesigns as necessary; and records and evaluates data and reports findings.
Extracts and compiles a variety of engineering data from field notes, manuals, lab reports, etc.; processes data, identifying errors or inconsistencies; selects methods of data presentation.

Skills and Abilities:  

Requires good computer skills
High degree of knowledge concerning electronics and electronic systems for data acquisition preferred
Soldering expertise and electronic construction
Electronic maintenance and calibration
Experience in high explosive test support preferred
Experience regarding Chemical, Biological, Nuclear, Radiological and Explosives (CBRNE) research, testing, and technology preferred
Knowledge in one or more areas including electronics, transducers, timing and firing systems, data acquisition systems, computer networking, wireless transmission systems, optical systems, or seismic instrumentation preferred
Good oral and written communication skills

Special Requirements (Licenses, Clearances or Certifications): Requires DoD SECRET Security Clearance

PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Education and Experience: AS degree in Engineering Technology, certificate in electronics, or related field preferred. At least 3 years of related experience in lieu of education.

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: Senior Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM)
description:
Title:

Senior Information Systems Security Manager (ISSM)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Position Summary:

The Information System Security Manager will provide system authorization support, risk management and business continuity expertise, threat detection and prevention methods, incident response and management methods, auditing, vulnerability management support, and system security documentation.

Key Responsibilities:

Coordinating, executing, and managing cybersecurity assessment & authorization (A&A) related activities supporting IT hardware, software, and connectivity capabilities in support of intelligence data management and analysis requirements resulting in an Authorization to Operate
Facilitate, perform, and manage actions necessary to maintain system and capability accreditation status consistent with DoDI 8510.01 (Risk Management Framework (RMF) for DoD Information Technology (IT)), including scanning, auditing, and authoring/coordinating security accreditation-related documentation
Perform analysis, design, and integration for complex software applications and collaboration infrastructures
Participate in the change management process, including reviewing Change Requests and assisting in the assessment of security impact of proposed changes
Create and maintain implementation design documentation, information system security documentation, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), and provide guidance on active Plans of Action and Milestones (POA&M)
Keep leadership aware of any roadblocks, issues, or concerns with system authorization status

Work Environment:

Location: Dayton, OH
Travel Requirements: ~10%
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

BS degree in information systems or related technical field
9+ years' technical experience in cybersecurity or information technology
CISSP certification
Understanding of common operating systems (Windows, Linux/Unix, Cisco IOS/NX-OS)
Knowledge of client, server, data storage, and networking technologies
Understanding of the requirements and standards for Cloud security
Familiarity with DevSecOps principles and Secure Software Development Lifecycle (SSDLC)
Innovative with strong analytical, problem-solving, organization and interpersonal skills
Self-motivated; able to work independently with minimal direction
An active TS/SCI clearance is required

Desired:

Advanced degree in a technical field
9+ years of IT/security-related experience with recent ISSM experience
Software Development in Java, Python, Ruby and/or C++ knowledge
Linux Expertise (RedHat/RHEL or CentOS preferred) knowledge
Prior experience with software scanning/static code analysis (e.g. Fortify, SonarQube)
Prior experience with cloud and container security tools

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: National Security Solutions (NSS) - Radar Graphical User Interface Developer Intern
description:
Title:

National Security Solutions (NSS) - Radar Graphical User Interface Developer Intern

Project Overview

KBR is recruiting full-time Radar Graphical User Interface Tester Intern for the spring 2026/summer 2026 semester. The intern will work through the software development lifecycle to help design and test a graphic user interface to control a radar system composed of an Arduino and ultrasonic sensors. This project will utilize agile test cycles, and the test intern will work side by side with the developer intern on identifying and documenting bugs, peer reviewing test cases, closing out New Feature tickets and deciding when a new build may be warranted. By the end of this project, interns will gain valuable experience working through the software development lifecycle to deliver a working radar system.

Key Responsibilities

Define system and user requirements.

Develop and Execute Test Cases.

Produce Test Reports.

Learning Outcomes & Impact

The Radar Graphical User Interface (GUI) Application project aims to provide an opportunity for an intern to demonstrate basic radar principles by developing a sonar radar application. The intern will work through the software development lifecycle to design and build a python graphic user interface to control a radar system composed of an Arduino and ultrasonic sensors. The intern will work with a team member to understand the desired functionality, performance criteria, and constraints in order to define system requirements. Based on the requirements, the intern will design and build a radar system using off the shelf components such as an Arduino and ultrasonic sensors. The radar system requires the intern to develop a GUI to serve as the primary interface for user to interact with the radar system, providing them real-time data visualization, control options and intuitive functionalities. The intern will work closely with testers to provide test procedures and user manuals to validate the functionality and performance of the radar system. Interns will be responsible for providing ongoing maintenance and support for the radar system, including bug fixes, updates, enhancements. By the end of this project, interns will gain valuable experience working through the software development lifecycle to deliver a radar system.

Minimum Qualifications

Rising junior, senior, or graduate student working toward an engineering degree

Emphasis on students with coursework in the areas of: Engineering and/or radar system design

Must work well in both a team environment and independently.

Must have excellent computer skills.

Must be a full-time student at an accredited U.S. college or university.

Must have demonstrated a high level of academic achievement.

Self-motivated; takes ownership of projects and issues and follows issues through to resolution.

Strong verbal and written communication skills with attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications

Programming experience (Python preferred)

title: Piping Stress Engineer
location:
locations
Leatherhead, Surrey, United Kingdom
IND, Chennai, 471 Anna Salai, Nandanam, Floor 10, Prestige Polygon, Tamil Nadu
description:
Title:

Piping Stress Engineer

KBR is a global provider of differentiated, professional services and technologies delivered across a wide government, defense and industrial base. Drawing from its rich 100-year history and culture of innovation and mission focus, KBR creates sustainable value by combining engineering, technical and scientific expertise with its full life cycle capabilities to help our clients meet their most pressing challenges today and into the future.

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 37,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries. KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

This role sits within KBRs Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) in the Integrated Solutions International business unit. Integrated Solutions is the engineering and project delivery group providing services which include front-end and detailed engineering, procurement, construction services, and program management primarily in the hydrocarbons and energy transition industries.

We are seeking a Senior Piping Stress Engineer with relevant experience in piping stress analysis within major EPC project environments. The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in conventional energy projects and a keen interest in expanding skills across energy transition sectors.

As a technical authority, you will provide expert judgment, ensure mechanical integrity of piping systems, and guide the development of critical project deliverables. The role involves working on complex piping systems, specialist analyses (including FEA), and leading stress engineering activities across multi‑disciplinary teams.

This position is based at our Chennai Engineering Office as an Expat supporting global EPC projects through multi‑centre execution. Candidates should be willing to work in an office‑based environment in Chennai. This role will be on a Project Hire basis. Work may involve short-term travel to project sites or global engineering offices.

Job Responsibilities:

Perform stress analysis using CAESAR II.
Quality check percentage of check stress calculation notes for the project, prior to the team issuing piping isometrics for construction and including in the Piping Stress Analysis Report
Provide SME support to the Piping Team in Chennai.
Execute FEA for complex components (ANSYS or equivalent).
Check the Critical Line List is being maintained, and criticality is as per project‑specific stress procedures.
Mentor a team of stress engineers.
Support vibration analysis and transportation analysis.
Coordinate with piping, mechanical, civil, and process teams.
Participate, when requested, in client meetings and technical reviews.
Develop, implement and maintain project work practices, procedures and job notes.
Designing piping systems for Flow Induced Vibration.
Committed to multi-centre project execution.
Isometric checking
Adhere to KBR WAY engineering standards and procedures as well as provide input to their development and enhancement.

Skills / Experience: 

Essential

Strong Knowledge of applicable industry standards (ASME B31.3, API, BS etc.)
Familiar with the TOTAL GS Specifications and Standards
Experience on large EPC and Brownfield projects.
Working knowledge of FEA Analysis
Experienced in developing and implementing project procedures.
Transportation Analysis of Piping Systems
Vibration mitigation of piping systems.
Forward thinking and happy to challenge the way we work and contribute the development of the KBR WAY.
Keen to share knowledge with Engineers located in the Chennai Office and other KBR offices.
Good communication skills. Qualifications:
Mechanical Engineering Degree
Chartered Engineer Status (desirable)
Unlimited Right To Work in the UK 

KBR Company Information

When you become part of the KBR team, your opportunities are endless. Through collaboration with our customers, we’re defining tomorrow’s challenges, then providing the solutions and services to overcome those challenges, always maintaining our commitment to total safety and reliability.

At KBR, we partner with government and industry clients to provide purposeful and comprehensive solutions with an emphasis on efficiency and safety. With a full portfolio of services, proprietary technologies and expertise, our employees are ready to handle projects and missions throughout their entire lifecycle, from planning and design to sustainability and maintenance. Whether at the bottom of the ocean or in outer space, our clients trust us to deliver the impossible on a daily basis.

Working at KBR means being rewarded for your contributions. In addition to competitive benefits and professional development, our people are empowered to use all their potential, creating meaningful change for themselves and our clients. We attract the best minds in the world because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services.
 

As the needs of the world change, we’re ready to respond and guide the way forward with strategic, sustainable, and technological advancements grounded in more than a century of practical application and execution.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
Title:

Marketing Specialist

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

KBR is seeking a Marketing Specialist to support our SPARC Program for KBR’s Science and Space division.  We provide solutions for NASA, federal-civilian agencies, the U.S. Department of Defense and commercial customers. Our services include astronaut training, health and human performance as well as a wide range of spacecraft and satellite development, operations and support services.   In this role, you will be part of a groundbreaking opportunity to support research and treatment studies for brain health for our military and Veteran community. Working with a top tier research and study team, the Marketing and Outreach program supports study goals by building community support and awareness for the program’s initiatives, especially within the military and Veteran community.   As the Marketing Specialist, your role will be to provide strategic and tactical guidance to create and implement a comprehensive marketing and outreach campaign within the overall program objectives and strategies.

The Marketing Specialist will be responsible for implementing community outreach and collaborating with the project team to develop local approaches and strategies to achieve the program’s objectives related to brain health education, awareness, and increasing awareness of this research study.  You will develop weekly, monthly and quarterly scheduling assignments and activities for your team as well as evaluating effectiveness and generating real-time insights into team performance.  Expect to be in the field with direct partner engagement at least 75% of your time and field work daily. You will be responsible for tracking the team’s performance goals to achieve outcomes associated with our brain donation initiatives. This includes exceptional ability to build community relationships, especially within the end of life and military and veteran local and regional partners. The Marketing Specialist will work with their supervisor, assigned teams, and senior leadership to provide outreach coordination across the team’s efforts and well as interface with teams outside of the region as appropriate.  This work involves a great deal of driving in the region conducting site visits at partner locations. 

Additional Responsibilities Include:  

Research, assess, develop, design, and coordinate and conduct outreach initiatives with other team members to achieve program objectives in the assigned region. 

Support all outreach initiatives by coordinating program scheduling, materials management, and event planning necessary to implement all outreach efforts.

Coordinate across regions with peers to build a cohesive and standard approach.

Plan and coordinate outreach events as well as participating in community events.

Implement promotional strategies with a strategic mindset.

Support the marketing initiative’s administrative tasks.

Support overall program objectives through directed activities to achieve its mission. 

Comfortable in a highly collaborative setting.

Comfortable presenting to and managing executive level relationships.

Outreach at event and conference tables and subsequent contact management follow-up.

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Education: Must have a bachelor’s degree in the field of Marketing, Communications, or a field related to our customer intimacy needs, and 3-5 years of engagement and outreach experience in a relevant field.  An additional 4 years of directly related experience will be accepted in lieu of degree.

Prior experience implementing and coordinating outreach initiatives in medical sales, end-of-life sales/marketing, law enforcement, civic leaders, military/veteran partners or similar roles.

Demonstrated experience in implementing and managing complex Customer Relationship Management systems, tools and processes.

Demonstrated experience utilizing marketing and outreach tools, i.e. print, presentation, audio, video.

Reliable transportation and current driver’s license due to daily use of personal vehicle.

PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

Prior experience working in end-of-life and/or military environments.

Ability to speak, read, and write in Spanish.

Thorough knowledge of relevant regional partners.

Basic Compensation: This range is for the Colorado Springs, CO area only

$66,000-$99,000

The offered rate will be based on contract affordability and the selected candidate's working location, knowledge, skills, abilities and / or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commission, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR BENEFITS

KBR offers a wide range of benefits for their employees; we offer medical, prescription, dental, vision, AD&D, disability benefits, retirement 401k, travel benefits, PTO, holidays, flexible work schedules, parental leave, military leave, education assistance, and the list goes on and on! We also support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Space Program Element Monitor / Space Capability Analyst - STARCOM
description:
Title:

Space Program Element Monitor / Space Capability Analyst - STARCOM

KBR is seeking a Space Program Element Monitor / Space Capability Analyst to provide on-site support to Headquarters Space Training and Readiness Command (HQ STARCOM) in Colorado Springs, CO.

A strong candidate has requirements experience, preferably with space mission areas. In this position, you will:

Key Responsibilities:

Support HQ STARCOM’s Requirements Management Corporate Process (RMCP) which is a predictable, scalable, and enduring requirements management framework to capture how the command defines, receives, develops, and manages requirements.
Validate requirements are traceable to higher-level justification and strategic guidance.
Translate validated requirements into prioritized material, non-material, and resourcing decisions that feeds STARCOM’s Program Objective Memorandum (POM), Operational Order (OPORD) and Unfunded Requirements (UFR) cycles.
Receive space mission requirements submittals and manage its data along with all RMCP data in multiple database systems.
Develop and maintain RMCP training program and materials and present training classes.
Support planning and managing of STARCOM requirements/acquisition programs to include tracking and management of technical and programmatic risk, requirements management, and day-to-day oversight and management of STARCOM program cost, schedule, and performance.
Brief senior leadership and decision makers through corporate processes.
Liaise with HQ STARCOM staff, other Field Commands and Headquarters organizations on STARCOM funding requirements.
Travel may be required for limited durations to support Customer events.

Qualifications:

Required:

An active TS/SCI clearance is required to be considered for this position, which is something only a U.S. citizen can obtain.
BA/BS degree (5+ years of relevant experience may substitute).
Headquarters experience in the US Space Force, US Air Force, Combatant Command, SpOC, STARCOM or equivalent.
Experience operating/supporting DoD weapon systems and missions.
Knowledge of Headquarters corporate processes and efforts.
Experience with defining, receiving, developing, and managing internal and external requirements.
Experience with validating requirements and ensuring traceability to higher-level justification and strategic guidance.
Experience with providing strategic advice, technical guidance, analysis and recommendations.
Ability to multi-task and produce high-quality products in a high-tempo, collaborative environment.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (i.e., Word, Excel).
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Accustomed to professionally working with internal and external senior leaders, offices, directorates, and action officers.
The ability to work in a secure, confined location (i.e., SCIF).

Desired:

Familiarity with fiscal resource and processes management tools (i.e., Automated Budget Interactive Data Environment System (ABIDES), Comprehensive Cost and Requirements System (CCaRS), Financial Management Suite (FM Suite) including FM Suite Funds Request and Certification (FRC) module, Commander’s Resource Integrated System (CRIS), Defense Enterprise Accounting and Management (DEAMS)).

Work Environment:

Location: Plaza of the Rockies
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 

40hrs

$115,000 - $130,000

This range is for Colorado only.

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

title: Sr. Specialist I, Cost Control
description:
Title:

Sr. Specialist I, Cost Control

Main purpose of the role:

Responsible for supporting the team accountable for delivering project cost control services with a range of activities including developing & monitoring appropriate budgets and cash flow ensuring that the base business costs forecasting remains highly accurate and that cost is being correctly charged to BP and in compliance with BP Published Guidelines and Common Process as it relates to cost controls.

The Cost Specialist provides detailed day-to-day cost control and support.

General Responsibilities

Act as a key liaison between contractors, contract owners, and procurement teams to ensure alignment and efficiency.
Provide critical SAP data, including contract details and purchase orders, to support informed decision-making.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial information to support contract evaluation and negotiations.
Proactively address contract-related queries by coordinating with key stakeholders, ensuring timely resolution.
Generate, analyze, manage, and distribute actuals and estimates reports to TL.
Provide Value of Work Done (VOWD) reports monthly and participate in monthly VOWD review meetings with BROs and SLs.
Monitor cost performance against realistic targets to ensure objectives and KPIs are met.
Support APM with SC, PO approval process by providing detailed insights and follow ups identified gaps.
Support with providing monthly update to APM about the overall cost performance of the area.
Review and verify contractor invoices (SES release) for accuracy and compliance with contractual agreements.
Collaborate with contractors to develop and maintain accurate cash flow forecasts and cost projections.
Track and update contractor and vendor PO values, providing detailed reports as required.
Support budget planning for BROs, including stakeholder engagement, activity set identification, and activity cost estimation.
Support QPF and GFO submissions in accordance with correct cost allocation.
Create additional reporting, such as budget comparison reports, cost-saving reports, and other analytical deliverables.
Track expenditures and commitments.
Conduct in-depth investigations and analyses to identify cost-intervention opportunities and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement cost-saving initiatives.
Facilitate preparation, approval, and tracking of Shopping Cards (SCs).
Maintain documentation of financial and statistical data used in cost analysis (e.g., PO details reports, Actuals reports, etc.).
Secure and organize accounting-related documentation such as financial statements, CTRs, and invoices.

title: Contact Centre Manager
description:
Title:

Contact Centre Manager

The role of the Helpdesk Manager (HM) is to manage all elements of the 24/7/365 Operational Helpdesk. title: ESP Downhole Reliability Engineer
description:
Title:

ESP Downhole Reliability Engineer

ESP Downhole Reliability  Engineer

EMNR30 - Sr. Technical Professional Maintenance & Reliability Engineer

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

The ESP Reliability Engineer is responsible for improving the reliability, performance, and integrity of all Electrical Submersible Pump (ESP) systems throughout their operating life. The main focus is to extend ESP run life, reduce unplanned failures, and support production goals by applying sound reliability engineering practices and data driven analysis.

As the number of ESP operated wells in the field continues to grow, the reliability function becomes increasingly critical to sustaining performance and managing operational complexity. The ESP Reliability Engineer ensures that every system performs to design expectations and that lessons from the field are systematically turned into improvements in design, operation, and maintenance.

The role involves working closely with operations, maintenance, subsurface, and vendors to understand equipment behaviour, identify reliability risks, and recommend practical solutions. Typical responsibilities include analysing ESP performance trends, leading Dismantle and Inspection (DIFA) and Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) activities, maintaining failure records, and tracking reliability KPIs to measure performance improvements over time.

Based on findings from field investigations and lessons learned, the ESP Reliability Engineer works with vendors and field teams to raise alerts and document any manufacturing, quality, or procedural issues, recommending design or process changes to prevent similar problems in the future. This helps close the feedback loop between field operations, engineering, and manufacturers, ensuring lessons are turned into lasting improvements.

Performance data from PI Vision and other monitoring tools is used to spot anomalies early and support evidence-based investigations during DIFA and reliability reviews. The ESP Reliability 

Engineer also works closely with the Data Scientist and Reliability Advisor in designing, maintaining, and continuously improving ESP reliability dashboards in Power BI, ensuring data is effectively transformed into actionable insights that drive better decisions and field performance.

The ESP Reliability Engineer in close coordination with the Reliability Advisor, ensures alignment on reliability priorities, shares technical findings, and jointly drives improvement actions to enhance ESP performance across the field. Both roles collaborate as partners within the reliability function, combining field insight and analytical expertise to achieve safer, more efficient, and more reliable operations.

Responsibilities
Reliability & Technical Assurance
Lead and coordinate ESP failure investigations, including Dismantle and Inspection (DIFA) and Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA).
Analyze operating parameters, well histories, and performance trends to identify emerging reliability issues.
Maintain and update the ESP failure database, ensuring data integrity, traceability, and proper documentation of all incidents.
Review and validate contractor failure reports and warranty cases, ensuring corrective actions are effectively implemented.
Provide technical recommendations to enhance ESP system design, installation practices, and operational standards.
Develop and maintain reliability dashboards and reports to track KPIs such as MTBF, run life, recurring failure modes, and reliability trends.
Analyze ESP failure data and historical performance to identify patterns, risks, and opportunities for reliability improvement.
Conduct preliminary assessments of reported anomalies or incidents and recommend further investigation or corrective actions.
Support RCFA and DIFA investigations by verifying technical findings and ensuring appropriate follow-up actions.
Review reliability metrics and maintenance reports to provide actionable recommendations to improve ESP life and reduce failures.
Advise on reliability risks associated with planned changes or maintenance activities, ensuring alignment with design limits and safety standards.
Document findings, lessons learned, and recommendations in formal reliability reports and databases.

Operational Support
Provide technical expertise on ESP systems to identify, analyze, and resolve performance deviations or anomalies highlighted through DIFA findings.
Support site teams in assessing and managing reliability risks to minimize potential production impacts.
Review operational data and DIFA insights to recommend improvements in ESP performance, efficiency, and longevity.
Collaborate with Operations and Maintenance teams to ensure ESP systems operate within safe and design parameters.
Lead investigations into recurring equipment failures identified through DIFA or operational performance trends and recommend preventive actions.
Contribute to reliability-centered maintenance strategies and continuous improvement efforts based on failure analysis findings.

Reliability & Technical Assurance
Lead and coordinate ESP failure investigations, including Dismantle and Inspection (DIFA) and Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA).
Analyze operating parameters, well histories, and performance trends to identify emerging reliability issues.
Maintain and update the ESP failure database, ensuring data integrity, traceability, and proper documentation of all incidents.
Review and validate contractor failure reports and warranty cases, ensuring corrective actions are effectively implemented.
Provide technical recommendations to enhance ESP system design, installation practices, and operational standards.
Develop and maintain reliability dashboards and reports to track KPIs such as MTBF, run life, recurring failure modes, and reliability trends.
Analyze ESP failure data and historical performance to identify patterns, risks, and opportunities for reliability improvement.
Conduct preliminary assessments of reported anomalies or incidents and recommend further investigation or corrective actions.
Support RCFA and DIFA investigations by verifying technical findings and ensuring appropriate follow-up actions.
Review reliability metrics and maintenance reports to provide actionable recommendations to improve ESP life and reduce failures.
Advise on reliability risks associated with planned changes or maintenance activities, ensuring alignment with design limits and safety standards.
Document findings, lessons learned, and recommendations in formal reliability reports and databases.

Operational Support
Provide technical expertise on ESP systems to identify, analyze, and resolve performance deviations or anomalies highlighted through DIFA findings.
Support site teams in assessing and managing reliability risks to minimize potential production impacts.
Review operational data and DIFA insights to recommend improvements in ESP performance, efficiency, and longevity.
Collaborate with Operations and Maintenance teams to ensure ESP systems operate within safe and design parameters.
Lead investigations into recurring equipment failures identified through DIFA or operational performance trends, and recommend preventive actions.
Contribute to reliability-centered maintenance strategies and continuous improvement efforts based on failure analysis findings.

Process Safety & Risk Management
Support the identification and evaluation of reliability-related risks in ESP systems for ORA and other safety frameworks.
Analyze mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic ESP failure modes and assess their potential impact on process safety.
Review ESP design changes or modifications to ensure both reliability and process safety implications are addressed.
Recommend monitoring, control, and mitigation measures to prevent reliability failures from escalating into safety incidents.
Integrate lessons learned from ESP failures into process safety management programs to enhance risk reduction.
Maintain documentation of reliability assessments, risk analyses, and failure investigation outcomes for compliance and future reference.

Continuous Improvement
Lead or support Continuous Improvement (CI) initiatives focused on increasing ESP availability, reducing failure rates, and lowering lifecycle costs.
Analyze recurring failure trends and recommend design, operational, or process modifications to eliminate root causes.
Document and share lessons learned, reliability alerts, and best practices across internal teams and contractors.
Evaluate and support adoption of new technologies, predictive maintenance tools, and data analytics to strengthen ESP reliability monitoring.

Collaboration & Coaching (Reliability Focus)
Collaborate with vendors, engineering, operations, and maintenance teams to align reliability strategies with system design and performance objectives.
Act as a central point for sharing reliability insights, failure analyses, and technical recommendations across stakeholders.
Facilitate cross-functional discussions to prioritize reliability improvements and ensure consistent implementation of best practices.

Experience And Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Petroleum Engineering (or equivalent experience).
5 years of experience in ESP operations, reliability or engineering support including minimum 3 years dedicated to DIFA.
Proven experience in ESP DIFA/RCFA and understanding of ESP design, operation, and failure mechanisms.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with a data driven approach.
Proficiency in reliability tools and methods such as 5 Whys, Fishbone, FMEA, Pareto etc.
Proficiency in English (reading, writing, and speaking).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to interface across departments and with contractors.
Competent user of various analytical and productivity tools, such as Power BI, Maximo, PI Vision, and Microsoft Office tools.
Demonstrated ability to work independently in a rotational field environment and deliver measurable reliability improvements.

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

title: AFCAP V Japan BOS: SCS Maintenance - Electrical/HVAC Technician
description:
Title:

AFCAP V Japan BOS: SCS Maintenance - Electrical/HVAC Technician

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

In support of the U.S. Air Force, KBR provides security, base operations, maintenance, and repair at Kyogamisaki and Shariki Communications Sites in Japan​. Our team is focused on providing continued mission-critical support in the INDOPACOM area of responsibility. In addition to base life support and facility and equipment maintenance and operations, KBR provides food services and other quality of life support. Our team was able to meet an accelerated transition timeline and ensure these mission essential sites ran without disruption throughout the contract transition.

Job Summary

Responsible for inspecting, maintenance, repairing and preventive maintenance on sites Power Quality, Ground Support Equipment, Fire and Safety Hazards, Lighting Standards, Comprehensive Electrical System Surveys, Electrical System Inspections.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Maintains, inspects, and repairs the site’s electrical system automatic transfer switches for all sites, and monitors electrical connections on site generators.
Maintains and repairs low voltage (600 volts and below) real property electrical systems to the code that it was installed.
Maintains and repairs the electrical systems (600 volts and below) on feeder circuits from the main lugs (secondary bushings) on the load side of pad mounted transformers for underground systems, and the standard utility connection point of an overhead riser or meter loop, transformers, streetlights, grounding equipment, electrical manholes, and other systems on-site.
Install, repair, replace, modify, test, and maintain fire alarm systems, the disaster warning system, and intrusion alarm systems to maintain proper operational capability IAW UFC 3-601-02, NFPA, and the original equipment manufacturer's instructions.
Performs installation, operation, maintenance, repairs, and disposal of heating, ventilation, air conditioning and refrigeration (HVAC/R) systems.
Must have mandatory knowledge on the principles of HVAC/R systems, controls, and components.
Must be highly proficient in the troubleshooting, repair, preventive maintenance and rewiring of the site’s fleet of heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment, in particular the 5-Ton Environmental Control Unit (ECU) built by Alaska Structures Incorporated.
Should have the ability to interpret drawings and schematics.
Must know and be able to apply the fundamentals of HVAC/R equipment and troubleshooting techniques, and environmental regulations for fuels, refrigerants, and hazardous materials. May explain instructions and documentation to plan work activities.
Completes and reviews records, maintains tools and equipment, and performs various cleanup activities. Job may require moderate to heavy lifting.
Observes and follows all safety rules and procedures, including wearing required personal safety equipment.

Additional general duties:

Acts as Alternate Maximo and Alternate Hazardous Material (HAZMAT) and Hazardous Waste (HAZWASTE) key person.
Performs general preventative maintenance tasks on assigned heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) units, power generation equipment, permanent and temporary structures including doors, windows, sinks and toilets.
Performs corrosion control measures on site structures such as entry control points, force protection points, fences, gates, and signs.
Maintains and operates the assigned material handling equipment (MHE) such as the Bobcat multipurpose handler and associated attachments, 2.5K and 10K forklifts and manlift.
Maintains and operates the assigned grass cutting equipment such as riding and push type lawnmowers, Bobcat lawnmower attachment and weed trimmers.
Maintains and operates the assigned snow removal equipment such as the tracked and wheeled snowblowers and the Bobcat snowplow and snowblower attachments.
Participates in the bimonthly Morale Welfare and Recreational (MWR) schedule.
Operates and drives the company vehicles to perform twice weekly (Tuesdays and Thursdays) mail pick-up and delivery runs to Misawa AB, Japan Air Post Office (APO).
Concurrently, completes shopping requirements at the Misawa AB commissary and exchange for the site-operated kiosk.

Basic Qualifications 

At least 5 years of experience.
Requires a high school diploma or equivalent 
Must possess active secret security clearance
Possess an EPA Section 608 Universal Refrigerant Handling Certification or be able to obtain the certification within 30 days of arrival at the job site. 
Prefer an electrical technician certification required by contract and laws (to include DoD and U.S. Army directives and regulations.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Lead Process Engineer - LNG
description:
Title:

Lead Process Engineer - LNG

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is seeking a Lead Process Engineer - LNG for its Houston office. Under broad direction, this role provides technical and people leadership for a team of engineers, including responsibility for performance management, coaching, and professional development. The position oversees and directs a significant segment of a large, complex engineering program—or an entire program of moderate scope—encompassing planning, budgeting, organization, and execution. The role carries accountability for measurable assets, including assigned staff and budget, and requires extensive experience typically gained through an undergraduate engineering degree and a minimum of ten (10) years of relevant experience, with most incumbents possessing 15 or more years of industry experience.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Execute process engineering work for large‑ and medium‑sized projects, or defined scopes within major projects, in accordance with applicable industry codes, standards, and best practices.
Lead and perform key process engineering activities, including licensor evaluation and selection; process modeling and simulation; development of heat, material, and utility balances; preparation of process flow diagrams (PFDs, process safeguarding flow diagrams (PSFD), Safe Chart, piping and instrumentation diagrams (P&ID), development of the project Basis of Design; definition of system design parameters; and design and/or rating of process equipment such as vessels, columns, heat exchangers, pumps, and related systems.
Conduct and support a wide range of process studies, including process optimization, flare and relief systems, blowdown and depressurization, vent system design, cooling and heating media studies, utility system sizing, condensate handling, produced solids management (including sand handling), and produced water treatment evaluations.
Participate in process safety activities, including HAZOP, HAZID, and other process safety assessments.
Provide technical guidance and expertise on complex engineering issues requiring independent analysis, sound judgment, and professional decision‑making.

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering.
Minimum of eight to ten (8–10) years of relevant process engineering experience.
Demonstrated experience executing and leading FEED (Front End Engineering Design) projects; LNG project experience is strongly preferred.
Demonstrated design engineering experience gained within a major EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction) organization rather than an operating or production facility.
Proficiency in industry‑standard process engineering and simulation tools, including Aspen HYSYS, Aspen Plus, and PipeSim.
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams and multiple stakeholders.

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability 

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: Sr. Manager Subcontracts
description:
Title:

Sr. Manager Subcontracts

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

Program Summary

KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, intelligence community, NASA, and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity.

Job Summary

KBR is seeking a highly motivated Sr. Manager, Subcontracts to oversee and perform a full range of subcontract administration/management activities associated with Managing a Subcontracts Team. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing subcontracting work on a project and ensuring the seamless integration of subcontract work within the broader program including cost, schedule, technical, and quality management.

Under broad direction, the Sr. Manager will be accountable for the performance and results of multiple related disciplines or sub-groups within the function, managing the delivery of functional objectives by providing leadership and direction to managers or professional staff. Additionally, the role involves participating in the development of functional strategy and may include responsibility for global processes and procedures.

Roles and Responsibilities

Drive all aspects of major subcontract execution including cost, schedule, technical, and quality performance, ensuring full integration of subcontract work within the program (e.g., proposals, negotiations, contract execution).
Manage the seamless integration of Subcontracts, Engineering, Quality, Finance, and Planning teams.
Serve as the primary point of contact between the subcontractor and project management team, remaining accountable to Supply Chain leadership.
Oversee the entire procurement cycle, coordinating between KBR’s technical team and suppliers across various functional teams.
Address critical, time-sensitive, and complex issues including proposal evaluations, contract documentation, and modifications for contract changes.
Lead key supplier negotiations regarding cost, terms & conditions, and long-term agreements.
Develop supplier sourcing strategies and metrics (scorecards) for subcontracted services
Measure, manage, and improve supplier performance, initiating corrective actions when necessary.
Research market trends to maintain a world-class procurement environment.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis as requested by upper management and corporate supply chain leadership.
Effectively manage and mentor the Subcontracts Team, ensuring they meet team objectives while being developed to their maximum potential. This includes conducting performance appraisals and identifying training and development needs.
Implement initiatives to improve efficiency and sustain KPIs.

Basic Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree required; or relevant job experience
Experience: 20+ years of experience subcontract management, with at least 8 - 10 years in a management role.
Minimum of 10 - 12 years of subcontracts management experience, negotiating Master Service Agreements and complex Subcontract Agreements.
Proven experience in establishing scope of work and writing technical or non-technical documentation including Specifications, Statements of Work, Contracts/Subcontracts, and Supplier Deliverables.
Experience supporting all subcontract types (IDIQ, Cost Reimbursable, Fixed Price, etc.), negotiations, terms and conditions, incentive arrangements, and order placement.
US Government Contract Experience is highly desirable
Strong working knowledge of FAR (Federal Acquisition Regulation) and DFAR (Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement).
Significant experience working with and/or leading audits with DCMA including CPSR Audits, is highly preferred.
Strong background with Cost Analysis and Price Analysis is a plus.
Significant experience negotiating Subcontract Agreements valued in the $25-$50M range.
Experience managing and leading 25+ supply chain personnel is favorable.
Proven experience managing Subcontract Administrators and Subcontract Managers.
Excellent English communication skills, both written, verbal, and presentation to effectively communicate business cases to all levels of peers, suppliers, and management.
Ability to communicate effectively at all organizational levels, including with international teams and suppliers.
Strong project management, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
Attention to detail and the ability to solve complex problems with excellent organizational skills.
Background Check Required.
MUST be U.S. Citizen

Preferred Qualifications

Government Contractor / Government Solutions experience highly desirable.
Experience managing international customer/supplier relationships.
Proficiency in developing and tracking internal metrics.
Desire to work in a collaborative environment and effectively lead a diverse team.
In-depth understanding of global procurement processes and supply chain management.
Strong leadership and mentoring skills, with the ability to guide a team to achieve objectives and maximize their potential.
Ability to drive initiatives to improve efficiency and sustain KPIs.
Ability to analyze and drive improvements in the procurement process.

*** MUST be U.S. Citizen ***

Significant experience working with and/or leading audits with DCMA including CPSR Audits, is highly preferred.
Strong background with Cost Analysis and Price Analysis is a plus.
Significant experience negotiating Subcontract Agreements valued in the $25-$50M range.

title: Donor Specialist (SAT)
description:
Title:

Donor Specialist (SAT)

Belong. Connect. Grow. With KBR

KBR is seeking a Donor Specialist to support our SPARC Program for KBR’s Science and Space division. The SPARC program (Service Personnel Advancing Research on CTE) seeks to: 1) Provide education to service members, veterans, and their families on brain donation; 2) Register individuals for participation in the Brain Donation Awareness Registry; and 3) Recover whole specimens, process, and prepare for shipping using appropriate methods. The goal of this program is to support research that is ongoing at the Uniformed Services University’s Brain Tissue Repository related to military brain injury and chronic traumatic encephalopathy. This is an onsite position, rotating between various partner locations each day.

The Donor Specialist will be on-call on a rotating and regular basis and must be available to work nights, weekends, and holidays with previously scheduled on-call shifts.


The preponderance of duties and work time of the Peer Family Educator will be focused on:

Approaching and educating medically competent military members and veterans about the potential to become a brain donor at time of their death, and about the opportunity for them to participate in the Brain Donation Awareness Registry.

Lead and implement all aspects of community partner engagement, stakeholder coordination, and direct interactions with service members and veterans for assigned commands.

Establish and support regional community partnership and outreach events initiatives to strengthen engagement efforts.

Approaching and educating families of potential donors about brain donation at the time of death of their military or veteran family member.

Serving as the primary point of contact to be notified about potential donors and answering questions from families, healthcare workers, funeral home workers, or individuals who would like to know more about the donation program.

Screening donors, registering study participants, and coordinating with local coroners, medical examiners, tissue transport providers, to facilitate brain donation for research.

Collaborating with Peer/Family Educators on recruitment activities.

Performing this work under general supervision where discretion is required, such as in the homes of military members, veterans, and their family members; in the rooms of patients in healthcare facilities; and in funeral homes.
 

On an as needed basis, ancillary duties in tissue recovery will also be performed.  Such tissue recovery duties will generally be performed in mortuaries, funeral homes, medical examiner’s facilities, and healthcare facilities. The Peer Family Educator may perform such duties in a solo role with no direct onsite supervision.  Examples of duties will typically include:

Verifying donor identity

Reviewing next of kin consent and chain of custody documentation

Assisting local dieners, coroners, and pathologists with donated specimens

Completion of documents and records for each donation

Sectioning and processing the tissue according to the protocols of the project

Preparing the specimens for shipping

Coordinating the transport of the body following tissue recovery.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Protecting the rights and welfare of all human research participants involved in research in accordance with federal regulations and sponsoring agency policies and procedures

Adhering to and supporting all Federal regulations and DoD policies and procedures instituted to safeguard protected health information (PHI)

Assuring that all key personnel involved in human research have completed the required education for the protection of human research participants

Developing materials and tools necessary to appropriately train individuals involved in the conduct of the study around issues related to (but not limited to) protocol requirements, schedule of visits, execution of research plan

Attending investigator meetings as required or requested

Preparing other study materials as requested, including but not limited to, informed consent document, case report forms (CRFs), enrollment logs, and study data

Assuring that the study complies with all terms and conditions

Coordinating participant tests and procedures, including interviewing families about the medical history of the tissue donor

Maintaining adequate inventory of study supplies

Maintaining effective and ongoing communication with sponsor, research participants and supervisor during the course of the study

Preparing and submitting any modifications to the scientific protocol

Day-to-day activities of the study including problem solving, communication and protocol management

Promptly reports any unanticipated problems

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

To qualify, candidates must have:

 A bachelor’s degree plus at least 2 years of experience in human subject research, tissue donation, professional clinical laboratory work, nursing, paramedic/military medic, or related similar experience, or 

An associate’s degree in a related field plus at least four years of job-related substantive experience in human subject research, tissue donation, professional clinical laboratory work, nursing, paramedic/military medic, or similar related experience.

In lieu of a degree, 10 years of related experience may be considered.

PREFERRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

 Prior experience working in military environments and interacting with service member personnel and their families.

 Ability to speak, read, and write in Spanish.

 Experience in the field of tissue or organ donation.

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

This is a contingent position based upon contract award

Responsibilities

Develop acquisition and presentation products concerning SG SPO that includes but not limited to:

Major Systems Acquisitions (MSA), Intelligence Program and Budget System (IPBS),

Congressional Budget Justification Book (CBJB), status meetings

Weekly Activity Reports (WAR), Director’s Action Group (DAG) taskings, Program Management Reviews (PMR), Quarterly PMRs, and other priorities as defined.

10 years’ experience in program 

3 years’ experience in acquisition with background knowledge of IC requirements and budget 

2 years’ experience in cloud-based software systems
