title: Project Manager, EPC Projects
description:
Title:

Project Manager, EPC Projects


KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for a Project Manager, to support/manage large and complex EPC projects having a TIC value, typically, of up to $500 million. These projects will be across Offshore, LNG, Petro-Chem/Refining, and energy sustainability focuses. Alternatively, may have responsibility for management of two or more smaller projects.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Assures safe project execution to the client's satisfaction, consistent with cost, schedule and contractual requirements while maintaining bottom line responsibility for financial success.
Delivers expected results for financial, HSE, client satisfaction, budget and schedule performance.
Serves as prime point of contact between the client and company.
Assures the project execution is in accordance with policies, procedures, systems, and requirements approved by the company.
Manages and coordinates activities of all project personnel by direct supervision, through subordinates or through joint ventures, alliances, etc. In the proposal phase, works closely with Sales to evaluate and interpret requirements. May serve as a proposal manager.
Defines precise scope of work and identify changes between the original proposal and final contractual agreement.
Negotiates changes with the client.
Plans the project execution and revises the plan as necessary and assures adherence to the plan.
Keeps the client and company advised of project status.
Leads the project management team and is responsible for the successful completion of the project.
Abides by KBR business ethics.

Education, Experience, & Skills:

Minimum of 12 years of experience in related projects with an average of 15+ years which includes several years of Senior Project Management level experience.
Skills typically required through the completion of an undergraduate degree in Engineering and possession of a P.E

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

title: Senior Operations Research Analyst
description:
Title:

Senior Operations Research Analyst

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a Senior Operations Research Analyst (ORSA) to join our team at Schriever SFB in Colorado Springs, CO. Active TS/SCI clearance required.

Successful candidates should have a strong understanding of the development and implementation of mathematical and statistical models to solve various problems across multiple domains.  Experience and familiarity with the space domain is preferred.

Responsibilities:

Technical leadership responsibility with oversight of projects which use: applied mathematics, operations research, data analytics, modeling and simulation, and decision analysis
Determining the level of analytic rigor required for analysis based on the complexity of the mission area being assessed and the uncertainties of the supporting data
Understanding customer requirements, adjusting analytical efforts to meet those requirements, and effectively communicating results
Ability to coordinate with senior managers and decision makers to identify and solve a variety of problems and to clarify management objectives
Work as part of a contractor team working alongside a broader team of government and contract staff

 Required Skills and Experience:

Bachelor of Science degree in operations research, systems engineering, or related technical field
10+ years of experience
Design of experiments experience
Ability to lead a team of highly skilled analysts on projects with notable risk and complexity.
Develops and implements new processes/procedures as needed. Provides direction/guidance as required.
Strong quantitative and analytic abilities to integrate and analyze data
Technical skill in operations research, modeling and simulation, computer science, big-data analytics, or similar disciplines
Ability to effectively communicate complex concepts to audiences of varying backgrounds
Willingness to learn new technical and management domains
The ability to work in a secure, confined location (i.e., SCIF)
High motivation, creativity, and flexibility to work in a dynamic environment
TS/SCI clearance required

 Preferred Skills and Experience:

A Masters or Ph.D. in operations research or a theoretical science field
Experience in DoD space and joint force programs
Programming experience with Python, MATLAB, R, SQL, VBA
Experience developing and implementing mathematical and statistical models
Experience with Excel VBA

Work Environment:

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Minimal less than 10% if necessary
Working Hours: Standard

Compensation:

$160-180k

Other Compensation:

title: Software Engineer Intern
description:
Title:

Software Engineer Intern

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

Software Engineer Intern

*** Three years of continuous residency in the U.S. for issuance of a Government Security credential ***

Location: Sioux Falls, SD (EROS Center) — on-site

Duration: May through August (approx. 10–12 weeks)

Team: Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC)

Role Summary

Join the LP DAAC team at the EROS Center to build and improve software that supports Earth science data services. You’ll contribute to real products used by researchers worldwide, learn modern engineering practices, and collaborate with a friendly, mission-driven team.

What you’ll do
Develop, test, and document small features and fixes in service components (e.g., data workflows, APIs, and utilities).
Write clean, maintainable code (primarily Python) with unit tests and code reviews.
Help with data/metadata quality checks and automation; use AI tools (Claude) to accelerate archive reconciliation tasks under guidance.
Contribute to build/deploy pipelines and basic CI tasks, following team standards.
Participate in agile ceremonies and sprint work (backlog grooming, stand-ups, demos).
Minimum qualifications
Currently pursuing a BS/BA in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field; rising junior/senior or graduate student preferred.
Coursework/projects in programming (Python).
Familiarity with Git and collaborative development.
Clear communication, willingness to learn, and attention to detail.
Nice to have
Exposure to cloud services (AWS), containers, or Linux.
Experience with data pipelines, geospatial data, or REST APIs.
Basic understanding of testing frameworks (pytest) and CI/CD.
Special Requirements
Three years of continuous residency in the U.S. for issuance of a Government Security credential
Ability to obtain and maintain a national agency check and background investigation for facility access

title: Program Manager
description:
Title:

Program Manager

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Must have the ability and willingness to periodically travel to Ukraine and work for short durations (up to 2 month periods).

Program Summary

KBR is supporting a contract to provide End-Use Monitoring (EUM) in Ukraine. The primary objective of this contract is to ensure the monitoring of assets subject to EUM requirements that have been transferred by U.S. Department of State’s Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement (INL) Section in Kyiv (INL Kyiv) to the Government of Ukraine (GoU).

Job Summary

The Program Manager is responsible for overall program leadership and execution, ensuring contract requirements are met while maintaining strong performance, compliance, and customer satisfaction. This role will provide strategic direction, oversee operational delivery, manage program resources, and serve as the primary customer interface for all program activities. The Program Manager will lead a team of contractor personnel who are technically proficient in conducting monitoring and evaluation activities, and will ensure program outputs are delivered on schedule, within scope, and to the highest quality standards. This role requires an agile leader with strong communication skills, excellent attention to detail, and the ability to operate effectively in a dynamic, high-visibility environment.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Lead day-to-day program execution, ensuring all program requirements, deliverables, and performance standards are achieved.
Serve as the primary point of contact for the customer and lead external meetings, briefings, and program management status updates.
Plan and oversee in-person, secondary, and virtual monitoring inspections to ensure compliance with EUM requirements.
Ensure monitoring activities align to contractual standards, documented procedures, and reporting expectations.
Oversee and manage a team of contractor personnel, ensuring appropriate training, performance accountability, and operational readiness.
Track program milestones, timelines, risks, and issues; implement mitigation plans to ensure continuity of operations.
Maintain program documentation, procedures, and reporting processes to ensure audit readiness and compliance.
Develop, review, and submit high-quality customer-ready reporting products, including metrics, summaries, and performance narratives.
Support program financial performance, including milestone tracking, billing coordination, and cost awareness.
Promote a culture of professionalism, reliability, responsiveness, and continuous improvement across the program team.
The PM or alternate shall possess full authority to act on behalf of the Contractor regarding all matters related to the daily operation of this contract.

Basic Qualifications 

Must have authorization to work in Ukraine.
Fluent in English (verbal, written, reading)
Bachelor’s degree in Program Management, International Relations, Security Studies, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 5+ years of experience leading programs, operations, or contract execution in complex environments.
Demonstrated experience leading customer-facing engagements and managing program performance across multiple priorities.
Strong leadership capability with proven ability to manage teams, workflows, and operational execution.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to engage professionally across diverse stakeholder groups.
Excellent attention to detail and reliability in monitoring, documentation, and reporting.
Ability to operate with discretion and professionalism in high-visibility environments.
Comfort managing ambiguity while maintaining structure, compliance, and accountability.
Gov Con experience
Must have the ability and willingness to periodically travel to Ukraine and work for short durations (up to 2 month periods).

Preferred Qualifications

Prior experience supporting DoS funded programs, security sector support, or monitoring-related contracts.
Fluent in Ukrainian (speak, read, and write)
Experience working with Ukrainian government entities such as the Ministry of the Interior (police, border guards) or the Ministry of Defense.
Familiarity with monitoring frameworks, compliance requirements, or inspection-based program delivery.
Strong proficiency in reporting, Excel-based tracking, and program performance documentation.
Familiarity with occupational safety and quality assurance, ability to promote safety and quality culture.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Design Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist/ Deputy Program Manager
description:
Title:

Design Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist/ Deputy Program Manager

Must be willing to travel to Ukraine.

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR is supporting a contract to provide End-Use Monitoring (EUM) in Ukraine. The primary objective of this contract is to ensure the monitoring of assets subject to EUM requirements that have been transferred by U.S. Department of State’s Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement (INL) Section in Kyiv (INL Kyiv) to the Government of Ukraine (GoU).

Job Summary

The Design, Monitoring and Evaluation (DME) Specialist / Deputy Program Manager (DPM) will work closely with the Program Manager to support day-to-day program operations and assist with the development and execution of the program’s sustainment goals, strategic objectives, and financial goals, ensuring all program components meet or exceed customer expectations. In this dual-hatted role, the individual will design and implement program surveys—including sampling, tool development, digital data collection, and field supervision—to generate high-quality evidence on program performance and outcomes. The role leads data cleaning, validation, and analysis, ensuring data integrity and readiness for decision-making and external reporting. The Deputy Program Manager will also step in for the Program Manager when necessary and serve as a liaison between key stakeholders, ensuring efficient program delivery and risk management in support of critical EUM requirements in Ukraine.  This role will oversee and manage a team of contractor personnel who are technically proficient in conducting monitoring and evaluation activities, and requires candidates who demonstrate flexibility, strong interpersonal and communication skills, cultural awareness, excellent attention to detail, and reliability.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Support the Program Manager in day-to-day execution of program operations, ensuring sustainment goals, strategic objectives, financial goals, and customer expectations are met or exceeded.
Serve as acting Program Manager when required and act as a liaison between key stakeholders to ensure efficient delivery and proactive risk management.
Plan and support execution of End-Use Monitoring (EUM) activities, including in-person, secondary, and virtual monitoring inspections in Ukraine.
Design and implement monitoring tools and program surveys, including sampling plans, tool development, and digital data collection methods.
Lead field supervision efforts to generate high-quality evidence on program performance and outcomes.
Oversee data cleaning, validation, and analysis to ensure structure, accuracy, integrity, and readiness for internal decision-making and external reporting.
Prepare clear, funder-ready analytical reports and professional data visualizations that translate complex findings into actionable insights and demonstrate results against agreed indicators and targets.
Oversee and manage a team of contractor personnel technically proficient in monitoring and evaluation activities, and possess the requisite property management and related experience necessary for EUM.
Maintain accurate documentation and reporting processes, including Excel-based tracking, inventory support (as applicable), and compliance-ready program records.

Basic Qualifications 

Must be a Ukrainian national and authorized to work in Ukraine.Ability to communicate complex ideas the US Government and senior personnel.
Demonstrated managerial experience leading personnel. Fluent in Ukrainian (speak, read, and write) with strong English communication skills (written and verbal).
Demonstrated experience in monitoring and evaluation activities as it relates to program management.
Proven experience in completing inventories, receiving goods, using Excel, and creating reports.
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage competing priorities in a dynamic environment.
Ability to lead Ukrainian local national teams and coordinate across technical, operational, and customer stakeholders.
Must be able to travel without restriction throughout Ukraine.

Preferred Qualifications

Strong preference for candidates with Ukraine–U.S. dual citizenship.
Prior professional experience with the Ministry of the Interior, including the National Police of Ukraine, the State Border Guard Service, and the National Guard of Ukraine is strongly preferred.
Experience supporting DoS/DoD-related programs, international programs, or field-based monitoring contracts.
Familiarity with digital data collection tools and field-based inspection/monitoring methodologies.
Experience using/analyzing dashboards, visualizations, and performance reporting packages for leadership and customers.
Familiarity with occupational safety and quality assurance, ability to promote safety and quality culture.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Special Operations Strength and Conditioning Specialist (27 SOW, Cannon AFB, NM)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Strength and Conditioning Specialist (27 SOW, Cannon AFB, NM)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

We are seeking a stellar Strength and Conditioning Specialist that will establish and administer effective strength and conditioning protocols designed to maximize the physical performance of SOF personnel, with the priority on SOF Operators and Direct Combat Support personnel.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

Design, administer, evaluate, and document the effects of physical training protocols under the supervision of the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator. 
Coordinate training programs with the HP staff to ensure a safe and expeditious return to training of SOF personnel recovering from injury. 
Design and implement physical training programs for personnel who are TDY/TAD or deployed under the supervision of the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator. 
Demonstrate and provide instruction and guidance on physical training, exercises, movements, and injury avoidance. 
Refer all personnel with an apparent new or undiagnosed medical condition to a medical provider for evaluation and treatment. 
Assist the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in developing facility standard operating procedures, guidelines, and training protocols including the safe use of strength and conditioning equipment. 
Participate in periodic meetings to review and evaluate physical training programs and identify opportunities for improvement. If a meeting occurs outside of regular working hours, the SCS is responsible for reviewing the information disseminated in meetings. 
Participate in periodic in-service training for members of the HP staff and/or POTFF staff as appropriate. 
Attend required training in accordance with guiding instructions. Commands will allow attendance at the necessary conferences or courses to complete the continuing education units required to maintain professional certifications. 
Perform administrative duties such as maintaining records of utilization, workload, conducting or participating in education programs, and participating in clinical staff quality assurance functions. 
Develop and promulgate training materials as requested and required by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator. 
Assist with supply inventories and provide input regarding supply needs for the HP program. 
Literately utilize computers, software, and technologies as required and requested by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff.

Education/Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in an accredited exercise science, health science, or physical education-related discipline.
Possess and maintain current certification by the National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA) as a Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) or the Strength & Conditioning Coach Certified (SCCC) through the Collegiate Strength & Conditioning Coaches association (CSCCa). Maintenance of one of these certifications shall be an enduring element of the requirement.
Minimum of 5 years or more of demonstrable accumulated experience (continuous and sustained experience preferred) of developing long and short-range planning and coordination of sport/mission specific performance programs resulting in attributable results with individual athletes and groups of athletes at the levels of NCAA Division I, Olympic, professional, and/or SOF Operators in the accompanying, respective settings.
Position requires U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status.
Must have a DoD Secret Clearance or the ability to obtain one.

 
Required Skills/Training:

Fluent oral and written communication skills in English. 
Current certification in basic Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) to include Automated External Defibrillator (AED) training.
Physical proficiency to demonstrate all prescribed exercises / techniques and to hike over rough terrain and function in austere environments. 
Must be able to lift and manipulate loads and weights up to 25 kilograms.

 
Desired Education, Experience, Skills or Training: 

Prior military and/or SOF experience. 
Master's degree in an accredited exercise science, health science, or physical education-related discipline.

Standard Company Requirements: 

Responsible for completing all required training.
Perform other assignments and duties, as required.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: LCV APS-2 Germany: Logistics Manager
description:
Title:

LCV APS-2 Germany: Logistics Manager

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR leads the global government‑services contingency market by providing responsive, full‑service logistics support to forces deployed worldwide under the Army & Strategic Programs. Under APS‑2, KBR supports the Army Prepositioned Stocks program by delivering maintenance, readiness, and logistics solutions that enable the rapid deployment of combat‑ready equipment and materiel across Europe in support of U.S. Army missions. Our APS‑2 workforce is composed of skilled professionals from diverse backgrounds who work together to ensure all equipment is properly stored, maintained, and mission‑ready for issue whenever required.

Job Summary

As a Logistics Manager, you will be responsible for planning, organizing, and leading the day-to-day activities within one or more MTOE, TDA, SSA departments or other functional supply areas. This role involves executing daily operations, training requirements, monitoring employee performance, and contributing to the accomplishment of short and long-term goals within all logistics areas.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Ensure all logistics activities—including the movement of cargo, equipment, and materials—are performed according to contract requirements.
Develop, implement, and manage logistics plans, including shipping, receiving, transportation, and warehousing.
Lead teams in a fast-paced environment
Ensure all operations meet U.S. government regulations, contractual deliverables (CDRLs), and safety (HSE) standards.
Interface with customer representatives, subcontractors, and vendors to manage, track, and report on logistics status.
Ability to operate in harsh conditions and adapt to changing priorities quickly.
Supervise employees during the performance of all logistics operations.
Ensure compliance with safety policies, government regulations, and military doctrine related to logistics Operations.
Oversee the processing of items through the GCSS-A system, resolve discrepancies, and maintain databases and files in accordance with established guidelines.
Advise the team on status, issues, impacts, risks, and cost influences, while keeping the team informed of updates to safety rules and procedures.
Provide leadership to create organizational structures and processes for service execution.
Plan, organize, and lead day-to-day activities within assigned departmental or functional areas.
Implement training requirements and monitor employee performance.
Establish production standards, monitor compliance, and recommend operational improvements.
Assist the Accountable Officer in achieving short and long-term goals for the department/function.
Maintain employee compliance with safety policies, government regulations, and military doctrine.
Ensure proper processing of items through the GCSS-A system.
Perform causative research to resolve various receipt and issue discrepancies.
Perform causative research to resolve discrepancies related to receipts and issues.
Possess or obtain hazard certifications: HAZ 12 & HAZ 15.
Possess or obtain technical transportation of hazardous material and European Hazardous material certification.
Verify hazardous materials shipped out have a signed hazardous certification document.
Provide expert guidance on logistics matters, including compliance with regulations, transportation methods, and inventory management.
Provide a strong level of customer service and promote teamwork.
Adhere to Army regulations, SOPs, and military Doctrine related to all logistics operations.
Adhere to safety procedures and policies.
Analyze data and key performance indicators to identify areas for improvement in logistics operations.
Maintain databases and files following established guidelines.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must have an Active U.S. Government issued Secret Security Clearance and maintain it for the duration of your employment on this contract. Due to this, you must be a U.S. Citizen to be eligible for this position.
Must have a bachelor’s degree plus 3 years of recent specialized experience, or; An associate’s degree plus 7 years of recent specialized experience, or; A major certification plus 7 years of recent specialized experience, or; 11 years of recent specialized experience.
This position is designated as a TESA (Technical Expert Status Accreditation) role. Candidates must meet all TESA eligibility requirements as defined by the U.S. Army and applicable SOFA regulations. Final approval is subject to government review and issuance of TESA status. Employment is contingent upon successfully obtaining and maintaining TESA accreditation for the duration of the assignment.
Must have at least 3 years of experience in a lead/supervisor/management role.
Must be proficient in the use of the GCSS-A system
Requires proficiency in utilizing office equipment, the MS Office Suite (especially Excel) for reporting daily workload data.
Requires the ability to multitask and work with little or no supervision.
Must have the ability to lift 50 pounds and perform physical tasks such as walking, bending, reaching, and carrying.
Must have a valid Driver’s License.
Requires a valid passport with at least 12 months of validity and 6 blank pages.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Previous logistics supervisory or management experience.
Certification in logistics or supply chain management.
Experience working in diverse and challenging environments.
Familiarity with international trade compliance and regulations.
Advanced proficiency in logistics and supply chain management software.
Ability to lead and mentor junior logistics professionals.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include medical, dental, life insurance, AD&D, R&R, an Employee Support Program and more. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Candidates must meet visa and or work permit requirements for the country of assignment to be considered and eligible for employment.

title: National Security Solutions (NSS) Software Engineering Internship
description:
Title:

National Security Solutions (NSS) Software Engineering Internship

Who We Are 

KBR Government Solutions delivers full life cycle professional and technical solutions that improve operational readiness and drive innovation. Our solutions help ensure mission success on land, air, sea, space and cyberspace for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA and other federal agencies. KBR’s areas of expertise include engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity. KBR strives to create a safer, more secure and sustainable world by bringing together the best and brightest to deliver technologies and solutions that help our customers accomplish their most critical missions and objectives. 

The Mission Ahead 

This role is with KBR’s Government Solutions U.S. division. At KBR Government Solutions, we don't just envision a world that's safer, more secure, and sustainable - we create it. Our legacy of delivering advanced full life cycle professional and technical solutions is matched only by our commitment to operational readiness and innovation. As stewards of critical missions for the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, NASA, and other key federal entities, we excel in engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT, and cybersecurity. United in our quest for excellence, KBR stands at the vanguard, ready to transform possibilities into impactful realities for a better tomorrow. 

Why Join KBR? 

Mentorship from experienced subject matter experts 

Cutting edge projects, relevant to real world challenges 

Work in a collaborative and dynamic team environment 

Networking opportunities with other technologists and executives 

Competitive pay and great company culture 

 

As a National Security Solutions Intern, you will: 

Provide administrative or secretarial support to a department and/or Manager. Typical duties include general clerical, receptionist and project based work. Responsibilities may be unique to a specific function or department such as Procurement or Engineering, but are mainly administrative in nature. Under direct supervision, performs assignments designed to develop professional or technical work knowledge and abilities requiring application of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria in carrying out a sequence of related tasks. This is an entry level job for professional work.

Provides technical support in engineering, science, IT or related field working in such areas as research, design, development, testing, or manufacturing process improvement. Performs simple routine tasks under close supervision or from detailed procedures. Work is checked in progress or on completion. Technical adequacy of routine work is reviewed on completion; non-routine work may be reviewed in progress. Working towards graduate degree. 

Ability to interpret complex information in a non-technical and engaging manner. 

Identify problematic areas in data and conduct the necessary research to provide a lasting solution. 

 

Selected interns for this paid opportunity will be provided with the opportunity to mentor with experienced professionals, gain experience and establish a name for themselves in this high demand career field.  

 

Anticipated Skill Set: 

Bachelor's Degree (in the works) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or any other scientific/engineering/technical degree with appropriate experience.

Experience with Python, JavaScript/jQuery, HTML, CSS, Django, Bootstrap, and Data tables is preferable. 

 

Scheduled Weekly Hours:    

Average 40 hours per week. 

 

Basic Compensation: 

$19.00 - 31.00 per hour (This range is for the Colorado area only). 

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity. 

 

Requirements: 

Must be a US Citizen 

Must pass a Security Pre-Screen and have the ability to obtain a security clearance.

title: Process Engineering, LNG
description:
Title:

Process Engineering, LNG

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is seeking a Process Engineer – LNG for its Houston office. Under general supervision, the successful candidate will independently apply advanced process engineering principles and techniques, exercise sound judgment in resolving complex engineering challenges, and make informed decisions regarding engineering methods and solutions. This role includes representing KBR in technical discussions, conferences, and meetings to address critical technical questions and to engage with key engineers and officials from client, partner, and regulatory organizations.

Functional job responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Serve as a Process Engineer supporting grassroots and revamp engineering projects for LNG production facilities, including utilities, liquefaction, and pre-treatment units.
Execute process engineering work for large- and medium-sized projects, or discrete areas within major projects, in compliance with applicable industry codes, standards, and best practices.
Develop and deliver core process engineering outputs, including process simulations and modeling; heat, material, and utility balances; process flow diagrams (PFDs); piping and instrumentation diagrams (P&IDs); hydraulic calculations; flare and relief analyses; and process design parameters.
Perform equipment design and/or rating for process equipment such as vessels, columns, heat exchangers, pumps, and related systems.
Conduct process studies, including process optimization, flare and relief systems, blowdown and depressurizing systems, vent systems, cooling and heating media studies, utility system sizing, and produced water treatment evaluations.
Participate in and support process safety activities, including HAZOP, HAZID, and other process safety assessments.
Provide technical leadership and guidance on complex process engineering issues, applying independent analysis and professional judgment.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering (Mechanical Engineering considered with relevant process engineering experience).
Minimum of seven (7) years of progressively responsible experience in process engineering, preferably within a major EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction) organization rather than an operating/production facility.
Demonstrated experience executing FEED (Front End Engineering Design) projects; prior LNG project experience is strongly preferred.
Proficiency in industry-standard process engineering software, including Aspen HYSYS, Aspen Plus, and PipeSim, for process simulation, analysis, and design.
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across multidisciplinary engineering teams and with project stakeholders.

Decarbonization – Energy Transition – Sustainability

title: Program Manager
description:
Title:

Program Manager

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is looking for a motivated individual to be the Program Manager (PM) for a contract focused on providing cost analysis and Integrated Program Management (IPM) support for Major Systems Acquisitions.

Key Responsibilities:

Overall Program Management: The PM will be responsible for the guidance, direction, and supervision of the team and be the primary interface between a series of customers and the cost analysis / IPM team.
Cost Estimation Experience: The candidate must have extensive cost estimation and/or IPM experience and be able to leverage that experience to lead and mentor the team.
Communication: The ideal candidate will have excellent communication and interpersonal skills and be able to use them to work collaboratively to resolve issues.

Work Environment:

Location: On-Site
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Security Clearance: Active TS/SCI with a polygraph
Education: Master’s Degree (or BS with three additional years of relevant experience in cost) in Engineering, Physics, Operations Research, Cost Analysis, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration.
Experience: Candidate must have 12 or more years’ experience in Cost Estimating and analysis or Integrated Performance Management (IPM).This includes performing Cost Estimating Analysis Support, improvement to cost estimating methods, applying IPM functions (spanning policy, regulation, guidance, benchmarking best practice, research), Earned Value Management (EVM) systems, performing  Integrated Baseline Reviews, schedule analysis, etc.
Space System Experience: The successful candidate must also have over 5 years’ experience specific to the domain of Space Systems Specific Cost Estimating or Space Systems Specific IPM.
Program Management Experience: The candidate must have greater than eight years of Program Management experience, including in the personnel, execution and financial management of government contracts.
Communication Skills: The individual must have excellent written and oral communication skills as well as interpersonal skills.

Desired Qualifications:

Contract Management Experience: The ideal candidate would have greater than ten years of program management experience, focused in government programs with at least five of those years spent managing government contracts (~50 FTE in size).
Multi-Team Management: The ideal candidate would have experience managing a workforce split into multiple teams operating independently at multiple work locations.

Ready to Make a Difference?

RF Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

In this role, you will apply a multi-disciplinary approach to validate RF system performance, support integration, and drive innovation in communication subsystems.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: Work on cutting-edge RF systems and waveform technologies.
Collaborative Environment: Partner with experts across engineering and acquisition teams.
Impactful Work: Ensure mission success through robust RF system design and analysis.
Key Responsibilities:
Validate technical performance of RF systems; support test and evaluation activities.
Analyze RF capabilities for various operations; design and validate RF link performance, quality, and reliability.
Perform RF interference analysis and provide recommendations.
Deliver systems engineering support for acquisition and development of advanced communication subsystems.
Conduct end-to-end trade-off analysis of RF systems.
Aid in validation of new waveform specifications.
Develop and present technical reports; perform modeling and simulation of RF propagation.

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Minimal
Working Hours: Standard
Qualifications:
Required:

Education: BA/BS and 12+ years of experience; or Master’s and 10+ years (additional 4 years may substitute for degree)
Experience developing RF link budgets, performing RF interference analysis, and validating RF system performance
Knowledge of communications systems theory
Knowledge of NTM systems and capabilities
Expertise in communications waveform design concepts, including:
Low Probability of Intercept (LPI)/Low Probability of Detection (LPD)
Forward error correction
Modulation
Interference mitigation

Advanced degree in a related technical field
Familiarity with emerging RF technologies and industry standards

title: Space Systems Engineer
description:
Title:

Space Systems Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

KBR is seeking a high energy Space Systems Engineer with the ability to coordinate with stakeholders as well as individual contributors to manage requirements, assess risk(s) and deliver reporting and results to an office dealing with satellite systems development and acquisition.

Key Responsibilities:

Support customer(s) in CONOP development,

Support initialization and on-orbit calibration and validation activities,

Support ground site integration and test activities,

Advise and mentor customer personnel regarding Segment architecture, specifications and verification and validation.

Support the documentation and maintenance of the collection system requirements baseline in automated tools such as DOORS.

Lead Segment verification activities; assess adequacy of developer verification data and provide recommendations to the GPOC for approval or disapproval with clear commentary demonstrating the logic for the recommendations.

Attend Segment level design reviews and program management reviews to assess design maturity, requirements compliance and to provide informed technical recommendations to the customer.

Review verification evidence and test reports to support space vehicle level requirement verification and Pre-Ship Review (PSR) events.

Review acquisition milestone design documentation for adequacy, accuracy and completeness, and identify cost, schedule and technical risks/opportunities, and provide mitigation strategies through formal and informal comments.

Support technical and programmatic reviews and meetings, as required.

Identify and assess segment-level impacts of new capabilities, including across specification, internal and external interfaces, and facilitate integration into the current program baseline.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: Up to 25%

Working Hours: Core hour support required

Qualifications:

Required:

Active TS/SCI with polygraph clearance

Bachelor’s degree in STEM (science, technical, engineering, math) or related discipline.

5+ years of relevant experience.

Understanding of DOD/IC satellite systems and architectures.

Excellent interpersonal, leadership, team building, and problem-solving skills with a demonstrated ability to be independent and effective in a government/contractor team environment.

Experience in DOD/IC acquisition and program management processes.

Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Available to travel domestically.

Desired:

Advanced degree in STEM (science, technical, engineering, math) or related discipline with emphasis on MBSE.

Prior Program Office experience.

Previous experience developing technical specifications for space systems.

title: GIS Analyst
description:
Title:

GIS Analyst

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides advanced engineering and technology solutions to support critical national security missions. We are seeking a GIS Analyst to deliver comprehensive technical and analytical geospatial support in a dynamic, high-pressure environment with evolving priorities and short deadlines.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: Work on advanced geospatial solutions for mission-critical operations.

Collaborative Environment: Partner with experts to streamline workflows and enhance connectivity.

Impactful Work: Transform complex data into actionable insights for decision-makers.

Key Responsibilities:

Collect, integrate, analyze, and visualize large volumes of all-source geospatial information.

Create advanced mapping, imagery, and visualization products for tactical and strategic audiences.

Combine geospatial and temporal data for all-source analysis and research.

Design, develop, populate, and maintain all-source geospatial databases.

Develop custom scripts and tools to automate data extraction, ingestion, and integration.

Collaborate to design and implement near real-time GIS situational awareness displays.

Provide quality assurance and control for all ingested data.

Improve information management, streamline workflows, and enhance user connectivity.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site

Travel Requirements: Minimal

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

In-depth knowledge of GIS concepts, GIS software, cartography, and production.

Ability to work effectively in fast-paced, high-pressure situations.

Strong visualization skills to transform customer requirements into audience-specific products.

Excellent planning, organization, prioritization, and communication skills.

Advanced knowledge of ESRI ArcGIS 10.x, ArcSDE, Spatial Analyst, Military Analyst, Google Earth, Remote View, VII, and Photoshop.

Journeyman knowledge of VBA, Visual Basic, ArcObjects, and/or Python programming languages.

Familiarity with geodatabases, GIS web services, and various vector/raster data formats.

Desired:

Experience automating workflows and integrating disparate data streams.

Familiarity with emerging GIS technologies and visualization tools.

title: Special Operations Physical Therapist (19th SFG(A) Camp Williams Draper, UT)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Physical Therapist (19th SFG(A) Camp Williams Draper, UT)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION. 

 

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

 

We are seeking a stellar Special Operations Physical Therapist who will provide evaluation, treatment, and rehabilitation of musculoskeletal conditions. They are licensed independent practitioners and credentialed as direct care providers in specific military HP settings. At KBR we maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts – Could this be you? 

 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 

Evaluate and treat patients with or without referrals.  

Refer patients to other POTFF staff members as needed.  

Provide and perform the following services in support of POTFF’s HP program for SOF personnel, with the priority on SOF Operators and Direct Combat Support personnel: Provide neuro-musculoskeletal injury care, utilizing approved supplemental clinical privileges including the ordering of images, laboratory tests, pharmaceuticals, dry needling, acupuncture, joint injections and aspirations, and referrals to specialty providers. 

If directed by HP Program Manager and/or Coordinator, directly supervise the PT Tech, PT Assistant, and/or Certified Athletic Trainer (ATC) within their scope of practice.  

Participate in periodic meetings with HP and POTFF for reasons such as, but not limited to, reviewing care provided to patients. Identify opportunities for improvement.  

Serve as an advisor to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in matters related to Sports Medicine (SM), injury prevention, rehabilitation, and relevant human performance research. 

Serve as an advisor to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator for administrative matters, purchasing of supplies and equipment, and supplemental fiscal requests.  

Conduct equipment, product, and literature reviews to ensure the HP program stays current with the provision of care.  

Provide input for the development and utilization of required databases.  

Conduct peer (record) reviews for the HP Staff as directed by governing credentialing body and local medical oversight process. 

Assists the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in developing and updating criteria-based job descriptions and performance standards.  

Assist the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator in developing and maintaining clinical practice guidelines to ensure consistency of care across all HP Training Centers (HPTCs) and associated facilities.  

Assist with the preparation of short and long-term fiscal plans; submits input to the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator.  

Attend and participate in meetings with other POTFF staff members and medical providers as requested and/or required.  

Ensure safe and effective operation of equipment used for patient care and contribute to a safe working environment. 

Participate in periodic in-service training for members of the HP staff or POTFF staff as appropriate. 

Attend required training in accordance with guiding instructions. Commands will allow for attendance at necessary conferences and/or courses to complete continuing education units required to maintain certification. 

Maintain 100% compliance with local mandatory command training requirements. 

Document care in the Military’s Electronic Health Record ) i.e., AHLTA, GENESIS, etc.) and/or the HP Enterprise-wide database (e.g., Smartbase, etc.) as required per DODI 6040.45, USSOCOM HQ and POTFF Staff, and as directed by local HP program manager and/or coordinator. 

Document work performed, utilization, encounters, referrals, and all other information in the Military’s Electronic Health Record (i.e., AHLTA, MHS GENESIS, etc.) and/or the HP Enterprise-wide database (e.g., Smartbase, etc.), as directed by HP program manager and/or coordinator and/or required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Perform other tasks, within the scope of the PT position description, as assigned by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and/or required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Collect and report all data as requested by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

Proficiently utilize computers, software, and technologies as required and requested by the HP program Manager and/or Coordinator and required by USSOCOM HQ and its POTFF staff. 

 

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training:  

This position requires U.S. Citizenship. 

This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top Secret Clearance, or the ability to obtain a clearance. 

Master’s degree in Physical Therapy. 

Certification through the American Board of Physical Therapy Specialties (ABPTS) as either an OCS or SCS, or certification through the National Athletic Trainers Association (NATA) as a certified athletic trainer (ATC).  

Maintain credentialing requirements in good standing at the local MTF.  

Capable of meeting physical demands of training with SOF including the ability to hike over rough terrain, function in austere environments, and observe SOF training evolutions.  

May be required to assist with strength and conditioning testing and training protocols and lift and manipulate loads or weights up to 25 kilograms. 

Minimum of five (5) years or more of demonstrable, accumulated experience (continuous and sustained experience preferred) of performing manual therapy in the sports medicine field with individual athletes and groups of athletes (experience at the levels of NCAA Division I, Olympic, professional, and/or SOF Operators preferred) in the accompanying, respective settings.  

Fluent oral and written communication skills in English. 

Must maintain current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) by the American Heart Association; must provide front and back proof of all training/certs/documentation. 

 

 

Desired Education, Experience, Skills or Training:  

Doctoral degree in Physical Therapy.  

Prior military and/or SOF experience.  

Additional credentials such as a Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist (CSCS) through the National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA).  

 

Standard Company Requirements:  

Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures.  

Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures.  

Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance.  

Responsible for completing all required training.  

Perform other assignments and duties, as required.  

  

  

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. 

 

KBR Benefits  

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.

Are you energized by meeting new people, building relationships, and making a real impact in your community? We’re looking for a Community Engagement Specialist who thrives in the field, loves meaningful conversations, and knows how to turn partnerships into action.

In this role, you’ll be the key connector between our organization and community partners like medical examiners, coroners, funeral homes, and more. You’ll lead outreach efforts, host educational events, and keep relationships strong—all while driving awareness and support for a life-changing mission.

What You’ll Do:

Build and manage relationships with community stakeholders.

Deliver compelling messages that inspire action.

Represent us each day in your local communities at events, conferences, and in everyday conversations.

Lead educational initiatives and professional development sessions.

Track your impact through smart reporting and CRM tools.

Why You’ll Love It:

Every day is different.

You’ll meet amazing people.

You’ll help drive a mission that matters.

You’ll work independently but stay connected to a passionate team.

Qualifications:

Required:

Bachelor’s degree in a related field (or related experience to substitute experience for education on a 1-1 basis)

2–4 years of experience post bachelor’s degree in field outreach, sales, or relationship management.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Personal vehicle, a valid driver’s license, and love for being out in the field.

Bonus if you’ve worked in organ/tissue donation, end-of-life services, or a criminal justice field!

title: Heavy Truck Driver
description:
Title:

Heavy Truck Driver

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

As a Truck Driver – Distribution supporting ground operations, you will be responsible for safely operating various wheeled vehicles and equipment across diverse terrains to support logistics and training missions. You will transport materials, personnel, and equipment between facilities, conduct vehicle inspections and minor repairs, and ensure cargo is secured against damage or theft. This role requires knowledge of military vehicle operations, including handling hazardous materials, convoy participation, and vehicle recovery procedures. Flexibility, attention to safety, and readiness to work in challenging environments are essential. If you're excited to make your mark in a dynamic environment, apply now and let's create something remarkable together!

Roles and Responsibilities 

Operate wheeled vehicles and equipment over varied terrain and roadways
Transport materials, equipment, and personnel between warehouses, training areas, and other facilities
Secure cargo against weather, pilferage, and damage
Load and unload vehicles with or without assistance; tie down cargo to prevent shifting
Perform minor mechanical repairs and maintain vehicles in good working order
Operate Material Handling Equipment (MHE) as required
Use radios for communication and perform vehicle self-recovery and towing operations
Report vehicle deficiencies and support mechanics as needed
Organize and participate in convoys
Dispatch vehicles and verify logbooks
Receive and fulfill motor support requests from authorized personnel
Compile time, mileage, and load data for reporting
Operate specialized vehicles such as HEMTT, HET, and PLS
Maintain certifications for CDL, Ammo Awareness, and Hazardous Materials Transport
Work flexible shifts, travel as needed
Operate in extreme weather conditions
Safely navigate maintenance environments
Perform physical tasks such as sitting, standing, squatting, and walking for extended periods

***Candidate must have the ability to work flexible shifts and travel on Fort Hood and Training Sites**

Basic Qualifications 

High School Diploma
Minimum of 3 years of experience operating military or commercial wheeled vehicles
Possess a valid Commercial Driver’s License (CDL) with appropriate classification
Completion of Ammo Awareness and Hazardous Materials Transport Certification
Ability to operate Material Handling Equipment (MHE)
Familiarity with vehicle self-recovery and field expedient towing procedures

Preferred Qualifications

Physically capable of sitting, standing, squatting, walking, and talking for extended periods
Able to work in extreme weather conditions and noisy environments
Prior military experience in transportation or logistics (e.g., MOS 88M or equivalent)
Experience operating specialized vehicles such as HEMTT, HET, and PLS
Knowledge of Army motor pool operations, dispatch procedures, and logbook verification
Strong understanding of safety protocols and convoy operations

title: Slide Developer
description:
Title:

Slide Developer

If you naturally visualize story lines and prefer to organize complex information into a dynamic format, KBR Mission Technology Solutions (MTS) is seeking Visual Solution Designers to join a team dedicated to pursuing assisted acquisitions and strategic contracts. The work combines a need for clear strategic thinking, project management skills, and a passion for compelling and persuasive graphics-oriented communication. Though the position is remote, you will be an integral part of a collaborative pursuit team focused on winning new work. 

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

The position supports the development of strategic and FEDSIM proposals as an oral presentation architect and content contributor. We are looking for an integral team player who works collaboratively with others, but who can also work independently, coordinate projects, develop and learn new skills, and maintain communication with various stakeholders across the enterprise

The primary responsibilities encompass project management and content development activities, sales material development and finalization, knowledge management, and research and analysis. You will:

Support pursuit management team from opportunity identification through award

Collaborate with Capture and Solution Architect team members to fully understand client desires and requirements

Support development of solutions targeted to deliver against client desires and requirements

Translate solution concepts into compelling graphics and slides

Develop proposal content for technical, management, and scenario responses

Collaborate with authors of other proposal sections to maintain message alignment across all proposal sections and volumes

Apply FEDSIM-specific oral proposal methodologies and scoring strategies to maximize evaluation outcomes

Collaborate in real-time with graphic artists and SMEs to develop visually impactful slides that clearly convey technical solutions and win themes.

Research and capture best practices from previous submissions, debriefs, and answers to follow-up questions

Perform all other duties as assigned  

Work Environment:

Location: Remote

Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%

Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications and Skills Requirements:

Bachelor's degree plus 7 years of related experience

Experience developing oral proposals for FEDSIM and other large (>$200M) opportunities 

Strong project management skills including team facilitation and management of resources and schedules.

Excellent communication/presentation skills including persuasive writing skills.

Superior organization and follow-through skills.

Strong interpersonal skills and analytical ability.

Excellent business acumen. A

Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to changing priorities and assignments.

Ability to lead and work together as a team, either in a support role or as a project leader.

Ability to translate objectives into a schedule and series of activities to meet requirements.

Must be willing to learn new skills.

Strong work ethic with the willingness to work overtime on short notice. 

National Average:

$109,000 - $163,500

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s working location, knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience, clearance level, contract affordability and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Senior Manager, Sales - Nuclear
description:
Title:

Senior Manager, Sales - Nuclear

KBR is a global provider of differentiated, professional services and technologies delivered across a wide government, defense and industrial base. Drawing from its rich 100-year history and culture of innovation and mission focus, KBR creates sustainable value by combining engineering, technical and scientific expertise with its full life cycle capabilities to help our clients meet their most pressing challenges today and into the future.

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 37,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries. KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

KBR is seeking a Senior Manager, Sales to lead business development and sales activities within the civil nuclear sector, based out of Leatherhead. This role will focus on driving growth across the UK and international civil nuclear markets, with particular emphasis on early-phase project opportunities including feasibility studies, concept development, pre-FEED, FEED, and owner’s engineering services, as well as technology- and advisory-led engagements.

The role is centred on client relationship development, opportunity origination, and front-end positioning, working closely with KBR’s global nuclear, engineering, technology, and project delivery teams.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and execute sales and business development strategies for civil nuclear markets, aligned with KBR’s global growth and nuclear strategy.
Identify, originate, qualify, and mature civil nuclear opportunities, encompassing new build, existing fleet support, decommissioning, waste management, fuel cycle, and nuclear infrastructure programs.
Lead front-end engagement for early-phase nuclear projects, including feasibility studies, concept development, pre-FEED/FEED, owner’s engineering, and advisory services.
Build and sustain strong, senior-level relationships with nuclear operators, government bodies, regulators, developers, supply chain partners, EPCs, and strategic alliance partners.
Act as a commercial ambassador for KBR’s civil nuclear capabilities, enhancing client engagement, market visibility, and thought leadership within the sector.
Collaborate closely with KBR’s global nuclear technology, engineering, licensing, delivery, and account teams to shape differentiated, value-driven solutions.
Lead opportunity qualification, capture planning, bid shaping, and sales strategy development for priority pursuits.
Support commercial alignment and contract negotiations, working in coordination with legal, commercial, and risk teams.
Provide market intelligence on nuclear investment programmes, policy and regulatory developments, supply chain trends, and competitive dynamics.
Mentor and support junior business development resources and contribute to continuous improvement of sales processes within the nuclear business.

Key Requirements

Proven experience in sales, business development, or commercial leadership within the civil nuclear, energy, infrastructure, or highly regulated industrial sectors.
Strong understanding of early-phase project development and the conversion of front-end studies into downstream engineering, procurement, construction, and programme delivery.
Demonstrated experience working with public and private sector clients, complex stakeholders, and long-cycle capital projects.
Strong commercial acumen with the ability to translate client challenges into compelling, value-based solutions.
Excellent communication, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills at executive and programme levels.
Experience operating effectively within a global, matrix organisation with diverse technical and cultural interfaces.

Experience & Background

A relevant number of years’ experience, with flexibility for exceptionally strong candidates.
Background may include sales leadership, business development, project development, commercial management, or senior technical-commercial roles within nuclear or adjacent sectors.
An engineering or technical degree is advantageous but not mandatory; commercial, business, or blended technical-commercial backgrounds are equally acceptable.
Experience with nuclear technology-led solutions, programmatic delivery, or advisory services is highly desirable.

KBR Company Information

When you become part of the KBR team, your opportunities are endless. Through collaboration with our customers, we’re defining tomorrow’s challenges, then providing the solutions and services to overcome those challenges, always maintaining our commitment to total safety and reliability.

At KBR, we partner with government and industry clients to provide purposeful and comprehensive solutions with an emphasis on efficiency and safety. With a full portfolio of services, proprietary technologies and expertise, our employees are ready to handle projects and missions throughout their entire lifecycle, from planning and design to sustainability and maintenance. Whether at the bottom of the ocean or in outer space, our clients trust us to deliver the impossible on a daily basis.

Working at KBR means being rewarded for your contributions. In addition to competitive benefits and professional development, our people are empowered to use all their potential, creating meaningful change for themselves and our clients. We attract the best minds in the world because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services.
 

As the needs of the world change, we’re ready to respond and guide the way forward with strategic, sustainable, and technological advancements grounded in more than a century of practical application and execution.

#LI-EF1

title: Reliability & CBM Head
description:
Title:

Reliability & CBM Head

Reliability & CBM Head 

EMNR30 - Sr. Technical Professional - Maintenance & Reliability Engineering 

KBR Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) provides holistic and value-added solutions across the entire asset life cycle. These include world-class licensed process technologies, differentiated advisory services, deep technical domain expertise, energy transition solutions, high-end design capabilities, and smart solutions to optimize planned and operating assets.

KBR is looking for Reliability & CBM Head- who Provide Technical Leadership to increase equipment reliability and consequently plant availability while optimizing Maintenance Costs and lead the implementation of all Predictive maintenance strategies.

Location : Rabigh


Responsibilities:

Oversee 'Root Cause Failure Analysis' of equipment and provide guidance to ensure that recommendations are actionable and will resolve the issue.
Oversee and manage the development of all Maintenance strategies utilizing proven methods to ensure minimal downtime in plant operations with optimized maintenance cost.
Lead and provide Strategic guidance for Feasibility Studies to justify investment in new equipment or technology.
Oversee and manage all technical related activities in the plant to ensure minimal downtime in plant operations
Oversee the implementation of all predicative Maintenance strategies utilizing proven methods to ensure minimal downtime in plant operations with optimized maintenance cost.
