title: Senior Solution Architect - Growth
description:
Title:

Senior Solution Architect - Growth

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

Join KBR’s Mission Technology Solutions team and help shape the future of critical missions across government and commercial sectors. We are seeking experienced Senior Solution Architects who thrive on solving complex challenges and delivering innovative, customer-focused solutions. In this role, you will have the opportunity to influence technical strategy, drive growth in emerging markets, and collaborate with top talent to support programs that matter—spanning Defense, Intelligence, Civilian Space, and Homeland Security. If you are passionate about advancing mission success through cutting-edge technologies and strategic thinking, we want to hear from you

Key Responsibilities:

As a Senior Solution Architect at KBR, you will play a critical role in driving technical strategy and solution development to support business growth across diverse mission areas, including Defense, Intelligence, Civilian Space, and Homeland Security. This position requires a strategic thinker with deep technical expertise and the ability to craft innovative, customer-focused solutions tailored to unique mission requirements.

You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and subject matter experts to:

Lead technical solution development for complex pursuits across the Mission Technology Solutions portfolio.
Shape customer requirements through early engagement, market research, and identification of competitive discriminators.
Develop proposal content, including technical volumes, white papers, and Basis of Estimates (BOEs), and respond to RFIs and market surveys.
Apply advanced methodologies such as Digital Engineering, Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE), DevSecOps, Agile software development, Smart Asset Management, Digital Logistics, and Cloud architectures, with a strong emphasis on Cybersecurity and System of Systems integration.
Mentor and build teams, fostering collaboration and innovation across internal and external stakeholders.

Work Environment:

Location: Remote
Travel Requirements: Moderate 20-50%
Working Hours: Standard

Required Qualifications:

Eligibility to obtain a public trust security clearance.
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline (Engineering, Computer Science, or related field); advanced degree preferred.
Minimum 18 years of industry experience, including 12+ years of industry experience and 6+ years of business development experience.
Proven experience in one or more mission areas: Defense, Intelligence, Civilian Space, or Homeland Security.
Demonstrated ability to lead technical solution development for complex proposals.
Experience writing technical volumes, whitepapers, and developing Basis of Estimates (BOEs).
Ability to respond to RFIs, market surveys, and support customer shaping efforts.
Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to mentor teams, foster collaboration, and engage stakeholders.
Strong communication and presentation skills for interfacing with customers and internal leadership.

Desired Qualifications:

Strong background in multiple technical disciplines and areas of expertise, including Cybersecurity, System of Systems integration, IT infrastructure, Cloud, Autonomy, Data Analytics/AI, Agile Software Development, Digital Engineering including Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE), or DevSecOps
Active security clearance

Basic Compensation:

$176,000.00 - $263,000.00

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

title: Technical Intelligence Subject Matter Expert – Modeling & Simulation
description:
Title:

Technical Intelligence Subject Matter Expert – Modeling & Simulation

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Key Responsibilities:

KBR is seeking a Technical Intelligence Subject Matter Expert (SME) – Modeling & Simulation to join a team of quantitative analysts and modelers dedicated to conduct modeling, simulation, and analysis (MS&A) of emerging concepts for the Defense Advanced Projects Research Agency (DARPA) using advanced MS&A techniques and tools and to support further enhancement thereof. This role is at the nexus of defense intelligence, military systems analysis, and computational modeling, enabling high-fidelity representations of real-world forces, capabilities, and behaviors. The candidate will:

Support the collection, curation, validation, and structuring of information and/or technical intelligence related to US, allied, and adversary military organizations, systems, and equipment for use in advanced analytical, simulation, and AI-supported environments.
Collect, curate, and maintain authoritative datasets describing military organizations, force structures, platforms, weapons systems, sensors, C2 architectures, and operational capabilities across U.S., allied, and adversary forces.
Translate data from OSINT, IC reporting, foreign military studies, technical assessments, and technical military system and organizational materials into structured, model-ready formats.
Define system attributes, performance parameters, constraints, and behaviors relevant to mission- and engagement-level simulations.
Ensure intelligence data is traceable, validated, and annotated for use in modeling and simulation environments.
Support the development of taxonomies, ontologies, and schemas for representing military entities and interactions.
Advise on assumptions, uncertainties, and intelligence gaps that affect simulation outcomes.
Provide expert input on threat evolution, emerging military technologies, and future force concepts.
Brief program leadership, DARPA PMs, and government stakeholders on intelligence-driven insights and modeling implications.
Contribute to white papers, technical reports, and program deliverables.

Work Environment:

Location: On-site
Travel Requirements: Minimal 0-20%
Working Hours: Standard

Qualifications:

Required:

Bachelor’s Degree with 10 years of relevant experience, or
Master's Degree with 8 years of relevant experience
Deep familiarity with U.S. and non-U.S. military organizations, platforms, and systems (air, land, maritime, space, cyber, or multi-domain).
Experience supporting modeling & simulation, wargaming, force analysis, or systems analysis efforts.
Demonstrated ability to structure unclassified and classified intelligence into data-driven, model-ready formats.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including briefing senior technical and government audiences.
TS/SCI is required for this role.

Desired:

Master’s degree in International Security, Engineering, Data Science, Systems Engineering, Military Studies, or a related field, with 12 years of relevant experience
Prior experience supporting DARPA, DoD R&D, FFRDCs, or defense labs.
Familiarity with AI/ML-enabled modeling, digital engineering, or synthetic environments.
Experience developing or working with order of battle (OOB) databases, force posture models, or equipment catalogs.
Knowledge of ontologies, data schemas, or knowledge graphs in a defense or intelligence context.

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 

40hrs

Basic Compensation:

The offered rate will be based on the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities and/or experience and in consideration of internal parity.

Additional Compensation:

KBR may offer bonuses, commissions, or other forms of compensation to certain job titles or levels, per internal policy or contractual designation. Additional compensation may be in the form of sign on bonus, relocation benefits, short term incentives, long term incentives, or discretionary payments for exceptional performance.

Proven expertise in candidate screening, sourcing and interview coordination
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)

title: E3D Desiger
description:
Title:

E3D Desiger

Job Overview:

The E3D Model designer is responsible for reviewing and cleaning existing 3D models to ensure accuracy, completeness, and alignment with the latest design specifications and operational requirements. The specialist will identify and rectify inconsistencies, reconcile models with relevant data, and ensure the models meet the required standards.

Key Responsibilities:

Review and analyze existing 3D models for accuracy, completeness, and alignment with design specifications.
Identify and rectify errors or inconsistencies in the models.
Reconcile 3D models with laser scan data, removing obsolete elements and incorporating missing components.
Align model tag numbers with the applicable numbering systems.
Collaborate with project teams to ensure proper integration of models with other engineering components.
Ensure that all model updates and changes meet quality standards and project requirements.
Document and report all changes made to the models.
Work with project management teams to meet deadlines and project goals.

Skills, Qualifications and Technical Skills:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Architecture, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in 3D modeling software, preferably in industrial or engineering sectors.
3D modelling in AVEVA E3D, with the ability to identify and correct errors in large-scale models.
Familiarity with laser scanning data and relevant reconciliation processes.
Knowledge of model tagging and numbering systems.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Attention to detail and ability to manage complex data.

title: DJBOSS: Assistant Fire Chief -Training
description:
Title:

DJBOSS: Assistant Fire Chief -Training

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team's philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver - Together.
 

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Program Summary

KBR sustains the operational well-being of U.S. armed forces at Djibouti, Africa, Camp Lemonnier Naval Base. Our services encompass program management, contingency and expeditionary, asset management and recreation support, postal operations, safety services, logistics, and more. KBR ensures the base operates smoothly, allowing deployed personnel to focus on mission execution.

Job Summary

Under the general direction of the Fire Services Chief, responsible for planning, organizing, directing, and coordinating the Fire and Emergency Services (F&ES) training and certification program on a full-time basis. This position advises senior leadership, Fire Managers, Fire Chiefs, Project Managers, clients and other supervisors on Department of Defense (DoD) F&ES subjects.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Leads directs and supervises the F&ES department in delivering professional F&ES to clients and customers within the Area of Responsibility served by KBR F&ES. Prepare consolidated F&ES Departmental Reports.
Reviews and validates F&ES training and personnel actions.
Reviews and evaluates Performance Work Statement (PWS) requirements as they relate to training requirements and provides recommendations to the Fire Chief.
In the absence of the F&ES Chief, we shall represent F&ES by providing reports, briefings, attending meetings, inspections and presentations representing F&ES to KBR, customer(s), and client(s). Assist the Fire Chief in developing and implementing an overall company long-term strategic plan involving fire protection. Plans, administrators, and supervises the training function.
When needed, assumes duties and responsibilities of the Fire Chief, Assistant Chief of Operations, or any other position qualified to perform.
Plans a comprehensive program of on-the-job and proficiency training for all fire protection personnel.
Coordinate and train all fire personnel to maintain the required certification and recertification standards.
May be assigned to fill in for Operations personnel assigned to apparatus crews
Fills in for Assistant Fire Chief-Operations or for Fire Chief when needed and perform other Duties as assigned
Assessing all services provided by F&ES department that are associated with the protection and preservation of life, property and the environment, consistent with KBR approved policies, KBR BOSS (PWS), and in accordance with national recognized standards for safety, personnel, and equipment.
Writes routine reports and correspondence using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook software
Provide guidance and input to facilitate resourcing F&ES for success through staffing, training and equipping as required to maintain levels of readiness and response
Recommends administrative personnel actions lAW KBR policies. Reviews and files reports, monthly summaries, and vehicle and personnel rosters.

Basic Qualifications 

The candidate must have a minimum of three years’ experience as an Assistant Fire Chief for Training in a fire department similar to the size and scope of Camp Lemonnier, Djibouti, Africa.
The candidate must have current IFSAC, ProBoard, or Department of Defense (DoD): Fire Officer III, Fire Instructor III, Fire Inspector II, Hazmat Incident Commander, and Airport Firefighter. HazMat Awareness and Operations. CPR and Emergency Medical Responder.
Position requires U.S. Citizenship and security clearance or the ability to obtain and maintain ONE.
Must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 12 months of remaining validity AND with at least 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining.
Must possess a driver’s license with at least 6 months of remaining validity.

Preferred Qualifications

Preferred Certifications Driver Operator Pumper, Driver Operator ARFF, Driver Operator MWS, Driver Operator Aerial, NIMS/FEMA 100, 200, 300, 400, 700, 800, HazMat Technician
Rescue Technician (Rope / Confined Space / Trench / Structural Collapse / Vehicle)
Knowledge of department computer systems and software applications (ESAMS)
Ability to communicate clearly in oral and written form and to make effective public presentations
Ability to work effectively in a high-pressure environment with multiple interruptions/distractions.

KBR Benefits

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development

location:

description:
Title:

Capture Manager - Mission ICT

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries.

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

Think.KBR.com

KBR in Australia 

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Learn more about KBR in Australia  

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR 

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

The Opportunity:

At KBR, we deliver solutions that matter - to our Defence clients, our communities, and our people.

As we continue to expand across Australia’s Defence domain, we have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Capture Manager to join our Growth team and lead the process of winning new business opportunities that shape Australia’s future capability.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Growth, you’ll take ownership of qualified opportunities, leading the capture and proposal phases of KBR’s Growth Lifecycle. You’ll play a pivotal role in developing winning strategies, building high-performing teams, and ensuring every pursuit reflects KBR’s commitment to excellence and innovation.

This is a permanent full time position and can be based in either Melbourne, Canberra, Sydney, Brisbane, Adelaide or Perth.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and execute winning strategies – create compelling value propositions, competitive intelligence portfolios, and teaming approaches to maximise our probability of success.
Lead multi-disciplinary teams – guide subject matter experts, engineers, commercial, finance, and business development professionals through all phases of the capture process.
Drive proposal excellence – work closely with our Proposal Management team to oversee the development of compliant, persuasive, and customer-focused proposals.
Engage stakeholders – foster strong relationships with internal and external partners, customers, and industry collaborators to strengthen KBR’s market position.
Ensure compliance and integrity – manage risks, uphold governance, and ensure adherence to all internal and client requirements.

About You:
You’re a strategic, results-driven professional who thrives on competition and collaboration. You combine business acumen with strong Defence domain knowledge and enjoy leading teams to deliver complex pursuits.

To be successful in this role, you will bring:

Proven experience in capture management, bid management, or business development within the Australian Defence industry.
Strong leadership and team management skills with the ability to inspire cross-functional collaboration.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated success in developing and executing capture strategies.
A solid understanding of Defence/Government acquisition processes and capability development principles.
Experience managing complex projects and budgets.
Familiarity with proposal writing and development processes.
Australian citizenship and the ability to hold (or a history of holding) a minimum NV1 security clearance.

Benefits of KBR

A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work
Flexible working conditions
Competitive salary (including annual reviews)
Paid Parental leave
Paid Reservist leave
Income protection
Corporate rewards
Salary packaging/Novated leasing
Discounted employee stock purchase plans
Flu shots, skin checks and private health insurance discounts
Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

If you’re ready to shape tomorrow, let’s get started. Apply Now!

Please note. Only candidates who are eligible to hold an AGSVA security clearance will be shortlisted for this opportunity. Shortlisting will take place as applications are received, therefore the advertisement may close early if a suitable candidate is identified. 

For shortlisted candidates, you may be invited to complete a short psychometric assessment as part of the recruitment process. These assessments help us gain a fair and objective understanding of your strengths and working style.

As a Major Service Provider of the Australian Defence Force, an AGSVA security clearance will be required and compliance to International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). As such, our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.

Notice to Third Parties/Recruitment Agencies: KBR Australia does not accept unsolicited resumes or any liability associated with fees or costs from recruitment agencies, search firms or third parties who have not been engaged directly on this job opportunity. Candidates interested in applying are welcome to submit their application online.

description:
Title:

Supply Chain Management Logistics Officer

About KBR:

At KBR – We do things that matter. 

We deliver science, technology and engineering solutions to governments and companies around the world. KBR employs approximately 38,000 people worldwide with customers in more than 80 countries and operations in over 29 countries. 

KBR is proud to work with its customers across the globe to provide technology, value-added services, and long-term operations and maintenance services to ensure consistent delivery with predictable results. At KBR, We Deliver.

KBR in Australia 

With over 65 years working on some of Australia’s largest and most complex projects, KBR has unmatched experience supporting the nation’s critical infrastructure, energy transition and national security priorities. KBR has around 2,000 employees throughout Australia, who are focused on delivering innovative technology and engineering solutions for a safer, more secure and sustainable future.

Belong, Connect and Grow at KBR 

At KBR, we are passionate about our people and our Zero Harm culture. These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to, and ongoing journey toward being a People First company. That commitment is central to our team of team’s philosophy and fosters an environment where everyone can Belong, Connect and Grow. We Deliver – Together.

The Opportunity:

The Supply Chain Management Officer is responsible for logistics operations pertaining to KBR customer’s inventory. This includes supporting operational outcomes for defence customers, including shipping, delivery and inventory management in accordance with defence quality and safety standards. The Supply Chain Management Officer will coordinate with warehousing staff, OEM suppliers and existing Defence supply-support facilities and distribution services

A working knowledge of Defence ICT asset systems (such as TAMIT and/or S4HANA) is crucial in support KBR customers manage, issue (including packaging), and dispose of inventory. The Supply Chain Management Officer will also support routine maintenance of assets (surface maintenance, Electrical Integrity Testing etc.) and reconciliation against relevant Configuration Management Databases.   

Responsibilities:

Manage the codification, cataloguing and disposal of Defence ICT Assets

Assist in 6 monthly reconciliations with CIs within the Configuration Management Database 

Develop and maintain an asset inventory level, including accuracy of records within TAMIT and or S4HANA

Conduct surface maintenance (dusting/vacuuming, charging etc.)

Manage Scheduled Electrical Integrity Testing (EIT) and tagging of physical assets

Update Configuration Management Database (CMDB) and relevant Asset management systems and provide reporting and required certificates for items that have been securely disposed of

Coordinate warehousing and transportation of goods with OEM suppliers or existing Defence supply-support facilities and distribution services

Support transportation (including safe hand and packaging) of Defence ICT equipment between military operation and exercise areas, including ships/platforms

As the ideal candidate you will bring:

Essential:

Defence recognised SCM qualifications and experience with Supply Chain Management tools and technology (e.g. S4HANA, TAMIT)

Excellent organisation, time management, and accuracy when multitasking across multiple activities and deadlines

Excellent written and verbal communication skills across all levels including internal and external stakeholders

Ability to engage internal and external stakeholders, building trusting, respectful and resilient professional relationships

NV1 Security clearance (with the ability to upgrade to NV2 if required)

Desirable:

Experience within Defence Deployed ICT Service Strategy, Service Design, Service Transition, Service Operations, Portfolio and Project Integration

Previous experience in Defence ICT Warehousing operations and stock control with relevant qualification in Warehouse Operations and Record-keeping

Forklift License

Intermediate level of knowledge in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel etc.) with experience with inventory and planning software packages

The ability to work autonomously and as part of a team under limited supervision, prioritising tasks, following through to completion

Ability to problem solve and analytical skills with the ability to reason logically especially during high pressure situations

Ability to demonstrate a strong customer focus and be responsive to customer and other ICT Partners needs

Benefits of KBR

A workplace culture certified as a Great Place To Work (Aus, India, UK & US)

Flexible working conditions

Competitive salary (including annual reviews)

Paid Parental leave

Paid Reservist leave

Income protection

Corporate rewards

Salary packaging/Novated leasing

Discounted employee stock purchase plans

Flu shots, skin checks and private health insurance discounts

Career development: Online learning, mentorship and career pathways

If you’re ready to shape tomorrow, let’s get started. Apply Now!

title: Capture Manager
description:
Title:

Capture Manager

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.
Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Work Environment:

Location: Remote, with required travel
Travel Requirements: Moderate 10-25%
Working Hours: Standard

This position is responsible for developing captures and campaigns that leverage capabilities and connections both internally and across the industry to win new work. The Capture Manager or Business Development Principal will support long‑range planning, opportunity qualification, competitive analysis, and strategy development. The ideal candidate brings an elite capability set aligned to high‑value Federal and DoD pursuits.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Participate in the development of marketing and business plans, strategy implementation, and oversight of BD budgets and forecasts for assigned capture areas.
Serve as a liaison with internal cross‑business unit partners on enterprise and cross-cutting opportunities.
Manage and execute the full business development lifecycle across multiple simultaneous pursuits and proposals.
Develop pursuit plans, customer engagement strategies, and capture frameworks informed by deep understanding of customer needs, requirements, and mission priorities.
Lead customer, competitor, partner, and industry engagement to assess acquisition strategy, competitive landscape, timelines, and contract vehicles.
Lead white paper development, RFI responses, technical solution sessions, and early shaping activities.
Lead capture activities including opportunity identification, competitive assessment, teaming, price‑to‑win, solutioning, and win strategy development.
Prioritize sales and technical resources to achieve strategic growth and protect existing customer relationships.
Success leading large, multi‑disciplinary teams.
Integrate transformation experience, including value creation initiatives, organizational redesign, and leadership development.

Required Qualifications: 

Bachelor’s Degree
12+ years of experience with Federal clients.
Customer engagement experience with Department of War and/or FedCiv programs.
Strong relationships and influence with Government and industry leaders.
Demonstrated success leading diverse teams.
Experience working opportunities in CONUS and OCONUS environments.
Track record pursuing opportunities with the Department of War.
Experience supporting classified pursuits.

title: Principal Specialist, Program Management
description:
Title:

Principal Specialist, Program Management

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of War, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

Provide support to the Product Support Manager in development and implementation of comprehensive product support strategies for a major Army weapon system.  Develop ideas and guide their development into a final product.  Ensure appropriate cost analyses are documented to validate the product support strategy.  At the Product Support Manager’s direction review product support arrangements between the Product Support Integrators and Product Support Providers to ensure the arrangements are consistent with the overall product support strategies.  Perform integrated product support analysis and life cycle procurement research to develop life cycle logistics support that provides best value.  Provide support in broad-spectrum System Training Development with experience in DoD materiel test, acquisition, operations, fielding, training and systems integration as it relates to Mission Command (Command and Control).  Coordinate cross-functional efforts to assist in training needs analysis, planning, sustainment, and validation/verification activities.  Interface with government personnel to identify required activities, perform collaborative planning, review deliverables, and resolve issues.

Roles and Responsibilities 

Develop and maintain administrative processes that reduce redundancy, improve accuracy and efficiency, and achieve organizational objectives.
Monitor progress on actions, generate metrics to demonstrate accountability for meeting deadlines and quality expectations.
Prepare periodic reports on action status and keep senior management aware of late, pending and new actions. 
Develop and maintain presentations. 
Review POI and Training material and observe instructor performance to improve the design and development of new/updated TSPs.  
Participate in internal committees, Integrated Process Teams (IPTs), working groups and task forces. 
Coordinate and manage Program Schedules for Senior Management Review.
Support Technical Publication validation/verification and Logistics Demonstration (LD) process development and execution.
Assist in the development of the Contracts Requirement Package.
Determine the strategies required to meet the learning needs of the User.
Coordinate cross-functional efforts to accomplish assigned tasks to support PM STARE.
Support the Product Support Manager Life Cycle initiatives including LCSP, CARD, BOIP, Training, TM development and MR.
Provide coordinated responses and assessments for accuracy for senior management review.   

Basic Qualifications 

Candidate must possess a bachelor’s degree in Logistics Management or equivalent experience (5-10 years of functional experience in Product Support Analysis across Acquisition and/or Sustainment Logistics). 
Ability to obtain a secret security clearance is required.

Preferred Qualifications

Functional experience in acquisition document development and fulfillment.
Functional experience in developing Military training including certification in Military Drivers Training.
Experience executing Logistics Demonstrations.
Functional experience in FMS case development and/or support.

title: LCV NORTHCOM NTC: Tactical Vehicle Mechanic (NIGHT SHIFT)
description:
Title:

LCV NORTHCOM NTC: Tactical Vehicle Mechanic (NIGHT SHIFT)

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR!

Program Summary

As part of the LOGCAP NORTHCOM scope, KBR provides rapid response support to scheduled and unscheduled U.S. Army training exercises. KBR’s LOGCAP team successfully completed another year of support to Warfighter operations by providing typical LOGCAP services at two locations.

Job Summary

The Tactical Vehicle Mechanic performs in accordance with ability to read and comprehend military Electronic and or Tech Manuals, to include lube orders and FMC (Fully mission capable) + Safety verifications. This includes determining and performing appropriate repair parts required, mechanical maintenance actions and repairs on various tactical vehicles, commercial vehicles, and equipment. The Tactical Vehicle Mechanic mentors and enhances the performance of co-workers and other personnel.

This is a NIGHT SHIFT POSITION: 3:30 PM - 12:00 AM Saturday – Wednesday.

Roles and Responsibilities

Perform FMC (Fully Mission Capable) and safety verifications on heavy and light tactical wheeled vehicles and equipment.
Identify required repair parts and conduct mechanical maintenance and repairs in accordance with IETM and TM procedures.
Maintain and repair PREPO, Green, and White Fleet vehicles and equipment.
Participate in the trades helper apprentice program, including validating apprentice work when applicable.
Communicate effectively with customers during off-site FMC and safety verifications during Issue and Regeneration cycles.
Generate and maintain both physical and electronic logbooks and records.
Participate in on-the-job and cross-training as required.
Meet the 95% regulatory and contract individual productivity requirement.
Ensure all work is performed correctly the first time, following technical manuals and publications.
Perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance on material handling equipment (e.g., forklifts, cranes, RTCH240/250, transport trucks, and trailers).
Conduct diagnostic tests using measuring devices, instruments, and special tools to identify system failures (mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, pneumatic, cooling).
Operate and test various equipment and systems per applicable procedures.
Repair and replace components such as engines, drive trains, and body parts.
Prepare and complete logs, records, and NTC Inspection packets.
Maintain clean and organized work areas per contract and company housekeeping standards.
Perform end-of-shift clean-up no earlier than 15 minutes before shift end unless directed otherwise.
Support and participate in KBR’s Zero Harm Culture, Continuous Improvement Process (CIP), and QA program.
Mentor and assist with on-the-job and cross-training.
Comply with all company rules, policies, procedures, and safety/environmental/quality standards.
Actively participate in the master driver training program.
Mitigate risk by: wearing appropriate PPE, using ground guides, conducting proper PMCS, wearing seat belts, obeying speed limits, properly disposing/storing hazardous materials, using three points of contact, stretching as needed
Maintain accountability and proper care of all property and government-furnished equipment.
Conduct daily inventory of assigned tools and equipment.
Interact favorably with internal and external customers.
Understand that failure to perform these functions may have serious consequences.
Writes performance evaluation comments and reports when places in a control/ assignment directive role.
Comply with all KBR rules, policies, procedures, safety, environmental, and quality standards, and maintain accountability and proper care of all property and government-furnished equipment.
Must be able to perform work in extreme temperatures, low humidity, rain, and blowing sand and dust.
Must be able to lift and carry up to 40 pounds unassisted and team lift up to 50 pounds.
Must be able to stand, stoop, crawl, and climb for extended periods, including in confined spaces.
Must be free of medical restrictions that prevent the use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).
Must be willing to work uncommon hours, extended hours, nights, weekends, and holidays.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications (Required Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

Must understand and be able to use technical manuals/IETM and schematic diagrams.
Field of Expertise: Mechanical inspection, maintenance and repair of light, medium and heavy tactical/commercial vehicles, and equipment
Must be able to pass a U.S. Government background investigation and obtain base access. Due to this, you must be a U.S. Citizen or a U.S. Green Card holder who has lived within the United States for at least the last 3 years to be eligible for this position.
High school diploma or equivalent (GED).
Education in lieu of working experience may be considered under the following conditions: Completion of an Associate’s Degree or higher in the Automotive Technology Field from an accredited institution; proof of completion by providing a college graduate certificate and transcripts of course completion. Completed education must have been within the last 5 years.
Must have two and one-half (2 ½) years verifiable experience in inspection, repair, and maintenance on military combat/ tactical wheeled vehicles and their sub-systems/ MKT unit/ various trailers/ various generators and other equipment, OR Must have two and one-half (2 ½) years verifiable experience in inspection, repair, and maintenance on Civilian semitruck tractors and trailers and heavy-duty construction type equipment is included.
Relevant experience must include at least six (6) months experience in the current position except when employees are promoting to a higher rated position.
Requires a valid Driver’s License and ability to obtain a military operator’s permit for required vehicles and equipment.
Must be able to meet CMF criteria in accordance with DA PAM 611-21 and AR 601-210 and AR750-1.
Must possess valid State Real ID.

Preferred Qualifications (Preferred Education, Experience, Skills, and Certifications)

ASE Certification - Extensive knowledge (ASE and CERTIFICATES of completion -preferred) on power and drive train, brakes, electrical and fuel systems with two and one-half (2 ½) years verifiable maintenance experience (lubrication tasks not included). 
Tactical Wheeled Vehicle maintenance experience.

Pay

Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40
Basic Compensation: $45.16 per hour

This position is represented by the Teamsters Union.

title: UABOS Turkey: Corrosion Control and Cathodic Protection Engineer
location:
locations
Incirlik Air Base, Adana, Turkey
description:
Title:

UABOS Turkey: Corrosion Control and Cathodic Protection Engineer

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

Program Summary

KBR supports the operational needs of U.S. armed forces at Morón Air Base in Spain and several bases in Turkey. Our services ensure smooth operations, allowing Air Force and government personnel to focus on their missions. We provide program management, civil engineering, morale, welfare, and recreation support, among other essential services. Awarded by the Air Force Installation Contracting Center, our contract spans a five-year base period with three one-year options, reflecting our commitment to excellence and operational support.

Job Summary

The UABOS (Turkey) Corrosion Control and Cathodic Protection Engineer is responsible for Corrosion Control and Cathodic Protection Systems, developing design solutions to rectify deficiencies. The role involves ensuring metal structures' and pipelines' integrity and longevity through effective corrosion control measures. This position offers an opportunity to work on complex infrastructure projects and contribute to protecting critical assets.  We are seeking an experienced and certified Electrical Engineer with the qualifications of Cathodic Protection (CP3 and/or CP4) to join our team to perform engineering and planning activities aligned with U.S. Air Force standards. 

Roles and Responsibilities 

Create systems to protect metal structures, fuel pipes, etc. from corrosion.
Perform corrosion surveys and inspections to assess the condition of structures.
Oversee the installation of cathodic protection systems, ensuring they are correctly set up.
Monitor and maintain systems, ensuring they continue to function effectively.
Collect and analyze data to monitor system performance.
Prepare reports documenting the status of corrosion protection systems and any necessary adjustments.
Plan and manage cathodic protection projects, including budgeting and scheduling.
Ensure all designs and operations comply with relevant safety and industry standards (like NACE/AMPP standards).
Develop safety protocols for cathodic protection systems.
Perform, lead, and document basic to intermediate cathodic protection testing and/or inspection services
Provide technical advice to clients and in-house maintenance personnel on corrosion issues and protection strategies.
Other duties, as assigned.

Basic Qualifications 

US Citizenship Required

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering from an accredited college or university, or approved equivalent

Minimum 3 years of verifiable cathodic protection and design experience
Minimum 2 years of Electrical Engineering experience
Must have valid NACE Cathodic Protection CP3 certification
Proficient in cathodic protection design software and testing equipment
Proficient in Microsoft Office & AutoCAD or similar software
Experience in planning, programming, scoping, and executing multi-discipline facility and infrastructure projects.
Strong understanding of electrical and corrosion control principles.
Familiarity with NACE, ISO, and other industry standards related to cathodic protection and corrosion control
Able to perform basic to intermediate commissioning activities
Knowledge of design functions and parameters
Experience in developing and executing multi-discipline construction projects, evaluating contract schedules, and preparing construction reports
Class B (passenger vehicle) driver’s license
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.

Preferred Qualifications

Certification as Cathodic Protection Technologist (CP4)
6 years of project engineering experience for major real property facilities
6 years of experience in design and management of construction projects
DoD installation-level experience
Familiarity with American and Turkish facility design standards
Familiarity with engineering principles, materials, specification writing, USAF contracting procedures, engineering equipment, and surveying essential
Familiarity with construction practices in host nation (HN)

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Title:

Senior Software Engineer

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!

KBR’s National Security Solutions team provides high-end engineering and advanced technology solutions to our customers in the intelligence and national security communities. In this position, your work will have a profound impact on the country’s most critical role – protecting our national security.

Why Join Us?

Innovative Projects: KBR’s work is at the forefront of engineering, logistics, operations, science, program management, mission IT and cybersecurity solutions.

Collaborative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team that thrives on collaboration and innovation, fostering a supportive and intellectually stimulating workplace.

Impactful Work: Your contributions will be pivotal in designing and optimizing defense systems that ensure national security and shape the future of space defense.

Position Summary:

KBR, Inc. is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Engineer to support the Air Force’s Advanced Battle Management System (ABMS) Division.  You will be responsible for providing expert-level software engineering and test and evaluation guidance on this complex program. 

Key Responsibilities:

Ensure product lines are interoperable across the DAF BATTLE NETWORK

Ensure that interfaces to other service, DoD and Intelligence Community(IC) efforts in support of Joint All Domain Command and Control (JADC2) are engineered to ensure interoperability across joint and coalition forces.

Perform all activities associated with the design, development, implementation, maintenance, configuration management and quality control of software for scientific/engineering applications 

Define system and software requirements and obtain customer approval

Analyze customer requirements and translate them into a design

Create prototypes 

Implement Agile development tools such as Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket/Git to manage work and collaborate with your teams.

Identify potential roadblocks and develop software solutions where the solution is not always well defined.

Work to improve performance metrics through critical planning and execution of development tasks.

Respond to and resolves software discrepancies against documented requirements

Collaborate with a team to define software requirements

Generate program design language and code based on department standards 

Design, develop, test, and deploy software systems for our customers 

Determine software maintainability and overall adherence to user requirements on department standards 

Generate/update documents defining software product baselines 

Explore new areas or program in new languages to deliver a complete product 

Support on-site meetings and deliveries to customers 

Lead junior engineers 

Perform other duties as assigned

Work Environment:

Location: On-site (Beavercreek, OH)

Travel Requirements: Moderate 20-40%

Working Hours: Standard – Core hours 0900 - 1500

Qualifications:

Required:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or a related technical field.

8+ years of experience in software engineering and/or test and evaluation with a specific focus on Air Force acquisition programs or similar DoD systems.

Demonstrated ability to manage software requirements verification and validation activities

Demonstrated ability to lead planning and execution events.

Expertise in software integration and testing.

Experience with prototyping and experimentation within the DoD or IC.

Proficiency with engineering tools and technologies commonly used in Air Force and DoD acquisition programs, such as model based systems engineering, risk management, requirements management, project scheduling, and software backlog management tools.

Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex security concepts to program managers, contractors, and non-technical stakeholders.

Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines within the DoD acquisition environment.

Ability to navigate the complexities of military contracting processes and collaborate with defense contractors to ensure compliance with Air Force security requirements.

Active Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility is required

SAP Eligibility

Desired:

Minimum of 2 years' experience in Special Access and/or SCI programs.

Demonstrated ability to work well independently or as a team member.

Demonstrated ability to drive projects to closure and to assimilate and correlate project information in a fast-paced environment.

Demonstrated ability to communicate with technical and non-technical project teams.

Experience acquiring and/or testing command and control or battle management systems.

Experience integrating weapon systems into a system of systems.

Experience with AFSIT and JITC certification testing.

Highly Preferred: DAWIA Engineering and Technology Management Practitioner or DAWIA Test and Evaluation Practitioner or Equivalent

Ready to Make a Difference?

If you’re excited about making a significant impact in the field of space defense and working on projects that matter, we encourage you to apply and join our team at KBR. Let's shape the future together.

KBR Benefits 

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. title: Special Operations Psychological / Mental Health Technician (Camp Lejeune / Sneads Ferry, NC,)
description:
Title:

Special Operations Psychological / Mental Health Technician (Camp Lejeune / Sneads Ferry, NC,)

THIS POSITION OFFERS RELOCATION.

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

KBR is a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers; but we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.  We maintain a highly qualified workforce to help care for service people and astronauts across the world.  We attract the best minds because our expertise thrives on creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration. That is how we supply our clients with cutting-edge solutions and services. 

The Psychological Mental Health Technician shall assist with the management and treatment of outpatient behavioral health activities.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Primarily responsible, under the supervision of a licensed psychiatrist, social worker, psychiatric nurse or psychologist, for providing a wide range of behavioral health interventions from prevention to treatment to individuals and who assigns work by defining objectives, priorities, and deadlines, and provides guidance on assignments that do not have clear precedents.

Under the supervision of a credentialed provider, conduct intakes, assist with care and treatment of psychiatric, drug and alcohol patients, and counsel clients/patients with personal, behavioral or psychological problems.

Accomplish work on a substantially independent basis, performing a full range of standard and nonstandard work assignments and resolving a variety of non-recurring problems encountered on own initiative. Extensive guidelines are available; however, the contractor must use judgment in locating and selecting the most appropriate guideline for application to the work situation at hand. Unusual matters, which may not be specifically covered by policy statements or published regulations, shall be referred to the Government supervisor.

Observe patients to detect behavior patterns and reports observations to licensed behavioral health staff.

Lead prescribed individual or group therapy sessions as part of specific therapeutic procedures under the guidance of a licensed mental health professional.

As needed, complete initial intake interviews and complete required forms for new patients on behalf of the licensed mental health provider.

Collect and maintain monthly statistical data assigned work place.

Conduct intake interviews under the supervision of a licensed mental health professional.

Administers psychological tests, compiles data and prepares reports for psychological testing under the supervision of a licensed psychologist.

Administer psychophysiological tests and assessments under the supervision of a licensed medical/mental health professional

Populate and maintain a computerized database that will contain the listing of all units within the HQ organization and identify the number of service members assigned to each unit/Directorate in order to compile monthly training statistics.

Prepare daily correspondence (i.e., training agendas, meeting agendas, purchase orders, clinical appointments).

Collect and maintain monthly statistical data assigned work place.

Prepare and maintain attendance rosters and statistical data for all active duty personnel who attended Social Work/Behavioral Health services.

Assist in developing program-operating instructions, works with providers to uncover inefficiencies, and makes recommendations for corrective action.

Make comparison reviews, to include office time sheets, to ensure program operations are managed within budget.

Be responsible for the development and implementation of appointment templates for clinical providers.

Place physical maintenance work orders and maintain hand receipts for physical property and inventory. Ensure proper supply stock levels and reorder as necessary including specialized behavioral health forms and tests.

Duties also involve assisting or independently gathering data for various presentations such as process improvements initiatives, longitudinal statistical tracking, hospitalizations, and discharges. Manipulates data and presents it using off the shelf software applications. Provide information via telephone and in person to the members of the Command, the professional staff, civilian and military personnel in response to inquiries regarding appointments.

Interface frequently with the Command’s family support organizations.

Maintain competency folders in accordance with program policy.

Coordinate attendance and agenda at Case Review Committee with military and civilian agencies.

Coordinate and reserve meeting location, verifies attendance and prepares current and tentative following weeks agenda.

Prepare open and closed case reports for required special handling of outpatient medical records in accordance with regulations.

Maintain a resource library for use by professional staff and customers. Library materials are selected with the intent of providing knowledge, ideas and support to practitioners in the fields of education, clinical social work and family studies.

Provide services to families desiring information on healthy family life and parenting skills.

Required Education/Experience/Skills/Training: 

Must be a US Citizen.

This position requires a Secret Clearance or Top Secret Clearance, or the ability to obtain a clearance.

EEG Tech experience desired. 

Candidates with military experience desired.

An associate degree or commensurate level of training, e.g. military mental health technician, for a psychiatric technician or mental health program assistant. Education requirement may be met by military or comparable training. If military trained, the individual’s specialty must be as a mental health technician / specialist.

The contractor shall have no less than 3 years’ experience as a psychiatric technician.

Must attend psychiatric technicians’ training which will provide a sound foundation / basis to psychology and/or social work to ensure the tech is prepared for the types of individuals and potential illnesses that they will likely deal with. This training shall also address the basics of conflict management, how to de-escalate crisis situations and individuals who are agitated, violent or potentially violent and/or suicidal.

Must attend training to learn how to intervene and, when required, to restrain violent or potentially violent or suicidal patients by verbal or physical means.

Must maintain current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) by the American Heart Association; must provide front and back proof of all training/certs/documentation.

Standard Company Requirements: 

Must comply with Safety, Health and Environmental plan, policies and procedures. 

Must comply with the Quality Assurance plan, policies and procedures. 

Must maintain regular and acceptable attendance. 

Responsible for completing all required training. 

Perform other assignments and duties, as required. 

KBR Benefits​

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule.  We support career advancement through professional training and development.​

title: Motor Vehicle Mechanic
description:
Title:

Motor Vehicle Mechanic

Program Summary

KBR’s Missile, Aviation, and Ground Systems (MAGS) division delivers mission engineering solutions for critical U.S. Army programs, specializing in aviation and ground systems, integrated air and missile defense, and threat and target systems. As a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of Defense, MAGS provides innovative, technology-driven solutions to enhance national security. With a global presence and a strong ethical framework, KBR ensures secure, effective, and mission-ready capabilities worldwide.

Job Summary

At KBR/Fort Hood, we're seeking a driven Motor Vehicle Mechanic candidate to join our Ground Operations Team to help support Aviation, Ground, and Maintenance Operations. Your contributions will be instrumental in efficiently executing ground vehicle maintenance for U.S. Army Tactical vehicles and Foreign Military Tactical vehicles to include the associated rolling stock. Your efforts will ensure Aviation and Ground Operations training stay on schedule. Join a team committed to excellence, where collaboration and innovation thrive. If you're excited to make your mark in a dynamic environment, apply now and let's create something remarkable together! 

Roles and Responsibilities 

The Motor Vehicle Mechanic will repair, rebuild, or overhaul major assemblies of internal combustion automobiles, buses, trucks, and tractors.  
Work involves the following: 
Diagnosing the source of trouble and determining the extent of repairs required 
Replacing work or broken parts such as piston rings, bearings, or engine parts,  
Ground Maintenance work will also include grinding, adjusting valves, brake systems, changing tires, rebuilding carburetors, and overhauling transmissions. 
Must follow a maintenance schedule and check fluids. 
Requires rounded training and experience. 
Must be a good problem solver, mechanically inclined, pay attention to detail, have an ability to multi-task, properly communicate, and follow detailed instructions. 
Conduct other duties as assigned by the Lead Motor Vehicle Mechanic. 
Must be able to work different shifts as required, be able to travel as needed, and be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance if required. 
 Must be able to move safely about in a maintenance environment (open bay and outdoors) and be able to sit, stand, squat, and walk for extended periods of time. 
The candidate will be exposed to extreme weather conditions (heat, cold, rain) and will be subject to loud noises, exhaust fumes, and dust. 

Basic Qualifications 

High School Diploma
2-3 years’ experience as a Motor Vehicle Mechanic 
Must have a Texas Driver’s License 
Must be able to communicate succinctly with customer and client 
No clearance required 
Must be able to lift to 25 pounds or more 
Must be willing to travel between North Fort Cavazos and West Fort Cavazos daily 
Must provide own tools / toolbox 

Preferred Qualifications

Class A CDL with X Endorsement  
EPA 608 certified

title: Voice Engineer (Supporting NASA at Johnson Space Center)
description:
Title:

Voice Engineer (Supporting NASA at Johnson Space Center)

Belong. Connect. Grow. with KBR!  

 

Around here, we define the future.

 

We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

The Mission Systems Operations Contract (MSOC) at the Johnson Space Center is seeking a Voice Engineer with a working knowledge of voice communication systems, video processing and distribution, and GPS timing systems. The applicant will be required to support mission, simulation, and testing activities in the Mission Control Center (MCC), Mission Training Complex (MTC), and Space Vehicle Mockup Facility (SVMF). Some activities may be considered Mission Critical/Complex and require support during off nominal (M-F, 8-5) hours, weekends, or holidays. This position may require business travel. 

The selected applicant will be required to support project design working groups, develop critical design review inputs to system engineering, perform project material and labor cost assessment/estimates, and support design presentations to contract management and the NASA customer. The selected applicant will be required to perform implementation of approved designs, support development of project schedules, provide status to contract management and project engineering, and coordinate implementation efforts with the integration and maintenance teams as well as other project stakeholders. The selected applicant will be required to initiate material requests for procurement of system hardware prior to implementation and provide status of the material delivery. The selected applicant will be required to generate/update configuration management documents as part of the implementation process including cabinet/console drawings, facility floor plans, cable running lists, cross-connect wire lists, Engineering Instructions (EIs), and Subsystem Readiness Tests (SSRTs). The applicant will work in a team environment, and must possess good interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written. The ideal candidate will have a strong drive to apply themselves and continually update his/her skill base, is team oriented, and works to develop and apply good problem-solving skills.

Responsibilities may include:
• Assist in the design, development, sustaining, and maintenance of engineering documentation (databases and drawings) and generation of instructions to change (install, modify, update) the various Mission Control Center (MCCS), Mission Training Complex (MTC), and Space Vehicle Mockup Facility (SVMF) voice, video, and timing systems, including MCCS flight control rooms and Ops Suite consoles and Training Systems Instructor Operator System rooms
• Support the design, development, testing, and deployment of Video, Voice, and Timing Systems
• Respond to and resolve technical issues as needed
• Report on technical work progress, issues, impediments, etc.
• Support integration of engineering hardware into the MCC, MTC, and SVMF environments
• Translate NASA customer operations concepts and functional requirements into engineering design details.
• Identify hardware components, develop parts lists, and generate material procurement requests for acquisition of equipment and materials.
• Support project level planning activities and provide project schedule inputs
• Be able to communicate effectively with internal team members and external NASA customer
• Generation of technical instructions for implementation
• Communicate and coordinate with team leader, as well as MSOC management as needed
• Comply with the MSOC contract and NASA/JSC/MSD direction, policies, and procedures
• Make improvements and suggestions to advance the overall engineering processes in place

Education:
• BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Engineering Technology, or related discipline
 

Desired Qualifications
• An understanding of voice, video, and timing systems
• 3+ years or more of experience in these systems is a plus
• Good problem solving and analytical skills
• Strong communication skills inclusive of low level technical details with peers and summary level to management
• Master Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent is a definite plus
• Cisco CCNA or CCNP certification is highly desirable
• CTS or CompTIA certification would be beneficial
• Demonstrated work experience to receive task assignments, work autonomously and provide periodic status to team members
• Demonstrated experience working system anomalies during mission-critical periods of operation through problem resolution
• Familiarity with IP-based Voice and Video system architectures
• Familiarity with Time Division Multiplexed (TDM) voice systems
• Familiarity with audio codecs (G.711, G.729)
• Familiarity with telephony system (Loop/Ground Start, SIP, Asterisk)
• Familiarity with telecommunications carrier interfaces (TDM, IP)
• Familiarity with mission audio recorder systems
• Familiarity with Analog/Digital audio conversion and distribution equipment
• Familiarity with IP video streaming formats and decoding techniques
• Familiarity with video interface types (HDMI, SDSDI, HDSDI) and resolutions (720p, 1080p, 4K/UHD

title: DJBOSS: HVAC Mechanic
description:
Title:

DJBOSS: HVAC Mechanic

Program Summary

KBR sustains the operational well-being of U.S. armed forces at Djibouti, Africa, Camp Lemonnier Naval

Base. Our services encompass program management, contingency and expeditionary, asset management

and recreation support, postal operations, safety services, logistics, and more. KBR ensures the base

operate smoothly, allowing deployed personnel to focus on mission execution.

Job Summary

Under direct supervision, assigned daily work. May explain instructions and documentation to plan work activities. Helps coordinate movement of materials and equipment to work locations and set up work site. Completes and reviews records, maintains tools and equipment, and performs various cleanup activities. Job may require moderate to heavy lifting. Observes and follows all safety rules and procedures, including wearing required personal safety equipment.

Roles and Responsibilities

Reports to and receives assignments, instructions, and direction from the Foreman or General Foreman. Reads and interprets instructions and documentation and plans work activities.
Completes records, maintains tools and equipment, and performs various clean-up and housekeeping activities.
Observes and follows all safety rules and procedures, including wearing the required personal safety equipment.
Performs other duties and activities as required and directed.
Prepares materials, builds and erects a broad range of structures in support of plant construction and maintenance activities.
Completes records, maintains tools and equipment, and performs various clean-up and housekeeping activities.
Individuals should possess thorough knowledge and have skills involving the inner workings of heating and cooling units, dryer maintenance as well as wiring, motors, pumps, switches, lights, fans and thermostats.
Work will also involve lifting and moving heavy units. 
Work may involve outdoor Conditions, Height and Lifting 50+lbs

Basic Qualifications 

2+ years of experience as a Laundry Equipment Mechanic and or HVAC Mechanic.
Experience in maintenance of Washers and dryers, or large commercial Air conditioning plants and Chillers
High School Diploma or equivalent
Associate degree or college level certificate in relevant field
EPA certified or equivalent.
Must be fluent in English
Ability to lift 50+ Ibs
Must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 12 months of remaining validity AND with at least 4 blank visa/stamp pages remaining
Must possess driver’s license with at least 6 months of remaining validity

KBR Benefits
KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which include medical insurance.
We support career advancement through professional training and development and flexible work schedule.
